Although, he felt bad and hated when she got upset with him.  Under all that he's a good guy just a little messed up.  His attitude and the way he behaved...there was a reason for it.  He was so afraid he'd hurt her.  Thats what made him likable to me.  He was sweet in his own way.  OMG Chelsea!  I laughed my butt off when she called Eileen and told her Verity was on her way up.  Her and Marcus had sex thinking she was coming to check on them thinking their mating was fake.  Well it actually was at first.  Anyways, it was priceless when Eileen found out Chelsea lied about that!  Made me giggle!  Damian...didnt see that coming!  Will Zeke be next in the series?  Enjoyable read!

I had trouble getting through this.  I have to agree with another reviewer that this seemed disjointed.  I seemed to move a bit slow for me too especially the beginning.  I also didnt quite understand what it was really about.  Thats what I mean by disjointed.  One thought here but there was no follow through on it before another thing was introduced.  It also ended abruptly.  I wouldnt call it a cliffhanger but some might think so.  I just ended FAST on a thought that she was going with him.

Loved reading Jackson's story!  I dunno I think this one's my favorite in the series.  It was developed really well and it was a true sweet romance.  Harper was dealt a bad deal when she got pregnant by a lion shifter who was crazy!  Wanting her to abort the baby because it would interfere with his plans becoming an alpha of a pride by marrying the Alphas daughter.  So, essentially Harper was used.  She's young and obviously not experienced with men.  She's also human.  Jackson saves her and her baby.  Its actually a very sweet story.  Kind of a tear jerker a couple times cause seriously Jackson is very sweet.  Great series.  I think she plans on doing Winston though before ending the series totally.  There was a hint to it anyways.

Ohhh I LOVE LOVE Bev!  She is so funny and such a character!  She is uniquely described.  She's really big like 7 1/2 feet and has claws and a tail but is very beautiful.  She has some balls of steel!  Cute story some errors but otherwise I enjoyed it.  I wasnt sure what to expect when reading it.  I THOUGHT it was a romance about Bev and nope.  Its about her new BOSS and his secretary who have crushes on each other but inter office romances are forbidden.  Bev wont take no for an answer and fixes it her way AFTER she takes care of a sleezy jerk after that sweet little secretary!  I want more of this series and just fell in love with Titan's Rising.  Give us more Bobbi!

Before I break each story down I have to say that there isn't any real difference between these 4 books with each other.  They kinda all play out the same.  Even some of the wording is the same.  Only real difference is character names and SOME of the circumstances are different.  Everything happens so very fast and there isn't a whole lot of development in regards to the story or their romance.  In a way they are kinda unbelievable and unrealistic if you wanna say it.Alien King's Bride- Your basic King in need of a mate but wanting to wait for his soul mate.  He meets her though as Avia a soldier tasked to guard the Ambassador whose meeting with Rom.  They are both quite taken with each other at first but she's taken aback at his sudden interest in her as a soldier and a woman.  I liked both characters and it was sweet.Alien's Runaway Mate- Sarah's been dealt a really really bad hand at life.  After her father's death she is taken and sold as a slave to pay for her father's debts.  Her master isnt nice to her...beats her and is just so cruel.  She finds a chance at escape and meets Brax who's a dock worker.  He sees the abuse and is mad as hell.  She's his mate but he doesnt force the issue and wants it to be her choice considering her background.  She is scared of Brax and his species because she listens to the rumors aboard the stowaway ship.  How brutal they are to humans etc.  She does make her own judgments at how Brax treats her like glass lol.  She approaches him and wants to stay with him.  Sweet story.Alien Guard's Mate- A socialite is being forced to marry a retched man who's hurt her physically and so has her father.  However, being escorted to said prospective husband her guard wants to believe the worst about her.  Thinking spoiled rich girl who needs a spanking but he begins to see things how they really are with her when she's attacked by her "future" husband.  He saves her and mates her.Alien's Little Thief- She's an escaped slave who turned thief to survive.  She is tasked to steal something of value from the King in exchange to remove her slave collar.  She is set up and is caught by Captain of the guard if you will.  He doesn't turn her in right away and as he gets to know her realize she's his mate.  He does get her collar removed and doesnt wanna leave him.These stories are all very similar.  The love scenes are kinda boring and the same.  Its insta love and sometimes those are ok but in this case not so much.  I think my favorite was book one.  Alien King's Bride.  Usually the case that the first one is better than all of em.  The second book I liked as well.  The last 2 were meh.  I cant really recommend this series just for the fact they lack a lot of development.  In character and stories.  Sorry.

Ok...so Ms. Julia Mills who I am a huge fan of started this new series.  I have to say its unique especially coming from her writing.  I liked it but didn't love it.  It was funny and quirky.  The writing style was different.  She...meaning Vidalia, uses a lot of parenthesis and talks to the reader a lot and I am not sure I like that or not?  I am also not sure about her relationship with Bobby I would have liked to be along for that ride!  She sorta takes us through it but not to my liking.  I'll of course read other like these short stories.  I did like it but I do think it takes getting used to.  If your expecting something like her style with her Dragons...nope.  Its a bit different.  :)

Cant tell you how much I loved this!  I'm gonna say that her mother Fang is something else!  I didn't like her and Ling really should have said the word NO to her instead of going along with things.  Odd name also Fang.  Anyways, love Marcus and he was all fumbly sometimes.  It was love at first sight for him but he didn't do anything about it right away.  He was wishy washy but only because he was trying to protect her.  I tell you she had a lot of mishaps!  Covered in green goo and fishy soup?  Poor Ling!  Cute story and thought it was funny and cute.  I don't like all the stories in this series but most of them.  My favorites are book 1, 3, and 5.  Didn't care too much for book 2 or 4.  Wonder who she will do next.  I think I didn't like the other 2 because they were already established mates pretty much, and I like the romance of it all from beginning to end.  Keeps the mystery going and I just like those type better.

I enjoyed reading it.  It was a really sweet and a cute read.  I see others didn't like it so much.  Jade is Luke's sister.  I thought Jade was a great character and enjoyed how she was with Dylan.  He was just unbelievably sweet to her.  Kinda reminded me of hero worship a little.  He found her and rescued her after the bombing.  I agree there wasn't a whole lot of time they spent together and not a lot of time was invested in their romance.  They didn't get together until the end because she was severely injured and then he got badly hurt too.  Not perfectly put together relationship wise but not a bad read either.  I hope Luke gets a story too.  He's a great guy.

This was kinda confusing at first.  Sometimes these short books have a feel to them.  It feelsl like I am missing part of the story.  This needed more of a back story and I think it would have made more sense.  I did like it once I was able to understand some of it.  Its interesting and kinda sweet.  Your basic racism toward a particular species and the humans being led to believe a lot of lies about them when its the humans that are screwing it all up to get along.  I enjoyed it.

This gets a 3 star because honestly the freebie book at the end was better!  LOL...that is so bad right?  Natalie is way uptight and her character annoyed me.  I mean she's not a virgin but acts like it no kiss until like the 3rd date?  She obviously has some issues because of the way she acts.  I didn't like her character.  Kirk...I didn't necessarily like him either...he was kind of a jerk and wasn't exactly nice to her.  Kept calling her idiot and moron a lot.  This whole thing with these 2 left me confused mostly.  This isn't a sweet story and if that's what your looking for move on.  When these 2 had conversations I was left scratching my head like what did they just say?  Uh wha?  Confusing!  Cant seem to talk straight forward.  For example taking a whole page to get something across that could have been done in a sentence or 2.  A lot of needless babble.  This needed development really bad.  Both the story and characters.Trouble was the bonus story and lemme say yummy and hot and kinda funny!  Duke was big and hot and owner of the bar.  Lexi comes from a well to do family but is trying to do things on her own.  He doesn't take her seriously at first and kinda laughs at her and calls her Blondie a lot.  They have some major sexual chemistry and give into it.  Lexi has a rule though.  No repeats.  They both fight it but its just inevitable they try it as a couple.  Sexy story.  Ending was sorta abrupt but that's alright.

I think this would have been a lot better if we had more of a back story about Connor and Randall.  Just seemed to be so fast and made their coming together unrealistic for me.  Ended fast and left things hanging.  Needs editing and better formatting.  Pages were all weird.  I also couldn't get past the her name.  Connor...I mean that's a male name and I really don't know any girls with that name.  Not saying that it couldn't be Connor its just not typically a girls name.  I read male characters all the time with the name Connor...that's probably why.  I think the author was trying to be different but fell flat.

I was so excited to read about Caleb and Lia.  I so wanted to know more about Aubrey's brother Caleb...Vampire Master of the city and last female saber tooth tiger.  We got a little teaser in Slade's Feisty Mate.  I really loved it.  It was hot and sexy and sweet.  Caleb's a great guy, powerful and hasn't let it go to his head.  He's smart also and treats Lia oh so well.  We also got insight to his Kiss and what it means to be his mate.  She is Mistress of the city now.  Of course these are short stories and always wish they were longer.  I feel really bad for Galen and I know we'll get his story in November.  I really wanted to pre-order but its not up yet.  Bummer!  Great read!

I actually liked this.  It was different and I enjoyed the story as a whole.  Every 5 years 3 random women are chosen to be "prizes" for like tournament games and whoever the 3 warrior winners gets a choice of the 3 women.  Aedian chose last and it wasn't a choice really because Roxanne was the only one left.  Roxanne wasn't at all thrilled be a PRIZE.  Hated it actually.  Had a bad attitude going into it.  What made it worse is Aedian has a negative attitude as well.  Detested humans and thought they were weak which they are kinda compared to them.  He did have a misconception in thinking they were worthless until he met her.  What surprised me is that they consummated so fast.  Like the same day as the tournament after dinner.  They weren't even supposed to be married for awhile.  They have sexual chemistry big time.  However, they hated their situation and disliked each other that they both refused to actually get to know the other.  Stubborn.  That was my issue with this.  They didn't know each other and didnt want to, it was hard to root for them.  No emotional connection.  Very little even at the end.  Still they didn't love each other.  Its like a marriage of convenience type of thing but never loving that person EVER.  That was disappointing to me and really sad.  I guess that the way Ms. West wanted it written.

Well....I am sorta on the fence about this short story.  I liked it but didn't for various reasons.  Ok, I get that these Watchers are aliens and came to Earth to save it more or less.  Not like Earth had a choice or anything.  Anyways, in return for their protection a lottery is had and every 5 years 3 women are taken either as slaves to work wherever or as breeders.  Now breeders haven't survived the pregnancy because the child growing takes pretty much from these human women and the child doesn't survive either.  So, if your chosen as a breeder you are pretty much a dead woman.  Slavers at least are given a chance to survive but CAN be killed by whoever is their owner.  So, its rather harsh this whole situation either way.  In Maggie's situation she is chosen as a breeder so she is naturally terrified.  These Watchers aren't all very nice and their human forms are the only forms that have been shown to this point.  However, once she is tossed in a room she sees their true form which is a nasty looking big spider who proceeds to force/rape whatever you wanna call it.  I mean she's chosen but not necessarily on a voluntary basis so it can be construed as rape to some people.  Although it sticks its pointy thorns in her thighs and legs and causes her injury she "sorta" enjoys it and does have completion but in essence it is rape and some readers will find offense and there is a warning in the title but it says force not rape which is the same thing just a nicer word.  Then she meets Prince Urieal who is nice and isn't happy she was injured and takes care of her and cleans her up and tends to her wounds but he likes her a lot.  She likes him too because he's nice and has promised it wont happen again well the thorn in the legs thing.  Now, I am not sure but he might have been the spider who has sex with her its not really clear though.  However, she DOES consent and they do have sex with each other later but its rather sweet and he's good to her.  The story ends when she's become pregnant but she doesnt even know it but he does.  It just ENDS!  Urieal wants her for himself but its against their laws or something.  I really wish this was a complete story but the end is confusing and left as it was.  I hope its continued because if not its not worth it to read.

This moved slow a little.  Its a different story and I was confused at times.  The microbiology thing didn't come up until well after she was abducted.  There needed to be a backstory and not spoken after the fact.  The way things went she was just expected and forced to be a Queen.  He didn't have the decency to explain anything to her.  He only did after she refused to do anything else.  This was choppy at best.  They really had no chemistry that I felt.  She didn't feel attraction to him for awhile.  She also kept going back and forth whether she wanted him or not.  This world was really different and that's a good thing but there was no in depth story about the alien world and there needed to be.  This seemed really far fetched even for me which I am an avid sci-fi romance reader.  It was ok but needed just a bit more explanations to understand this alien and his world and we don't know much about Mary either.

This was a pretty decent read.  I really think this would have been a 5 star if all the gaps were filled.  What was with the dragons?  What are gatekeepers?  Why was Marcus such an evil jerk?  Also, the fight at the end what the heck happened?  One thing the evil dragon is in front of her and then nothing and it was all over?  Uh how did he die?  What about those "premonitions/visions" she had?  Since she's half vampire now does that mean she is immortal?  Also, from what I understand the whole reason they take a woman from the village is to have sex and possibly see if the woman a candidate for a child?  Those who aren't the one who can conceive are paid after so long and move away?  In exchange they protect the town.  I cant understand why that would be a huge secret the town wouldnt know?  Doesnt seem to be a big deal to me.  Why make the town think those women died?  So, as far as characters go they seemed decent.  Now, I have to say I wish their "relationships" was more in depth.  Michael was kinda out of it mostly though.  Valad was an ok character but I felt I really didn't know him or Michael very well.  They seemed to keep Siona in the dark a lot which she should have demanded knowledge of stuff.  Sexual chemistry was off the charts.  Emotional connections were there for the most part.  I think this story and characters needed a little more background for it to work well.  Its not a bad story and I did enjoy it but I did have questions and I was confused a lot.  Siona seemed to accept things awful quickly without many questions or concerns.  Especially the pregnancy.  I think with so much going on in this story it was too short for what needed to be developed to make sense.  This so didn't feel like 196 pages but maybe it was.

To be clear what you get is this nifty pretty Paris wallet with a built in aqua blue cover you just push your plain phone into it.  It closes and its magnetic so don't think your gonna get Velcro.  Its a pretty cool case and exactly what I thought it was.  Unfold it to do whatever and talk or text.  Its pretty easy and I know some reviewers might be confused on what your actually getting.  So, I thought I'd describe it.  The seller is from China and I totally thought I wouldn't get this for a whole month like it said.  I got it in a week and a couple days!  Awesome!  Shipping was pricey but that's because it was coming from China so its ok.  I'm extremely happy with it!

Not sure what it is about her female characters lately but they just kinda annoy me.  Sandy was ok at first until about towards the end.  She had every right to be upset with Josh with what happened and he held her like a prisoner.  Then again she went into someones house uninvited and started to look for him?  Boss or not or Assistant or not...total idiot.  LOL.  At the end she makes it seem like he held her prisoner for like months instead of a few days.  Then shes all over him and once everything is all said and done she refuses to see him or be around him for the dumbest reason ever.  Cause she didn't wanna work with him?  Uh?  Whats that gotta do with anything?  If her reason was she needed some time to herself to think that's fine but because she didn't wanna work with him or his company...I am just drawing a blank.  I think the story was interesting and sorta off the wall but not too bad.  Just Sandy's character rubbed me wrong.  Josh was fairly decent as a character.  I kinda felt pity for the guy being an alien and being altered like that and never being able to go home etc.  That sucks.

To be honest the story was interesting but the characters leave a lot to be desired.  I found Stacy wishy washy and annoying most of the time.  If she actually took some time to think about things and talk to him instead of "trying" to escape the whole time I think she would have been better off.  I have a hard time believing she went from being a total pushover from her previous relationship to someone who tells Ash to f off.  I found Ash cold and unfeeling most of the time and they were seriously oil and water and couldn't get along.  Its hard to believe they just turned a switch and boom loved each other or liked or whatever.  I've read her books before and some are good and some aren't.

This was excellent!  I've never read anything by this author and found it enchanting and funny.  My heart broke though for both of them when he left years ago.  He did so to protect her but I don't think it was the right choice but I can understand why he did it.  He was actually sweet and really sexy and a good guy.  She was just funny and really stubborn and a strong woman to deal with what she had.  Look forward to reading more and dude...his brother has a fetish for stuffed animals?  That was just freakishly awesome I laughed!  I am wondering if he'll get a story or her friend Bonnie.

2 things that stopped me from giving this 5 stars.  At the beginning Ellie is said to have blonde hair, but right before they do the horizontal tango she is described to having brown hair.  Then I didn't like the ending for Ellie and Kanatel.  Part of me thinks she is a little selfish because she seemed to go on about not being able to make it as a couple.  Yeah he was exiled and they SHOULDNT go to earth because he IS an alien.  He gave up quite a lot for her.  What about the planet he took her to?  That was beautiful and they could start over.  After him rescuing her and him taking such good care of her you'd think she'd compromise on that.  Kanatel was as sweet and can be.  Took things slow with her.  They didn't even do anything until close to the end.  He's a gentleman for an alien and never overstepped with her.  Never treated her poorly.  I dunno I just didn't like ther ending.  Otherwise, I loved the book.  Developed nicely and seemed complete.  Likeable characters.  I do wonder what became of Juanita and Sam.

I was excited to read this and kept waiting for the release.  I was kinda disappointed.  The pace seemed awful slow to me.  It was a short book but took me all day to read and it only should have taken me 1-2 hrs at most.  I put it down constantly and sighed.  There is a lack of depth in parts of the book and with the characters.  The whole Weatherly guy thing just seemed a little out of the blue and could have done without it.  I don't think making him a antagonist worked well.  Obviously if it hadn't been for him she would have never got turned but I think with that whole situation we needed more development.  Their pasts and needing to know more about Colt and Jericho.  I felt I didn't know them as much as I knew Red.  I also think it highlighted too much of the sex and manage thing for anything else in the book to survive.  Yes, I am saying there IS a such thing as too much sex lol.  I wanted them to form a relationship and although I felt them caring for each other I didn't feel anything else.  Also, I felt they dived way too fast into sex.  I mean she went there to think and like 30 seconds from knowing Colt she does the horizontal tango.  Then 2 minutes later his friend Jericho comes along and boom again so fast.  Made it not believable for me.  That's something I would expect from a short story or even erotica or erotic type of books.

I have to say that all the books I've read of hers this wasn't exactly my favorite.  I was anxious to read it because it sounded awesome and I enjoyed the others.  I just couldn't get past at how Kendrick and Joel treated her and how they regarded her as a chubby girl or too many curves and not in a good way.  Is it no wonder she had low self esteem before and how they have made it worse for her.  No wonder she didnt believe them when they told her she was beautiful.  Sorry...she isn't stupid either she knew they were talking about her not the crocodile.  Ha.  Sorry they even still thought that about her after they discovered she was their mates.  Kendrick was a real dick to her and disrespected her a lot for about 3/4 of the book.  Ordered nobody help her and she's constantly falling and hurting herself and has trouble getting her tent up and other things.  I get she needs to prove herself but still someone needed to show her how and then let her do it on her own from there on out.  Joel was a little better but not by much.  So, I wasn't a big fan of Kendrick and Joel.  Joel you can kinda understand his nasty attitude and its more of a defense with him because his mother left him and his dad treated him like a leper.  Kendrick though?  No damn excuse for his behavior.  Just sayin.  The story with Carlie, Ruth's sister was a little unorthodox.  That led me to believe she was forced at everything.  So, I dunno if I even wanna read her story or not.  Gah!  I dunno!  This book had its moments and I enjoyed some of it.  I loved the ending.

I loved this story.  I think the only downer was Mitchell was such a jerk to her.  Disrespected her a lot.  Even after he came to his senses it took so long for him to then he was even more of a douche after they all mated.  So, not a bit fan of Mitchell at all!  However, sexy, sweet, hot, cute and oh so yummy Alejandro was perfect!  He was so supportive of her and although it took him some time to work out what he was feeling for Francine was genuine and they were mates it was all bets are off!  He was protective and just a great guy...yeah he was a manwhore before but he was reformed after he met her.  I loved how they met!  That was so funny.  Alejandro and Francine are both vulgar and pervy and perfect!  Not saying Mitchell was a slouch he's just more serious and reserved.  Perfect balance after he pulled his head out of his butt!

I have to say right off that this box set was kinda disappointing.  I now remember why I don't buy them.  A lot of these stories were parts of a series and I just skipped right over those and didn't bother to read.  I would have if they were all complete books.  3 of these books I read already previously.  Dark Love seemed to be pretty good til I got about halfway through and I rolled my eyes cause it was SLOW and gave up....NEXT!  Honestly, I think my favorite out of the whole thing was You Lucky Witch written by Marie Mason.  That was actually really good and hot and sexy.  I wanted my own demon!  :)  Needless to say I really was disappointed.  This got 3 stars because of You Lucky Witch.  Hopefully she releases it separate and I can give it what it deserves.

Yay!  Box set!  Snagged this puppy...err....kitty up right away it was .99....mine!  :)  Great set of stories I already read more than once and loved loved loved!Controversy is about hot tamale Vax and sweet human Callie.  He's wanted her ever since he laid eyes on her while working at his club.  She's drawn to him and wants him too but doesn't think someone like him would want someone curvy like her.  She's got a relationship with a white tiger she speaks to and has no idea its Vax!  That tiger is her best friend and confidant she spills her secrets to.  She's so mad when she finds out its Vax lol.  Great story and oh so yummy!Territory is about Lila, one of Vaxs' sisters.  She's had a relationship with Gavin who's the head of security but they aren't mates and things didn't work out.  Gavin has trouble getting over her a little.  She meets this tiger shifter Cy who's on a mission to find his missing/kidnapped sister.  Lila and Cy are mates.  Lila feels she's got something to prove and tries to solve this on her own.  Cy kinda messes up and doenst trust her to NOT get hurt.  Ohhh is she mad or what!  Has every right to be.  Their journey is an interesting one and loved it!Adversary is an interesting story about Veila another of Vax' sisters.  We meet Mark Martinez who's family of had a feud with the Teiro family for years.  Its a Romeo and Juliet sorta.  This is a heartbreaking story in a way with how Vax was forced out because he chose to take a human as his mate.  His father is old school and refuses to "dilute" the lines but Vax didn't give a crap and loves Callie.  Veila stands up for her brother and herself because she sides with Vax.  So family drama aside her and Mark are mates and although its rocky they get their HEA.Last but not least is Sanctuary.  We get Gavin's story and a little artic fox named Laila who knows she's his mate but because of his past he avoids her and refuses to be with her.  After she is more or less scared because of a note she received while working...Gavin's mating instincts kick in.  LOL.  He isn't able to fight it.  He still kinda does but after his fox isn't having it!  She's got secrets of her own.

This is a good story don't get me wrong.  I like the characters.  Well developed as well.  I will say in the beginning I think it was a tad too descriptive.  I had trouble continuing after Chapter 12.  Not sure what it was maybe it was the flow.  I read other reviews and they sorta said the same things.  She would have one thought and then start something else without really finishing and there was some repeating as well but by other characters.  I have to say though for a debut this was really good.  I have to admit I skimmed because I had such a hard time continuing.  I even skipped to the last chapter to see if there was a difference.  I did find out that there is a cliffhanger which I don't like those types.  So, I put it down to read some reviews on book 2 Fight For The Fae and also a reviewer mentioned that book ends on a cliffhanger as well.  I'm not a fan of a series that goes on and on with the same 2 characters.  There has to be an ending or I get bored with the story.  I enjoy a series that ends with the first book and then writes about another couple.  I am not saying that the conflict should just end and start another.  For instance you can continue the conflict but maybe highlight another couple like her brother Keegan and a prospective mate for him and continue to have all the secondary characters still in this.  Its done all the time and I guess its what I like and am used to.  Or even having stories about Colin's brothers and a woman in their life.  This just seems like one HUGE never ending conflict but is spread out in at least 3 books which comes out soon probably.  I am sorry to say after finding out that book 2 ends on cliffhanger also and a third is planned with the same things going on that I decided to stop reading it and not continuing.  Maybe I'll give this author another try with her next series.  Just not my thing.  Not to say that others wont like it but honestly I do not.  :(

This was so bad it doesn't rate a star in my opinion.  Spelling errors and editing wow.  Names that don't belong.  This isn't a romance its more like an erotica story that has no HEA.  If you are expecting that don't bother.  It was really bad and the wording she uses.  I've read her before and she doesn't get any better unfortunately.  I don't know what it is or lack of caring maybe.  Her stories are choppy and all over the place.  She cant write scenes well either.  Sorry not trying to be rude or mean but damn you'd think after as many she writes she'd at least try harder.

Well...this is one of those stories that you feel your missing a lot of information.  Apparently he's already saved her from whatever it was he saved her from.  She's working for him but has feelings for him.  He does too.  Then we are whisked away to his "tribe"...didn't know dragons had tribes but more like clans but oh well.  They paint her up and make her walk naked in front of them all.  Take a step off a cliff without knowing someone will save you.  Boom you then gotta have sex in front of them all to mate your dragon.  SO...yeah...it was weird and kinda unbelievable.  More like a chopped up fantasy nightmare.  Development is a big issue apparently along with no real characterization with these 2.

So, the main reason this is getting 3 stars is because its not as long as its made out to be.  I'd say each of the 3 dragon stories are about 35-40 pages TOPS!  The rest of this includes different stories and excepts from other authors.  Some are short stories and some only give you part and you gotta buy the rest of the stories.  I get this is a box set and its not by any particular author.  So, apparently its published by a company or set of companies with all these partial books in it.  Nothing but a ploy to get you sucked in to buy.  Pretty good Amazon lol.  It SAYS its 675 pages but at the top it says 22,000 and I seriously doubt anyone is paying attention to that part cause I didn't.  I fell for it.  Well...at least I didn't buy it...Kindle Unlimited baby!  So perhaps I got the last laugh.  I am kinda ranting but apparently this is a new thing now.For the stories themselves though, they were shorts yes.  They were fairly decent but editing is a problem and some of the plots weren't exactly believable and I think one story I felt was missing a bunch of stuff.  Like I got in the middle of a novel and just started reading...so yeah I missed a lot.  That's the feeling I got reading.  No more box sets for me unless its more legitimate like well known authors.  I hate to be that way but otherwise we are wasting our time on this twaddle.

Its ok.  I've not gotten box sets for quite awhile because they all seem the same kinds of stories and always have cliffhangers and want you to buy a ton of other books as well.  Or they only contain part of the story but in order to get the rest you gotta purchase it.  Stories weren't all that interesting to me but they weren't bad.  So, 3 stars for me.

Well, I was really into it until the end.  Ended so abruptly and all there was in it was a kiss romance wise.  Really disappointing actually.  I was expecting more.  It would be one thing if it was a series but it isn't.  Just a short.  Never read this author before but I have Calista Skye so I was kinda surprised it was a little boring in the romance part.  There really wasn't any.  Its your basic forbidden love thing.  Also, I thought he was an alien and he was basically a bear shifter.  So a little strange there thats why we needed to know more.  We also need more information about this new world and his.  I liked both characters it just seemed incomplete to me.

This could have been a series I believe.  It was really a decent read.  Not too short and not overly long.  Intesting characters and world building.  Vampires exist and are part of society.  Seb is King of the Vampires and is quite old.  He's used to taking what he wants whenever he wants it.  However, he is bored with that and needs to take a mate.  However, things change when he meets feisty Rachel who is a Jr. pastry chef.  This was a yummy read and I totally wanted more about them.

This actually wasn't bad.  Most types like this don't impress me.  They are usually in need of editing and more development.  For what this is I enjoyed reading it.  It was an interesting read.  Madison is kind of nave and doesn't always listen to her instincts meets Damian which he means well but kinda messes up.  He's followed her and watched her for years.  Fell in love with her and tries to impress her and talk her into mating with him to be Queen.  Yeah...uh no.  He's a Prince yes but doubtfully will he ever be a King because he's 4th in line.  Oppsy.  Interesting story.
Not bad just kinda short and needs editing.  Story was really rushed and underdeveloped in story and characters.  Kind of made thing that did happen unbelievable.  Not horrible though.

This was quite painful to read actually.  Not the whole book.  The beginning was perfectly fine.  Seemed to also take them forever to get to Maine.  The book moved a little slow.  There were so many different things going on it ended up being choppy and not flowing well.  There were 5 women and men being paired up.  I think that's a big reason this book didn't work.  That's just too many to deal with all at once.  We saw no relationship or romance development at least not much.  Sex scenes were either skipped over or were written poorly and rushed.  Unanswered questions remained.  We would be focused on one thing happening and then something else would be the focus and it left me scratching my head sometimes.  I got about halfway when I started to doubt I should finish it.  I'd say I got about 3/4 the way through before I called it quits.  It was just confusing and burning and slow!  I really think this book should have been split up or maybe not split the focus so much.  I also didn't care a whole lot for the women's attitudes and their way of thinking.  Zoya comes to mind.  Just didn't like her.  She seemed to want to cause waves if I am quoting her.  She seems a little jealous of Alex because she got Boyd and tries to make a play for him at the start.  I dunno I just dislike women like that.  Its an ok story just couldn't keep the right flow and delve into one or two things at once instead of throwing all this information at the reader and expecting us to just understand it all.  Doesn't work that way.  Sorry.

Oh holy heck!  I don't know...I think this might be my favorite!  I love them all but damn....Damon and Clara!  Just started this afternoon and I could NOT put it down!  Just had to keep reading.  Damon has been through some awful things in his long life.  He's felt that he had to be cold and let nobody in because he loses them anyways because he's immortal and the only one.  Clara has been through some awful things too.  Losing her whole screw and 2 men she loved and tried to be a family with and have kids only to lose them.  Clara is the spitting image of Damon's love from eons ago and Clara comes from the same line.  She's different and I believe all her headaches and dreams she has is because that woman's spirit is in her.  She's got a task to complete, a promise she made to Damon before she died.  She takes over long enough to complete it.  He's not exactly receptive of Clara at first but he can't help himself.  She's vibrant and funny and really sweet.  Feisty comes to mind as well.  They are good for each other and it doesn't take long for them to fall in love.  They do get their HEA but I cant give everything away.  Its a great ending and its all summed up as well to end the series.  Will there be more?  I don't know what she'll get up to or these bears!  LOL.  We've learned so much about Damon that we constantly wondered about.  I cant get over how much I loved it.  T.S. Joyce is brilliant!

Wow...yum!  This was a great book 2!  These are so short and I just wanted them a little longer!  Slade was sweet and hawt!  Gretchen was great!  I loved her and she is feisty and sweet as well.  These are fast stories which actually are written well for their length.  I can't wait for the next book which is Lia and Caleb.  Which at the end of this one I was like nooooo I wanna read more!  Dammit!  :)  I must wait I guess for a couple weeks til the other book is out.  I am surprised a little at how well Jonathan is taking losing 2 of his fighters so quick.  I mean they had a contract and everything but still I imagined he'd beg them to stay on.  He seems to let them go without a big deal.  Also, Gretchen's old pack...really?  They are prejudiced against inter-species mating?  Eh...good riddance!

*****Received this ARC in exchange for an honest review. Contains Spoilers!!!!!I enjoyed reading the story about Knox and Lilly.  Its a little bit different than a "normal" shifter world...if we can say normal shifter!  Ha.  Anyways, Lilly's lost her parents at a young age and was raised by her best friends parents who love her like a daughter.  She has an Uncle but he's so busy with being Captain of the Guard he has no time.  However, he's always been there for her at birthdays and important stuff like that.  She's kind of a complex character.  She feels like she isnt good enough because her parents were kinda poor.  So, she wants to prove to others and herself that she CAN do this and be a Guard.  She's taunted by a lot of her peers and doesnt have the best self confidence.  She meets Knox who is The Prince of the Wolves and future King.  They end up being mates but when he hears she's going for the Guard he puts a stop to it and breaks her heart and she runs away and leaves town.  Not the most mature thing to do but I understand why.  She feels so out of control that her one dream was stolen and her life is ruined.  Their mating is definitely off to a rocky start.  She doesnt even know they are mates until he locates her later.  I wont give away everything but lots of twists in this book.  He does end up supporting her and agrees to let her compete.  Ends on a HEA.  Had great secondary characters and hope to read more about them.  Holden and Sloan for sure.  :)This was written well.  I had only had 2 issues with the book.  Some editing errors I found when reading it.  Just small ones and there was a typo when her father, Marcus is described and he was still referred as her Uncle.  Just little things like that.  My other issue was that there were a few times that Knox and Lilly acted a wee bit juvenile a little too much emphasis like stomping ones foot and pouting.  It wasn't a lot but usually at the most high stress situations in the book.  They are in their low to mid 20s and acted 17 once or twice.  Have to say I've witnessed it in her books before and its actually gotten way better but still there every so often in her characters.  Definitely a recommended read for me and I really loved it actually.  I smiled a few times and thought Knox was sweet and protective.  Lilly had a tendency to run away instead of facing some issues but I found her sweet and shy and definitely innocent in many ways.

So, the difference with this book is that it was released in one book instead of broken up.  Considering its Mina Carter it doesn't matter which way because when she does serials she puts them out pretty quick.  However, I did like that this was all in one book.  I liked Jane and Karryl from Tarrick's books.  I thought it was funny that he wanted a nice and meek woman who obeyed him.  Ha.  He so didn't get that!  Jane is tough and she's an older woman and knows what she wants.  She's totally independent and kick ass.  I liked her but she had SUCH a stubborn streak!  Karryl was just sweet and VERY persistent on wanting to mate her.  This was interesting and both actually kinda got in trouble.  Jane because she was caught as a spy which actually hurt him and changed his view of her.  He thought her as a soldier and someone who was honest and honorable and that kinda changed after he found out it was true.  I felt bad for him.  However, he got in trouble with her because after they crashed after escaping she lost her memory and he used that to mate with her.  They were perfectly matched and the sex was scorching!  Dayum!  I wonder who is gonna be next?  Laaryn maybe with Jess?  Hmm...I wonder who would get lucky enough to have Kenna for a mate lol.  She's a chatterbox!  Love this series!

This is a very much loved series for me!  She did this awesome box set and revised and re-wrote and edited the first 3 which is awesome!  Thank you Julia!  I got this at such a great deal!I have to say to date my favorite book is For The Love of Her Dragon.  Its so awesome and heartbreaking.  Heart wrenching and I cry every time I read it!  Darn dragons!  Love Kyra and she's such a great character!  She cracks me up.  Love her.  Now I've read all in this series.  She's written a book 8 and 9 as well.  I know she isn't done even after that.  There are more beloved dragons to write about.  :) The other favorite is Fighting For Her Dragon.  I know its Andrew's story and everything he's done.  Still though its very emotional as well and Emma sweet Emma is awesome!My reviews haven't changed in these books you can catch my reviews on the individual books on Goodreads and here on Amazon!

Yeah...I read these a long time ago and purchased.  However, she's doing more books in the series FINALLY!  No that's not subtle!  LOL.  Anyway, box set came at a great deal and I snagged it.Knight Protectors is a different kind of vampire story.  We have Nibbled By The Vamp which stars Wren and Griffin.  Wren is all kinds of hilarious and very fiery and feisty!  She gets into a bit of trouble at night when she heard screams and being her she couldn't not try and help but alas it was a trap by some vicious pixies!  Yeah not so nice kind with teeth and poisonous venom!  Griffin saves her and after healing her he JUST cant help but want her and has her he does but later after the help of some fellow Knighters she's his "fire" which is like soul mate.  So, this is a crazy tale of their rocky but oh so sexy and funny lovedom!Then we have Big Bad Vamp which has Wren's roommate Tory and Griffin's fellow Knighter Liam who is such a man*hore and flirt!  Tory cracks me up because she is kinda paranoid but in a good way.  She's got all these escape plans like 52 1/2 I think?  She's got purple hair and is kinda different than what Liam normally goes for.  He knows she's his fire but considering she isn't all the "experienced" in the ways of sex he goes slow.  Which hey she is sorta freaked still cause she is more or less a vampire but cant make the conversion because she's his fire and he changed her to save her or she'd die.  Lots of cool things happen and I don't wanna spoil everything but you'll love this tale.  :)I SOO look forward to book 3!

So, of course I've already read these books all separately.  I was excited to get them in a box set.  Its a different alien world than I have read.  It took getting used to after I read the first part.  It was released in different parts at the time.  However, it grew on me and I ended up loving it.  Tarrick and Cat are awesome characters.  They are sorta alike but not.  She fights him at first but ends up not being able to keep her hands off him.  She makes the "sacrifice" to mate Tarrick to save her fellow human women who were also captured.  Yeah its a real sacrifice for her too!  LOL.  Anyways, read it cause you'd love it too!  Cat totally has him wrapped around her finger so to speak.  These aliens are big but they value women who don't really exist where they come from.  Love this series and cant wait for more!

Loved reading about Carter and Bethany.  Carter is a wolf/tiger shifter.  He shifts into his tiger but takes on attributes of a wolf as well.  Bethany is a rare white rabbit shifter.  She doesn't have a lot of self esteem or believes in herself all that much.  Her family adopted her and they happen to be lion shifters but love her so very much.  Her fear comes from the other groups in her pride not her family.  Her family doesn't know all of what happened to her throughout her childhood and even adulthood.  They know some but not all.  Her mom and dad are very protective of her as well as her annoying sisters lol.  Love her dad...sweet protective daddy!  Ha.  Anyways she moves from her pride to a new town Deal's Gap, Tennessee which is a shifter town.  She first meets Greer who's the Alpha's right hand and he's charming and SUCH a flirt.  I'm new to the Kindle Worlds so this should be interesting!  Carter couldn't be more sweet and hot and charming and hawt...yes I said it twice!  Cause yeah he is!  He wouldn't change a thing about Bethie...love his nickname for her.  She actually runs when she figures out he's her mate...so cute she ran off.  He thought so too he found her later and coaxed her out of her house with the help of her sister Hannah on the phone.  This is really quite humorous and that's to be expected with Celia Kyle right?  Love her stuff!  This is a different shifter town there isn't an "alpha" per se just someone who oversees and keeps things on the up and up.  We don't get to meet him in this book.  Just his second Greer.  Just loved this book and it was too short but that's ok cause loved it anyways!

Well, I did like it but I do wish it were longer so we could get into the relationship part of Hale and Renae.  I have to admit its not as good as some of her other work, but I still enjoyed it.  It didnt flow as well and when things were happening it wasnt always clear what the big picture was.  He's supposed to be a total jerk but he really wasnt.  He was supposed to have all this magic but I only saw a trick or two.  He turned into a bad ass werelock for sure at the end but otherwise I wasnt all that impressed with his capabilities.  However, since it was kinda short that's to be expected.

To give Ashley props this was a big improvement in her stories.  They are getting better but I do find some issues.  Not sure I read the same book as the other reviewers.  It was a good story I do admit that.  Just the banter between characters and things like that just made no sense sometimes.  The parentheses thoughts were confusing and seemed silly.  She talks to her deceased family as well like they are right there.  It was just strange and I wasn't sure what Ashley was going for there.  Christian was a complete douche to her through most of it.  I get trying to keep her at arms length but this kinda went over and beyond and really bordered meanness.  Calling her garbage?  Really?  Wow!  Her co-worker Stevie who is supposed to be her friend wasn't exactly supportive of her either.  Saying she would get more people to like her if she lost weight.  Uh way to be supportive there dude!  Rick the werebear who she patched up no less basically blamed her for everything.  Just some of the parts of the story I didn't care for.  They all treated her like crap!  It was REALLY hard for me to root for anyone other than Veronica and yes later I rooted for Christan when he got over himself and did a 180.  I think the ONLY one nice to her from beginning to end and he didn't even spend that much time with her was Argo I think his name was.  He was sweet.  Also this wasn't 166 pages.  It was half of that because there was another story included which I have read before.  Don't like when authors add extra stories to make books seem longer.  Honestly that's what it was whether it was intended that way or not.  I do continue to read her stories because they are good stories.  Just the conversations, editing, and development can be off putting at times.  :)  This was a solid 3 stars for me.

I received an ARC of this book in exchange for an honest review.  Contains spoilers.  Faith is a young woman in an abusive relationship with a man named Wolf who’s a leader of a violent gang called Los Lobos.  She’s desperate  to get away from him and his abuse.  She learns he plans to lock her away in a compound of his and refuses to be his slave so she escapes.  However, a few days prior to her escaping she meets Jackson who was supposed to be meeting Wolf for information.  Something about Faith that draws Jackson in and he wants her.  He’s not exactly sweet to her and she’s wasn’t nice either more like a defense mechanism.  Jackson isn’t a nice guy but he’s not abusive like her ex.  He’s rough around the edges for sure and is part of a gang called The Brotherhood.  Difference between these groups is Los Lobos are killers plain and simple.  The other is not.  They steal basically and that type of deal.  We never really know much about them in the book.  Anyways, Faith goes to find Jackson and found him she does.  He offers her protection at a price.  Her surrender and he wants a son out of her.  He wants her total surrender and wants to be her Master and Owner.  He wants to dominate her.  After spending 3 days together doing the deed he ups and leaves her to go after this gang to kill them all.  By himself and alone and risks his life.  Of course she ends up pregnant and has a son, Sam.  However, this goal of his takes him 12 years.  All that time and Faith raises their son for almost 12 years all on her own.  When he comes back its not all roses.  She never stopped loving him and having hope he’d be back.  They both stayed celibate through the 12 years which is unheard of.  Things get to a rocky start when he does come back.  Eventually though things work out and he meets Sam and they just hit it off like buddies.  So, through everything Faith and Jackson get their HEA.My opinion is this is a good first book for Chance.  Not a bad job at all.  I could tell it was written by a man but I can understand how difficult that can be.  I have to be honest though that when I read what it was about I was excited.  However, as I went along its not really what I was expecting.  The timeline just didn’t work for me.  12 years.  Hard to wrap my head around you know?  There were a few of things that bothered me.  The whole “I wanna own you and be your master and I want your surrender and I wanna dominate you” is like a BDSM kind of thing.  That was nowhere in this book.  It was explained way later what he meant by that.  In a nutshell its marking his territory plus having sex with her in all her *ahem* places.  Best I can describe it on Amazon.  So, I get the total surrender thing and even possibly dominating.  Master and Owner thing just didn’t jive in this book though.  Never came up.  I’m an avid reader of BDSM so I fairly know what dominating, owning, surrendering etc is.  I also think there needed to be more information about Jackson and Faith.  We really don’t know them.  They spent so little time together that there was no real relationship there.  Not that I expect a big one or even one so in depth.  I just think throwing in the being apart for 12 years messed it up for me.  We don’t know much of anything about where they come from.  Also, we needed a little backstory about the Los Lobos and The Brotherhood.  I THINK they might have been MC’s but I don’t know for sure.  Its so vague.  We don’t get to know Faith and Jackson’s age until almost half the book.  I am also surprised there was no interaction with this Wolf guy or their gang except that one guy and it was like a sentence saying he’s a dead man.  We get no interaction between Faith and Wolf either.  Seems underdeveloped character wise and I mean all of them.  Its like the story was between Jackson and Faith and The Brotherhood which consisted of 4 people.  I KNOW Chance is doing more book in this series and maybe we’ll get more character development.  Even after everything I mentioned I still thought it was a decent read with a lot of potential.  It just didn’t quite make it for me.  I needed more background and development in the story and characters.  I think the biggest hurdle for me was the 12 year block.  I do look forward to reading his next book though.  So pretty good job Chance.  :)

I really loved the story BUT I think Ellen's self worth needed to be addressed.  I mean she had a low self-esteem.  Thought she was so plain and boring and she's also a bbw.  Kinda felt Mix didn't want someone like her because she wasn't as pretty as he is used to being with.  Felt because of fate he was forced to take her.  I knew that really wasn't true.  Yeah he didn't necessarily assure her he thought she was beautiful and he wanted her.  I think that's what was missing from it.  Although he was drawn to her from the beginning although he fought it til he scented her.  She really was funny and sweet.  Its a shame those other 2 witches were you know....*itches.  :)  Can't wait to see what she comes up with next.  It really was a great story.  Refreshing and even different from Von and Lomond.

I really loved this.  It was a little darker and different.  Jackson and Alex are mates but she is leaving because of the violence all the time.  His clan are rough around the edges and have issues controlling their bears.  That is the reason primarily she is leaving although there is another reason.  An abused ex-husband who is bat***t crazy.  She ends up hurt and Jack comes to her rescue.  Its actually sweet and she gets to know the real him instead the fighting all the time she also gets to know the other guys.  They stop fighting long enough for her to breath and relax and get to know them all and to heal from her injuries.  Great story and look forward to the other bears finding their mates.

Some people might get mad at me but there are some issues that need to be addressed.  There are issues with this story and the previous few.  Lack of romance between characters.  In this one everything was rushed.  She seemed to hate him at first in the diner but then boom she's had a crush on him for 10 years.  That just didn't make any sense.  She knew who he was and she was kinda hostile towards him.  I realize he was an idiot at first trying to flirt with her but still.  Then he yells he loves her as he skedaddles out her apartment for an assignment and she says nothing?  She doesn't even think anything of it at the time.  So, I dunno it was missing something.  These are great stories but I think compared to what we are used to reading from her these aren't as good as others.  I thought a demon this time was an interesting touch.  Seems like there are very good stories but its the romances themselves that aren't as good.  Ms. Kristen's Mate series were awesome.  Just wondering how it can be the same author?  These are short stories and I get that there isn't going to be a lot of details but I think I agree with another reviewer that how they "sense" their mates are inconsistent.  We need a bit more.  For instance, Liam Skyworth's story was way better than the ones that came after his book to be honest.  His came in parts but still I felt the romance and connection between the characters and the story was great too.  Not that I'm gonna stop reading just hopefully she'll read the reviews and maybe take our suggestions.  :)  Maybe Dylan or Luke will be next.

I thought there was issues with formatting because the chapters seemed smooshed together too tightly.  I kinda sometimes thought Tucker sounded like a teenager.  LOL.  I dont know if that was because he got so nervous or what.  He didnt seem so confident and plus he kinda jumped her like a teenager would a girl they liked.  Otherwise I enjoyed the story.  I look forward to more.

I did like this but there were a lot of editing errors and needs to be cleaned up.  Also, it was a little under-developed.  I think we needed more details about this alien world and the characters.  I liked the story but it was kinda different and I got confused once or twice because it was hard to tell or picture what was actually happening.  I think if it was edited correctly it would have been a different experience for me.  This would have been a 4 star for me otherwise but because of all the errors and lack of development only a 3 star.  I do like this author because her other book I liked a lot.  Hope to read more from her.

Contains some spoilers!!!!I'm a fan of Lynn Cooper and this was way different than what she normally does.  This is a very dark tale.  It doesn't necessarily have a HEA.  Maybe not even a HFN.  Its a weird situation and if you read it you'd understand what I mean by thats.  I will say this is a dark romance book and not for the faint of heart because it included kidnapping and holding a woman captive and some abuse.  We meet Amara who is a young woman who's had a sheltered life and religious one at that including still being a virgin.  She was abandoned by her hippie parents and left to the care of her Grandmother who raised her to be a Godly woman.  Well, after she passes it doesn't take and Amara goes out on her own and ends up at Myrtle Beach.  She is alone and gets her wallet taken and after almost collapsing of heat exhaustion she is found by a seemingly nice guy Colt.  However, she comes to find out not everything is as it seems and nor is everyone.  He drugs her and kidnaps her and puts her in a cell in the basement of his home in the mountains.  When she wakes that's where her nightmare begins or so she thinks.  She is confronted by a man who looks exactly like Colt but is way darker and meaner.  His name is Slade and they are twins.  Light and dark and good and evil.  She can't help but be afraid of Slade but is also intrigued by him.  He's a dominant and he's not gentle or nice pretty much brutal.  When I was reading this it was little things and I discovered that early on that Slade is both Colt and Slade not 2 people.  So we got split personality going on.  Amara doesn't find this out until she is able to escape but is found by a sheriff and told of Colt and Slade and indeed there WAS a Colt but he was killed recently and Slade didn't handle it well.  Had a psychotic break because they were twins and inseparable.  I felt a lot of pity for him.  Slade forced her to choose between Colt and himself because the other person would have to go.  Yeah its a crazy kind of deal and Amara knows that if she chooses Colt it would end Slade and be so much worse.  So, she chooses Slade but he doesn't take it well because he doesn't wanna let go of his brother.  He eventually accepts it and accepts her as his.  Now that's pretty much where it ended after they did the deed which her virginity was taken.  Although he is known for his brutality and being ungentle...he really was pretty nice about taking her that first time.  I was impressed.  Anyways, although this was way different than her normal stuff I did like it.  It was a very interesting story and turn of events.  I wish it were longer though so at least we knew we had a HEA but guess not.

This was a great story.  I really loved it!  It surrounds a quirky little town and its residents who are mostly paranormal.  We meet Joss who is a young witch who is sort of a peacekeeper of the town.  They mostly run to her when there is a problem or squabble.  She's had a very bad day so far.  A growly bear who continues to fight with the squirrel shifters...3 suitors who wanna warm her bed for the winter, a siren issue which may or may not be a legend, a murder, a mate, and to top it off a crop of mushrooms to destroy...will her day get better?  We meet Tiberius Hawk or better known as Hawk to most who is an officer of sorts from The Department of Supernatural and Existential Affairs.  He's kinda growly at first and trying to do his job considering he found Joss in the middle of the illegal mushroom field.  Once he finds out she's his mate the game totally changes.  Add a pesky vampire into the mix who was YES one of the potential suitors who wanted to warm her bed.  Who by the way couldn't HELP baiting poor Hawk.  Ha.  Great story and I just laughed.  Awesome and I hope we kinda get more like this because it was certainly different in a very good way!

This was a very good story.  I loved Corin's character.  He was a very good guy and although didn't know May's situation at the time he did rescue her.  He finds her bleeding and naked and hurt and offers to buy her to rescue her.  However, he DOES have an ulterior motive and wants to study her.  Once she talks to him and he finds out whats happened and what the real situation is he sorta diverts a little.  He feels things for her but tries not to because he has a mission to find compatible women for his people who are dying out.  He doesn't tell her he's an alien she sorta figures it out.  I found the story to be refreshing and my favorite of hers.  Sweet and romantic too actually and crazy chemistry.  :)

Awesome little table that took 10 minutes to assemble, and only took that long because I'm not a tool wielding ape. It's sturdy enough for my printer, and the cats like to sleep on the bottom shelf. Can't ask for more from a cheap table. I kind of wish I'd gotten a few more at the same time. (Though it was like $25 when I bought it, and it's now $31.)
I buy this soap by the case. Chandrika and the Mysore Sandal Soap is all we use. It gets you clean, makes your skin soft, and smells amazing.

I buy this soap by the case. Chandrika soap and the Mysore Sandal Soap is all we use. It gets you clean, makes your skin soft, and smells amazing. I get told daily by strangers that I smell good. Which is kinda weird sometimes, but I take it in the spirit it was intended.

I love these shoes! I got them yesterday. I'm a shortie, and they make me feel tall and glorious. I out level my 12 year old son for the first time in months.In seriousness tho: Good sturdy straps, comfy soles with just a little give for your toes to sink in, the bottom is a little slick, so watch out on wet floors. These were a replacement for a pair I've had for 8 or 9 years, so I had high standards.
At least that's what I'm reminded of every time I smell it. Still the only thing I'll use on my face after 20 years.
It gets hot and blows hair around. Works for me. It's lightweight and gets my hair dry in about 3 minutes, which is approximately 15 minutes less than my old one.

Card worked for approximately as long as it took to get Windows Updates downloaded, then started artifacting. The light on the board turned red after taking it out to reseat it. RMAd and got an EVGA instead, and it works beautifully. Amazon was awesome with the return process.
I love this stuff. I use it on my lips, my hands, dry elbows, flyaway hair... too bad it doesn't do windows too. I need to start buying in bulk.
It was ok at keeping the shine down some, but with the texture wasn't my cup of tea. It's very waxy feeling. No real difference in how my pores looked.

For $30 I wasn't expecting miracles, but this is a pretty darned good steamer. It heats up fairly quickly, and gets the job done. I knocked off one star for the small capacity and annoying cap.The capacity could be better, but this is fine for small jobs. On a first time clean of the bathroom sink, I had to refill twice - BUT it had never been steamed before and I got a little overzealous.If you have kids and think your bathroom is clean, go steam your toilet. It's ok, I'll wait here.The cap is another story. You have to screw it down until it's almost closed, then push and turn like a pill bottle. It's not hard to do, but can take a couple of tries to make sure it's right.

To my mind this is not a thriller, or especially gripping. And it's definitely not for everyone. It's a quirky, humorous, sad tale of dementia - with a mystery twist. I found the mystery (such as it was) the least interesting part of the book. Instead it was the character's observations and offbeat voice that I found appealing. It was also confusing at times and slow at times.

I wanted to like this book and in the beginning I did. The early chapters were engaging, I liked  Lydia and was able to tolerate Claire, and there were questions raised that made me want to keep reading. But it didn't take long before the book turned tedious, unbelievable and gruesome for reasons that didn't further the plot. The bad guys are evil beyond belief, the relationships unrealistic, the plot bounced from Claire's wallowing to sadistic torture scenes (not involving Claire). It read like it was written by a teenager. I don't understand the rave reviews.

This is a very small toy. It's 6 inches if you stretch out the legs, but the basic toy is 4 inches. Not anywhere near the 8 inches listed in the description. Not worth sending back, but it's a lot smaller than I expected. It is very cute, however.
Arrived quickly, just as listed. I can't find flesh colored or beige in stores, only white if I can find at all. Useful for facial scratches, cuts and nicks.
After years of thin, drugstore covers, I bought this and a pad. What a difference! And it fits, that's a new experience for me also. Very happy with this purchase.

Don't believe the one star reviews, they are clearly written by Clinton supporters trying to give the book a bad name. But be warned, the book is so heavily detailed and documented that it's a bit of a slog to read. If you follow politics, you are probably familiar with the material in the book. It covers the long history of the Clinton's manipulation and abuse of power. The author documents it all, but it wasn't really anything new. If you are a died in the wool Clinton supporter who is not interested in facts, then the book will definitely not appeal to you. But if you are only vaguely familiar with political history, and/or you are looking for information to make an informed decision come 2016, then it's worth a read, or at least a quick read.

I found this book laborious, meandering and not at all compelling. I slogged through to the end because I was on a trip and this was the only book I had. First off, I didn't care about the situation or the setting, and thought the gimmick that kept the main character in town and on the case wasn't believable. Although I started out liking the main character, I grew tired of him and bored by his "pursuit of the truth." The author does too much caving stuff (hey, we get the idea that it's dark and tight) and the story lacks focus. Could have been half as long. This is my first book by the author and it will be my last. On the positive side, the early few chapters are interesting and there are some nice surprises. Unfortunately, it's downhill from there.

This is a fairly bad, poorly written book but I'm giving it three stars because I did read it to the end (albeit skimming parts.) it's basically a different slant on a romance novel and as such, it suffers from the flaws of many (but my no means all) romance novels  - flat characters, cardboard and juvenile dialogue, and unbelievable contrivances. Unlike some of the other critics, I liked the way the story was framed - chapters in the present as Dave and Lillian give an interview about their experience on the island, and then real time on the island. The transitions weren't as smoothly done as they could have been, but the framing was the only thing that gave the book any suspense or momentum. The interviewer (and apparently much of the public) don't believe the account of Dave and Lillian's time on the island (why??), but the hostility and snarkiness is over the top and totally unfounded. Character motivations are pulled out of thin air to fit the story so that the whole book is not only unbelievable, but doesn't ring true on an emotional level. And the ending was possibly, one of the stupidest things I've ever read.

This book is like a B-grade made-for-tv movie -- it held my interest but was poorly written and way too convoluted to be believable or gripping. I'm not sure why the author needed to included so many characters and tangential events - yes some added "thrills" but the amounted to nothing in the end. Maybe because without all the extraneous stuff the story would have been obvious early on (as it was anyway.) And speaking of the ending - A big cop out. There are a lot of unanswered questions.

I enjoyed the first part of the story - told from the point of view of the youngest of three sisters (Jess) raised by an abusive father. Maybe enjoy isn't the right word because really unpleasant things happened to them, but the story was gripping and the characters well-drawn and believable.  The second part of the story is told from Jess's eighteen-year-old daughter's point of view. She does stupid things and is not at well-drawn or believable as the three sisters. The final part is told from both Jess's point of view and her daughter's and their behaviors are so over-the-top dumb as to undercut almost all my sympathy and interest. That said, the book will keep you turning the pages and I enjoyed it enough that I am going to give the author's other books a try. Warning, it does contain graphic material which, based on the reviews, was too much for some people. I didn't like it but it was true to character. If you only like cozy books with nice people, this is not for you.

I took this bag on our last European trip in place of my more bulky "gym bag" type carry on.  I loved it. Easy to carry, helpful pockets, stood up on its own (as long as you don't put heavy stuff that makes it lean and fall over). I used it for stuff I needed on train or plane (iPad, passport, glasses, meds etc) not as an overnight bag. Ideally, it would have been a little less tall and a little wider at the bottom, but over all, very happy.

This is an unusual book in that I found it heavy handed and amateurish in many respects, yet riveting to read. It is definitely a plot driven sort of story without a lot of character development or subtlety, but I was willing to overlook that because I was hooked into the story from early on. I read the Kindle version and there were a number of formatting errors (mostly paragraphs than ran together in dialogue) but I also didn't let that detract from my enjoyment of the story. I thought this was a first time author but have since found out he has an earlier book. The author shows promise. The book is worth reading for story line and theme.

We got this as a replacement for the NuHeat Solo thermostat, which we loved until it stopped working. This one works fine. Some observations -* It's slightly larger than the Solo, which is only a problem if, like us, it's right next to the light switch. It's also slightly creamier in color.* The wiring (hooking it to electrical in the wall) is completely different than the Solo. My husband installed it fine but without the diagram from the old Solo he would have had trouble sorting it all out. (He's not an electrician although he is rather handy).* The face is black with white numerals, so a different look than the Solo.* Programming was easy (there is no manual but it's all self-explanatory). It took me awhile to figure out how to get back to the home screen after it was programmed as there is no "home" button. Answer - turn the whole thing off, then turn it on again.

I enjoyed this book. While the characters may not have been totally believable, they were interesting enough to keep me engaged throughout the story. A modern gothic romance sort of book.  A good read for easy enjoyment. I am going to look into other books by the author.

I really wanted to like this book. I liked the idea of it and many parts of it, but overall it fell short. The story seemed plodding to me and flat, with no emotional swings even though it dealt with very emotional and heartfelt issues. In part it was the writing style and in part it was the characters who again struck me as flat - even though they were depicted (on the surface) as being really good or really bad. I also thought the time period sounded much more like someone who'd read about it than lived it. Overall, I found the book heavy-handed and not engaging.  And very predictable.

I've read other books by this author, some good, some I've put down without finishing, but this one was riveting. I tend to avoid books about war and suffering, for many reasons, and so many of the ones I have read are dense, heavy and ponderous, often with unappealing characters. This book drew me in from the start and kept me emotionally involved until the very end. I can't vouch for the veracity of the historic details (although most seemed to fit with what I know), but Hannah did a good job of creating a world that felt authentic. Highly recommended.

I generally enjoy Lippman's books but this one was a bit of a disappointment. Years ago a mother left her child in a hot car and the child died. I find that a fascinating set of circumstances, but the book is not really about that but about manipulation and game-playing by the people years later. I didn't like Tess's continually wondering if she was a good mother, and I didn't like the other characters. The story lacked focus and got bogged down after the beginning. It read like the author didn't really know where she was going and let the story meander.

Nice hat, and just what I wanted. A large-brimmed sun hat isn't always convenient (exercise,  crowded places etc) and a baseball cap (my other option) has a rather narrow brim. This hat has a wider brim than a baseball cap and is almost as deep.  It still doesn't give the full coverage of a real wide-brim sun hat, but it's comfortable, fits nicely with enough depth that I can pull it low (and tuck my hair up inside). It's adjustable in the back.

I rarely give novels a one star rating but this one was bad, and especially bad for Tami Hoag who is capable of turning out a really good book. The main character is recovering from a traumatic brain injury and can't remember what happened to her. First of all, I find this set up is used far too often and is a cheap gimmick for "mystery" and "suspense." More importantly it's boring to read. And  in this book it goes on and on. I didn't care about the characters, the cases, and in fact skimmed the last third as fast as I could. The ending did not redeem the book for me. If it hadn't had some recurring characters from earlier books, I would have said this was an old, early attempt at a book she hadn't been able to get published years ago.

For the early part of the book I thought this was a serious psychological thriller and I was mentally very critical of it for many reasons. But then I realized it's not supposed to be realistic. It's a Hollywood type cat and mouse, plot driven suspense story - and for that it was a decent read although by the end I was really happy to be done with it. What I didn't like: flat,unlikable sociopathic and shallow characters; stilted dialogue; women characters obviously written by a man. But it was suspenseful and the story marched along at a quick pace. A good airplane book.
I loved this book!  Funny, moving, insightful, clever, delightful -- Highly recommended. One of the best books I've read recently.

I read the first book when it came out, in part to see what all the hoopla was about and in part to keep up with what's hot in the YA market. As an adult, I didn't expect to find it more than mildly interesting. But I was blown away. I loved it, found it fully engaging, cared about the characters, loved the drama, the questions it raised and appreciated the broader concepts of power and corruption.  I read the second book and was equally captivated.  I was looking forward to the Mocking Jay and was quite disappointed. If you haven't read the earlier books you won't understand or care at all. I found very little to care about, even the characters who'd so intrigued me in earlier books. The action is more page filling than dramatic. It read to me like the author wanted to wrap up the story and that's all. If you're a fan of these books, you'll certainly want to see how it all ends (as I did). But don't expect the same depth of story as in the earlier books.

At the start of this book I thought "ho-hum" three stars at best. The characters weren't interesting and the chapter structure confusing. But along the way it got better and by the end I couldn't put it down. I agree with those reviewers who point out the logical flaws, of which there are many, but I was willing to overlook them because I got wrapped up in the story, particularly the Colin chapters. (Actually, I found Eve, the mother, really annoying and unlikable.) The thought the author did a good job of showing how a person can get caught up in something and in over his head without meaning to. I guessed both ending twists early on (there are clues, plus it was about the only way it could end and the final twist about the only thing that could give it a knock-out punch) but that didn't bother me. I wanted to watch it unfold. That said, if you are a reader who wants realism and is put off by obvious holes in a story, this may not be for you.

I have been a longtime fan of Connelly's books. I've found them engrossing and moving and memorable. The Burning Room was just plain boring, with characters I didn't care about, cases I didn't care about, prose that could have been written by a ten-year-old. I got the feeling Michael Connelly has checked out. Maybe he had one book left on a contract and so he wrote this, just throwing words on the page to get to the end. Very disappointing.

I wish I'd returned this before I even tried to use it. (The frustration free packaging by the way, is anything but. It took 10 minutes, one broken nail and a cut on my palm!). This unit tries to do too much. I wanted a step counter, period. You can't reset this one to zero! Others love it so it might work for you, but check all the questions to see if it does what you want it to.  It's also very large.
