Which might be convenient to use in the car for phone calls.  Charging the TDK is only done with the AC line cord from an outlet. There is an "outbound only" USB port, to charge other devices while you are listening to the TDK (or have it on, but with no signal being sent to it, or volume turned down, if you want silence while charging something else). The manual says the TDK will charge other devices through the USB, when it is "on" and plugged into an outlet. Since I have not tried it, I don't know whether the TDK would charge something through the USB port, if it is not plugged in.  Also, in the distant future, if and when the rechargeable batteries run their course and no longer hold a charge, they are replaceable, unlike some electronic devices which have sealed systems. There are instructions from TDK on how to remove and replace worn out batteries. This will not happen for quite some time, since these types of batteries typically go through hundreds of recharge cycles before wearing out.At least purchase this unit and try it at home, side by side, with any other speaker that you have narrowed your choice down to, and let your ears be the judge, without online "brand fans" hyping their favorite, at the expense of what will please you. You will not be disappointed.

Overall, this is a good quality bag. However, the price leads us in a different direction. Functionally, the primary minor drawbacks are these: they do not store in the freezer very efficiently due to the way they are constructed, which prevents stacking as flat as other bags, which are not self standing. So, if you want to store a lot of bags for extended usage periods, they might not be the best solution. We also found them to be a bit more difficult to fill, due to the stiffness of the bag. Although the labeling section at the top is a nice feature, if you cut the bag off closer to the ziplock area above the reservoir, they are easier to fill, which works out ok if you are not concerned about storing them for extended periods. And we think that is not much of an issue since the breast feeding cycle is not likely to force you to keep them for more than a month or two in the freezer, if you are cycling them properly by using the oldest first. We feel that you can use a "Sharpie" to mark the date on the lower portion of the bag, laid out flat on the counter, before you fill the bag, so that you can cut off the upper portion. We tend to favor the Lansinoh bag over this one. But we think you should at least try on package of this brand to see if it better suits your needs.

I got these for my daughter and grand daughter. She says the pads work great from a functional point of view, but aesthetically they are somewhat undesirable, due to the thickness, which makes them fairly noticeable when wearing thin bras and light weight knit tops or blouses. And the shape makes them seem somewhat like "Madonna" (the singer) bras, in my daughters words. She says there are better choices out there for comfort and shape.

This is an extremely well designed lantern/flashlight. As a lantern it puts out adequate light to maneuver within a fairly large room (not necessarily to be able to read by), but what really blows me away is the flashlight, which should really be classified as a SEARCHLIGHT. This baby throws a very wide angle beam of light with an intensity one would expect from those spotlights that you see on vehicles. There are two concentric zones of light within the beam which are co-existent. At 10 feet away, it illuminates a 20' diameter circle well enough to walk in the woods in the dead of night and be able to see everything in your path. And within that 20' wide beam, in the center is a very highly concentrated and very bright hot spot of light which is about 3' to 4' in diameter, so you can see objects within that zone, as if it were daylight.  I am extremely impressed for outdoor use in open spaces and navigation. Also has a handle for 90 degree rotation for the most comfortable position for carrying as a lantern versus searchlight. Obviously the reflective design of the searchlight cone and of the other end of the unit for the lantern, have been very well thought out. Also has a fold-away hanger on top for suspending from the inside top of tents and a direct line charger for plugging into electrical outlets when not using batteries. And since the light sources are high efficiency LEDs, the battery life is going to be very good.  Well done and a slam dunk purchase, with no worries of buyers remorse.

SO SAD, that Amazon (who is generally the gold standard for honest retailing and fantastic customer service), does not more thoroughly screen the fragrances category of their offerings. There are many "less expensive" knock-offs of well known name brand fragrances, which have found their way into the Amazon marketplace. And the risk that Amazon customers run, is that if you discover that your fragrance differs from the authentic, which you might buy at full price at Dillard's or Macy's, etc, you can not return it for credit. You are stuck in the Amazon prohibition for fragrance returns. Just be aware, when the description at the top of the page for any fragrance says, "In stock but may require and extra 1-2 days to ship". This means that the fragrance is being provided by someone other than the original manufacturer or the original manufacturer's stocking distributor. It is taking the extra days because Amazon is relying on an outside source to fulfill the order, or getting it to Amazon for them to ship it. And Amazon obviously does not care to qualify their supplier's resources or the authenticity of the product that they are representing on their website. Extremely disappointing since I have relied on Amazon to be my "protector" over 15 loyal years of frequent purchases.Regarding Tommy Bahama Very Cool... I have been wearing this for 4 to 5 years and get endless comments from ladies on how wonderful it smells. I always receive comments, out of the blue... even from strangers in public. However, I recently ran low, almost exhausting a 2 year supply I had at home, only to find out that Tommy Bahama discontinued the fragrance. It is nowhere to be found on their website, as my first clue that it was no longer available. And in checking with Von Maur, Dillard's, and Macy's, they also confirmed it is no longer available, thus they do not carry it.However, I was momentarily delighted to find it on Amazon, only to be disappointed upon receipt. When it was in authentic production, it was being formulated by "Viewpoint International", who is clearly identified on the bottle and on the box, and it also had the distinctive oval cork cap. What is now being sold as TB Very Cool, is made by an alternate manufacturer "5 Star Fragrances", sporting a new cap which is a vertical plastic cylinder. IT IS NOT THE SAME FRAGRANCE . Obviously Tommy Bahama has farmed out its license to this alternate manufacturer, allowing them to use the TB name and fragrance name, so shame on them for tarnishing their brand. And shame on Amazon for displaying the deceptive pictures of the bottle with the cork cap, on the product description page, which is misleading to those who might be "in the know", and expecting to get the authentic versus the less impressive knockoff.The knock off fragrance is just ok, but does not have the subtle floral/citrus oil punch and longevity of the original. I sprayed the original on one wrist, in the morning and the knock off on the other, and then took a sniff at mid day and at days end. The original was still very much noticeable and  potent at days end, however the knock off had faded considerably by mid day. And the knock off, although somewhat similar in smell at first sniff, is definitely lacking what the original offered. And I have 5 daughters who have always raved about how great it smells (over the past several years), so I recently quizzed them as well, wearing the knock off, without explaining the background, and they offered that I did not smell the same as what I normally wear.

This book is the definitive resource for trying to understand the impacts and ramifications of Medicare and all of the peripheral issues related to comprehensive coverage. As an all-encompassing treatise on Medicare, it is written in an easily digestible format, with common sense English, explaining everything you need to know about senior health care. The book is written by a Medicare expert at AARP, who has been analyzing Medicare for 14 years and has answered thousands of questions, since 2008, from Medicare beneficiaries, on the AARP website.Not only does it cover all aspects of Medicare, but also delves into supplemental insurance and how to evaluate different plans, in relation to the basic coverage provided by Uncle Sam. It touches on how to manage your health care costs, in order to reduce out of pocket expenses, when dealing with doctors and filling prescriptions.  I seriously doubt that there is a question, left unanswered as well as providing answers to questions you would not even think of, to ask. It covers all deadlines and explains the consequences for missing deadlines. I only wish that this book had been available before I turned 65, two years ago. It would have saved me money on premiums as well as guiding me into supplemental Medigap plans and Part D drug coverage, with governmental safeguards and requirements which protect against the whims of insurance carriers, if you enroll in those plans within the first 6 months that you are elligible for Medicare. After the 6 month window then you are at the mercy of what the underwriters can do to your policies. So much valuable information which cuts through all of the clutter of information that comes at you from all different directions. This is a "must read" prior to reaching Medicare age, if you want to have a clear understanding of your choices, in one single, concise, and comprehensive resource.

After purchasing one pair of the Melvin loafer, and wearing it for about a month, I decided to purchase 5 more pair in various colors for wardrobe matching and as backups, since you never know when a manufacturer is going to cease making something that might be your favorite. Without question, this is the most comfortable shoe I have ever worn, and is in a style which goes well with extremely casual, all the way up to business casual. Very versatile look. The memory foam insoles are like walking on marshmallow pillows. They also provide great arch support (I have high arches) and are so light weight, you hardly realize you are wearing a shoe. Wow. My feet have never been so pampered. Can't begin to describe how sensational they feel. I have also purchased Skechers Go Walk which are close, in comfort but tend to run a bit smaller than standard. But they are not quite as comfy as the Melvin. There are also some other Relaxed Fit models, such as their "Dario", "Diamondback", and "Naven" models, which are close in comfort but not quite as much as the Melvin (but even at that, these other models are still far more comfortable than the majority of competing brands). Overall, Skechers has created some of the most comfortable casual shoes over the last 15 years, that I have ever experienced. Anytime I run across a new model in shoe stores, I always try them on and have rarely been disappointed with their extremely comfortable casual shoes. Although, I have not tried any of their sneakers or athletic shoes.

I was attracted to this item due to the inflatable headboard, which is a very smart feature. I have often wished there were some way to prevent my pillow from falling off the front edge of the bed, with inflatables. This solves the problem very simply. And being 6'-2", I was worried that this  would shorten the head to toe dimensions of the bed, which it did not. My feet did not hang over the foot of the bed. So, all in all, a great product. Caution....not a big deal, but since it has the inflatable head rest, you can not slip a fitted queen size sheet over the mattress, so we simply use the top sheet for a bottom sheet and wrap it around both sides and the foot of the bed. Another top sheet and blanket, finished it out. We slept comfortably on the bed. No reason not to buy it.

Dont buy it for the lighting. It is virtually non existent. And the air output is so low that it would have to be hung right over you in a tent in order to feel it. Much better solutions have to be out there.

Dr. Mulhall is the world's leading expert in sexual medicine, as it relates to preserving male functions after radical prostatectemy (prostate removal for cancer). After my prostate removal in August 2013, I did a massive amount of online research regarding how best to get back to normal after the surgery, which will take 12 to 24 months. Prostate removal, universally results in the inability to achieve erection, due to nerve damage (even when the nerves are totally spared). It takes the nerves as much as 12 to 24 months to come back to life, in order to trigger normal sexual function, even though you have full sensitivity to touch, without any lapse, immediately after the surgery.An unforeseen problem arises for those who do not engage in penile rehabilitation, during this critical 12 to 24 month period of nerve healing. If erections are not instigated through intervention (as described in Dr. Mulhall's book...daily use of low dose Viagra or Cialis, or trimix injections), on a regular basis, starting about 6 weeks after surgery, then the cavernosa muscles in the penis, which the blood flows into, in order to "inflate" can be become damaged through lack of oxygen that accompanies engorgement from blood flow. Collagen deposits will form in the spongy tissue of this muscle and cause atrophy, over a period of time. Then when the nerves do come back to life, they are ineffective in causing an erection because the erection muscle has been damaged through inactivity.The only reason I knew about this critical post operative requirement is because I went to Houston to have my prostate removed, by one of the foremost surgeons in that situation. Dr. Brian Miles has performed over 5,000 of these surgeries over the past 20 years and he told me that it was critical to follow this protocol to keep myself in the best possible condition for the return of the nerve function. I discovered that every male has 2-3 nocturnal erections every night in their sleep. We may not be aware of them, but it is the male body's normal way of keeping that muscle oxygenated, which was a complete surprise to me. Clinical sleep studies measured a large number of test subjects, to discover this universal pattern. So Dr. Miles advised that stimulating at least one to two erections per week with the help of Viagra or Cialis and in conjunction with your partners help, if possible, is critical to maintaining the health of the membranes. Subsequent research on  my part, led me to Dr. Mulhall, who lectures to Urologist symposiums throughout the country (some of which can be seen on Youtube, under a keyword search of his name). I discovered that he had written this in depth book on the subject and purchased it to educate myself even further. There are no gimmicks here. This is a true medical professional, writing on a very critical subject, with the sole purpose of allowing yourself to get back to normal with the highest potential degree of success. The book covers every possible aspect of explaining how we function "down there", and what leads to erections, along with in depth education on the structure of the membranes and tissues which are affected and what they will respond to, in order to overcome erectile dysfunction.AN ABSOLUTE MUST READ FOR EVERY MAN THAT GOES THROUGH PROSTATE REMOVAL.12/5/14 UPDATE. I am happy to report that, approximately 9 to 10 months after the surgery, my system started to awaken without the use of Viagra or Cialis and am delighted that one year after the surgery (following the book's advice) that I am totally back to normal and able to maintain full erections, as I had before the surgery. Thank you Dr. Mulhall and my surgeon in Houston, who brought this critical post op regimen to my attention.

This is a jewel of a lantern. Small package with fantastic light output. Undoubtedly, due to the design of the lens enclosure around the extremely "low power drain" LED bulbs. I have paid three times this much for larger LED lanterns that put out a dismal amount of light, in comparison. This one gives off an even and very bright glow, capable of filling an entire room with light. We bought 4 of them to place in various areas of the rooms in our cabin, to allow spontaneous switching on and off to navigate during the night without waking others. Inside a tent, you can easily read with one nearby. It can radiate 360 degrees or there is an optional "slide up" shield on the backside if you want to turn the lantern so the light does not interfere with your eyesight while illuminating the entire area that you place it in. Also has a flip out hook to hang it wherever desired. Truly a great value with superb illumination. Worth twice the cost for its performance.

3.5 STARS**I received an ARC for an honest review.**I am going to start out with why this book is getting the 3.5 stars when I really didn't care for it until the end. I think Blake redeemed himself when he finally fully opened up. I think the secrets of his past gave him a bit of a pass to be the man he was, but it doesn't justify all of his actions in my eyes. It just helps better understand where he is coming from. I think if I would have been able to read his POV instead of just Lila's this book would have been better for me.But...As it stands this book just didn't do it for me. I really didn't connect with Lila at all. Her characters didn't ever just grab me and make me feel for her, other than at the beginning of book one before she through her life into a tailspin of emotion. I couldn't stand all of her choices and then I couldn't understand her justification of those choices. I hated the way she treated Pierce even though she didn't really do it intentionally, but she did it not once but twice. I am neither fan or foe of insta-love, if it's written well I can get on board, kind of the same with a love triangle. But after this book I am "on a break" (like Ross and Rachel) with insta-love and the love triangle.There were too many mixed emotions, rash decisions and push & pull with everything in this book. The pace seemed to be slow and then speed up when somethings could and should have been elaborated on to help better connect with the story and the characters.In the end this book just wasn't my cup of tea, although the last few lines of this book did intrigue me as to "who" it might be ;)I leave it here. This wasn't a must read for, but you know that saying "another mans trash is another man treasure", this book could be your favorite of all time. But you do have to read book one Lies Unspoken before reading Love Unspoken.

3.5 STARSSo, Lila pretty much got the shock of her life when her fiancé called off their wedding the day of her final dress fitting. She ignored all the signs that they had been drifting and it came as a shock to her when he gave his honesty. So, she decided to finally follow her dreams and move to Chicago.When we first meet Lila she is a bit of a broken mess, but I did admire her drive to start over in a new city to far away from home. She gained my respect when she went out and found herself a waitressing job on her first day in town in a crappy place because she needed a job. I liked that she made friends with the people around her and that she even allowed herself the opportunity to move on with her life after Derek. I like that she made the effort to better herself personally and professionally.But...By the end of this book I think that I lost a bit of respect for her.When she meets Pierce Stanley I was pretty sure that this guys should be the one that she focuses on, but nope. She falls for her friends moody and tortured brother. I hated that she fell for him so easily and so effortlessly. It made her lose a bit of herself and I lost that connection with her. The connection though really wasn't all that strong to begin with. I think her character could have been a bit more developed with out Blake's presence consuming so much of her. I felt like once they became what they did that she changed and not for the better. She allowed him to treat her like crap and it wasn't beneficial enough for my liking. I really like the way the end of this book was going but then it fell off for me.I guess I am unsure about how I feel with this story and the characters. I guess Lila's story isn't one that I have fully connected with. It feels like she is too naive at times and too wrapped up in Blake, who in my opinion hasn't fully redeemed himself for me.I am currently reading book two and I am liking the way it has started, but I'm not sure about where it appears to be leading.To be continued with LOVE UNSPOKEN...

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**Lately I have found myself drawn to the religious cult fiction books and this book was a pretty good read. It didn't really focus to much on the religious cult aspect, but it did focus on the darker depravity that usually goes along with the religious cult reads.At times I felt like I just couldn't get on board with some of the things that were done with this storyline between Candace and Ivan, but I guess it ultimately worked for them, just not for me. I am not going to give them away but I do wish that revelations would have come sooner and that the two main characters would have had a little bit more to their ending.The storyline has a pretty consistent flow but at times it was a bit repetitive or at least the characters actions. I did like that she eventually did it for the right reasons and that it eventually worked out for her and for Ivan.This is a good religious/cult fiction read.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**I LOVE BEAU! That is all... okay seriously though...River Savage has done it again and she has continued to keep me coming back for more with this series. This is definitely in the TOP 3 of my favorite MC Series' reads.I have been waiting for Beau's story since pretty much book one. I have been waiting for him to be knocked on his ass by love and lead around by his balls by his woman and boy was he ever. Now, we all know (if you read the previous books) that Beau likes to partake in some pretty sexy kink, well let me say that Beau does not disappoint in that area. But I will also say that he stole my heart with his sweet and caring nature when it came to Kenzie.Mackenzie, we met her briefly in book two when she is ran through the the safe house and is saved from her abusive ex. I knew then that this little broken woman would be Beau's weakness and I could not wait for her to heal and find herself. All she needed was to be able to feel safe and comfortable in her own skin to be able to come out of her shell and Beau and the club did that for her.Some pretty heavy stuff happens in this book regarding the "other side" of things for the club and even with Beau and Kenzie, but it made for such an amazing read and it is exactly what their story needed for them to move forward. I hate though that some people get hurt along the way and are still hurting when the end of this book comes around, but I know that their story will make for a good read also.This is by far one of my favorite MC reads that keeps me coming back and I look forward to more of the Knights Rebels.

5 DARK and BAD ASS STARS!!!**ARC for an honest review**Tillie Cole is fast becoming one of my favorite Dark Romance Authors. She definitely knows how to spin one dark and depraved tale and this might just be one of my favorite of hers yet...well not really because off of her books (that I have read) are all on my favorite list.Okay, let me get to the RAZE. WOW!!! There are so many twists in this book. You kind of get the feel of where it is heading and who RAZE really is to the Bratva family that Kisa was born into, but until it is confirmed and all things come out into the open you are just holding your breath. Waiting to see if all things will come full circle.Kisa is the Bratva kings daughter. She has suffered through the death of her brother and mother and the loss of her soul mate, Luka. She is just living her role as the next Bratva King's fiancé, Alik Durov. He is one dark and sadistic man. I hated him from the first chapter told in Kisa's POV. I knew that there would be nothing redeeming about his character...ever. On a night that Kisa is helping the church she is assaulted and is scared for her life when a large man comes from the shadows and saves her. She doesn't know why, but there is something about this man that the feels the need to know him.RAZE aka 818. He has spent most of his life in the gulag, a prison where he is forced to either fight to kill or be killed. He has no memory of who he is, where he is from or why he is there. He does however know the name and location of the person responsible for his being in HELL. He escapes his hell and is on his way to exact his revenge.Raze is one scary dude. He is huge, all muscle and no humanity. I had trouble seeing how this man turned monster would come back from his hell, but the author did a wonderful job. Kisa and Raze had such a unexplained connection, but when it all comes out it is oh so good. This book is a must read...especially if you love the dark romance, especially if you love hot fighters and most especially if you love male leads that will make you swoon and shiver. Raze's character is so well written. I loved him throughout this whole book. I loved Kisa too...one thing I would have changed is her willingness to comply to her crazy fiancé and her Papa. I would have liked her to be more rebellious, but at the same time I loved her sweet character and I am glad that she did eventually become a tad rebellious.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**I loved me some Dirty English. That Declan Blay is what most fantasies involving accented men are made of. He is strong, smart, intense and oh so sexy. I loved him right off the bat and I really loved that his book includes his POV. It really helped to connect with his character and to understand him more.So, this book starts off pretty much in the middle of any woman's worst nightmare. I hate that Elizabeth went through something so tragic at such a young age and that it left her jaded. Most of all I hate that she blamed herself and that she let it dictate the next few years of her life. When we meet her in the present she lives her life by her set of rules and she mostly sticks to herself, well that doesn't last long. Slowly and surely Dirty English himself as well as his brother Dax weasel their way into her life and slowly she realized there is more to life that just getting by with her rules.Now there isn't a love triangle in this story by any means, there are some misguided decisions but those are easy to get over once everything is out on the table. Dax is Declan's twin brother, yes twin brother, but he does nothing for Elizabeth once she sets eyes on Declan, Mr. Dirty English himself.I liked both characters personalities and I really liked the way both of the grew over the course of this book. They are so much alike and so well suited of each other. I also loved all the secondary characters too, they too are well developed and make the story better as it progresses, even the ones you want to slap in the face or maybe get shabby with in a dark alley.The storyline of this book flows pretty steady and never really stagnates and makes you lose interest. I couldn't sit and read this in one sitting, but every time that I had to put it down I couldn't wait to pick it back up. A lot of things are going on in this storyline with both characters and I love the way the author flawlessly ties them all up. I like that there aren't any strings left frayed and flapping. I really liked the ending of this book and how both characters really changed over the course of the book. That they both needed each other to really become who they were meant to be.

Kentucky on the Rocks by Gwendolyn Grace Review4.5 STARS**I beta read this novella*This was quick and sexy read. I liked the two characters and Gwendolyn's ability to make me connect with them in such short story. I admired that Josette took a stand with her long time, not ready to commit, boyfriend Derek. I liked that she was ready to move forward with her life and move on from all the emotional push and pull that her relationship with Derek caused.I loved the way that Aidan and Josette meet and I like that he made something that should only take a few hours span over the course of a few days, just so he could see her more. I also liked that he knew what he wanted and he was going to get it. I loved that the start to their relationship outside of customer and vendor, started because Aidan volunteered to help her with her writing assignment.I really enjoyed how these two go to know each other and the pace and flow of this book really worked well for the novella style. I love Gwendolyn Graces writing and this is another must read of hers.

This what a great addition to Malcolm and Rachel's story. I loved that after all the drama of the past was cleared up a bit and the effort that they both put into getting to know each other again made for a good reads.At times I felt that some things fell a little flat and predictable, but I did enjoy the different sides of Saint and that more of his vulnerable side showed. I also loved that Rachel learned for her mistakes and was always honest the second time around. The two of them together are really a sweet but totally sexy couple. I also loved Rachel started to take cues for Saint and ignore what others thought of their relationship, mostly the public. I also like that Saint made a stand for them with his friends and with the public by his actions.I enjoyed spending a little more time with both of these characters.
The arrived quickly and well packaged. They are super cute and my three year old loves them.
Got theses quickly and they were packaged well. The worked excellent for my nine year old daughter on our 18 hour trip to and from Florida.

5 EMOTIONALLY SINFUL STARS**I received an ARC for an honest review.**This book is by far my most favorite of Penelope Wards, ever. I think I have said that about each and every book that I have read, but this one takes the cake. It is filled with so much more than I thought it would be and it definitely surpassed all of my expectations going into it.This book contains so much emotion right from the start. It is just packed with so much that I don't even want to mention because I do not want to give any spoilers. But I will say that I am in love with Sevin Montgomery. I will say that he is so much more than the man we meet at the beginning got this book. I will say that it has been awhile since I have connected so fully with a male character and he takes the cake.As I write this review, I am still reeling a bit from the ending of this book. I can still feel the lump that was lodged there pretty much the entire second half. I am still going through everything that happened and still processing it and keep loving this book more and more.This book is definitely one of my most favorite reads of 2015 and I can pretty much feel the book hangover coming on.If you are a Penelope Ward fan then this is a MUST READ. If you have never read a Penelope Ward book before, then this is a MUST READ. If you have never read a book before, but love an emotional and satisfying story then this a MUST READ. So, in my honest opinion Sins of Sevin is a MUST READ.

3.5 STARS**I received an ARC for an honest review.**This MC book was a pretty good reads, but it was predictable. I could see some of the things coming from a mile away.I did like the characters Cami and Gauge though and I really enjoyed getting to see their relationship grow from the beginning. Of course there were some obstacles in their way that caused a lot of tension and grief, but I guess that all comes with any relationship. I also liked that Cami eventually found herself again, but I thought her situation with Nathaniel could have been more expanded on. I would have liked a little more grit to their relationship, especially since some of the things she did to cope. I just didn't complete feel that whole situation and it all just ended way to easy.At times I thought that things could have been developed a little bit more and not just thrown out their without any warning or hint before hand. It happened a couple of times with pretty big things in the storyline, but it didn't really take away from the story it actually helped to where it was going overall.There were a few inconsistencies that I was able to overlook seeing as it was an ARC, but there were quite a few things that even for an ARC that distracted. A sentence just ended right in the middle and a lot of missing words or a word in place that didn't make sense for the sentence.Now, I loved the ending of this book. The last few chapters really made me like this story and the characters. Although it really didn't hook me like I would have liked.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**This was a quick sweet read, but I just did't really connect with the characters completely. I did like the crazy aunts and the crazy beach town of Pelican Key Cove, but there just was never that spark between me an the characters.There also wasn't enough of Luke and Ginny for me. I would have like to see more of them together, but I did like that the storyline did revolve around the whole wedding planning and reality tv show. Although I did think it overtook the storyline and didn't really leave much room for the actual love connection for Luke and Ginny.Now, don't get me wrong the times they were together were good, but I just never had that feeling where I loved them together. I wanted that overwhelming feeling of second chance love, but it never happened for me.Don't get me wrong there are plenty of great parts of this book. Especially when Ginny finally realized that there is more to life than just making sure a wedding goes off without a hitch. That she finally decides to put the feelings of others first. I really like that part of the storyline. I also enjoyed her reconnecting with her old friend, Jules and making new friends in Marcie and Pixie. Even though most of the time I wanted to wring both Ginny and Marcie's neck for always making it about the show or the "I do" they really did redeem themselves by the end.The ending of this book was really sweet and left a smile on my face. If you are in the mood for a quick sweet read then this book is right up your alley.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**Another great book in this series. I love that in this book that we get both Brooke and Masons POV and I am so happy that Mason did get his POV. I LOVED him and his accent back in Alabama and I now I love him even more.Mason is truly that perfect mix of sweet and oh so sexy. I love his sweet and caring side. I love that he didn't just want what Brooke was offering and I loved that he wasn't scared to ask for more. His personality really endeared him to me. Now, let me talk about his dirty sexy mouth. Wow! That man sure could spout the filthiest of things that would make even the filthiest of women blush and boy did he make Brooke blush on a number or occasions.Brooke, we met her in the previous books, when we saw that Dylan didn't really want to hire her and Joey hated her. But we also got to see her start to find herself and go through some changes. Well, this book really opens her up. We really get to see Brooke for who she is and who she eventually becomes. I love that all it takes for her to open up is a sexy, dirty talking yoga instructed.I really loved how their relationship starts and unfolds. I like that no matter how hard she tried, Brooke just couldn't break Mason, even though I know he struggled with it. I like that their relationship grew according to what Mason wanted and that eventually without realizing it Brooke began to want it to. The way that their relationship progressed was something that I really enjoyed. It felt real between them.Another great book from J. Daniels.P.S. I love that certain chapter from that certain POV that most definitely deserves a book or a novella in the very least ;)

**I had the opportunity to BETA read this book**I am not going to give anything away because there are something's that just need to be found out on your own.Kennedy and Grayson met at a young age and both grew up in less than great lives...heck their lives were less than period. But they had each other...until they didn't.Things happened, lines crossed, friendships left behind and lives definitely changed. For Grayson it was fame and fortune. For Kennedy it was a great loss and living a comfortable life in a small town.When their paths cross again and secrets are revealed things really start to escalate. This book was a really emotional read for me. It was hard for me not to get choked up when all the secrets finally come to light.I felt so terrible for both Grayson and Kennedy. I hated that they both had to come to grips with some something so heavy when they are reunited. But I do love that after the eventual shock of it being revealed and after the anger dissipated that both of them leaned on each other. I like the determination that Grayson had to be more in the know. I like all of his actions even his anger because it was real. I loved that Kennedy stepped up and helped Grayson however she could even though it wore her up. I really liked the support that they had with their friends.The end of this book blew me away. It was such a perfect ending and it was really beautiful to me.This book is another of my favorites by Stacey Lynn.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**This is my first M. Robinson book and I am blown away. She had me hooked from the prologue and I was hanging on every word until the end. She did an amazing job making me connect to all of these characters, not just Lucas and Alex. I loved that this book follows their ENTIRE story. That it doesn't skim over all the ugly less flattering parts, everything is out there laid bare and I could feel every emotion Lucas and Alex experienced throughout their lives.Some parts of this story I hated...absolutely loathed...I wanted to close my eyes a look away and pretend that it wasn't about to happen or happening. But I just couldn't I had to keep reading. I had to feel everything that Alex and Lucas felt, because it was so consuming. There are so many emotions in this book. So many heart aches and heart breaks. So many happy times and so many sad times. This book has it all and it won me over completely.I didn't know how I would like the timeline of this book after the prologue, but this book couldn't have been written any other way. There was no other way to tell Half-Pint and Bo's story, it had to be from the beginning. Their story started out so young, but even then you could feel the strength of their bond. You could feel the magnitude of what they meant to each other. Sometimes they gave in to their urges and other times they handled them poorly, but it all had to play out the way it was supposed. The way that would lead them to their path.It wasn't easy for them and at times I was sure that it was impossible. That too much happened for them to be able to move forward and strengthen their bond, but if things happened any differently I don't think their story would have been half as special.I am really excited for more from this author and definitely more of this series. This is a MUST read!

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**This book had me second guessing how everything would turn out. I just could not seem to predict what would happen. So many twists and turns in this book and it made for an excellent end of sorts to Jackson and Anna's tale.This series got so much better for me from the start to finish. At the beginning I was a little annoyed with Anna's less than strong character, but she is the only female lead that would have complimented Jackson so well. This book really made me love and hate Jackson. I was so worried about him losing himself, but Anna seemed to be the only thing that kept him grounded. Don't get me wrong there were plenty of times that I wanted to reach through my kindle and smack the ever loving crap out of him, but he ultimately redeemed himself.As mention, but defiantly not spoiled, there are so many new things brought into the picture of this book. So many more characters have stronger rolls in the storyline and I really would like to get their stories too, I am hoping that LA Cotton was leading up that. Well, I know of at least one character that will be making a come back and I am oh so ready for that.A lot of things closed up and sealed tight in this story. I loved that, even though it was drawn out into three book, Jackson and Anna's story needed those three book to get the full scope. A lot of things happened that I didn't see coming, but it made so much more sense. Other things I hated had to happen, but it made for a fantastic story.This book is definitely a great addition to the Chastity Falls Series. I am definitely looking forward to more!

**I received an ARC for an honest review.** Well, what an amazing end to this series. I fell in love with Blake in Erica right from the beginning and even though their story hasn't been easy it is definitely one of my favorites.This book in The Hacker Series really cemented this series as one of my favorites. I love that Blake and Erica's love saved them both so much. I like that Erica kept to who she really is at heart and fought for Blake when he though all was lost. So many things in this book helped close the doors that were left wide open in the other books.People were dealt with and some people redeemed themselves even if just the slightest bit. Loose ends were tied up, relationships solidified and friendships grew. I loved every moment of this book. It really stayed true to the rest of the series, being that there wasn't a lack of sweet, sexy and even suspense. So many things come to light and so many things are handled that I did not think that this would be the last of it, but Meredith Wild really closed this up nicely.I don't want to give anything away because if you are a fan of this series like I am you will want to discover it for your self. I am sad to see the end of this but it was such a great ending that I am very much satisfied with it.This is a MUST read series...every book is a MUST read!!

**I received and ARC for an honest review.**Well, I can honestly say that Guinevere redeemed herself in my eyes. There was a time that I was so disappointed in her and maybe even  little bit hated he, but this book definitely turned it around. Put things in perspective for me even though I still hate some of the things that happened along the way.I'm not going to give away the ending but I will say that it could not have ended any better...at least in my opinion. Guinie definitely went through some trials in this book, but I think she came out a stronger and definitely more respectable person. I like that the strength that she showed in book one makes a reappearance in this book. I loved that she eventually realized that she needed to be the one to let go in order for her to move on and forward and to find herself, ←not a spoiler.In this book I think I am a whole lot mad and a whole lot disappointed with Arturo and it is all because of the choices he made. They not only hurt him but they hurt everyone that he considered family. I hated that all of his family (the bad and Guinie) suffered because he wasn't strong enough to face what happened. I also hated his choices that made things so much more difficult for him and Guinie to try and reconcile.I can sit here all day and list the things that I loved and hated about this book and the truth of Arturo King, but the fact is I loved the way everything happened. It all falls into place and it all had to happen the way it did for this series to keep me interested. There isn't one thing that I would change that happened along the way because it made each character stronger individually and then it made them stronger for their partners. This was a fantastic end of this series.

I vow that this a 5 STAR READ!!!**I received an ARC for an honest review.**This is most definitely one of my most favorites of 2015. I LOVED this book!Mia Sheridan does an amazing job with this story. I felt the heartache and pain as well and the happiness and love. She makes sure that everything gets it ending and leaves no stone unturned. She has an amazing way with word that draws you into the story and it's characters. Her characters are so well written and easy to love or hate.Grayson Hawthorn is kind of an ass, but he his an ass that will still make you swoon and root for him. I couldn't help but fall completely and utter in love with him. Although there were times when I wanted to reach into my kindle and smack him around a bit, but after getting into his head and knowing his full story you can help but understand him and the reason he guarded his heart. When all of the truths finally come out and everything is laid bare, I think I fell in love Grayson a little bit more.So, when Kira is concocting her plan I really didn't see it coming. I though about quite a few things that she could possibly proposed to Grayson to help each other out, but what she actually did was ballsy and after getting to know her totally made sense. I loved her personality the more I got to know her. Especially after knowing her past and relating it to the person she became. She is such a genuine and loving person. I loved that not only did she want to make Grayson's life a little bit better, but she made everyone's lives better in the process.Her coming into his life allowed him to open up as well as the people around him. I loved all of their interactions even the ones that broke my heart, but I loved that they both started to trust each other enough to open up. I really liked when Kira brought out a side of Grayson that had never been present. I loved that her presence made slowly brought him back to life and let him start to mend the scars of his past. Of course there had to be some pretty awful things have to happen before the mending could begin. And this awful things just about gutted me.This is a MUST READ!!!

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**It's no secret that I LOVE to read. So, the fact that I get to read a book that is about something very similar to my life is pretty cool. I like the behind the scenes feel of this book. I love that and author wrote a book about an author and there is so much of the indie community in the book. I like all the added touches with Facebook, private messages, street teams etc.So, in book one Behind the Lens we met Blake and his mut-self. Even though he pissed me off with all he mutty stuff that he did in book one he totally redeemed himself in this book, big time. I was so hooked on his character in this book. I loved his honesty and the way he changed so drastically because he finally found someone worth changing for. Although he was still his same smart butt self, he was no long a mut.Enter London...London is an author...pretty cool huh? An indie author writing about an indie author, who just happens to get to know the model of her latest book a little too well. I loved the start of their relationship, but I quickly hated it when London did her Houdini act and left Blake high and dry. I guess he kind of had it coming to him, you know Karma and all. Anyway, I really liked London after she started remember who she was before. Before the really crappy situation in her life that sent her running to California in the first place. I loved that when she finally starting living again, that it was Blake that was making her love life again. I liked that she was opening up herself to new friends and experiences, although she did remain closed off about her past, but I can't blame her for that. I would want to forget also. Blake was so patient with her and that really endeared him to me more.So, of course there is a big bad scene in this book, but I won't say what it is..you will just have to read and find out. But I will say that Blake handled fantastically and pretty bad ass might I add. I especially loved the after.We get a little bit more of Kallie and Jax in this book as wells as  Brody, loved that Brody's story got expanded on a bit. At the end of this book there is a nice glimpse into the next book that has left me really curious as to what is going to happen next in this series.I enjoy this series and the characters. I like that the author writes them in a way that I can connect with them.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**Another great addition to this series. I absolutely fell in love with Jake right off the bat. Talk about swoon.I knew Lana as Tate's sister in book 2 of the Try Again series and I was very curious to know her story. I knew that it had to be something pretty dark considering to small tidbits we got in Whatever You Do. Even though Lana has had a not so pleasant past she doesn't let it affect her in her life "after". That is what I loved most about her. That even though she is going through a pretty tough time, with getting over her past and then to be carried from her home in the middle of the night by a complete stranger because your home has just gone up in flames, she is still really well adjusted. Well, minus her fear of everyone eventually being taken from her.Jake...oh that Jake. I loved him from he beginning. I loved being inside his head and getting every single one of his thoughts, they were some really good thoughts. I loved his open, loyal and honest, well mostly honest, character. Even though he was hiding a secret from Lana, it didn't make me like him any less because of the part of his character that he was holding in tact. I really liked that about him. Also I loved that he was such a wonderful father. Being a single parent has to be hard on anyone, but Jake handles it so well. I loved that the most about his character. I also loved that he was just the sweetest man ever.So, by now you have figured out that Jake has a child, a daughter, Hallie. She is one of the best parts of this book. She is so sweet, well adjusted and funny as hell. I loved all of the "Hallie Tales". She was definitely a nice addition to this story. Her straight forward nature added much needed comedic relief at all the right times. I laughed out loud many times during this read.If you haven't read any of the Try Again series you should definitely pick up some one, two or all of these books. They are emotional, sweet, loving and pretty dang sexy too. All can be read as stand alone, but the characters are all friends so it is nice to keep getting little pieces of the other couples after their books have ended.This is a MUST read series in my opinion.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**Another great book in the Kill Devil Hills series by Sarah Darlington. So, far I have enjoyed each book more than the previous one and this one is no different.I loved Rhett!He isn't at all like I assumed him to be from the previous to books. Nothing. Well, okay so he was indeed a manwhore, BUT that all stopped when he met (or met again) Sydney. I liked that we get his POV in this because it really made me fall in love with him. He is truly a great guy with just a few insecurities but he does an excellent job working through them.So, Sydney is not at all like she appears in the first two books either. Nothing. I though I was not going to like her because of the way she seemed in those books but the author did a really good job of clearing up all of the past appearances Sydney made in this series. I will admit that from the past appearances, Sydney seemed like a bit of beyotch, but she is not at all one. She is very different and it a good way. I also like that when it comes to Rhett she always is honest with him and that she does stand up for him when it matters.One of the things that I really liked is that this book runs parallel to the rest of the book. It truly starts at the beginning and we get to see the relationship between Rhett and Sydney from the very start and I mean the very beginning. I like that it doesn't pick up after the LA trip and then go from there because it really helped me get to know Sydney and Rhett and it made me love them and their relationship so much more.If you are looking for a sweet feel good read then this is your book. I really enjoyed it and I am hoping that there is more of this series, particularly Ben's story and I wouldn't mind more of the rest of the Kill Devil Hills gang either.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**What a nice surprise Where We Belong was. I loved this addition to Ben and Mia's story and to get another glimpse into their lives after they started their HEA.So, things aren't always as easy as Ben and Mia thought they would be. After the scare of their lives in book three and then adjusting to life with two kids, they learn that making time for themselves is a bit tricky. There isn't always the right time and things aren't always going to be convenient. This biggest adjustment was learning that their naughty time will be interrupted as long as Nolan and Chase are anywhere around.Even though they are adjusting and growing through the growing pains of a growing family, they are both still very much in love with each other and they make the time to let each other know. Even though they are frustrated with Ben's ever changing schedule and from being denied sexual gratification, they always talk openly with each other. I fell in love with Ben Kelly a little bit more in this little book, because he got even better and sexier. Mia even grew and marital life and motherhood agree with her.They have a bit of a tense situation involving Angie, Nolan's birth mother, but that situation is handles so well and I felt the relief of that situation when it was over. There are also some other things that are going on with Ben and Mia as well as some of the other characters that I love and I can not wait for more of this series.

**I received a copy from the author for an honest review.**And another MC romance makes it to my growing list of great MC reads. Kings of Korruption is now on my list to keep an eye out for. The author did a wonderful job keeping to the MC feel as well as keeping to the characters true natures. I really enjoyed getting to know the characters in Ryker, all of them, all of the guys in the MC were written well also and made me very curious about their stories and wanting more of them also.I especially loved Charlotte. She is an amazingly loving and genuinely sweet person, but she is also a bit of a feisty live wire with a bit of a naughty side. Well, Ryker really brings out her naughty side and I don't blame her one bit. I think he would bring out anyones naughty side. Okay all of that aside I really loved Charlotte. I liked that even though her sister was a major pain the the butt she still stuck by her. I liked that even though she had to grow up at such a young age and basically take responsibility for her sister she still did not turn out jaded. I also really like that she took the experience that she went through in her teens and turned that into a career. That she genuinely wanted to be there for others in their time of need. I really loved everything about her character. I mean LOVED her.Ryker...well Ryker is definitely all biker and definitely what naughty biker dreams are made of, but he is also so much more. Charlotte definitely brings out a whole different side to him. He doesn't think that he can have someone in his life. He doesn't want to risk them getting hurt by his life choice of being in an MC. But I love who Charlotte puts things in perspective for him. I love that all it takes are a few words from her perspective to make him change how he looked at things. I really enjoyed both of them together and I really enjoyed their characters separately.The storyline of this book is really great. I liked that the MC feel is there with the gritty and gory details. I like that even though it is MC book that there is still things outside of the MC that are introduced into the book. I really liked that it starts out outside of the MC and it starts with Charlotte and it also gives a bit of her backstory. The flow and pace of this book is great. I like that things are constantly moving forward and it all things introduced into the book were all addressed and found their endings. Even if they weren't pretty. This book also had some moments where I got choked up and got teary eyed and I wasn't expecting that at all. It definitely has it all. It is well written and I will definitely be reading more of the Kings of Korruption by Geri Glenn.

**I received and ARC via NetGalley for an honest review.**I absolutely loved that this book is told entirely from Jake Beckers POV and what an awesome perspective it was. Even though we don't get any of Chelsea's POV I fell in love with her all the same.She is one amazingly strong and wonderful person. At twenty six she becomes the legal guardians of her six nieces and nephews. As a mother of three I can only imagine the trouble with double. She handles it so well and she is so great with the kids. I loved everything about her and her relationship with the children. She really won me over with her personality and the way she interacted with both the kids and Jake.When we first met Jake you can tell he is lying the ultimate bachelor life...bachelor pad...anonymous hookups...sexy...honest even if it hurts...and in no way about to make any woman believe he is capable of "more". That is until he has an unexpected visitor, a barley memorable hookup that makes him look at things a bit differently. I loved those couple of agonizing weeks for him because he definitely got the meaning of "reap what you sow". After he decides to turn over a new leaf he runs into someone that is going to inevitably change his outlook. I really loved that pocket picking incident and the fact that Jake saw himself. From there things start to progress pretty quickly.Jakes life begins to change for the better. His world is no longer that of single man always looking for a hookup but it consists of becoming part of the McQuaid family even if he is a little slow on the take. I loved every moment of him changing and becoming attached to the McQuaid kids and their aunt. I didn't care for how he kept trying to pull away because it was so much more than pulling away from Chelsea...the kids also felt left behind. But I did admire him staying apart of their lives even if he was trying to be "just friends" with Chelsea.I really enjoyed this authors writing style and the flow of this story. I liked the character development and the way she made me fall in love with all of the kids as well as Jake and Chelsea. I loved and of the emotional tension and sexual tension in this storyline and boy was the sexual tension so delicious. Overall I really enjoyed this book.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**I am in love with Joshua Hayes!!!! I was so ready and curious about his story. I wanted to know if he had something looming in his past, but he didn't. Well, just his promiscuous ways, but those were quickly done away with when he started to feel something for Arden.Arden had lived a terrible life before she had her daughter and met the fold of Willow Creek. Luckily she was able to get out of her toxic life, although it was not in the usual way...that should have been a dead giveaway that things were far from over. I loved Arden role as a mother. She put her daughter first always and I really loved that about her. I also loved that while trying to fight her attraction to Hayes because she should put her daughter first, she found that he too was including her daughter in all things. I loved that during this whole book Mia is never left out of anything. Things revolve around her and all of Hayes and Arden's decisions are made with Mia in mind.Now of course this wouldn't be an amazing read without some sort of drama that happens and guts you..well let me tell you I was gutted. I hated that Hayes, Arden and Mia had to go through such a horrible ordeal, but it made their bond so much stronger. I liked that Arden didn't push Hayes away, she did lash out, but she needed him to keep her together. I also love how Hayes finally broke when things were finally resolved..well partially resolved. I definitely teared up a few times with this book.I am a huge fan of this series. Probably one of the best crossover from YA to NA rocker series there is. I LOVED every book and all of the characters and their stories.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**These two authors teamed up and gave us one amazing read. I love all things Penelope Ward and I loved what I have read by Vi Keeland, but this book I absolutely LOVED and I really would like them to do more together.I loved Aubrey and I loved Chance right from the start. I liked that their story starts immediately and that we get to go through their tale with not one but both of them. The first part of this book is told in Aubrey's POV and and it gives that story of how them meet and how their relationship/friendship starts. I love all of the things that they do together and all of the new things that Chance shows Aubrey. I especially love that he awakens a new part of her that she didn't exactly know about herself. I loved both of their personalities and the way that Chance really brought Aubrey out of her shell. I will admit though that at one point I was not a fan of Chance even with his really good looks and awesome personality...oh and that accent...but ultimately he did redeem himself.Part two is told in Chance's POV and I fell in love with him so much more after getting his story from his perspective. He is so much more than the Cocky Bass turd (<had to keep it clean) that we first meet. Even though he takes up a bit of an unconventional approach to winning Aubrey back I still fell extremely hard for his character. He isn't your typical manwhore...even though he totally could be...he is so much more. I love that he waits for Aubrey and that he is dead set on getting her back and making things real.What I loved most about this story is that is kept close to Chance and Aubrey. There weren't  too many other outside things going on to distract from their story and the ultimate goal. There definitely was a good amount of tension and some emotional stuff going on that made me hold my breath and hope for the best, but I really enjoyed the flow and pace of this book so much. I like that everything happens in a seemingly realistic fashion and that there isn't the instantly resolved problems. I just really enjoyed this book.I really hope that these two authors will collaborate more in the future and gives more books like this one or even better.

5 STARS**I received an ARC for an honest review.**What a fantastic end to King and Does story. There were so many things that I just didn't see coming. The author does a fantastic job twisting all the parts of this story and keeping you in your toes. Characters that you thought you would love are characters that you will end up hating with a vengeance and when they get what's coming to them you will most definitely have a smile on your face. Characters that you thought you would hate and loathe redeem themselves in the final pages of this book.They are shocking twists and heartwarming surprises but it is all done and kept true to the feel of this book. Some parts made me cringe and grit my teeth. Some parts made my heart melt and some parts are just down right naughty and sexy.I loved that I fell in love with both King and Doe all over again. I also fell in love with Sammy and Max and the people that Doe and King became because of them. There were a lot of revelations  in this book that helped both characters grow and become better than they were in book one.Overall I really enjoyed this book and King and Doe's story. I am excited for more from this author.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**This is by far my most favorite book in the Hades Hangmen series. I didn't think that it would be possible to top Styx and Ky and their old ladies, but HOLY FLAMING HADES HANGMEN, I am in LOVE with Flame.What a terribly broken couple Maddie and Flame make. I didn't think that Flame's story could be any worse than the horrors of Maddie's past, but I was so so wrong. Flame's story is so heart wrenching and so terribly horrific. I could not believe the things that he suffered in his childhood to make him into the person he is, but I loved that Maddie is the only one that could get through to him. To save him. To claim him. Especially when he spent most of his life feeling like he was wanted by no one and that everyone he touched left or was harmed by him. His story is just so much worse that I imagined.Maddie's story is as expected but we also get to know so much more of her traumatic past. I love Maddie's sweet disposition even after everything that she suffered in her life. I like that she came to grips with what she believed her whole like was not real. I like that she openly admits things to Flame and that they both fit together so easily. I like that once she knows that he needs things to be said strait to the point, she is always honest with him and makes sure he knows what she if feeling. I really loved all of the interactions between Maddie and Flame.Their love is definitely unique and it definitely shocked most of the group, but it felt so pure. I liked that after getting to know them both a little better, I could not see them without each other. Now in my mind there is no Flame without his Maddie and there is no Maddie without her Flame. These two people needed each other so they could both realize who they were meant to be.There is some pretty crazy stuff happening with The Order in this book and I can not wait to see what else is coming from them. I was a bit shocked that these "Godly" people are so blinded by their faith that they believe the rambling left by a creeper of an old man. Now I wasn't shocked of the things taking place because of the first two book, but I am shocked that these people are so easily swayed by the newcomers and that Cain's brother Judah has easily accepted the teachings from the previous Prophet. I am really looking forward to more of what is going to happen with them and the Hades Hangmen. Although I have hated Cain for awhile I am now wondering how is story is going to play out.Tillie Cole has a real knack for making both sides of this book so real and believable. Her writing style lets me really connect with all the characters in these books. I love that the MC aspect of this book is so real and it feels authentic. I like the grit of the men of the Hades Hangmen and I really love their women. The women in this series are such a contradiction, but at the same time it makes so much sense of them to be saved by the men of Hades Hangmen. It makes sense that they could not just go out into the world because they would be overwhelmed, but with the Hades Hangmen they are both exposed to the world and they are protected form it.This is by far my most favorite MC series EVER. I love every word of every book even when they are hard to read. Even when they make me cringe and want to vomit, I am addicted to these books an these characters. I can not wait for more of this series. I have to know where things are going from here.

This has now one of my favorite MC series'. This is the first book that I have read in the Selected Sinner MC Series, but I will undoubtedly will be read the first three book as well.When I read the synopsis and an excerpt I just had to find out about this "eighth wonder of the world", but I will be honest...I HATED the name Biscuit for a biker, but after reading this book and falling in love with Dalton "Biscuit" Biskette, I don't think that I could have loved him by any other name. I loved that he was so freaking hilarious, but still held that certain sex appeal even when he was telling stories that made him look like an idiot. I loved that even though he was a bad ace 1%'r he was still a stand up guy. I liked his honesty especially when it came to women and what he intended to take from them...well really what he intended them to give him. I also like that once he realized that Kat made him feel different that instead of running or screwing every puntang in the area he searched her out and was willing to give things a try. What I loved most about Dalton "Biscuit" Biskette was his willingness to step up and take responsibility for something that most men would run from. That endeared him to me all the more.While I love the fact that this book seems to be dominated by the male POV I really loved the added female POV. I love when a biker book is written well enough that you can connect with both characters equally. I loved Kat. I liked that she was not your typical 22 year old twit. She was your typical 22 year old cop daughter looking to rebel, but it seems that she looked for the wrong type of bad boy before meeting Biscuit. I like how she seemed to changed. I also liked that by the end of this book it seemed that she was in a healthier relationship with her mother and father. I also like the way that she went about getting to know Biscuit better when she realized that she liked him more than just of the sex. By the way the sex was oh so sexy!If you like biker books and not just those that seem to imitate SOA, then you should start this series. Being that I started this series with the fourth book I was in no way lost with the storyline at all. I liked that it was read as a stand alone, which meant that the others most likely follow the same. I will most definitely be starting the series from the beginning because I have to know more about Slice, Toad and Otis and I hope there will be more to come after!

** I received an ARC for an honest review.**What a sweet and swoon worthy second chance romance. I loved Lawson and Emelyn and their ability to forget and forgive the past and move forward to a new future. This book has everything that makes a great quick romance. There is sadness, there is love, there is super sexiness, there is tension and there is heartfelt forgiveness. I loved this book right from the beginning and I just did not want to put it down.This book starts off with Emelyn waking up from a nightmare that will change the course of the next four years. Her life is no longer on the course she thought it would be and everything changes. There are flashbacks with glimpses into how everything started and it helps connect with both Lawson and Emelyn. We get to meet them as children and we get to see the sparks fly even at such an early age. We get to see them for a little bit in their teenage youth and their teenage college youth. We get to know them as young adults and then eventually as adults. They both change so much over the course of this book especially after they reconnect.I really enjoyed the pace and the tone of this book. I liked that even though they all went through something so tragic that they all were able to grow and move on with their lives. I hate that things were lost between Lawson and Emelyn, but I think it all played out the way it should for these two people to be able to be who they are. I really enjoy this authors writing style and I really liked this book. It was just so nice and refreshing to read a sweet and relatively drama free book. Don't get me wrong there is drama, but there isn't unnecessary drama in order for these characters to find themselves both separately and together.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**I loved this book more than the first one. I absolutely hated Mack in book one but he really did redeem himself in this book of the Drive Me Wild series.I met Jonna in book one and I knew that she was Drew and Woody's sister. I knew she was fiesty and a bit of a spitfire but I didn't know how much. I liked how she was with Mack right off the bat and I liked how she pushed to get to know him when she thought he was pushing her away.It turned out that Mack had good reasons for pushing Jonna away and they were for her own good. It was nice to see that someone could actually penetrate his tough exterior and open him up. I liked the softer side of Mack and it did not take away from his sexiness at all. This book had plenty of sexy and Mack was at the center of them all.There are quite a few new developments going on in this book in regards to the racing circuit and even the other characters lives. The very last words of this book dropped a bomb that sets the tone for th next book in the series and I can not wait for it. I look forward to more of what is going on with the other characters.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**This book blew me away with the twists in the plot and the overall outcome. When things started coming to light and everything started sliding into place it made Nick's need for revenge that much sweeter.Right from the start something was swirling in my head and I kept trying to get my sister to tell me if I was right, but I am so glad that she didn't give it away. I loved every word, paragraph and page of this book. Nick Ryder is every woman's hero, although not in the traditional sense not by a landslide. Nick suffered a terrible tragedy and so did his family. A tragedy that he watched with his own eyes and vowed that he would get revenge for what was done to his family. The things he saw were enough to splinter anyone and the way he went about his retribution was dark, depraved and oh so bad ass. The thing that Nick did in the name of revenge is not butterflies, flowers and unicorns. This is not a light and airy romance. It is so messed up, but so fulfilling.Aubree Culling she found herself trapped and kidnapped not once, but twice in her life. She is so broken, but she is still so strong. The things that she has had to survive and live through are so much worse that I would have thought, but are what I suspected right off the bat. I love that she found herself with Nick and that the two of them seemed to have found themselves in each other. I liked the honesty that they shared with each other after they started to cut through the bullspit.I don't want to give anything away and this is already turning to a point of being a bit spoilerish... I will just say that this book is so much more than I thought it was going to be. I knew it would be dark and gritty, but it was dark and gritty in an amazing way. The things done in this book will make you cringe, but also make you cheer with they are avenged. This is one of those books that you can't put down because you can't wait to find out how everything will play out. Somethings I saw coming and somethings were a surprise, but I loved everything in this book.This book is a MUST read.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**What a fantastic emotionally packed read. I loved the growth that took place with the Maxfield family in the wake of their terrible loss. The author did a wonderful job portraying all of the emotions, thoughts and feelings that Kelsey went through.I don't agree with what Kelsey did, but seeing as she did not break down like I would have expected, it seems that the relationship that she grew with Peter helped her grow and accept that she no longer would have her twin by her side. I knew that even though she didn't want to be the one to tell Peter, that Michelle had die, her not telling him wasn't entirely selfish. She knew that he needed that little light at the end of his tunnel. But once she grew to love him and him her it was harder for her to tell him. She just couldn't break him and let him go back to war.I liked that this story mainly focused on Kelsey and her life and her heeling. I really enjoyed watching her re-learn to live her life, but what I like the most is that she started to view some of the world as her sister did. Even with a loss so big, she still managed to find her path and her life changed for the better. I hated that the rift between her and her parent grew to crazy proportions, but I did like the end when things were aired and addressed.There were a few inconsistencies in this book and just somethings that didn't really flow well for me in this storyline. None of it took away from the storyline, but it did make me want to know why those things may not have been addressed.Overall this is a great YA read and the ending was very touching.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**NOT ROMANCE.I am hooked. I am so overwhelmed with guessing what is happening. There is a constant loop of possibilities of what I think is happening to Nora Gilbert going through my head. I want to know what is going on and I want to know now.There are so many possibilities of who took her an who locked her away. Was is Bradley? Was it Maren? Was it Rosies? Are those people even real? Was it her mother? Was it Nora? So very many possibilities! The way this book flips from past to present makes things all the more confusing, but in a really mysterious and a suspenseful way.Especially the ending.What was on the other side of the hole? Who is singing? What is the beeping noise?So many questions and I need the answers. I am very much looking forward to The Missing - Volume Two - LIES. I know there will be so many more questions until the end of this three part series, but I need the answers to those questions.

**I received an ARC for an honest review.**This was such a intensely sexy read with a bit of mystery. The whole time I was reading this I kept thinking about the way that the synopsis made it seem that Jeremy was only after revenge and I kept trying to relate a vengeful person with him and I just kept coming up empty. It was so hard to keep the faith when all of the secrets kept popping up, but when everything was finally out in the open I really wasn't all that shocked. It made more sense than anything.I don't want to give anything away with this story so I will steer clear of that. I will tell you that at times I felt like there was too much going on in the story and that there was a lot of back and forth with Phoebe and Jeremy. I love drama in my reads, but at times there was too much, I guess that made the name of the book appropriate, TOXIC.I liked the person Phoebe became after her past. I liked that she took over her family's business with the hopes of saving it. She appeared to be strong and had her life together. I did not like that she so easily lost herself in Jeremy so quickly, but I guess she also found herself in him as well. At times I thought she was to insecure when it came to their relationship and I also thought there were too many things on the outside that they both let affect their relationship.  But in the end it all made it worth it. Everything they went through was something that needed to happen for them to ultimately become who they were. For them to find themselves and for the to find each other.I loved that epilogue was told in Jeremy's POV and that getting that glimpse of things from him was an added bonus of their story. I enjoyed this read.
