Shemane offers practical daily motivational and spiritual exercises  for overall wellness and daily living. Living well and living happy. And I'm not referring to physical exercise, but exercises in the way we live, the way we think. How we handle situations, or how we don't. Our relationship with God and people. How we can improve our lot in life no matter what situation we may find ourselves in.  This is just a fantastic book that should be in every household, read by men and women alike.  If you want to read an uplifting book, this is the book you want. If you want some great advise on how to improve your life, then this is the book you want. Shemane Nugent has written a truly inspired book... Well done Mrs. Nugent.. Well done Uncle Ted.. and your still a Hoot...

The Sentey THOR X Headphones are exceptionally good over the head headphones. Starting with the overall construction quality, and the 40mm drivers, these headphones rock. As comfortable as they feel, they also feel almost indestructible.  I'm an audiophile and have had headphones that I've paid $300.00 for that weren't as good as these by a long shot. Plus, the inline control makes these very versatile for use with PC's, Stereo's, but even more importantly nowadays Smart Phones. With the inline control you can answer calls, pause, skip to the next track. These are really cool. But I digress. Again it's all about the SOUND. And these have it. I have three songs I use for testing speakers and headphones. And they will either blow the speaker/drivers or sound great. These passed at full volume on a 140 Watt Stereo System. Couldn't leave it that way long, but they handled it. Separation is great whether through my PC, Smart Phone or Stereo.  Another really nice feature is a padded carrying case. If you are an audiophile yourself or want to make someone really happy, pick up a pair of these. You won't be disappointed. Oh, and I almost forgot, these babies are noise canceling too. You just can't beat this deal on these headphones. The price for these in my opinion is well under their value, especially in comparison with much higher priced Headphones. Save your money and get these. This is truly one product I can recommend with no hesitation whatsoever. As always, thanks to Amazon for bringing fantastic products like this to the market place..

DO NOT BUY THIS !!!! I purchased mine from Wally World and it lasted 1 year. One whole year. This is absolutely the worst Keurig made. If you buy it, you better make sure every pod you buy has a Keurig logo on it or it WILL NOT WORK. And even then no guarantee it's going to last. I paid $189.00 when I purchased this sorry contraption. Three years prior I purchased three of the earlier models, all of which are still functioning just fine. And they make coffee from any brand, including my own ground coffee. I strongly urge you to reconsider buying this piece of crap. I wouldn't recommend this to someone I hated. Keurig really got greedy with this model. Plus the carafe, is cheap plastic that is totally worthless. The only thing it's good for is filling up the water reservoir. DO NOT BUY THIS.

Sherlock Holmes & Ian McKellen are probably two of my most favorite characters. Although the one being fictional. I was so much looking forward to this movie having been a fan of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's "Sherlock Holmes" all my life. A character so many have played with such great success. From Basil Rathbone to Robert Downey Jr. . However this movie portrays Holmes in a completely contradictory role as that of the original character, and further attempts to insinuate that everything previously written prior has been falsified by Watson. From his physical appearance to his case history all being fabricated by Watson.  All the while McKellen (Holmes) now suffering from old age senility,  having temporary reflections of his past, while tending his bees, adds nothing whatsoever but boredom to the story. The first half of the movie is very slow moving and quite boring. Laura Linney is cast as Holmes housekeeper and seems very out of place in the story. Speaking with an American accent, yet having a child with British accent. This again seems to add nothing to the story. There are a few moments when Holmes reflections are lucid and we see the Holmes we have come to know, but quickly dispelled by Holmes shortcomings as a detective. Once again as if the whole purpose of this movie is to shatter the image of Sherlock Holmes the character himself into something far less than what we have all come to love about the character... My recommendations of this movie are this. If you feel you must see this.. Rent it.. Don't waste money buying it, you will be sorely disappointed. I am. Ian McKellen is one of the greatest character actors of the last 30 years. I have no idea what purpose HE had in making this film. The writers of this film should be sued by Sir Arthur Doyle's estate for the way they portrayed this iconic character. Mr. McKellen should stick to fantasy films after this.

I bought a GMC last year with BT enabled everything. It's the only way safely to talk while driving. If you have to at all. It's also a great way to stream your favorite music as well. The problem is, if you own a car several years old, you may not have BT. Well now you can.. If you have an AUXILLARY Input line, a cigarette charger, then you can have Bluetooth in your care. This New Vtin Bluetooth 4.0 Hands Free BT adapter for cars is really cool, and it really works. It comes with everything you need to charge itself, your phone, and another USB device. It will pair with 2 Smart Phones. Stream music right onto your Car's stereo system. Incoming and outgoing calls can now be made "Hands Free" over your stereo system through the BT receiver that also acts as a microphone. It operates at 2.4Ghz, with a range up to 60 feet. These are so simple and easy to use, and install in a couple of minutes, for the price everyone should have one in their automobile. These are great. They work flawlessly. Pairing takes only a couple of seconds. If you want Pandora, I Heart, or anything Streaming music, this is your chance to get it..... BT Hands Free Adapter.. All you need is an AUXILLARY INPUT.......And a Cigarette lighter slot to power.

Excellent product. Works exactly as described and promised. Used this in conjunction with Enitek HDMI splitter, now I have cable in every room of the house, with only 3x Comcast XI platform cable boxes. No signal or sound loss whatsoever. Another well made product I can recommend to Amazon buyers with confidence. As an added note, I also use the J-Tech HDMI splitter too with a 100 foot configuration. And it works fantastic. Just FYI. Why pay for more cable boxes than you need when you can do this..

Excellent product. Used this in conjunction with Twisted Veins Brand 100 foot HDMI cable to slave off my Comcast cable box so I could run an additional line into my Pool Room. Works great. Picture and sound both are crystal clear now coming into my 55" Samsung Flatscreen. After reading all the reviews by other customers I felt confident this was the right product. And it was, thanks to Everyone that takes the time for writing reviews. They do matter. Now I can recommend this, and Twisted Veins HDMI cable as well.. Delivery was overnight with Prime. Great job all the way around buying from Amazon.

I purchased this to slave off of my bedroom DVR Comcast Cable box, through the ceiling into the attic and into the pool room. Not quite 100 ft., but right at 90 ft.  I had already maxed out on the number of receivers my home can handle with the X1 Platform. Having a 55" TV in the pool room running CATV just wasn't cutting it. So with the aid of an HDMI splitter, I purchased this 100 foot Twisted veins HDMI cable, after carefully reading all the specs and REVIEWS, by other customers. This works FANTASTIC. No loss of signal strength, or audio.. Picture is perfect. This is very heavy duty cable. Best cable I've seen, or bought.. I also purchased this in 50 ft. length. And of course, same quality. Great product. I highly recommend this if you are in the need of HDMI cable above and beyond the normal length.. Great price too. Also comes with two extra connectors and 3 tie downs.

I rec'd this in favor of a review. This a one handy and well thought out design. Whether you choose to use this with a GoPro camera or a Smart phone, this Telescoping extension pole, with it's breakaway tripod parts, will allow a number of variations for using and taking photos and videos. The Go Pro will screw right in. The SmartPhone clamps into a nice padded spring loaded clamping holder that will pivot 360 degrees. Very ingenious design. Really cool product. Especially for making hands free video's. Well balanced, very simple and well made. I've used it several times just making guitar tutorials. I really like it.. Adjust from about 3" to around 4- 5 feet in height. Set in on a table top, or in the full extended version on the floor across the room.

I purchased this for my Mom. She's at the age where getting in and out of the tub has gotten to be extremely difficult. My dad and I had looked at bathtub chair lifts initially, until I saw this. Then I realized even with a lift, we would need this. So I thought, lets try this first. All three of us have been very pleased with the results. My mom can now get in and out of the tub, mostly out, with little effort now. She is very happy with this grab bar. So my dad and I are too. So simple to attach. Very sturdy metal with a vinyl covering over the top. The wedge type locking grip makes this impossible to come loose if you tighten it down properly. I installed it in minutes. And I tested it myself. I'm 195 lbs of muscle, and once I locked this in place, I couldn't budge it. Excellent product if you have a loved one that needs assistance getting in and out of the bathtub. And as the description states, the bar is adjustable in height.

I was fortunate enough to receive this for a review. This is long overdue and a fantastic product. The ROKU as everyone knows that has one, is very lightweight, and easily pulled by the cables. Especially HDMI cables. I have several of these. And the only negative thing about the ROKU is they constantly seem to slip of the top of whatever they are sitting on if anything gets moved or dusted. These mounts make that impossible now. The mount for the ROKU allows you to slide the box in, attach it basically anywhere you want. In sight, or out of sight. And with the available remote control holder, again, it's right where you put it all the time. It slides perfectly into the holder that will mount with double sided tape to anything your heart desires. Fantastic accessories for the ROKU.

I purchased this after reading the reviews for all four variations of this brand. I expected this particular one to be the best value for the money. The only I found that was $70.00 more didn't have any different specifications than this one did. And the difference between this topper and Amazon's rated number one seller Pinzon, was the material it was made from, and the reviews I read. So I figured this had to be the best overall value. WRONG. I should have picked the one for $89.00 or less and gotten the same thing, by the same manufacturer. I was embarrassed at myself when this arrived for the choice I had made. I bought this to replace my original mattress topper which I have had for 2-3 years now. I bought it at Belk's and paid around $129.00 for it. It's so much nicer still than the one I just bought I feel stupid. So now, instead of having a new "Marriot" comfort topper for my bed, this will go on one of the guest beds. And by the way, I slept on it last night for the purpose of this review. It does not help cool down the mattress or dissipate body heat one bit. The baffling is weaved, not boxed. And the loft is maybe an inch. The texture is not soft, but almost rough feeling. I am very disappointed in this product. I had thought, since I too am a Veteran, and seeing this was a Veteran owned company that perhaps this was the real deal. It is not. When the FedEx driver showed up and tossed me the box from the truck I knew I had made a mistake. Don't you make one.

This is the second coat I have rec'd. I sent the first one back. I have 3 closets full of sport coats and suits. Every color you can own. I sent the first one back because it was not as pictured, Heather Brown. Today the 2nd one came, and it is exactly the same coat as the one I just sent back. I have every color and shade of brown slacks you can imagine. This coat is closer to grey than brown. But it IS NOT in the Brown family at all. It is a nice well made coat. All of these Haggar performance coats fit well, and fit per size. But this coat is not in the Brown family. I rely on reviews. As most everyone on Amazon does. So on this particular coat, buyer beware. I'm not sending it back because it's just too much trouble. I'll wear it with jeans.

Very nice sport coat. I love the color of this charcoal blend. I ordered a 42 regular and it fits like I had it tailor cut. The brass buttons really accentuate the coat as well. Cant beat the price either. Very Pleased with this purchase.

Very hard finding 100% Cotton Sport coats. I was a bit leery not having tried Jones New York styles before. But thankfully because of other reviewers out there like you, I went ahead and ordered one. I wear a 42 regular, on the slim side. This coat fit me perfectly. I would have loved it had the color been perhaps just a shade lighter, none the less I love the coat. Great for my blue jeans or slacks. Nice coat, well made. Now I can recommend this myself.

This is a well made nice fitting coat. I wear a 42 regular with a slim cut. This jacket fit me perfectly. The color is exactly as pictured. A beautiful light grey. This particular line of Haggar Coats are much more trim fitting than some I have owned. More tailored looking. Nice coat for the price. All season coat. Looks great as a suit or with jeans.

Excellent western starring Ed Harris and Virgo Mortenson. Done in the tradition of westerns from the days when movies were made to entertain and not shock. Not filled with vulgarity or excessive violence. Very enjoyable.

Excellent compilation of some of KR's more memorable tunes. There are a lot of THE BEST of out there.  In my opinion this particular album/cd, covered most of the best. Great album. Great price. Granted there are still a lot of good tunes not contained in this album, but unless you purchase the $79.00 collection, you can't get all the songs KR released. But this sure is a good one to start with.

These sleeves are great for DVD or CD's. I make a lot of both. Normally back up copies. Sometimes copies for friends or families. These are great for protecting those disks w/out the more expensive and cumbersome jewel cases. You get a lot more for the money.

These are EXCELLENT CD-R for recording MUSIC . 4 each 50 packs. I thought the price on this bundle was an outstanding purchase. I've used these Memorex brand CD-R disks for years recording music on my home stereo CD burner and on my computer as well. They work flawlessly in either. Sure can't get this deal at any Wally world. Great deal, great value. I highly recommend.

Bought this for my 82 year old Father. He loves it. This shoe horn is made of heavy duty plastic, which is fairly rigid. But not so rigid it would break, like some of the cheaper shoe horns I've seen, and like the one my dad had which did break. This one has enough pliability to it, that it should hold up for years of daily use. The length of this shoe horn is probably the greatest feature other than the quality. You can be standing upright and use this shoehorn. Which keeps you from having to bend over, and for elderly people like my dad, who lose their balance easily, it's great. This is really a great idea and a great product. Great price too. I couldn't recommend a product more highly than this for anyone needing a shoe horn. But especially for older folks, handicapped , and just about everyone. My dad loves it. I've purchased a number of products from VIVE Health and every product has been outstanding. Thanks VIVE and Thanks Amazon.

Very disappointed in this album/CD by the Oak Ridge Boys. Compared to their last Album this is rather boring and seems as if they simply weren't trying. I've had several people listen to this as well and said the same thing. For those familiar with the "Red" hymnal book, these songs are basically sung exactly like they would have been sung from the RED book. No songs stand out on this album at all.

Excellent Solar powered motion activated light for those places that you can't get hard wiring to. This works great as an add on light in those hard to reach places around the house where you need additional lighting but don't want to call an electrician to come out and run wiring. Mounts easily with 2 screws, and provides a sufficient amount of light. I have mine mounted over my storage building as a security light. Works great. And for the price, just can't be beat. Good value. The unit itself seems very well made and feels heavy and solid built.

Absolutely love this Quilt set by Greenland Home. This is my second by Greenland home, the other being the Antique Chic. Both are beautiful. This one as well as the other is much prettier than the picture. Excellent quality. Unbeatable price, although I did notice the price jump right after I purchased this set. Nonetheless I would buy it again anyway. The quilt is light enough to use in summer, and heavy enough for winter with a blanket underneath. With just about every color you can imagine in this quilt, its easy to match with curtains, carpet and wall paint.

Fantastic wall mounts that I stumbled on as a Amazon Value ADD ON items. Excellent price at around $4.00 or so. These will hold everything from a Tele, to a Les Paul. Looking for good solid wall mounts, give these a try.

I really like this. I've been burning scented candles, and melting scented wax for years. This takes just a small amount of your favorite fragrance essential oils, with some water, press a button to add a little color, like a nice soothing Blue, or Red, maybe Yellow depending on your mood, and you have a perfect combination for dispensing a wonderful fragrance throughout the room. This Oil diffuser adds a nice touch of ambience as well as a nice fragrance, and only a hint of a whisper of sound. One button to turn on the diffuser, and one button to adjust the color. Really pretty at night. Great product, and a great way to sit back and just relax. And a little oil goes along way with this diffuser. Which is a big plus. This is one item I can highly recommend. This runs for hours without having to replace the water or oil. Very efficient. Very cost effective.

All in all this is probably about the best overall combination case for protecting a phone I've seen. Once you slip on the back and front cover, your phone is very well protected. And even though very secure, it slides easily into the casing, and just as easily out. The back of the case has the kick stand that allows you to stand the phone upright or sideways. Then when you go mobile, slide the outer shell onto the phone with the clip attachment, and your ready to go. The case itself is lightweight, but hard as nails. This is a rather ingenious design, unlike any other I have seen. And at a great price for the amount of protection it provides. And the features. Really a great product. So if your looking for something that gives you a coupe of good options, with good protection for your phone, then this case will certainly do it for you.

The best Coffee out there, so much so I order 2 cases of the decaf, and 2 cases of regular every month. If you haven't tried Donut Shop coffee's yet, you don't know what your missing. And you can get this through Amazon's subscribe and save program as well. I have dinner parties fairly often and I have yet to have anyone not ask me, what kind of coffee is this. It seems everyone loves it. So, like I said, if you haven't tried it, order some and see what you think... Just darn good coffee. And it works in the older versions of the Keurig coffee makers and the brand new models. Also comes in the Carafe size.

This is a good, but long forgotten John Wayne movie that sees very little air play. Which I don't understand. They continuously show repeat after repeat of the latest Hollywood garbage, and overlook classic movies like this. Good movie with John Wayne in a more lighthearted role. Very enjoyable and a must have for Western Movie fans, and more specifically, John Wayne fans. 3 Godfathers... Just a good old cowboy movie, one you'll definitely enjoy.

Great quality Tin of The Duke. Fits the décor of my pool room (man cave) perfectly. This particular photo reminds me of Hondo. These are top quality tin photo's. And reasonably priced. I really like mine. I would have never found this without AMAZON... Thanks Duke, and thanks Amazon.

This is the third product I've ordered from Hoont. And I've been satisfied with all three. This particular product works great, especially if you have pesky animals that you don't want foraging around your house or garbage cans at night. This motion sensitive device works in 5 modes, either with flashing lights, or a combination of flashing lights with or w/out an audible noise. You can set it for whatever purpose you need. It runs off battery and DC as well. But I can tell you, my neighbors who won't keep their dogs in their own yard, don't come in mine now. And possums and raccoons don't get anywhere near my garbage cans at night. So I'm very satisfied with my Animal Repeller. For that matter, it might scare off other things bigger than skunks and polecats.. Having problems with neighbors dogs, or animals coming into your yard, give this baby a try.

I rec'd my Soundpeats Blue-Tooth headsets this week. After I charged them for about 3 hours, and put them on. I was thrilled.  First, they fit better than any Blue-tooth headsets I've EVER tried. And they stayed in my ears. I've never been able to find any that would stay in my ears, or stay on for that matter. The way these are designed helps them stay on. They actually hug around the back of your neck and fit close into the ears.  I have never been able to wear ear plug type headphones or headsets unless they were the traditional over the head headphones. These are great. They pair easily with all my Blue-tooth devices simply by pushing a button. You can select the next track on your playlist, receive an incoming call, just by pushing a button on the headset. And the sound quality is very impressive, just as good as a regular set of stereo headphones. Soundpeats has a winner with this set of Wireless Blue-Tooth headphones. Great price, great product.. One that I highly recommend. As a side note,  I cut my yard wearing these, and I heard music, crystal clear, not my lawnmower. Even more, driving up under some trees that scratched me to pieces, the headphones never came off. I couldn't be happier with this product.

I ordered this not knowing exactly how long it would take before I rec'd it. Much too my surprise it came within less than about a month. All 6 seasons. 30 DVD's. I am in heaven. This is my favorite Western of all time. And Hugh O'Brian ranks up there with John Wayne as one of my favorite all time American hero's. Purchasing these as individual seasons is much more expensive than buying this Complete Set, so this is a truly fantastic purchase at $119.00. Just a GREAT price. I've waited forever for this. I couldn't be happier with this, I feel 50 years younger just watching these episodes. What a shame we've drifted so far away from the values displayed in the simpler times characterized by this show, and the values Mr. O'Brien himself stood for. Aim only too wound and not kill. Drink milk, not whiskey. Semper Fi Mr. O'Brian. And for anyone out there that loves these old shows, this is a wonderful way to continue watching TV. Thanks AMAZON for making this available. Thanks Mr. O'Brian for everything you've done in your life. You've been a great role model.

I rec'd my Aduro Power supply unit about a week ago. This is a great device for charging just about anything that uses a USB port to charge with. It's small, and  has 6 convenient plug in's. I have been able to successfully charge my Smart Phone, my Zune MP3 player, my  Laptop's and my Blu-tooth earphones all at the same time. It keeps me from having a multitude of extra cords cluttering things up. And everything is right where I want them. It's really a great little power hub. Once I plugged it in, hit the power button to turn it on, all I did was start plugging in my different devices into the appropriate ports on the charger. I am completely satisfied with this very handy little box. I wished I had had this along time ago. I've gone through more blasted phone chargers than I can remember. Now I just use the USB cable. This is a great gadget to have around the house, and one I highly recommend in this world of Smart Phones, and devices that charge via a USB cable. Truly a great value. Also, when friends come over, especially guests staying over, they always seem to leave their phone chargers. Now I have something they can use to charge their phones with as well. And that is another added plus for my guest.

I didn't really know what to expect when I ordered this book. I've always been a BIG fan of the Bible, and a fan of Tolkien. The authors did a wonderful job in writing this book. Once I picked it up, I read it straight through. Although I suspect, they like myself, may have discovered God's deeper truth's in this Middle Earth trilogy , as Tolkien himself in my opinion, may very well have discovered for himself in The Bible, but they , as Tolkien, do not detract or add too it from his original story. They do add a great deal of spiritual depth to the story line however. And make this "Finding GOD" a genuinely satisfying piece of work in my opinion. One that I truly think anyone having had a spiritual connection with TLOTR trilogy with, would enjoy reading this book. I certainly did. Great book.

I saw two very negative reviews posted regarding this particular lawn mower, all others were great. When mine arrived, it was 15 minutes late within the target window. Not bad. It arrived in a crate on a pallet. The driver had a lift gate and lowered the pallet down, used a pallet jack and placed the mower exactly where I asked him to. It took 10 minutes uncrating the mower, and about 15 minutes more hooking up the battery, steering wheel, and sliding the seat into place. I checked the oil, put gas into the mower. Then read the instructions. Afterwards cut my grass. The mower performed flawlessly. It handles well, great turn radius for tight turns, which is one of the biggest reasons I chose this mower. And at close to 15 HP it will definitely scoot you around the yard. This is a good performing mower. It feels solid underneath you. Prior to purchasing this mower like anything I purchase, I check out all the competitors and sales ads. This was the best in price and performance for the dollar. I am very pleased with this purchase. And of course having it delivered right to my front door is always a very big plus. I have no problem recommending this mower at all.

Just rec'd my Screen Protector for my Note 3 a couple of days ago. I am very impressed with this screen protector. First it is hard as glass, as it is described. And unlike the other vinyl type screen protectors it seems much more sensitive to the touch. My screen seems brighter. Applying this was very simple. Again, being a solid piece of glass versus a piece of peel and stick vinyl you just clean the surface of your phone and basically press it on. I had only one tiny air bubble, which took a second pressing out.. great product.. I highly recommend this product. Good vendor..

UPDATE TO MY ORIGINAL REVIEW.. BATTLE CRY IN THIS SET IS DEFECTIVE. I purchased April 5th, today is May May2, They say 30 refund window. But yet will not let me refund. The movies Battle Cry Will not play. I have 5 DVD players, DVD, Blue-Ray and 3D Blu Ray players. it plays in none of them with out stalling and hanging freezing. No FF. Just locks up the DVD player.I haven't had the opportunity to sit and watch this movie prior to now... Battleground.. That's why I bought this set. 101st Airborne in Bastogne. I remember this movie as a child. The battling "bastards" of Bastogne. Great movie retelling of the 101st's position during the Battle of the Bulge. Shown from more of a personal side.Battle Cry.. Another great World War 2 flick.. This set alone is less than buying one individual movie... Good value.

This is a good quality knife by Smith and Wesson. I own a number of S&W knives, always have since my earliest Army days. This being one of the smaller or medium sized pocket knives. Nonetheless it, along with other models such as the S.W.A.T. knife, I highly  recommend as being good solid built knives. Easily sharpened, and easy too keep and edge on. With break in time being minimum on manual opening knives, and on spring assisted knives, a matter of minutes. Smith & Wesson, good quality knives...

At last the Hobbit ends. What's next ? I've loved all the movies. I loved this less than them all. I did enjoy seeing this in 3D. Wished they had released the others in 3D before I bought all the other Blu-Ray versions. If your even reading this, more than likely you've seen the other films, and probably, this one. So you make up your own mind.. None the less, if you have the rest, then you know you have to have this one too.... Buy it now.. And think about the 3D.. One day, even you may want a 3D 65" Samsung Flatscreen.. This package gives you all three versions. HDDVD, Blu-Ray and Blu-Ray 3D. It may be the way we start buying our DVD's when we can..

Four of the best JOHN WAYNE War Flicks in one economical package. A good buy. All films were very high quality. Very pleased with this overall Value. I very much recommend this product to ALL AMERICANS.

Great Shirts. These are just as they appear in the picture. Plenty of sleeve and plenty of length. I bought Medium, I've always worn medium. 6 foot, 190. fits perfectly. Great shirt. I bought 6 in total. I wear them as outer shirts and undershirts. Much cheaper than buying Henley's.  Very comfortable. Material hasn't shrunk either.

Great fitting, nice comfortable cotton material. I'm 6 feet, 190 lbs. I wear the medium and they fit both in length, waist, and crotch perfectly. Very comfortable to wear. No shrinkage from what I could tell. I bought 6 pair in assorted color, and although there is a difference in material varied it seemed by color, they all, after washing are very soft, hang straight, have a high waistband, cut full length and sit loose enough in the crotch too add some additional comfort without making them look like old mans britches. A nice job on these. I thought a fair price as well. The tops that are the countertops for these pants fit in color, sizing,  and price. And also are full length cut, giving ample length in the sleeve and well below the buttocks.

This is a GREAT CD Burner for Home Stereo use. And unfortunately becoming one of the few available of it's kind. In this class and for this price range. This is an exceptionally fine product that gives normally, a good 5 years plus of service under normal daily usage and maintenance. So if you have cassettes, vinyl, or basically any other format that you can plug into this, either as a stand-alone, or part of a Home Stereo or Surround System, this Teac recorder will fit the bill. And still at a very affordable price. The next option above this would be the Tascam. Both of which are good machines. This was purchased for my Dad, who after 2 Sony CD burners having played out on him ( which don't exist anymore) , now reordering his second Teac. Which proves by the way that the average life span of these machines have been around 5 years. Of either the Sony or Teac. I also might add I had a high dollar Harmon Kardon that lasted even less time than that. I now own the Tascam. The upper end. It's great, but not necessary. This Teac would have been plenty for me too. This is a good machine, and a good buy. I'd get one of these before they quit making them too.
High quality tote bag. Pockets on both sides and both ends. Supple leather. A really nice tote bag. Also comes with a carrying strap. I'm very happy with this purchase.

This is a decent meat slicer for what you pay for it. Certainly not an industrial grade, but for this price one shouldn't expect it. it works well for a home use model however. You can slice your deli meats pretty thin or thick, depending on your choice. Clean up is easy. It isn't as heavy as it really needs being and there are more plastic parts than metal, which is why it is lighter in weight, and why I gave it 4 stars. Still, all in all a good home machine for cutting your deli meats.

I wanted something that would help me with my squirrel problem. And my neighbors roaming dogs. Sweet as they are. They both get annoying. Although this unit is not meant for outside use, and optimally is best when there are no obstructions like walls between it and the object you wish to repel, I have found that it works quite well when placed in the right position. My neighbors dogs kept coming up to my door setting off my door alert. So I placed this on the opposite side of the door. it took a week, and they quit coming around. That was the first experiment. The second, placing this in my attic. I have huge oaks trees, and the squirrels love running all over my roof. Since I have had this in the attic, they have decided to play elsewhere. So I am very satisfied with this product. it does what is says it does. And you can't ask for more than that. Oh, and I can't hear it at all. So this gets 5 stars from me... great product..

I rec'd this about 2 weeks ago and have been waiting and watching to see how well this product would work, and hold up before I posted a review. The first day right of the box into the yard, by nightfall it was as bright as could be. Much brighter than I expected. The following day, rain. So subsequently, the light was greatly diminished. The following day the sun popped back out and that night, it was bright as a beacon again. Now after having had it going into the third week, where I live, we've had a lot of rain and cloudy skies. But on days when it's able to get some sun on the solar panels, this Solar Spotlight works great. I was concerned the batteries would be drained with so many days of rain and cloudy skies in between sunny days. But so far, this has held up really well. So I think these guys got this one right. And I'm quite pleased with this product and have no problem recommending this to anyone. The Hoont LED Solar Spotlight/Yardlight.. 5 Stars from me..

This is the latest and greatest in developments for us Wine drinkers. And an easy way to get that foil off the top of the bottle of wine. If you are like me, you've found that most wine bottles require more time peeling off the foil than popping the cork. The EDGY simplifies that in just a second. I rec'd mine last week, but waited until I had company coming in to pull it out and use it. I had several very special German vintages just waiting, along with a couple of domestic reds. In the past I have always had to pull out my pocket knife, like a , well I hate using this terminology, but like a redneck  to get the foil off the bottle of a $100.00 bottle of wine. No more.  This little baby just fits perfectly around the top of the bottle and squeeze, then just give it about 1/4 turn, and that's it. The foil is off. Clean as can be. Really an item long overdue in my humble opinion, but one that will get many years of service. I have only one problem with this Edgy, my friends wanted to depart with it... So this will make an excellent gift item to any wine loving friend you have. Edgy Wine foil cutter. If you don't have one, you should. And get an extra while your ordering and make a friend happy. Comes in a nice little gift box.

She wore a Yellow Ribbon was one of John Wayne's great westerns. Starring Joan Dru, John Agar, Harry Carey Jr. And more familiar faces that are seen in most of John Wayne's films. A young Ben Johnson. This has a great story line. And just a downright good movie. A must have for any John Wayne collection.. Victor McLagen plays the hard nosed hard drinking Sergeant major. Just a great film and fun to watch.

Four of John Wayne's best. And without a doubt, three of his all time best Westerns. The Searchers being his own favorite according to his son Patrick Wayne. Rio Bravo with Ricky Nelson and Walter Brennan. Fort Apache with Henry Fonda. This a value priced DVD package. So if you are looking to stock up on your JW collection, this is a good way to do it. Every disk played flawlessly.

This was another great album by the Legendary progressive Rock band The Moody Blues. I remember when I heard Nights In White Satin when it was released the first time. I've been a fan since. Although this was a bit more mainstream at the time of it's release, it's still none the less a great piece of artistic work. I still have the vinyl. Just wanted a CD to download on my computer files. Great disk. Check it out.

Top quality 16 Gauge Speaker wire. This 100 foot spool of Speaker wire is as good or better than any other brand of speaker wire you can buy. Only difference is you pay less when buying Amazon basics, which I have found to be excellent products, and in most cases, as this, superior to most name brands. Can't go wrong buying this. Excellent speaker wire.

After I looked over the product and read all the other reviews I ordered 24. At $10.99 I felt it was a fair price. Before the product arrived I had several projects in mind. I really wanted to put these through the test. And I must say, these are really a fantastic product. My first project was making Custard Pies in these Silicone Cups. yep, 24 individual servings. Once they baked and cooled a bit, I popped them right out of the Liners, rinsed them off, which took maybe 5 minutes. Which is another great thing about these. Clean up is almost unnecessary. These liners are really great. They never lost shape at all. I used nothing in the way of bakers spray. Next I made 24 individual peach pies. Same results. They came out perfect. Took them out, cooled a bit and popped them right out. After rinsing them off, I made gelatin in them. Again, same results. Same procedure. These are the coolest thing in my kitchen right now. And the possibilities of what these can be used for are basically limitless. Pretty much whatever you can think of using them for. I'm thinking perhaps now, little side dishes for dinner parties. H'orderves of any kind. Bottom line, these are fantastic. 21st Century Cookware. Totally cool. If you don't own these, you really should. Every kitchen should have this product in it. I couldn't recommend a product more highly than these. These really do make your Kitchen Home Complete... This is one product if I could give 10 stars I would. Thanks Home Complete, and Amazon for bringing these products to the Marketplace."Excellent Company.Will do business with again and again. prompt and very courteous. "

Donut Shop Medium Roast Extra Bold Coffee. Best darn tasting coffee period there is I think. If you have a Keurig and you haven't tried this, then you haven't had a really good cup of coffee. I've been buying this in Regular and Decaf by the case, by the month through Amazon's subscribe and save program now for several years. Everyone that steps through my door and enters my house loves this coffee. I have given away as gifts 3 Keurig coffee makers, and with it I gave them assorted Variety packs of coffee, so they could choose their own flavors. Each of them chose Donut House. And to this very day, still drink it. Just a great tasting cup of coffee. I really recommend this brand to any coffee lover. If you haven't found that perfect cup yet. Then give this one a try

This is not a heavy duty physics text book - there are many out there if you need to delve more deeply into any given physics topic or if you need to practice problem solving. This is more of a brief but clear synopsis of the important fundamental physics topics.It's a bit like Cliffs Notes, but more visual and fun. Everything is explained simply and eloquently with cute black & white cartoon illustrations, analogies, and not much math. It's great for high school kids up to adults of any age.

Amsterdam Standard is Royal Talens' inexpensive line of student-grade acrylic paint. It's made in the Netherlands. Their professional line of acrylics is called Expert.These have a smooth, moderately-thick feel, similar to other student-grade acrylics. They will retain some brush and knife marks if applied thickly, but not quite as much as professional acrylics. As can be expected, most colors darken a bit as they dry - especially the dark ones. They dry to a satin finish.This color (Permanent Blue Violet), is a semi-transparent, intense 'grape' purple when spread out thinly. When applied thickly it dries to a purple so deep & rich it's almost black. The Sap Green and Phthalo Blue also have good depth of color. I also tried Nickel Titanate Yellow and it was a beautiful and useful color but disappointing opacity. That color has been reformulated with a different pigment - I haven't yet tried it.These come in several large sizes, and I like their tubes have a flip-top cap rather than the small, difficult-to-grip caps that some other acrylics have. You can also buy Amsterdam 'dosing nozzles' for the these which allow you to squeeze out raised lines of paint.

These Art Noise paints are manufactured by Tri-Art in Canada. They are inexpensive, scholatic-grade paints. They're made with 100% acrylic binder and better pigmentation than a lot of craft paints.The large container sizes available make these great for murals and classrooms...anywhere you use a lot of paint. The thickness is about the same as most craft paints - the manufacturer says it's like lotion - which is a good way to describe it. It dries to a matte or satin finish with little or no texture or brush marks. For artwork on canvas, you might prefer student grade or artist grade acrylics if you want to retain brush marks.This 'Crimson' color is a deep maroon when applied thick, but spreading it thin shows a fiery reddish undertone, and when white is added it makes a nice pink. When mixed with most greens, you will get a dark grey or black. This is a versatile color to have.

Unlike most LED night lights which emit a harsh white or blueish-white light, this one emits a tangerine orange light. This is good for minimizing the effect of 'waking up your brain' by inadvertently getting blue or white light (which contains a lot of blue) into your eyes in the middle of the night.It actually seems to be a white LED with a transparent orange diffuser, but the result is the same - a rich orange color. It is 'always-on' (no photosensor) but it uses so little energy (less than 1W) that it costs virtually nothing to operate 24/7.It's moderately bright; not as bright as 7 watt or even 4 watt incandescent bulbs, but bright enough to cast a glow a few feet around to see what you're doing. Probably not bright enough for brushing your teeth, but perfect in the bedroom and hallways. All the white LED night lights I've used before got dimmer over the years; time will tell if this one does. So far this is my favorite night light.

This is a utilitarian office phone...it isn't pretty to look at. But I bought it for its features not its looks. It can stand up at two angles...regular or a high angle...depending on which direction you insert the plastic stand on the bottom.This is a 2-line phone but you can use it with only 1 line like a regular phone if you don't need 2 lines. If only 1 line is connected, the red status light for the unused line will always be on. Also, if someone is on the phone elsewhere in the house or office, the red light for that in-use line will be lit up...a useful feature. The ringer has 7 volume levels plus off. The lowest volume setting is somewhat quiet, but not as quiet as I had hoped.The LCD display illuminates with blue backlighting when you lift the receiver or when someone is calling - so you can use this phone in the dark. Otherwise the backlight is off. The text is medium-sized. You must plug in the wall adapter (included) for the display to function - there is no battery option.The caller ID is supposed to let you assign a custom name to any number that calls - but this feature only worked for one caller. For 8 others I tried, only their number displays when they call, no additional name shows up.Also, on my phone, it always displays "0 new calls" ...even if I did miss a call. I have to manually go into the call history menu to see if anyone did call. I don't know if these 2 problems are because something is wrong with my phone, or because these features don't work properly here in Canada.

This map is made from completely waterproof plastic 'paper'. ITMB's waterproof maps are larger than other waterproof maps (such as National Geographic Destination maps and Rough Guide maps), but it's not as huge as the full-size paper maps you can buy anywhere.This map shows the central and Downtown region in good detail, but only shows the rest of the city in a small, low-detail inset map section. There is also a small rapid transit map.On the opposite side is a large regional map that shows Southern Ontario, Northern New York and Pennsylvania. This is a huge bonus, useful for traveling, but I would rather that the opposite side was instead used to show the entire Greater Toronto Area in decent detail.

I bought these for loosening and tightening the large nuts and connections under sinks. These are often round and meant to be hand tightened, but often get too tight to loosen by hand. Almost all slip-joint or groove joint pliers I've seen before have jaws that are too flat and/or too short to properly grip these nuts. Oil filter pliers have jaws that are round but too big and not the right gripping shape.So I gave these a try and finally got a grip. The jaws can grip nuts up to around 3" diameter. They actually open wider but 3" is about the maximum for a good grip. The slip-joint mechanism on mine is very rough...the one thing about these pliers that is cheap. To open to the widest of the 4 settings, the pivot nut must be loosened a bit...but then it's loose on the 3 smaller settings. But the overall design and shape feels perfect in the hands...and it's not overly big & clumsy in tight spaces. It comes with 2 hard plastic jaw covers if you want to avoid scratching delicate plastic parts.If you live in North America, the shipping cost will probably make these pliers not a good value. But...pliers with jaws of this shape are hard to find, so I'm glad I bought these. They save a lot of aggravation when working under sinks.

The capability and features of this recorder are impressive for $150. The 2 tiny built-in mics are a great bonus and surprisingly good - with 'heavy' deep bass response. They allow quick, cable-free stereo recording.Some things I'm not crazy about...The use of tiny rotary knobs for the mixing levels doesn't look or feel right for that function. Traditional sliders (even short ones) would've been much nicer. Also, these tiny knobs feel a bit flimsy. I like that left/right balance and reverb have their own dedicated knobs for all 8 channels...no need to go into a menu.This unit was designed to minimize the need to navigate through menus by having direct-access buttons. But you still often do need to navigate deep into the menus anyways. And just starting a new song is a tedious procedure. Despite being advertised as easy to use, it isn't quite. But considering all the features and capabilities this unit has, this has to be expected to some extent.You can give each track a short name, but it seems that it does not show up while the song is being played - you have to go into the menu to see it.I don't like that you have to press & hold the tiny recessed on/off button for several seconds to turn the unit on & off. No AC adapter is included - its 4 AA batteries won't suffice for long recording sessions.I chose this over the smaller DP-004 or DP-006 because the display is backlit. It's crappy that Tascam didn't include this in the two smaller models. I wanted to get the competing Zoom R8 which in my opinion has nicer looks and user interface, but this Tascam has similar capabilites at half the price.

These are acceptable if you want to try your hand at acrylics with a good selection of bright colors in tiny paint tubes. Some colors in this set are surprisingly brilliant - almost fluorescent - but are not very lightfast and will slowly fade over the years.Many colors are transparent - which can be difficult to work with if you paint opaquely, but can provide neat effects. Most colors darken noticeably as they dry - more than other acrylics I've tried. These also dry faster than any other acrylics I've tried, and they dry to a matte finish.These are moderate viscosity like most other student-grade acrylics. They stay in place rather than flowing and leveling. But they don't retain texture and brush strokes like artist grade acrylics do. But considering the price, these are a good value.if you simply want intense colors.

This Quikrete No. 1101 is a regular strength, general purpose concrete mix. It doesn't contain the coarse aggregate (large gravel) you might expect...it contains sand and small amounts of tiny pebbles. This 1101 concrete mix also comes in large bags but I don't know if they also use the same fine aggregate. These 10 lb bags are super-convenient when you only need small amounts or don't want to lift 60-80lb. bags. I've found these at Lowes for under $3.This mix is meant for applications thicker than 2 inches, but it has worked well for me for much thinner applications. But for less than 2 inches, Quikrete recommends their No. 1103 'Sand/Topping Mix' which contains cement and sand but no gravel. For very thin and smooth topping applications on walls, parging mix works best.You'll probably need to add more water than the instructions suggest. But only add as much water as you need to get the workability you need. Add a little bit at a time while mixing. Too much water will result in weaker concrete that is more likely to crack.This concrete sets at regular speed, so it gives lots of working time but takes quite a while to harden. Depending on the temperature, it will take 1 or 2 days to harden, but will still be weak and crumbly. After 1 week it will be strong, but will take about a month to reach its final 4000psi strength.With regular-set concrete such as this, it's important that it's not allowed to dry out for at least the first week if possible. Otherwise it won't reach its full potential strength. Plastic sheets and occasional watering as necessary helps to keep it from drying out during the important curing phase.Be careful not to store these on damp ground or surfaces. Moisture can leak through the plastic bags even if they seem intact, and prematurely harden the concrete inside.

This toggle switch is Leviton model No. 1461. Unlike some single-pole switches, this one comes with a grounding screw.When it is off (down position), the toggle glows orange. When it is on (up position), the glow is off. The point is to make it easy to find in the dark. This is the opposite of a pilot light switch - those glow when on, and not when off.The orange glow looks very dim in the daytime but it's just bright enough to easily be seen in the dark. The toggle is clear and transparent. A frosted or more opaque toggle (as some others are) would make the light more even and diffuse - it's a little bit 'industrial-looking' to use in a bedroom, but it's perfect for a workshop or basement.

These picks are very stiff with virtually no flex. They are very smooth on the strings with almost no friction. It's like playing with a piece of polished glass. Some players might like this, but to me it feels lifeless, and I prefer something with more flex and 'feel'. I don't like the thick, rounded lozenge shape...to me it doesn't grip well. But pick choice is personal preference...try it yourself to see if you like it.These have a 'dark' sound with high frequencies suppressed. But that is mainly because of the thickness rather than the material or shape. These picks are better suited to bass guitar, but you could use them for guitar if you want the stiffness.

My comments are for the Philips 11W, 2700K Soft White bulb (Philips model # 9290002268) - as in the product description. Some of the earlier reviews here are for the 5000K daylight version.This Philips 11W soft white LED bulb is heavy for its size, with the 'bulb' section being made of thin glass, and the white heatsink/body being metal. The light output is impressive for 11 watts of power consumption. Mine doesn't make any buzzing that others have experienced - even when dimmed.To my disappointment, it's white light is slightly cooler and more pinkish than a 60W incandescent.  Very similar, slightly un-natural color cast as most 2700K warm white CFL bulbs. And strangely, when dimmed down to low brightness, mine takes on a bizarre, eerie, cool color tinge. Whereas incandescents get redder as they are dimmed down...to me an appealing quality.If you're less picky than me, this light might be perfectly acceptable. But for my needs, it's not a match for a 60W incandescent bulb.

This tunable AM antenna can improve AM reception significantly, but the tuning is 'mushy'. When you turn the knob, the reception doesn't suddenly get better when you hit the proper tuning frequency as it should, it's a gradual improvement - you have to turn it back and forth to try to find the best spot.In comparison, on my old Select-A-Tenna, the reception will suddenly and sharply improve when you hit the right tuning frequency - a sharp "bing!". Though this Kaito is 1/3 the cost, and the Select-A-Tenna seems to not be made any more.In terms of looks and ergonomics, this Kaito AN-100 is nice...you can't ask for much more at this low price.

This tab book & play-along CD is not for complete beginners. The songs range in difficulty from moderately-easy to advanced. The included software can slow down or speed up the CD when played on your computer. This is a great bonus, especially useful for learning fast solos.There is a refresher page of the symbols and techniques used in the notation (such as bends, vibrato, pinch harmonics, etc.). Each song is notated in standard notation and tab, and includes lyrics. But the audio on the CD is instruments only - no vocals. I wish it did have vocals, but most guitar play-along CDs don't. That might be a good thing if you want to sing along. A lot of the songs have two guitars (lead and rhythm) but the tab shows one guitar only (usually the lead or main guitar). On the CD, each song comes in two recordings:first: all instruments except vocals (to learn how it's supposed to sound)second: all instruments except vocals and lead guitar (to play along)The sound quality, clarity, and playing is very good as you'd expect from  professional session recordings. But I was disappointed that some parts of the guitar playing aren't exactly the same as the original artist's album recording. This is because the transcribers have to use their judgment as to the way it's played in the original, as well as slight differences in playing style, equipment and settings. But overall, I prefer tab books like this to online tabs which can vary greatly in quality.

I bought this Dictionary & Thesaurus to avoid having to buy two separate books. It serves its function very nicely. Like other Oxford dictionaries, it's clear and easy to use, and I love that the synonyms are encircled in a box for clarity. It also includes antonyms and pronunciations for more difficult words. This is a step above a beginners' dictionary.It's bigger than pocket-size...a bit bigger than an ordinary novel. Unfortunately, the construction is like a supermarket novel: ordinary paper covers and ordinary binding, and slightly thin non-glossy pages that feel a bit like newsprint. Though this keeps the weight down. [It's notable that Oxford's 'School' series dictionaries have thicker, stronger pages, more durable binding, and strong linen covers. Those are wonderful kids' /beginners' dictionaries]. It would also be nice if the headwords were in a color other than black for visual clarity and aesthetics - a lot of dictionaries do this nowadays.For a similar price, you can get better physical quality, but Oxford's content and presentation is top-notch.

These grammar study cards have questions (multiple choice, fill-in-the-blank, or translation) on the white side, and the answer and explanation on the opposite blue side. They're meant for practicing and reinforcing grammar rather than teaching it the first time.This set is too difficult for complete beginners - if you've just started learning Spanish, it's better to start with vocabulary cards...the Berlitz vocabulary cards are simpler, funner, and less tedious than this set. With this set you have to actually think to get the right answer, whereas the vocabulary set is mostly simple word memorization.As others have mentioned, they aren't labeled by topic/category or difficulty, but they arrive grouped by topic. A lot of the questions involve conjugating the proper verb tense to fill in the blank...a boring but essential language skill. But to me, a good beginners' grammar workbook does the job better, with much better explanation.The cards themselves are somewhat flimsy, small, non-laminated paper. They fit so tightly in the box it's hard to fit all back in. But there are lots of cards to go through, offering lots of practice.

The official product photo is incorrect when I wrote this review - though the description is correct. You can check the product number on the H-B or Thomas Scientific website to know for sure which model you're getting.It's -5 to 50 Celsius, total immersion, 160mm long, and comes in an aluminum 'duplex' case. Duplex means the thermometer itself is wrapped in open-front aluminum inner armor that gives a modest amount of protection, and this is stored in a closed aluminum tube which offers a high level of protection. Though if you drop it, it's still very possible that it might shatter inside. You can also remove the thermometer from the inner armor and use it with no protection for faster response time.It has turquoise-colored liquid over white. It would be nice if it was marked in both Celsius and Fahrenheit, but most glass lab thermometers aren't. I don't like the cluttered half-degree increment markings, nor the fact that the 15, 25, 35, and 45 degree increments are all labeled as just '5'.Like most other Thomas/H-B liquid thermometers, it's shipped from amazon in its plastic peel-open factory packaging - with no additional protection like bubble wrap. Mine arrived undamaged, but with a bubble in the liquid column, which is common after a bumpy shipment. I was able to very carefully get the bubble out.A great little durable & accurate thermometer for experiments, environmental study, and expeditions.

This Berlitz Compact dictionary is almost small enough to be pocket-size. The Berlitz Pocket dictionaries are even smaller...truly tiny. The Concise versions are mid-size.The cover is nice vinyl plastic. The corners are rounded. The binding is high quality, so you can expect this dictionary to last for many years...perfect for students lugging it to class every day. And it's no more expensive than dictionaries with paper covers that fall apart.The text is quite small, but there are 50,000 definitions, which is enough to find most words you'll encounter - this is a 'real' dictionary, not a beginner one which is missing a lot of words. I like that the headwords (the words being defined) are in blue ink. Berlitz uses the same color and cover style for all languages; it would be nice if they varied the color for different languages. Inside the covers is an excellent, highlighted visual explanation of how to use this dictionary and what the abbreviations mean.

I chose the red version of this mesh bag. It's quite large...perfect for storing and carrying clothing, towels, and beach/swimming gear. The open mesh doesn't trap moisture, so it's also good as a laundry bag. There is an extra zipper pocket on the side.The red color is darker than in the official product pic, and the Finis logo is hard to see on it. Made in China. The polyester mesh is not soft, it's slightly stiff/rough. Hopefully it'll soften up a bit over time. There are no grommets where the drawstring enters the bag...only time will tell if the mesh holds up to the friction in those two places. The drawstring can clip to the bottom corner of the bag to make a shoulder strap; a neat feature.

This is a neat little liquid ball compass for a super-low price. It's about 1 inch in diameter. The main color is white, which I find is nicer-looking than black.On the one I got, the inner ball will sometimes momentarily stick a little bit as it catches a rough edge in the inside of the globe. But the bumpyness of a moving car will keep it moving freely. The bubble at the top of the liquid seems to be getting bigger - suggesting that the liquid might be slowly leaking out - I'll keep an eye on it to confirm that.The suction cup holds firmly on a car window, but I accidentally broke off the  mount by pulling on it too hard to remove it. Lesson learned: lift off the suction cup gently by first lifting up an edge.Note: unlike some other similar-looking ball compasses, this one is designed for automotive use; you look forward onto the face of the compass to read it. If you read it looking top-down, you will get a reversed reading.

I'm as delighted with this 4.5 - 6 Volt Dorcy LED bulb as I am with their 3 Volt (2-cell) version. The beam pattern of the LED itself (used outside of any flashlight) is wide, with perfectly gradual fall-off towards the edges...no central 'hot spot'. Once in any flashlight, the reflector and lens will affect the beam pattern - will concentrate it in the center or make a circular or ring pattern, etc. The spectral color is only slightly more blueish than the near perfectly-white Dorcy 2-cell version I have. Though there is color variation in white LEDs from one sample to the next.There are some complaints that it's not as bright as some incandescent bulbs. In my 4-cell flashlight, I can say it's the brightest bulb I've yet used. It's a lot brighter than I need, and I'd rather have lower brightness & power consumption to get even longer battery life. In a 3-cell flashlight, it is a bit dimmer, but still adequate for most purposes, unless you're a security guard looking for bad guys from 100 feet away.You can't go wrong with these replacement bulbs...you'll never go back to incandescent.

Due to the somewhat high price, a lot of other atlases might be a better value. But over the years I've grown fond of the aesthetics and features of Goode's world atlases.Goode's is packed with lots of specialty world maps and information such as population, religions, climate, ocean currents, agriculture, mining, etc. I love that a lot of the major world cities have their own little city map (a tiny city map is better than none at all). However, most are found together on dedicated city map pages - I would much prefer to see the city maps on the same page as the country they are located, if possible. I am dismayed that there aren't any indications on the maps that show what page to find the continuation of the map in that particular direction.I like that this paperback version is printed on thinner, lighter, and less glossy paper than my old Goodes from the late 1970s...just my preference. Some  might prefer heavier and glossier pages.

When my X5 arrived, it barely illuminated. The batteries had a bit of powdery white corrosion on them (similar to old alkaline batteries). After wiping them clean with a dry tissue, I reinserted them, and wow! Finally the brilliant little flashlight I had hoped for.Since it uses 4 small 'button' batteries, battery life is limited. Not 130 hours as advertised, more like 2 hours nonstop on-time. I would prefer if it were designed to trade off brightness to get longer battery life. The beam is wide and perfectly round, with a concentrated spot in the middle.The instructions don't really explain how to replace the batteries. You must unscrew the lens end, and then push the rubber on/off button hard enough, and then the entire inner assembly pops out. The instructions call for LR44 batteries - this battery type goes by other names such as L1154. You can do a wikipedia search for 'LR44' to see the other names.This flashlight is solidly built, is about the size of an adult's thumb, and is a nice bright orange color. It comes with a lanyard which seems to be designed to break free if under enough tension, as a safety feature. Also included are green and red lenses which can replace the clear one that is pre-installed. Replacing the lenses is difficult because the reflector element must be removed first...it needs coaxing to pull out. The red lens makes for a superb little astronomy flashlight, or for any other time you want to preserve your night vision.

I bought this instead of a 'flat' compass because the advantage of a ball compass is that it doesn't have to lay horizontal...it should spin freely regardless of what position it's in. But unfortunately, this one occasionally 'sticks' momentarily. A light tap, bump, or movement will free it up again, but it shouldn't stick at all. I will try the Brunton model to see if it's better in this regard.The markings glow in the dark. The brass-colored pin can be cut with a wire cutter and removed, leaving a little eyelet hole that you can use to attach the compass to a string or keychain instead.

I bought this wireless keyboard to use with my Western Digital TV Live internet media player. It works with my TV Live no problem...finally I can actually type in search terms.But the buttons require a lot of pressure...you have to press hard to get the firm 'snap' actuation. It becomes tiring and it's difficult to type quickly and without mistakes. And pressing a key once will sometimes make the letter show up twice or even three times. Completely sucks.Also, I don't see a reason to have a built-in red laser pointer. I already accidentally got a painful flash reflected off my TV and into my eye. But I like the bright white key illumination and the built-in battery with USB charging.

I've been using this projector for about 10 years for projecting reference photos and line drawings onto canvas for painting. It can accept images that are up to 5x5 inches in size. You place the unit on top of the paper image (or book page, etc.) and move the projector forward or back to adjust the size of the image it makes. You adjust focus by sliding the lens in/out. It can slide right out if you pull it out too far, and it can fall out while carrying the projector.Moving the projector forward makes a smaller, brighter, and sharper image. Farther out makes a larger but dimmer and duller image. Regardless, you'll usually have to use it in the dark. Using a 100W bulb heats up the reference image to real hot...I wouldn't dare leave this thing on for long periods, or leave it on unattended. There is no carrying handle on top - which would make it easier to move around.Although it looks modern, cute, and funky, it's mechanically and ergonomically a crude design. At first it's fun to use and elicits a "wow!" response, but the more you use it, the more frustrating it becomes. Top-loading projectors are better and much easier to use, but they start at around twice the price of the Tracer.

This is a newly-released pocket-sized atlas of Toronto. Note that it only covers the city proper of Toronto - from Scarborough in the east to Etobicoke in the west. It doesn't cover the outlying cities like Mississauga. If you need coverage of the surrounding cities, you'll need a Toronto 'Area' street atlas, which will be bigger & heavier.This is basically a full-sized Toronto folding paper map cut up into sections and put into booklet form. It's small and light so it's easy to keep in your pocket and open up on the go without covering your entire face with a huge map. It's colorful and easy to use and has closeup sections of downtown Toronto.Its small size means that each page covers a relatively small area of the city...you need to do a lot of page flipping if you're using this to navigate by car. For that purpose, a full-sized spiral-bound street atlas is a better choice.

These are for glass lab thermometers that don't have a ring on top. It prevents it from rolling, and the loop can be used to hold it up. It's a pack of 25. They are purple (apparently the only color available), soft vinyl rubber which grips well. H-B also makes a triangular style which is simply a ring without the loop on top.Here on amazon, I've seen the price fluctuate from a high of over $20 (semi-insane) to a low of $5.27 (nice). If it saves a single thermometer from rolling off the table and breaking, it has paid for itself.

This somewhat hefty text book can be described as late high-school level or early college-level. There is a moderate amount math, and not much in the way of hands-on experimentation. But it is perfect for preparing for exams because it offers quite a lot of problems to solve, preceded by examples that thoroughly show how the problems should be solved.It's black & white only - no color, and a few crude line drawings for illustration ...which serve their purpose well enough. There are funner, more colorful physics text books out there, but this one takes the time to explain things very thoroughly and clearly - like a good physics professor.

These are for all 2-cell (3 volt) flashlights - AAA, AA, C, or D cell. Dorcy also has a similar LED bulb for 3 cells (4.5 volts).This bulb's spectral balance is very close to pure white - not harsh and strongly bluish or purplish like many others. The beam pattern varies depending on the lens of the flashlight you put it into. Outside of a flashlight, the beam is extremely wide and even. In a flashlight, you'll get the beam more focused in the center. Overall brightness is not super-bright, but adequate for most purposes.Buy one of these for each incandescent 2-cell flashlight you have lying around the house or car. They'll quickly pay for themselves in saved batteries, not to mention the superior performance and should last for decades.

These are for all 2-cell (3 volt) flashlights - AAA, AA, C, or D cell. Dorcy also has a similar LED bulb for 3 cells (4.5 volts).This bulb's spectral balance is very close to pure white - not harsh and strongly bluish or purplish like many others. The beam pattern varies depending on the lens of the flashlight you put it into. Outside of a flashlight, the beam is extremely wide and even. In a flashlight, you'll get the beam more focused in the center. Overall brightness is not super-bright, but adequate for most purposes.Buy one of these for each incandescent 2-cell flashlight you have lying around the house or car. They'll quickly pay for themselves in saved batteries, not to mention the superior performance and should last for decades.

This is Ridgid's smaller portable drill bit set. The bits are cryogenically-treated, black oxide coated, high speed steel (HSS). I'll update later to tell how well they stay sharp over the long-term. The larger bits have shanks with 3 flattened sides - supposedly to grip better in the chuck.I chose this set over similar ones from Milwaukee, DeWalt, and others, mainly because the box has a little built-in storage compartment - which I use to hold my tiny bits smaller than 1/16" - which would otherwise get lost. The box is made of hard ABS plastic and I like the design and the orange color - though it's a pumpkin orange rather than the intense red-orange in the official product pic here on amazon.A major irk: the two black bit holders are difficult to open - they require a lot of forceful prying to unlock and open outward. I don't know if they're all like this or only mine. An easy solution is to sand down the locking tabs a teeny tiny bit. A smaller irk: there are two 1/8" bits. I would rather have another size added instead, like 7/16". But overall, a great basic drill bit set.

I was happy to find this clipboard in red because I could only find the clear version at Staples and Wal*Mart where I live. It's a beautiful transparent ruby red color - middle red, not a pinkish or purplish red, so it's approved for guys :). The board is made of hard plastic, and the steel spring clip opens wide and holds strongly - so it can hold a lot of paper if need be.

Note the official product pic here on amazon shows a different, smaller model. I'll be using this for measuring indoor air temperature, so I chose the total immersion version.It's a whopping 18" long and is rated 0.3º Celsius accuracy...which is plenty enough for most purposes. Though mine didn't come with any documentation. This model is red spirit liquid over a white back. It comes with a triangular purple plastic anti-roll ring at the top.The wide scale spacing makes it very easy to read, as well as to see small temperature changes. Each degree is spaced about 6mm apart, and is subdivided into tenths of a degree.It's packaged in a triangular clear plastic protective tube. My first thermometer from amazon arrived broken - even though the packing box was in perfect condition and the thermometer was wrapped in bubble wrap. Luckily the replacement arrived intact. It's an unfortunate reality that a long & thin glass rod is very fragile - but I prefer a good liquid-in-glass thermometer over any mechanical or electronic one.

Although it's not nearly as detailed as larger globes or world maps, this is a real little globe, not just a toy or paperweight. The advantage of a globe over a map is that it should present the world in a realistic and distortion-free way that no kind of 2-dimensional map projection can (every flat map projection is a compromise). Nice to have handy for keeping up with world news events and seeing how the seasons are a result of the Earth's tilt.It shows most major world cities, although a lot of smaller countries don't show even one city. I was happy to see South Sudan is there. It has the main lines of latitude and longitude, arctic and antarctic circles, and tropic of cancer and capricorn.Strangely, the lines of latitude (supposedly all 10 degrees apart) are spaced/angled more widely apart towards the poles than near the equator! This is the first globe I've ever encountered with distortion. One can only guess if this was accidental or intentional for some reason.Unlike most larger globes, this one doesn't have raised relief to show mountain ranges. It has the absolute basics - no more. I was relieved that the equator line is not as thick as it looks in the official product photo.It's made entirely of plastic, so it's waterproof. The base is a tiny bit wobbly...this will probably be the part to break if the kids are rough with it. The globe itself is strong hard plastic which is difficult to even dent.

When new, this knife is insanely sharp - treat it with caution. You'll be able to cut tomatoes in very thin slices with no pressure. But after a year of use, and treating it gingerly, mine has developed tiny nicks in the blade and is not quite so un-necessarily sharp, but still very sharp.Since the ceramic blade is brittle, you can't twist and pry with it like a steel knife. Also unlike a steel blade, it has very little flex...to me it feels too rigid and un'responsive' for lack of a better word. When using a kitchen tool as fundamental as a knife, you shouldn't fell as though you have to 'walk on eggshells' while using it. You shouldn't have to worry about damaging it when using it in the normal way you've used steel knives all your life.The knife is made in China but the blade in Japan. The handle is hard plastic. The white blade deceptively looks like plastic. The rounded end of the blade is sharpened, so you can cut even when the knife is pointing downward at a steep angle. The 4 1/4" blade is too small for cutting larger items like grapefruits and bread. But it's perfect for precision cutting smaller vegetables & fruits.edit: after over 2 years, the cutting edge of the blade has developed several larger chips. I haven't exactly 'babied' this knife, but I treat it a lot more gingerly than an equivalent steel knife. So I downgraded my rating to 3 stars. After using it over 2 years, I don't see much benefit of a ceramic blade over steel. The only real advantage is to those who don't want to re-sharpen their knives - which is not that difficult anyway.

**************************************************************************************************************************************************IMPORTANT NOTE***** This seems to be a Japanese-labeled version of the SA-46. I bought mine (with English labeling) from Toys R Us in Canada in 2010.*********************************************************************************************************************************************The SA-46 is a small, basic, 32-key keyboard. It's the little brother of the SA-76 which is larger with 12 more keys, orange bottom, but otherwise similar. It doesn't have a built-in record or sampling function. Nor does it have a keyboard split (where the left half of the keyboard can play one tone and the right half plays another). Come on Casio...many small keyboards from 30 years ago had these features. On the plus side, it has 8-note polyphony - you can play up to 8 notes simultaneously.It has 100 tones, 50 rhythms, and 10 built-in songs. You can adjust the tempo of the songs or rhythm. I often use the drum beats like a metronome while practising guitar. The big green piano/organ button quickly switches between those two tones rather than have to enter them manually. It's useful if you use those two tones a lot, otherwise it's a bit of a gimmick. It also has a very basic 5-button 'drum pad', but the buttons are stiff, which limits its usefulness. The LCD display is small and non-illuminated.The tones are listed in several categories rather than individually. It would be much nicer if each of the 100 tones were printed individually on the keyboard...even if the lettering would be small. The tones are decently natural-sounding, but aren't as good as even the cheapest full-size keyboards from Casio or Yamaha. Some tones (such as the bass instruments) are actually quite decent. The vast majority of tones are of real instruments, but there are some electronic and silly novelty sounds thrown in. If you hook it up to a good sound system, you'll find surprisingly deep bass in the bass instruments and the drum beats. YouTube has some reviews & demos of the SA-46 if you want an idea of what the tones sound like.The 32 keys are small, but not tiny. They have a springy feel which I don't like - I prefer a more natural 'thunk' feel. The bottom half has smoothly rounded edges and is bright lime green. It has a carrying 'handle' indentation which is of limited usefulness.
