My only suggestion right now is to simply take your time at creating that relationship for yourself, and believe me, when you have one of these machines on your crafting table at home, you are going to wonder how you ever got by without it!  If you are on the fence about buying it, take the plunge and just get it.  You really won't regret it.  As for the other machine from Cricut, unless they have done a LOT of improvements, it doesn't even compare.  (I really was never interested in owning one of those myself, as I regarded it as a money vampire that had too many limitations.)If you are looking for the ultimate gift for your crafting spouse (yes, you husbands out there!) this is one that will surely get you on her good side a lot further than buying her a vacuum cleaner or new steam cleaner.  It's also a lot more fun than a piece of jewelry that rarely gets worn because you rarely go anywhere dressed up or a piece of fancy lingerie that spends its time in the bottom of the dresser drawer.  You also won't get on her bad side because you bought the wrong size/color!  It would also make a fantastic family gift, making holiday, school and art projects much more impressive than mere construction paper and scissors ever will.  I know I'm going to have my adult daughter drooling over mine and asking to borrow it, forcing me to guard it jealously.If you are looking for additional items to accompany it, whether it is a planned purchase or a gift, I would suggest adding some DCWV Cardstock Stack, Match Makers Brights, 58 Sheets, 12 x 12 inches, a couple of different Pacon Foam Board, 20"X30", Assorted Colors, 10 Boards, some Crayola 0.29-Ounce Glue Sticks, 12 per Box, and you have the makings of your learning curve projects.  Additional papers to offer more flexibility or geared towards individual tastes, would also come in handy, as would card stock to create your own greeting cards.  Of course, with kids, adding an assortment of Glitter Assortment 12 - 3/4 0z. Bottles is always going to win you some "cool" points (just don't forget the traditional glue, as well as inexpensive paper plates to help confine it.)  This cutting machine, combined with some basic supplies, would go a long ways towards keeping kids entertained and occupied with holiday projects as the weather turns cold and everyone is confined indoors more.  It can also help create new family traditions, as the homemade projects become treasured heirloom decorations for your tree or cards to enthrall relatives.

This pillow case is crisp and cool, snow white, and has an end that folds over to neatly encase your pillow.  That was another feature I was unfamiliar with, as standard American linens typically just have the sack-like designed pillow cases.  I put it on my favorite feather-down king size pillow, and despite the overstuffed nature of the pillow, there is more than enough room to easily slide the case on and fold over the end to enclose it, much like an envelope would.With a 400 thread count, most cotton or cotton-poly pillow cases would feel somewhat coarse.  This is as smooth as microfiber or very high thread count linens, despite the much lower cost.  I was really impressed with that!  It just has a cool, crisp feel to it.Sleeping on it is a dream.  I hope it launders as well as it sleeps, but if it doesn't wear well, I'll update the review.I did purchase this pillowcase with a promotional discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.  All of my reviews are always my honest opinion, and this one is no different.

This is a very simple and plain magnetized bar to hold your knives.  It makes it easy to prevent accidental cuts as well as dulling of your expensive knives.  They are in plain sight for easy identification of which one you want (or which one is not where its supposed to be!)  That's the in-use parts.I wanted to switch from a knife box mounted on the wall to this type, which is typically what is used in professional kitchens.  It simply speeds up the process of getting the right knife, as well as immediately identifying which knives are present and accounted for.  I had used a knife box mounted high on the wall the entire time that I was raising my kids to keep the blades out of their reach, but larger knives always protruded out of the bottom of the box and each knife had to be identified by the handle.  This is MUCH more convenient.Now for all of those not so DIYers out there that like directions, you won't find THOSE in this package.  The most direction related material is where it's printed on the box "mounting screws included."  It comes with two rather puny screws and equally puny anchors.  If your walls are like ours, and formed from drywall, you might want to take a trip to the hardware store for something more substantial.  The last thing I wanted to have happen was for me to reach for a knife on the bar, and have the entire bar, along with ALL of the knives, come tumbling down.  For a buck or so, save yourself the nightmare and potential injury.  Make yourself a template by laying a strip or sheet of paper over the back of the bar, marking where the mounting holes are in the bar.  Use that template to put the screws in the wall, ensuring that you have the bar where you want it and straight.  I actually just taped the template on the wall to get my placement right, then tore the paper away after the screws were put into place.  Slide the bar over the screws, with the large end downward, and gravity will keep the screws in the narrow portion of the mounting holes.The bar actually has fairly good magnetic strength and seems to hold the knives securely.  Even so, I'd really suggest NOT putting it where a falling knife is going to land on someone's foot (or a short person's little head).  Even with a good grip, accidents can and do happen.  Mine is mounted on the wall above my counter, so a fall is just a foot or so to the counter.  So far, nothing looks like its going to happen anytime soon in regards to falling knives.Overall, it would be a five star item if it included decent screws/anchors and directions.  Maybe that's petty, but I really hate having to run down to that big box store for 2 screws and 2 anchors.  It's also something that even the most inept DIYer should be able to mount without help-if they had directions.  On the flipside of that direction issue, maybe its better to have no directions than to have badly auto-translated directions that make no sense and are more confusing than anything.A magnetic knife holder is one of the sleekest and nicest features for a wannabe gourmet kitchen.  It's simple design doesn't clash with anything and goes with just about any style of kitchen decor too.  My only concern is that some stainless steel isn't so stainless, and in our hot & humid South conditions, start to rust.  If that fate strikes, I'll update my review.  Outside of that, I'm expecting this to literally last a lifetime.  It certainly has enough heft that it SHOULD last that long!I did purchase this with a promotional discount in return for my honest and unbiased review.  Since all of my reviews are always my honest and unbiased opinion, this one is no different.  I really DO like this, and would have to recommend it.

I've been taking a prescription thyroid medication for about five months now.  It seems that a number of members of our family have been diagnosed with sluggish thyroids in the past few years, resulting in most of us now being medicated.  Since things like always being fatigued, dry skin/hair, etc. are not exactly thrilling symptoms to endure, I wanted to  minimize the impact that it had on my life.  It is also taking the doctor some time to get the dosage of my medication adjusted just right for optimum health.If you have ever taken the medication, you know how quickly it starts to dissolve and how foul it tastes.  At the same time, I didn't want to mess around and make things worse, so I asked my doctor about this supplement.  While he was very dubious that it would eliminate the need for medication, he also did not see it as potentially harmful in any way, and suggested the "maintenance" dosage in combination with my regular medication.  Using it in this way, he felt that it would provide me with the nutritional benefits without causing any potential problems.It's not a miracle cure, whether or not your health care professional approves of OTC supplements or not.  At the same time, my dose of medication has been steadily climbing without ever reaching the levels he wants them at, so if this helps, I'm all for it.  On the short term, which is far from clinical trial evidence, I DO feel a bit more energetic, less irritable, and my scaly skin seems to be improving.  As for hair loss, I'm still losing more hair than I would like, and that is unlikely to stop until the doses of my medication are optimized.  Nutritionally, that takes some time as well.  Obviously, this could also be a result of the increased dose of medication and we have no way of really knowing.  All I can say is that if it helps a little bit, it's worthwhile in my book.  Just don't toss out your medication if you are being medicated for hypothyroidism, and do check with your doctor--this is not going to be a cure by any means.  It does provide the necessary nutrition to allow your thyroid to function properly though, along with a common sense diet.I did purchase this supplement with a promotional discount in return for my honest and unbiased review.  All of my reviews are always my honest and unbiased opinion, and this is no different.

This watch is drop dead gorgeous, in a manly way, of course.  It's got some serious heft to it--no lightweight, the heft alone just makes you think "quality" when you pick up the watch.It made my day, in a cheeky sort of way, to present this to my husband and watch his reaction.  He loves watches, and I had given him a sturdy wear-around-the-house watch for his birthday in fluorescent yellow.  While he likes the everyday watch, it's definitely not something to wear in dressier situations though.This one is.  It's functional, beautiful, very gift-worthy, and not overly glitzy either.  If you are looking for a watch that will fit a large (maybe even massive) wrist without looking foolish or having to replace the band, this watch is also your friend.  On my husband's wrist, which I would consider in the "average" range (he's average build, just over 6' tall) the watch face itself is very substantial.  That translates to nearly as wide as the top of his wrist.  The band itself will have to be adjusted down to fit him, it's honestly that large.  For guys with beefier arms, this would be a huge plus.  However, if you are the smaller framed or "geekier" build, this watch might simply be too large and have far too much heft to suit you.  It definitely is too much watch for a teen's wrist.We'd never bought an Invicta watch before.  It comes in a very nice gift worthy box, with a thick owner's manual, as well as an invitation to buy an expanded warranty for the watch.  There was even some sort of a membership card with space to write in the date of purchase.  Invicta is proud of the watch they produce, and hopefully that also equates to superior workmanship and customer service.As for price, these aren't cheap watches, and they certainly don't look cheap either. Amazon's price (currently under $100) is an attractive price for a "nice" watch without breaking the bank.  Most men would be very happy with this, whether they purchase it for themselves or receive it as a gift from their parents, spouse, or even kids.  Speaking as the wife/mother/grandmother/aunt of potential recipients, this is a watch that I would be very pleased to gift to someone.  (In its box, it would even be fairly simple to wrap, even if you are as paper-and-tape challenged as I am.)  For the high rollers who have $1K watches for dress, this would be one that was very suitable for wearing to the office too.  It won't clash with your suit, whether it is a rented tux, department store special, or a semi-custom tailored one.  It will go just as well with your golf shoes, polo shirt, & trousers for a round of golf with your dad or brother in law.  While I cannot imagine my husband wearing it while snorkeling or water skiing, it is water resistant to 330 feet, far deeper than I would personally plan on diving anyhow!The only reason I can potentially see anyone NOT liking this watch would be those with small wrists or those who cringe at the price.  For the price-cringers, consider that we bought about six watches at $10-30 each over a period of about a year.  Each had to be replaced when they failed, for one reason or another.  That easily adds up, and we spent from $60-180 over the past year for garbage watches.  That makes the price on this watch a whole lot more attractive and budget wise.

I am a huge fan of Aeropress Aerobie AeroPress Coffee Maker with Tote Bag coffee, and with recent kitchen renovations, our coffee pots have been packed up for the time being.  My husband thinks the Aeropress is "too complicated" to use, requiring wifely assistance for each cup of coffee.  In the name of restoring domestic bliss, enter the Joyful Java Collapsible Silicone Pour Over Coffee Maker.We have had pour over coffee makers before, and used them both at home and while camping.  This works on the same principle, but unlike previous models we have owned (like Melitta Melitta Ready Set Joe Single Cup Coffee Brewer black this one is collapsible, which translates to takes up a whole lot less space, whether we are talking about a cupboard or a backpack.  Combined with our cordless electric kettle, we now have a coffeemaker that my husband feels comfortable using.  You simply put the filter in, add your ground coffee, and pour the hot water in.  With our over-sized mugs, it does require multiple additions of hot water to achieve a full mug, but that's still relatively low-tech.  Presto, we have a hubby who can make his own cup of coffee!  (I tease him with the ditty "I'm-A-Big-Kid-Now" from Pull Ups.  Dirty trick, but funny!)Super simple, compact for storing or traveling with, the only "negative" is that single serve coffee makers typically use more ground coffee per cup than making a full carafe.  The plus is that nobody ever has to drink that last cup of burnt tasting sludge to empty a pot.  (Don't you HATE that?)This little cutie is really convenient, even coming with its own little carabiner to make it easy to find in a backpack (or to hang it from a thermal mug).  For a great gift for a traveling coffee drinker, pair this with a hand operated little coffee mill, a mug, and a portable kettle, add a bag of some gourmet beans and you will have the PERFECT gift for your coffee drinking buddy.For the ones out there that are as frugal as I am, the smaller cone filters that fit this coffee maker are more expensive, as well as harder to find.  You can buy the larger size more easily, and they typically cost a lot less per filter than the small ones, but the large works just as well.  If you need the neater look, they can be trimmed to fit, but I never bother.  The extra just makes it easier to toss the whole thing into the compost!  I have also been known to use a regular round filter and just fold it to fit, add my coffee, and brew away (see the photo--it does work just fine.)This is fantastic for those occasions when you have a power outage, go camping, decide to live off grid, or just want one cup of coffee without spending a fortune.  I've owned just about every model of single serve coffee maker out there (Including Keurig and Tassimo) and this does just as good while costing a mere fraction per cup compared to those fancy coffee makers.  Without parts to break, it will also outlast all of those expensive machines too.  It also stores compactly when not in use, whether it's hanging on a peg, in a drawer, in the cupboard, or hanging out with your mess kit in your camping gear.I did purchase this with a promotional discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.  All of my reviews are always honest and unbiased, and this one is no different.  This really IS a great little coffee maker.

I really LIKE tenderized meat for making a number of dishes.  However, I don't like having it processed elsewhere--the more meat is handled, the more points there are for contamination.  Granted, I could do like my mother did, and beat it myself, but maybe I'm just lazy.  I hated the mess, noise, and time it consumed.This is three rows of angular blades, not the round pin style, and they are pushed through the meat cutlet by pressing down on the top bar, which slides the blades through the perforated base and into your meat.  They are razor sharp, and if you use a wood cutting board with your raw meats, it will seriously mark them up.  I use the more easily sterilized white poly cutting boards with raw meats, and when they become too seriously rough from knives, etc., they are replaced.  (Save your wood ones for safer bread & veggie cutting!)  This tenderizer is substantial enough in size to quickly work through enough meat for a recipe/meal.  The blades are substantial enough in size that they work great at pushing a dry rub, minced garlic, etc. right into the meat.  I've tried it on cuts as thick as 1", and it works efficiently with the thicker cuts as well.  I really LOVE the lack of spatter mess compared to pounding meat.This is a great answer to  making a hated task easier as well as promoting some additional recipe tweaks.  Unlike pounding meat (no beating of meat jokes please!) this isn't going to make your cutlets thinner, but it is going to tenderize them.  This tenderizer also does not have the spattering effect of pounding meat with the hammer style tenderizers. Another feature I really like is that  I can smear the meat's surface with seasonings of choice (try coating your beef cutlets with minced fresh garlic and black pepper) and these gazillion blades will literally stab it through the entire cutlet.  Talk about perfecting a true chicken fried steak!  Everything comes out fork tender, whether it is beef, chicken, pork, or turkey.The tenderizer cleans up reasonably easy, just don't let anyone interrupt you long enough for meat residue to start to dry and cling to the blades or it can get tougher.  I immediately clean the blades by disassembling it and washing with hot soapy water, let them air dry thoroughly, and then it stores neatly in its guard.  It's safe to store in a drawer too, as the case protects my fingers from being cut when fumbling around for whichever gadget I'm searching for.  I'm not sure it is dishwasher safe--our kitchen is being renovated and we're doing dishes the old fashioned way until its completed.Overall, I couldn't be happier.  This inexpensive gadget saves a lot of money over buying substandard cuts of meat that have been pre-tenderized at the store, as well as giving me more flexibility about what kind of meat I use.  (Nobody sells tenderized turkey breast or chicken thigh cutlets!)  I did purchase this tenderizer with a promotional discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.  All of my reviews are always my honest and unbiased review, and I really DO love this gadget.  It would have been a five star gadget but the included guard arrived with hairline cracks in it, despite the box being undamaged.  Over time, I suspect that it will break long before the blades themselves wear out.

Eukanuba dog foods are one of my "trusted" brands.  They consistently have high quality foods.  However, on my fixed income, it usually doesn't run to this particular food.  However, I do have a beloved and very senior dog who has been failing fast over the past year.  Sometimes, she isn't as interested in eating as she used to be (she was always a chow hound in her youth).She still has a great coat, despite her age, and this time of year is an important one for her, as she is growing in her normally very plush winter coat.  We haven't been using this food long enough for its effects to show yet (it takes a while to affect the coat) but she seems to like this food better than the various offerings I'd tried with her lately.  It also doesn't seem to be difficult for her to chew, as many older dogs have dental issues, and she is no different.No diarrhea, constipation, vomiting, etc. occurred as we introduced her to this food either.  (She normally has a cast iron stomach, but some things have not agreed with her the past year or so.)  My past experiences with Eukanuba foods have never shown their foods to be inclined to cause stomach upsets anyhow.I'm pleased with the food, even though I know that it doesn't include any water from the Fountain of Youth.  (Heck if it did, people would be chowing down on the stuff.)  I feel better about her eating this food though, as we have a long history together (she's a big girl and about to turn 14).  Nutritionally, providing her body with a great foundation is about the best care that anyone can give an aged dog.

My husband has giant feet, size 14 shoes.  He also has one foot that is somewhat atrophied, and he limps.  That means his shoes take a beating, cost a fortune, and he frequently complains about foot discomfort, as well as having trouble with stumbling.  Insoles, one would think, would be the last of his worries, or potential solutions.That was totally wrong.He is in love with these insoles.  He tried them out in a cheap pair of athletic shoes, the one thing that never works that well for him.  It was an immediate and instant improvement in the shoes' fit and comfort, on both the good and bad feet.  He really likes these insoles, and for the price, even if they have to be replaced every 3-6 months, it may extend the life of his shoes/boots by as much as 12 months while remaining comfortable.  Considering that a "cheap" pair of shoes is going to be at least $50 for him, and decent ones are as much as $200, that is saving a lot of money.We haven't had these insoles long enough to know how well they are going to last yet, but typically other brands have lasted the 90-180 days, depending on the brand and how much he wore the shoes they were in.  These insoles also fit his shoes perfectly (one time that having a size 14 shoe was an advantage?) with no gaps or trimming.  I'm ecstatic, he's happy.

This is a VERY sturdy crate for its size, yet remaining an easy-to-fold design.  Despite the description indicating it is a single door model, the one I received has two doors, giving you the option of using either the end or side as your favored door.  With the size and dimensions of this crate, it is taller than I had anticipated, and while that isn't necessary for the chihuahua this crate is intended for, it might be very advantageous if it is intended for something other than a canine inside.  (Such as large birds, etc., although the plastic crate won't work with parrots or macaws for long.)I was really impressed with how sturdy the crate was.  They would also stack well, and are strong enough to be stacked several high even with occupants inside.  Overall, they are a very versatile crate, capable of far more difficult applications than housing a small dog for road trips.  It's great for that, however, and folds for easy storage when not in use.  Our chihuahua is a rescue dog, and doesn't particularly enjoy road trips unless he is in a nice, safe, crate.  Since he loves the destination part of a road trip, such as the campground, a sturdy crate keeps him safe on the road, as well as when we're not directly supervising him in a campground.  This crate offers much better views and ventilation than an airline crate, and stores much more compactly when not in use.  It's also a LOT easier to securely attach a "Lix-it" bottle to (our dogs' preferred crate drink method) compared to a small airline style crate.While I did purchase this crate with a promotional discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review, this is a good value even at full price.  I fully expect the crate to outlive our far from young chihuahua and undoubtedly host another rescue small dog in the future.  I am impressed with this crate enough that I may consider replacing some of our other crates with this brand in the future, which is saying a lot.  (We have multiple rescue dogs in our household, and crates maintain peace, as well as promote housebreaking ASAP.)  All of my reviews are always my honest and unbiased opinion, and its rare for anything to be as impressive as this crate is.

I'm not sure exactly what I was expecting, but this just seemed a lot different than the usual undergarment for smoothing under your clothing.  The edges of the shoulders are as though they were woven that way rather than finished with a seam.  My first reaction was that it seemed cheap and unfinished, but it has changed.It really is a sleek "smoother" for an undergarment, nearly vanishing under your clothing for a much smoother appearance even under the finest fabrics.  However, as with any shapewear, it does flatten the breasts, which is going to upset most women, while those who are well endowed may find that a plus, allowing for a smoother fit of garments through the bust than they would normally have.  Personally, I prefer to not have buttons straining through the bust.This isn't a miracle garment, and it's not one of those things that all women will love.  However, it does have its place in many women's wardrobes.

Our cats are picky.  Expensive also does not translate to they will like it.  Real meat doesn't even mean they will like it.  Their idea of good stuff is usually Meow Mix dry.All of that flew out the window when this food was offered.  It was manna from heaven to them.  Maybe it's Kitty Krack?As glad as they are to have it, I have to admit that our fixed income does not go far enough to buy this food regularly for them, so it's going to remain a rare treat.  They really DO love it, and if I had unlimited income, I would buy this food for them because of how much they do like it.  However, my husband also loves cheese burgers.  He does not get those too often either, although there are health reasons as much as budget ones for his limits on the cheese burgers.If your budget can handle this food, they really DO love it.

This arrives and looks exactly like the photo.  As for why it is labeled for nursing, I have NO idea.  This top is really only suited for small busted women, and comes with thick pads.  Support is minimal while wearing this too, so don't plan on doing anything where you want more support than you would need for lounging around the house.It's cute, but it's really not that wonderful as a bra.I did purchase this with a promotional discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.  All of my reviews are always my honest and unbiased opinion.

Snoring is a family trait in our family, and while it doesn't bother those of us that do it, it does bother our partners.  I thought I would try this solution.It was a dismal failure for me.  I tried it on, and it barely fit my head.  I don't have an unusually large head, and don't even wear a particularly large hat size, so I was surprised to have this barely velcro together enough to stay put, but only when uncomfortably tight.  It's so tight that there is no room for my ears to protrude through the side slits, as they are pulled very narrow.  I am certain that it will not fit my husband's head either, as his head is larger than mine.  (So are his ears, come to think of it.)I'm not sure who modeled the head this is shown on, but the head must be small.  As it is, it's so tight that it would be impossible to fall asleep with it on.  I have no idea if I would snore with it on, but suspect that no one could snore with it on, largely because the discomfort would ensure they did not sleep.I did purchase this with a promotional discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.UPDATE: I gave the chin strap to my adult daughter, who is much more petite.  On her smaller head, it did fit properly, and it also helped reduce her snoring, and as a side effect, it also reduced the drying of her mouth and lips from sleeping with her mouth open.  I changed the review to a four star review as a result instead of a one star, because it should be sized to fit a wider range of heads.  So if it fits, it does really help.

The money belt itself is a multiple compartment belt, very soft and lightweight, and fits easily against your skin to avoid attracting attention as you carry your important items along with you.  It's well made, the zippers and belt clip operate very easily.  It's everything that it should be.The metal wallet for cards, however, is another story.  It arrived non-functional as it refuses to open.  While my husband may be thrilled with one that did just that once the cards were inserted, in this case, it remains empty.  It's useless.  If you are purchasing this set because it also includes the card wallet, you are apt to be sorely disappointed.  I'd also question whether or not to use it, since there is no obvious damage to the wallet and the reason for its refusal to open has remained a mystery.I did purchase this with a promotional discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.  All of my reviews are always my honest opinion, and this one is no different.

This beard butter is like a heavy duty beard hair treatment.  I'd gotten my husband some beard oil, and while it did sooth his skin under the beard, it didn't make a huge amount of difference.  This stuff is tougher stuff, apparently.  It's harder to work into his beard and down to the skin, but it also is easier to avoid using too much, as I did not like the smell of the beard oil he was using at all.My husband has eczema on his face and scalp, and it's part of the reason that he has a beard, as daily shaving really irritates his skin and increases the severity of the break outs.  At the same time, periodically, he has to shave off his beard to really deal with the break outs.  Nobody likes having giant chunks of dried skin in their beard, especially wives of the ones with the beards.  (Can we say yuck?)  This isn't a miracle cure, but we didn't expect one (all the doctors over the years haven't done anything for it any better)  but it does help sooth and minimize the issues.  It also does leave his beard a bit softer and just as shiny as usual (he has very shiny hair and beard naturally).  This is better than the oil because of its firmer texture and ease of use.I did buy this beard butter with a promotional discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.  All of my reviews are always my honest opinion, and in this case, it's as the wife of the actual user, since I'm not trying out for a role as a bearded lady.

Make absolutely sure your TV is compatible before you buy this.  It comes with no cables other than a power cable, so you have to buy an HMDI cable at the very least. You may also have to buy an digital audio cable. Since my TV had the HMDI ports, I assumed it would be compatible, but I was wrong.  So far it has been an exercise in frustration trying to hook it up. I wish I could say it sounds terrific, but I can't because I can't get it connected.

I love this stuff. It's wonderful for baking cookies, tarts, anything. Foods don't stick to this paper. They just don't. Also great for freezing individual items before storing them. I use it for almost everything - It has practically taken the place of tin foil for any oven or freezer use (not good for storage, though). I wouldn't bake without it anymore. There is virtually no clean up. Just pull the paper off the baking sheet and throw it away. It's great!

Wouldn't start my 2000 Ford Crown Victoria.  I followed the directions (very poorly written).  I put the clamps on the battery (red-red, black-black).  I pushed the orange button to turn it on.  I got in the car and tried about 6 times to get it to start.  The engine was turning over.  There was no grinding or clicking.  It just didn't have enough oomph to start.  A tow driver was able to jump start my car with his much bigger and more powerful magic box.  I'm going to get one of those.
Very pretty.  Especially suitable for any winter festivals you celebrate.  It is made of metal.  It would make an excellent hostess gift, or gift for an office party.

Tart and sweet.  I love freeze dried fruit.  One serving is 1/2 cup and then are three servings per 1.25 oz bag (about the size of a small bag of chips).  One 1/2 cup serving is only 40 calories.  They are not particularly attractive, like say a cherry lollipop, but they do taste good.  Ingredients list:  Fuji apples, Raspberries, Fruit pectin, Apple juice concentrate.  That's it.  No unpronounceable ingredients.

The Millennium dish towels are thinner than I expected and thus don't hold as much water. It gets wet just drying your hands. It is good at drying dishes and stuff, it just gets wet pretty fast. I think it's because it's a thin -ish fabric. They are a nice size. I can't think of anything else to say about them. They are a dish towel - not as nice as some, not as cheap as others.

The shelf liner is really cool. It's like a cross between fabric and paper. It is indeed washable - just lay flat to dry. It is NOT stainproof. I tested it w some red Koolaid and the Koolaid does not come all the way out. It left a pink shadow. (After a good soaking the Koolaid did come out. I'm surprised.)  Since it's made of a fabric-y paper, it does make a nice liner for glass shelves. On bigger shelves, I used a little tape to hold the pieces together and that seems to be working ok. It would be nice if it came in a more neutral color - the ones I got are a bright green. It's 2 sided - one side is dots, the other side is a grid-like pattern, which is nice for cutting to fit.

The hairdryer/styler does everything it says it'll do, but it's made for straight hair or it makes your hair straight if yours isn't.  It would give gentle waves to shoulder length hair, (maybe a little shorter). It's not much good for short hair. The styler brush is paddle shaped, not round, so it's not going to give anyone curls. And the brush is large - 3 inches wide and 5 inches long. My hair is short and all it could do for me was dry my hair as I brushed it back. It does smooth as it dries. It's target audience would be women/girls w longish hair that they want to style in a smooth, straight fashion.

I've had one of these before.  After a year or so of getting clawed to death by the cats, itb will need replacement.  But the cats love it.  Especially the "high seat".  It is easy to put together and smaller ones like this don't take up too much room.  I have it placed so the cats can hang out and look out the sliding doors to the back yard.

This is the second time I have tried a gluten free flour.  For what it is I am sure it is a great product.  I guess i am just too accustomed to the way wheat flour works and tastes.  I tried a bread recipe with this and was deeply disappointed.  I have made bread before, though it is not an everyday thing in my house.  The bread from gluten free flour is just too dense to suit me.

The system really is designed for an IPhone, but does work w Google on my tablet. In order to get FULL use, you'd need Apple products designed to measure blood pressure, activity trackers and a pulse oximeter. (None of which I have).Also - the scale and tablet or phone have to be in fairly close proximity to the wireless server (modem, in my case) in order to sync. The scale will tell me my weight and body fat % in the bathroom. But the bathroom is too far away from our modem to sync. I bring the scale into the office, stand on it there, and then am able to sync it. It doesn't work to stand on it in the office and then bring it into the office and try and sync. I have to stand on it in the office. Once I sync it, it gives a list of  body fat, lean mass, body water, muscle mass, DCI(daily caloric intake nec to maintain your current weight), bone mass and VFR(?).  Then you can chg screens to see the trend for each of those measurement. Ex - even tho the scale says I've gained weight, it also shows that my body fat is trending downwards, my water % is almost a straight line and my muscle mass has a very slight tilt upwards. Very cool. My problem is that the office floor is not level, it has a slight tilt downwards (it was a garage). I suppose if you are looking at trends, not actual numbers it's ok. During set-up it was a little tricky to set up.It took 4 trys putting in the modem's password before the scale recognized it. I wanted to do a little 'Hooray' jump when i finally got. For some one like me, who is not completely 'plugged in', the set-up was a little frustrating. the directions pretty much assume you know how to do this already. The same goes for the set-up on the tablet. There are 2 iHealth apps on Google, but only the newer one works. I think for someone who has and is familiar with Apple products, it'll be no problem. But for others, there will be a couple of hoops to jump thru. I'm not sure anything will fix the issue with needing to be near the modem to work.

- I love it. It's big - 81/2 x 11, so i don't have to scrinch my entries. It lays out each month as a month so you can see the whole month, but also lays each week out as a week. So you can look at the month or week by week. And it's pretty. It's not something you'd put in your purse and carry around w you, but it's great as a desk calendar. It starts Jan 1, 2016. i'm looking forward to using it.

I set this up as a repeater for my home network, since the cable company, well whatever.  Anyways, I had to make one quick phone call, which was answered on the first ring.  The gentleman on the other end understood and solved my problem immediately.  Once you access the wizard, the rest was easy.  Very pleased with this item and would recommend to anyone, even a novice computer user.

Although it does everything it's supposed to do, it's a little hard to figure out how to make it do those things. The illustration of the watch face in the instructions does not match the the actual watch face.  The print and/or icons on the watch face are truly minuscule. So learning how to do the things you want it to do is a trial and error process. Other than the difficulty in figuring it out, it's cool. It has an alarm, an hourly chine, and 2 timers - one counts forward, other backwards. It's supposed to have a light, but I haven't found that yet.
I've never used Goody's before.  The fruit flavored powder tasted much better than I expected.  And it eliminated the mild headache I was having.  What more can you ask for?

Very nice TP.  The hardest part occurs when you get near the end of the roll.  It sort of falls into a small pile.  If you are one of those people who make sure your TP roll is put on the holder with the TP coming from one direction,mor if you fold the TP at the end to make it look nice, these will eventually annoy you.  I just keep my TP on the counter and don't worry about it.

It has that crinkle sound that some bags marketed for cats have.  It is soft and scrunchable.  I have four cats, one of whom hunts :(. Despite my wishes.  And she thinks this thing is something she needs to kill.  She pounces on it, and its crunches up which makes it crinkle, which surprises her, so she pounces again.  I love anything that keeps my four cats busy and this is looking like a real winner.  It is soft on both sides, so on a wood, tile or other hard floor it slips all over the place, which means the cat has to "chase" it around.  I will have to get more, as my little huntress does not like to share toys with her sisters.

Very nice plastic cups.  Holds a whole can of soda (or pop if you prefer) with ice.  I love the color.  Hefty always seems to do a good job with their plastic products and these cups are the standard others strive for.
Good quality Hefty garbage bags.  The Clean Apple scent was only noticeable if you held the bag to your face and sniffed.  Very faint.

Still searching for good flavor enhanced water.  This tastes primarily like club soda, with a hint of flavoring.  I'm good with the hint of flavoring, but I don't like the club soda taste.  This is a personal taste issue.  I didn't taste any fake sugars, but if they are in the bottle they might have been masked by the club soda taste.  So if you like plain club soda and think a hint of flavor is a great idea, these just might be what you are looking for.

I'm a fan of Epson WorkForce printers: I've had a few around the home, office and such in the past decade, and they tend to work fabulously, are easy to set up and use, and tend to have great improvements from one mid to higher end model to the next mid to higher end model. That's why this EcoTank wireless was a bit of a surprise: for the price, it's just ok. Here's why:The PROS: it's super easy to set up. It takes 15-30 minutes to set up and get the ink and everything all ready. That's not the shortest time ever, but with the big new cool tanks, it's not surprising that it takes a little extra time. WiFi easy to set up, printer easy to un-box, plug in, remove all tape and bits, and then move forward to getting all the ink tanks and print test pages takes the longest. I think it's pretty AWESOME that it is an all-in-one printer with up to 2 years of ink included. That's pretty awesome in my book. But will it really last that long? Only time will tell. An all-in-one, that feature I love. The decent amount of paper it holds, the capabilities overall, the 2 sided printing, all great in a smaller (mid sized) home office all in one.The CONS: no idea how the eco tank will unfold since only time will tell (not really a negative, just an uncertainty). It's entirely lacking in SD or other card readers, and it lacks a color LCD screen: not a necessity, but it sure is a nice feature to be able to print straight from camera card for a printer that is in this cost bracket. I was a little thrown by the ink level indicators: usually my printers tell my computer how much ink is left (are they always accurate, that's another story) but didn't see that on this one. The price seems a tad high for the features included/excluded.The Epson WorkForce EcoTank wireless color printer, well, overall it's a solid, nice all-in-one printer for personal use/home office.

I like the Guard Dog hybrid case for iPhone 6 - it's black (jet black trim) and is reasonably solid, with a bit of flex and a hard outer shell. It's not an otter box hard core case, but it's a solid and reasonably priced quick hybrid amor case to protect your investment: overall I like it, and it protects my Apple iPhone against scratches and dings (note, you need to get a separate protector cover for the screen of your iPhone): recommend.

This is basically a really cute play mat for little babbies! Yes, it can double as a small blankie in a pinch, but it's meant for softening flooring when you're on the go and at home, etc. It's VERY cute and it's well made, with lots of differing bits for interest and touch: very CUTE! I personally love the soft portion, it's really soft and loveable, comes nicely presented like a square blankie with a white ribbon tied around, and would make a cute baby shower gift. Slightly practical and slightly impractical, the higher-ish price point makes this more of a splurge then a necessity, but overall it's SO well made and so adorable, I would definitely recommend it!

Wow, I'm a FAN. It's quite RARE that I give a product 5 stars (my average rating is 3-4 stars), but this GelPro floor mat earns every one of those 5 stars. First, it's the softest, best feeling floor mat I've ever stood on: well worth the higher price. Second, it wipes and cleans up easily, looks fantastic on the floor, is a great big size. We put this where we cook on the stove for best support: and WOW, I have to admit this GelPro vintage leather elite floor mat feels like heaven on your bare feet/socks: would highly recommend!

This Dove conditioner for curly, course hair is ok. It comes out very thick (good) and a yellow gray brown color (um, yuck). It layers in your hair very thick and when washed out, left my hair nice and soft. My problem was the smell: it's a bit overpowering for me, it could be just that it's not my favorite scent, and others might find it great smelling, but it was a turn-off for me. So much so, that I can't see myself using this again. My hair, which is brown, long, wavy with a bit of natural loose curl, was well-conditioned by this on day one. Smooth, the scent of the conditioner was more balanced once I washed it out. But usually I only wash my hair every other day, and by day two, my hair was a little on the dry side. That's not the case with my normal Pantene conditioner. I love Dove products, especially soap and body wash, but I've never had much luck with their shampoo/conditioner lines. This is probably a great product for someone, but it's not for me.

Excellent external hard drive to add more gaming storage to your Xbox One or Xbox 360! I got this for our Xbox One, and it works fantastic: it quickly and easily plugs into the back of the game console (in the USB plugs) and does USB 3.0 or USB 2.0 (depending on your console), it takes a moment to format on your first plug in, but then it pretty much hangs in the back and while you still default save to your game console hard drive, this becomes a great external storage device for more saves or more needed storage! Best of all, no need to plug this in anywhere (so no annoying extra plug), it simply pulls its power from the Xbox game console, and you're good to go: would definitely recommend!

Wow, this necklace is quite stunning and a VALUE for the price! It's a rose gold plated sterling silver heart necklace, and came in a nice black presentation box, all pretty and delicate and lovely looking! This is not a high end piece but is a LOVELY necklace for the price, the design is quite beautiful and delicate and both romantic and artistic, and great as a gift to a woman of romantic and elegant taste! I happen to absolutely love this necklace, and while the chain and necklace are both thin and dainty, I adore wearing this, especially with the 18" shorter chain bringing this up near my neck. It's gorgeous and cute and pretty and I would definitely recommend this as an affordable gift!

I love these Hefty Drawstring trash bags! At 30 gallons, it's a great big size, with easy drawstring ties and a bit of stretch, to get all your junk in here. The Extra Strong is just tied to the marketing name of Hefty, as I could not find that the plastic was thicker or higher grade than what I generally use for outside/big trash bags like this. That said, these trash bags take abuse pretty well and stay together nicely, and tie easily for removable and keeping stuff inside. I love the large size Mega Pack because these are SO useful for moving (pillows, couch cushions, covering hanging clothes, etc.), for trash, for outside trash (weeds, trimmed branches, etc.) and for general house use, it is always a good IDEA to have a LOT of these around: would definitely recommend!

Avery makes another great product with these shipping labels! I've been using Avery labels for years, and what I like best about them is they have a customizable template or you can use their template, using your own logo or their clip art choices, and making changes as you need to along the way, all with EASE! These print nicely and being interchangeable between inkjet and laser is a very good benefit (color inkjet and black laser). The value is also there for so many labels, and you can use these for your own small business product labels like I have (recommend you protect with a finishing spray like Krylon. These are so easy to print and to use, just do a quick Google search for Avery templates (and using the four digit item code on the box) and you're set: would definitely recommend!

These Hefty trash bags hold up well to stuffing trash and things in them: they flex, they cling well to the top of the trash can, and the included ties are great for quick closure when you're ready to take the bag out and keep the trash inside. I also love the fresh clean smell, and it does a decent job of keeping smelly trash at bay (still can't get all smells like bad chicken, etc.) but the ultimate flex, FLEXES WELL, and the price for these good-sized 13 gallon trash bags from Hefty, is what I'd expect for pack this size. I would definitely recommend these trash bags!

I received the TeiKis stainless steel BBQ set and 3-in-1 grilling set from the manufacturer for review. One Word: "Value". I was a bit curious at first, what the quality of this stainless steel BBQ set would be for the price, but I was pleasantly surprised by the overall value of the bbq tools and case. First, it comes in a nice presentation carrying case, with all the tools well-strapped in place (not shifting or moving as you carry this around or in shipping): that's impressive considering everything that is included in this kit. All the BBQ utility tools are solid metal (stainless steel) and properly placed within the kit, so when you open the lid, it not only looks fantastic but it's also easy to find things when you need them. Some of the knives are held in place with velcro straps (to help reduce frustration at putting the kit back together and making sure all fits well) and to hold things where they belong. The tools work great on the BBQ grill: like any others, you'll want to clean them after, and they're gonna show a little wear & tear over time, but these are solid, well made tools for the grille. This would make an excellent gift or Father's Day gift for a man who seriously loves to barbeque: there may be some other great BBQ kits out there, but overall, I was impressed at the quality and the presentation, an exceptional BBQ set for your average Joe or Jane, most exceptional for the price: definitely recommend. And the 3-in-1 Grilling set? Well, the gloves are great, other than they could be a tiny bit longer, and the other included tools you definitely need and use: But the claws, OH the claws, the 2 BEAR CLAW MEAT HANDLERS are amazing. So great for picking up and turning big hunks of meat. Everything else in this set is practically a bonus :).

I received this neckband headset free from the manufacturer for review. These headphones have come in REALLY handy lately when doing HANDS-FREE things around the house: moving the lawn, exercising (running), cleaning the garage, etc. These have become my primary headphones for hands free use, BECAUSE they are so lightweight, and they weight distribution is balanced well: the light weight of the headphones rests on my neck/shoulders (rather than my ears), and there are no cords to get caught on the various things around while doing things like mowing the lawn, so overall these headphones are great for hands-free work. There are a few things I wish I could change, that I hope they address in further product development, which are: trying to plug the headphones into the micro-USB port is a bit difficult. I recommend the port be moved to a more accessible area, or change to a wireless charging station solution (to recharge the headphones) - this would take these from great to awesome. I also wish these came in different colors, other than black, so were a little more sporty. Overall value for the price, at about $25 sale price, I'm a huge fan. At full retail, it would be too high price for the value/quality - definitely plan to get these on sale. Overall though, these NECKBAND hands-free headphones deliver on quality sound, great weight distribution, and no cords to get in the way while you're trying to use your hands and arms. Would recommend.In Conclusion, I am happy with my purchase.

I received Mr Rugged beard oil conditioner free from the manufacturer for review. Mr Rugged beard oil I found to be a fantastic product. You know that awkward in-between phase when full beard growth is not yet there, but you're trying to get there, or there is some scruffy that you don't want to shave just yet? Well, this beard oil conditioner is FANTASTIC for that because it makes the hair soft and smooth, and seems to reduce the itching significantly. A little amount seems to go a LONG way. And it helps to have a much smoother face for the benefit of your partner, less scratchy, less 'beard' burn; the smell is really quite nice, you don't need very much of the conditioner to get the result that you want, and the value for the price is hands down GREAT value. Definitely would recommend Mr Rugger beard products after this experience. Seriously helps get through that awkward beard growth phase and to smooth and maintain a great beard once you're there. Definitely have become a fan of Mr Rugged beard products!

We got the Serta Regular 9" Stabl-Base Foundation for our QUEEN bed a few weeks ago and have been sleeping on it ever since. Our mattress is mid high-end IKEA mattress (foam and springs combo) and it's getting on to about 7 years old, and we were starting to think we might need to replace it soon (we used the high end slats from IKEA rather than a box spring before this), and we could not believe the DIFFERENCE!! We have been sleeping much better since we removed the slats and used this Serta Stabl foundation with our older IKEA Queen mattress: it's firmer, more comfortable, less lumpy, and both of us have said that we can't feel each other moving around as much as before! Add to that the quality of the wood, springs, and nice blue fabric cover, and we are sold: this Serta foundation has made a big difference in our sleep in the weeks that we have been using it so far: and an immediate difference like this, means that you can buy a good Serta Stabl Foundation and invest your money in the box spring that you can use for years and years, and then be able to use your mattress longer, makes this a great VALUE and definitely recommended item!

I received this bag free from the manufacturer for review. This is my first experience with an Avber Women's bag, and I have to admit, I'm pretty impressed. The bag came nicely protected in a large box with good packing material, and the bag itself came protected in a soft cloth case, protecting the bag from scratches, etc. - the bottom purse metal "feet" were each covered with a little piece of tape, protecting them, and the purse was filled with two pieces of packaging stuffing material, in order for the purse to keep it's shape nicely. The  synthetic leather is high quality and smooth, the bag reflects quality workmanship and attention to detail, and is design for both style and use. I LOVE the inside zipper pouches. The bag also zips along the top, and includes great long SHOULDER straps for easy carrying! It's actually a perfect style of purse for me: fashionable, quality, beautiful design, holds a lot, great shoulder straps, and the price is fantastic! I have a range of what I find affordable for everyday purses and this falls precisely within that range of affordability and great use. I am actually quite impressed by the quality of the materials and the workmanship: I feel like I'm getting a high fashion, well made designer bag at a great deal: I would HIGHLY recommend this Avber fashion tote!!

This is simply a fantastic vacuum - I want to give it 5 stars, but it needs a bit more tweaks in development before it's worthy of a 5 star rating. Read on to learn why this is a 4 star vacuum in my opinion. PROS: it works AMAZING. It has STRONG suction, pulling up a ridiculous amount of dirt, debris, fine pet dander, hair, etc. I am frankly quite impressed by how this vacuum does with suction and more importantly, maintaining suction over time. A HUGE fan of this vacuum for that reason. Another pro: the canister is easy to remove and empty, the filter is easy to replace and clean, the number of included attachments is GREAT, there are a few choices, they come on a nice stand/canister. It is SUPER easy to use, goes easily around and under almost any surface, works fantastic on WOOD floors and carpet and tile and vinyl, and I used this as a sort of wet dry vac for deep cleaning hardwood floors with the included Floor GENIE attachment, and it worked SO WELL! I LOVE this vacuum.The CONS (why I can't give it 5 stars) - it turns TOO easily. Basically this is because the vacuum is top heavy so the weight swivels quickly and easily from left to right, and seems to favor swiveling left - this is great but also annoying because it causes you to turn when you want to go straight. That just means it takes a bit of extra hand/arm coordination to move it around, although it self propels so NICELY that it almost cancels this out. But it IS a bit too top heavy, so it loses a star there. Also figuring out how to remove the vacuum from the included canister stand wasn't intuitive: even with a release bar and a button on the vacuum that says 'Lift Away' was still, honestly, a bit difficult to figure out that you needed to do BOTH things at once to remove the vacuum. But once you figure it out, no big deal.Seriously, this vacuum has AMAZING suction, and the 'True Pet' version comes with additional attachments and better filters than the regular Rotator Lift Away version, I would recommend the 'True Pet' version, and I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this Shark vacuum. It's not perfect, but it's pretty darn close!

3M Ultra Clear Energy Saving Window film does its job WELL. We used it on a window in our office getting full sun for a good bit of the day, and can definitely tell in the results: it's cooler, seems definitely more energy efficient (current A/C works better), and still lets good sunlight in, THROUGH the tinting. It's quite time consuming to apply, and you need to follow the instructions to fully clean your window AND take your time and use the included tools in application. I recommend you take the time to really, really get all dust, dirt, hair, paint flecks, etc before trying to begin, and even save the application for a day when static is less likely (a bit of moisture in the air can be your friend when you apply this). It looks a bit dark until applied, but this stuff is great because it does what it says and gives you what you want; no, it's not going to magically make your window better (i.e. it won't make your window an energy efficient window), but it will IMPROVE the energy efficiency in a room where the sun heats up the room and you use a lot of energy for cooling. I would definitely recommend this!

The Kelty Tuck 22° sleeping bag, is awesome. Basically it's down to 22° weather, don't forget to use with the ground pad in order to keep your sleeping bag dry and working to it's optimal heat efficiency. This kept me plenty warm, and the ability to stick your feet out on warm nights? well that is awesome. Compresses well, reasonably lightweight. What I love about this sleeping bag, is the value for the price; this is a great sleeping bag for basic mountain back packing trips, scouting trips, hiking trips. It's probably a tiny too heavy and a little to non-compressible for extreme sporting. Otherwise the sleeping bag is fantastic and I would definitely recommend it!

The Lifeproof Nuud case for iPad Air 2, is light weight, about half the weight of an OtterBox defender, covers your entire iPad other than screen, but is still very light weight in comparison to OtterBox. It provides good grip excellent, superior protection for your iPad, it is even waterproof up to 6+ feet. Not saying you should take this in the ocean, but if you have it around the pool side or you accidentally drop it in the tub, you might just have protected your very expensive Apple device. This even includes a faux iPad sized piece, that you can use to test the water proofness of the case before putting your actual iPad in it. Beware that once you put your iPad and it will be difficult to get out again in fact the company includes a tool to assist in this way. You will have to put together the case it comes in two pieces. For the reason alone of paying a reasonable price for a fantastic case, for protecting your very expensive Apple device, I would highly recommend this case. Button access is good but not perfect, as they could make some improvements on the fingerprint reader access, but this case is SO well done and provides superior protection without adding a lot of weight to your device, that I absolutely love it! This is seriously great and lightweight protection for your iPad, I would definitely recommend!

These DII Elegant Lace curtains are nice - they are long, a pretty lace design, AND 100% polyester (hardly a surprise with the price, that this curtain set is poly). They are pretty, decently look and affordable for the price - they are NOT luxurious looking but they are not bad. The Pros: pretty curtains, nice and long, good set, really like these, not too heavy, not too light, have a decent stiffness and 'weight' to them. The Cons: the edges could be a bit more finished along the top and bottom, they are 100% polyester (most curtains are these days) which is better for NON ironing when you wash these, so overall I like these elegant lace curtains ok for the price.

High quality shower rings,good weight, nice finish, come in a plastic bag: I like these shower curtain ring set, perfect for my bathroom! I love that they are 'made in the USA', so there are no surprise contents in the metal: they meet standards, they're well made, I really like them: I would definitely recommend!!

I love Downy Unstoppables, a great fresh clean scent, add a small capful to a load, and BLAM: clean, fresh smelling towels! I was so hoping and frankly expecting something similar here, with Downy Fresh Protect, but it just didn't quite deliver as expected. No great clean smell...did it DO anything? Not sure, it didn't seem to, but maybe it helped somehow I'm not aware of? Perhaps this product needs better instructions or a formula tweak, but just "ok" from my perspective.

Seriously, awesome. What a great Captain America figure!! Great size, HE speaks!! Comes in a nice box: Quality piece, well made, good price, seriously, was very excited upon receiving the box: I would highly recommend this figure from the new Age of Ultron movie!!! Another great product from Marvel Comics!

Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed is great so far - the grass seems to be coming up well for us, although we'll see if it lasts (could be dependent also on heat/weather/sun/watering). Basically we needed this to fill in some patches of dead grass/no grass/light grass, so spread this seed out there. A couple weeks in, it seems to be coming up and I'll update this if anything changes, but I like it thus far! I used the Pacific Northwest mix for the Middle Atlantic/East Coast, because the mix of grass seed ingredient list was ALMOST identical, and this was the one I could get. It still worked fine, would recommend!

This BLUE Studio G phone is only $100, a great price for an UNLOCKED phone that you can use with any standard SIM card from any of the GSM providers (AT&T, T-Mobile, etc.). Reminiscent of a Samsung Galaxy phone (but it's NOT one), this is a great value phone for the price: it comes unlocked, so you can purchase any SIM card and get it working, which is awesome! I charged it right up (battery came needing a charge: big surprise, most phones do these days), and the speakers, headphone jack, on/off, touch screen, all seems to work great, I really like this so far!

Delicious. We tried the Original Recipe Beef and the Honey Barbeque Chicken first, and the flavors were GREAT. The jerky was moist, flavorful and quite delicious. I especially was impressed with the Chicken Jerky: it was unique and very good! The jerky was a bit sweeter than I personally would have preferred, but not too much so. We really, really enjoyed the flavors. This is definitely a small quantity of jerky for the price, but we enjoyed it. Would we purchase again? Maybe...it's a bit on the expensive side, but the flavors were fantastic and the meat cuts were good; it's a smaller quantity of jerky for the price, but the unique chicken jerky we really liked. I highly recommend!

30 gallon drawstring trash bags in BLACK from Hefty - these are good, standard 30 gallon size trash bags, extra strong, for heavy duty use. They stood up against a lot of yard leaves and foliage, and while some of the thicker branches poked through, the bag held together really well, including the drawstring. For lots of uses, when you need a good strong 30 gallon black trash bag, these HEFTY ones work great: would definitely recommend!

Like the sauce, it's a good base to make your own good Italian meals: add some herbs, add some great cheese, add some freshly cut up vegetables and herbs (dice up some red pepper, or add some cooked ground beef), and you have a delicious meal ready quickly! These two sauces have great flavor, quite delicious, although I agree with other reviewers that the sugar content is higher than I would normally want: for that reason alone, I would tend to buy other, more healthy, more organically minded sauces as my base starter for a delicious dinner. If I went just on flavor, I really like these sauces and enjoyed the meals made with them, and maybe because I add so many other ingredients to this as a base, I can't taste the sweetness, it's just good Italian sauce. Would recommend!

In this case, you are definitely getting what you pay for! This is an inexpensive, inclusive set that includes a plastic shower curtain, plastic shower curtain hanging shower hooks, a plastic soap dish, plastic soap dispense and plastic cup. It's a pretty basic mosaic design, and is great as a starter set for kids going to college, a little boys bathroom, or a bathroom starter set on a budget. You can't buy all these items separately for less than $30-$40 bucks generally, and this starter set is $18.99. For the price, you are purchasing a budget version starter set, until you can afford to replace with something better: the shower curtain is 'wash by hand' only, so something to keep in mind, but in an empty bathroom that just needs something until I can find something nicer, or for a kids bathroom to get a design going? Sure! Would recommend.

Affordable Pack-It cube travel bag: perfect for 'dirty' shoes or smelly gym clothes, to separate from the clean stuff. This reasonably priced and well made travel bag, with a mesh separation area, is perfect for shoes or gym clothes. It does tend to be a bit small for really large sized shoes, so better for medium to small size shoes. Great little bag for gym clothes: keep in mind, it's not a huge bag, but it works great for a pair of shorts, shirt and undergarments. I love having these around the house, I use them all the time to transport things in the car, to work, to the gym, to travel, to separate out dirty clothes or shoes in a travel suitcase, etc. Well constructed, good price and lots of uses: would highly recommend!

The perfect fitness IQ band is quite neat! It measures my steps, calories, distance, and connects easily via Bluetooth to an app on your iPhone, iPad, Android device, etc. It tracks my fitness goals, daily and weekly status, progress, and more: it fits easily on your wrist and the rubber wristband is comfortable and easily adjustable to many sizes. I like this. It's an affordable alternative to the Fitbit or future iWatch - best of all, I find it very comfortable to wear...would recommend!

While I'm not in love with this particular set of curlers, I like the base idea of this product, it just needs a lot of improvements:The Pros: I like the unique design, the way it stands up on end, it turns for easy access to the curlers, and no clips or pins are involved...I really love that the plastic rollers hardly touch the heat, so they don't really burn your hands much like other curlers: the soft rubbery material used underneath that does get hot, is reasonably easy not to touch too much while you are rolling: would love to see more of this material used in curler sets! The silicone (soft rubbery material) protects hair from heat, so is great, except in this case, there are just NOT enough curlers, period.The Cons: the 'I'm ready' light is pretty much non-existent...it supposed comes on red when you plug it in and goes off when ready...yeah, I never saw any sort of light, and had to keep guessing if it was hot enough or not. it's also a bit weird to get used to where/how the curlers are located so you can turn and use them...and you have no idea which are the large and which are the medium: that should be labeled. But for me, the worst two cons are, I have thick, long hair, and there is no way that there are enough curlers in here to cover all my hair: I tried and failed. and if I put more hair into each curler, then basically the curlers won't 'snap' shut and they just start falling down. Which brings me to my other con: it's neat, but even using a small piece of hair, my hair fell down way too easily, which means that the hot curlers are down on my forehead and hot, which I really didn't like. Overall, a neat product idea that could use further development, but I wouldn't recommend it...even those who had thinner hair said that it doesn't work well for them either. Sorry Conair, I like your products, but it's back to product development on this one.

Great top, smooth and natural feeling fiber, definitely stretches; it comes looking very small and then stretches to fit! It's also smooth natural cotton and other natural fibers: it feels great against the skin! It does tend to fit tight, so you probably want to order a size up! I was impressed with these crop pants: the fabric and make is high quality, making them worth the price: would definitely recommend!

The business romantic is a fun idea and a neat premise, but something just came up a little short for me: 3 and a half stars if I could...maybe it's the fact that the author focuses too much a time on selling in such a way that you're basically lying to sell...maybe it's the fact that business is not quite romance, but rather it's passion and drive and energy and purpose...maybe it's the fact that this book is a little too much intellectual and a little less of real-life application...overall I like the premise and the idea that the author is going after about bringing back "the romance" to business...that is a great idea! But some of the methods and carrying it out in the actual application just fall intellectually flat for me. Where three if you want to dig in a little bit more into this intellectual side but you may be like me and disagree with the methods that the author proposes at times, based on your own ethics and integrity. Interesting read and I did get some things from it but just not quite for me.

This apron is adorable, but the "100% cotton" is majorly treated and therefore, suspect...PROS: design is cute, colors are great, ties at neck and waist are a good length, it includes a nice sized pocket, and for a one size fits all, really a decent shape, overall a very cute novelty apron. CONS: it runs a tad small (I am tall and would like a bit more length), the "100% cotton" fabric comes feeling VERY stiff and fake: it's definitely got sizing or some form of chemical treatment all over, it's also very fake feeling on the blue band in the lower waist (backed with something to stiffen it), the overall size for a woman could run a bit larger/longer, and the price is a bit high for what I would consider a novelty apron versus everyday use...the bottom line: I expect a bit more in an apron for the price.

Dove Deep Moisture delivers: it provides a healthy, clean shower feel, and slightly moisturizes at the end: I love and use both gentle soap like Dove U scented and body wash, but usually switch to a moisturizing body wash in the winter, as my skin gets extra dry during the cold months. Dove delivers on the extra moisture promise, as I've found, using this body wash regularly the last few winters, and this bottle is surprisingly big, dispenses easily through the pump, and it's great design makes it fit well on the tub edge: well done!

Comfortable mat, at a good price: great for the kitchen, the home or the office! It's nice and good sized foam, well made and clearly a good mat for the price, not low end but not high end either; I find this perfect for the kitchen, comfortable to stand on, and easy to wipe clean. Would definitely recommend!

D-Link wireless gigabit router: this was really easy to set up, and nice and easy to use, plus I've found the signal strength is great: works great in our entire place (albeit, we don't have that big of a space)! This router connects easily to multiple devices, linking them all together well, and it was a solid connection, with little disruptions so far. No big cons so far found: I would definitely recommend this D-Link Wireless gigabit router!

3 and a half stars: it's more about the value than anything else here...Pros: the pillow contour is good, it's ventilated (which is a plus), it's a good standard pillow size and it's a good VALUE: at this low price, this is a pretty good memory foam pillow. Cons: it's a bit too hard, and if you spend more money, you can get a good increase in quality of memory foam, and a pillow that will last longer and make you happier. So it's all up to you: as a value brand, this is really pretty good, but  if you want a really great memory foam pillow, this is not necessarily it. For the price though, it's a good value, and I'd recommend.

Excellent wireless headphones from Jabra: these headphones go on SO easily, fit really well, are comfortable on my ears and head, provide excellent quality sound: easy to set up, easy to use, I have no complaints about these headphones other than wondering when I'll need to replace the batteries: so far they've provided hours of use with easy switching between devices, but with no way to know when the battery is depleting, at some point I'll be surprised by that :)...overall though, I love, love these wireless, bluetooth headphones: they work fantastic, they sound great, and I would definitely recommend them!

This set comes with a sleep mask containing 12 "bio-magnets" and a set of earplugs. The mask is stitched securely but did need a few threads trimmed away to have a clean finished look. The elastic is stretchy but does cause a bit tighter of a fit than I'd prefer. It does feel like that will loosen up with some wear. The strap is not adjustable in size but can be worn above the ears or split in half to go around the ears. The inner lining has a zipper that really isn't explained in the instructions why it exists. I am really not all that sure, I knocked a star off because my eye mask doesn't match the picture. The inner lining is the silky pink as pictured but the outer part of the eye mask is black. It looks like perhaps this is meant to be the inner foam and some how it got shipped with out the outer pink finishing material sewn on to it. It did not affect the performance of the eye mask (only the appearance) so I kept it at a deduction of one star. The eye mask does block out light and is stated to help with "stimulating the melatonin hormone, treats puffy eyes, migraines, headaches, sleeping disorders, and sinusitis." The ear plugs are pliable and easy to use and come in a nice reusable plastic case. The case can be tossed in an over night bag or purse so that you can use when you're away. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

I've owned several foot massaging devices and have never found anything that couldn't be bested by a good foot rub. I've had severe foot pain for many years now and I still search for products that can provide some relief. This massager consists of a smooth wooden ball (aprox. the size of a baseball, perhaps slightly smaller) that is attached to 2 cords that have wooden handles. It is of sturdy construction, good quality materials, and well made. It is attractively packaged with a nice foot massaging chart and very basic instructions that this can be used standing, sitting, or laying down. The cord is just the right length for me to use in any of these positions with ease.This device is simple but I am so pleased with the results. It leaves my feet feeling relaxed, stretched, and much more comfortable than many of the other foot massagers I have used in the past. I will continue to use this frequently as it does provide relief to my foot pain. This is nicely portable, doesn't take up much room and would make a great gift for any of your loved ones aching feet. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

These silicone heart molds are great! They're really easy to use and clean and are very compact for having 15 separate heart molds in each tray. They're good sized hearts that have a little crease in the middle and a dimple on one side. This gives them a little character and makes them feel a bit more cartoon like and cute. These molds are truly non-stick and very flexible making it super easy to pop whatever you're making right out. They don't crack or break up in the process, just a nice clean unmolding for a perfectly heart. I also liked that I had no issue with any harsh silicone or plastic like odor while using these. They gave off no smell of their own straight out of the package or after washing and being heated in the oven.Silicone molds rock, especially ones as flexible as these are because you can do so many things with them. They're freezer, oven, and dishwasher safe so they're very versatile. I love making gummies, jello, mini muffins, cookie and brownie bites, chocolates, and hard candies. For crafts making mini tea light candles, soaps, crayons, side walk chalks, or painted clay molds make great gifts and party favors. I love silicone molds and these heart molds are a great addition to my collection! I received this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

This eye mask is nicely sewn and comfortable to wear. Not many sleep masks I've tried have had an adjustable strap and they generally squeeze too tightly and I don't end up wearing them. This sleep mask is easily adjustable and doesn't squeeze against my head. There are tiny magnets in this mask that the listing states that in combination with the mask are to help with " Relief from Headache, Migraine, and Sinus Pain, Eye Fatigue, Dry Eyes, Acerbity, Itching, and Discomfort". I cannot attest to having had relief from these things as of yet but hopefully if I do deal with them the mask will help. The mask does however block out light well and doesn't feel uncomfortable or overly warm on my face. The set also comes with a set of earplugs in a nice storage case. I don't usually sleep with earplugs in my ears but I will save these for a guest to use in case they need them. They seem well made, pliable and easy to use. The storage case makes them easy to toss into a purse, overnight bag, or night stand to be handy for later use. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

I really prefer fine tipped tweezers but it is so hard to find them in stores in my area. I was pleased to come across these. They're a great length, shape, and weight and feel really comfortable to hold and use. The tweezers surface is textured and helps to have a nice no slip grip without feeling gritty or like sandpaper. These have a nice spring to them without feeling like you have to press overly hard to tweeze. I use these for plucking my eyebrows and for splinter removal.
