They have a great precision tip that grips well. They also come with a little rubber tip guard and a draw string bag for storing. These are well made, and very functional and I really like this little set. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

This backpack is bigger and sturdier than I thought it would be and I am really pleased with the quality of it. It has two pouches on the side that are big enough to tuck a water bottle into securely. There are also two front pouches that have flaps that snap closed. The main bag has a draw string to gather the top closed and a flap that comes over it and magnetic snaps shut. The draw string has a plastic cinch to hold the rope where you need it. The inside is lined and has a zipper pouch in the upper back part of the bag.. The nylon is a nice wipeable surface and is easy to keep clean. I love the decorative trim on the flaps of the backpack it is well done and the studs seem secure and well placed. The backpack straps are sturdy, wide, and durable. They're easily adjustable to fit anyone and are comfortable to wear. There is also a loop to hang the pack up by. Great looking, well made backpack that we will get a lot of use from. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

This hundred board is made of sturdy wood and is nicely constructed and appealing to the eye. The tiles remind me of rustic scrabble pieces. I say rustic because not all of the numbers are centered in their tile, also the tiles aren't all exactly the same size. (but they're close on both counts) The set includes a board with a blank blue grid, a board insert that has the 1-100 numbered grid, tiles numbered 1-100, and a box/tray to store the tiles in. I do wish the tile tray had a lid but I have found stretching a couple rubber bands around the tray long ways keeps the tiles in the tray for storage. I did note a strong smell that reminded me of the clear coat matte spray I use when painting ceramics. I am assuming that it's the clear varnish coating the wood. I did need to air it out before use but it didn't take long for the smell to dissipate.This is a great mathematical tool to teach kids matching, number sequences, counting, and many other number based lessons. I was disappointed there wasn't an insert laying out different ideas and games using the board but that was nothing a quick google search couldn't remedy. I found several sites with different  suggestions on how to use a hundred board and the different things it could teach. What I like best is it can be a very basic teaching tool that grows with the child and can be utilized to teach more difficult math lessons later on. We will get a lot of use out of this board and I am pleased with how sturdy the construction of it is. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

This dog shampoo has a pleasant smell unlike some we have used in the past. It lathers up well (unusual for an organic and all natural product) and we didn't have to use as much of this product as we do some other shampoos we've used.Pros:Great latherDog wasn't itchy after shampooing and skin didn't seem to dry out.Fur was very soft and manageable.Smell was pleasant.Cons: (why I knocked off a star)I am really not sure what is going on with the label vs pictures and descriptions on this listing and therefore have no idea if my label is accurate. It states certified USDA organic. (the picture on this product listing does not have this statement now)  Also the picture of the ingredients in this listing do not match the list of ingredients in the product description section. I'm not sure if they changed the product or just the label at this point.They do need to straighten out what's going on with the description and labeling inconsistencies and straight up just sell their actual product. I stuck with 4 stars and not 3 because in the end our dog is clean, smells good, didn't have any itching or adverse skin reaction and the product worked well. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

This "bump and go" train has a spinning set of wheels so that when it runs into a wall it will bump it and turn itself around and go another direction. This train runs on 3 AA batteries (not included) that you'll need a mini philips head screw driver to install and change. It plays music and sound effects that sound like a train running along tracks, and a train horn before going back to the music again and repeating. The sounds are a bit loud and I would love an option where sound could be turned off but the lights were still able to run but the kids love noisy toys regardless. There are also flashing colorful lights making the train bright and fun. This is "approx 13 inches(length) x 3.5 inches(width) x 2.5 inches(height)" so it's a decent sized toy that is easy for a kid to hold and carry around or play with. This comes nicely boxed and would be a great gift for any train loving kid in your life. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

These super cute and versatile puppy paw silicone molds are great to have in my bakeware collection. These molds make 14 puppy paw shaped baked goods or crafts at a time. I was pleasantly surprised with the 2-1/5x2 inch.sized cavities and that they produce a nice sized, perfectly molded paw print. This mold had no awful silicone or plastic odor to it when I pulled it from it's packaging. I washed it in warm water and also had no issues with silicone smell out of the freezer or when baking with it. Speaking of this is freezer and oven (upto 450 degrees) and dishwasher safe. This silicone pan is super flexible so I recommend reinforcing the mold with a sheet pan to make it easier to handle when putting in and out of the oven or freezer. I actually like when molds are on the thinner more flexible side because they can be flexed very easily to pop out even the most stubborn and sticky of molded materials with no issue. These molds are non stick and I've had no issue simply twisting the mold and popping out each puppy paw in whole well molded condition. These molds would be great to bake your own home made healthier dog treats. If you have a dog lover in your household or family they would be sure to like cookies, muffins, brownies, or Jello in the shape of cute little paws. These would also be great for little soaps or crayons.I received this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

This is a large 16 oz bottle of sweet almond oil. It comes with a flip cap for easy dispensing and a little goes a long way so this will last me a really long time. I'm happy that it has a great shelf life and the expiration date is clearly labeled on the side. I have very dry skin and I really don't absorb lotion well, it just seems to want to stay on the surface of my skin. I did like that just a very small amount of this oil really softens and moisturizes my skin with out it feeling over saturated or not wanting to absorb. It did feel slightly, well oily because it is oil but I like it much better than lotion, it has really made my skin feel soothed. I also like that it doesn't have a fragrance to it and that it washes off pretty well with out making me feel like water is being repelled by the skin that has oil on it. As a hair treatment I recommend being very light handed with it. A little goes a long way and it takes a bit to wash out. I like working some into my hair about an hour before I get in the shower. I then shampoo and condition my hair as normal. I have found that it really makes my hair extra soft and shiny and it feels much healthier. I am pleased with the results and will get a lot of use from this big bottle. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

I have allergies so I'm always hesitant to try new things in the line of beauty products. I get nervous that my skin will not react well to it. I was so pleasantly surprised by this jojoba oil. It's so soothing to my dry and irritated skin. My hair is also dry and frizzy this time of year and this has really helped to keep it healthy and moisturized with out weighing it down or feeling greasy. It's really hard to believe when you read about a product that claims to be great for just about everything for hair and skin but this product really delivers. I have been very pleased with this vitamin rich and healing oil. The results for my hair were apparent after the first use. My dry skin took a bit more time but I am really pleased that its feeling very soothed and less itchy and dry now. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

I really like these shoe laces. They're stretchy, reflective, sturdy, and easy to use. I do wish there were instruction stickers on each baggie of shoe laces included, or at least one print out. There is a photo reference in the Amazon posting if you need instructions on how to properly fit these to your shoes. It's a simple process that only took me about a minute more than lacing up standard laces and a pair of scissors. Once the laces are cut you really won't be able to reuse them on another pair of shoes because you do trim away the plastic tips that make the laces easy to feed through your shoes eyelets. I don't have an issue with this because 5 pair are included and it's nice to have a new pair of laces when you have a new pair of shoes. Instructions on how to use these laces1. Lace through your shoe like a standard pair of shoe laces2. Pick up the circle button like piece and push, feed the laces through and then let go of button.3. Feed laces through the small end of the bell shaped plastic piece and position it at the bottom beginning part of the laces.4. Tie a firm knot and slide the "bell" over the knot.5. Trim ends of laces so that the bell covers the ends.These laces are so much quicker and easier to use than standard laces. I also find that they have a bit more give in them and flex with my foot making my shoe more comfortable to wear as well. They're simple to adjust and retighten and make it easy to put on and take of my shoes. I also really like the black laces I chose with white reflective stripes. They're stylish and match my tennis shoes well. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

In the fall and winter seasons my hair gets very dry. This oil treatment helps with the frizz,static, dryness, and flyaways that occur. I really like that it isn't an in shower hot treatment. A little goes a very long way with this oil. I just put a couple of drops on my hand and work it through my hair. It doesn't leave it feeling oily at all. It feels moisturized, shiny and soft. I do wish they offered an unscented version but it's not an unpleasant smell, I just prefer something that won't compete with the scent my shampoo and conditioner already leave in my hair. I recommend sticking to the dry ends of the hair and avoiding the scalp area so your hair won't look greasy. I am pleased with the results of this oil and it's really helped tame my dry frizzy hair. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

This time of year (autumn) I always deal with dry hair that is full of static with lots of frizz and fly aways. I look for a shampoo and conditioner that can keep my hair soft, moisturized, and from being so full of static that it clings to all my clothes. This set has worked really well for that. My hair feels much healthier than it usually does this time of year. I'm really happy for the ability to brush my hair with out it looking like a lightening storm! The set comes in nice big pump bottles and I didn't feel like I needed a large amount like I do with the cheap stuff I normally use. These will last me quite awhile. I also like that it's really easy to rinse out of my hair. It doesn't feel like it's clinging or making my hair feel weighed down or greasy. I wish that this was offered in a less perfumed scent but besides that I've been very pleased with the results. My hair is soft, fuller with out being bushy or frizzy, and feels healthier. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

This is such a handy guide that makes Mexican food accessible to even the busiest of families. I always thought of cooking Mexican cuisine as daunting and time consuming. Thinking of times where my friends spoke of the all day process of batch cooking tamales or the slow roasted flavor of carnitas and barbacoa. I really love my slow cooker. The "set it and forget it" method of cooking can really offer up a great meal at the end of a busy day. A meal that other wise would be fast food or something from a box. I love that the author really took the time to lay out the basics of cooking in a slow cooker. There were a few rules that I really needed a reminder for and will help me get the best results. The book is broken down into simple quick to read sections that I found very informative, not at all repetitive or boring, and never over simplified. There is a fine line in writing a cook book were it can feel too dumbed down and the author never made that mistake. I found the section on Mexican pantry staples and explaining what each add to Mexican cuisine particularly interesting and really liked that a break down on chiles was included. I really have always been curious about what effect the different preparation's  of a chili pepper had on it's flavor profile. I love when a cook book not only gives me recipes but also teaches me about the cuisine and methods I am using to cook, and this book delivers that in a quick and interesting way.I live in a small town in the Midwest so I am always a bit concerned that when I start cooking foods from another cuisine that there are going to be more exotic ingredients that I'm just not going to be able to locate. If that is not the case I also find myself concerned that the recipes would be overly Americanized and I wouldn't get true authentic flavors. In looking over the recipes I am pleased that I haven't come across any ingredients that have been difficult to locate. The recipes also feel true to cuisine and well adapted to the slow cooker. Each recipe has a breakdown of how many it serves, how long it will take in the slow cooker on low or high settings, the amount of prep time involved and a chili pepper rating of just how much heat you can expect from the recipe. I also love that the recipe includes directions for what should be prepped the night before and what can be done in the morning so that it you're not in for any surprises that might set you behind at the beginning of the day.The book is informative, the recipes easy to follow and make, and I love having a home cooked meal ready and waiting even when I'm too busy to cook. I am pleased with this book and can't wait to make my way through each of the recipes and find my favorites. I received this book for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

This digital blood pressure monitor has a nice sturdy and practical design. It runs on 2AAA batteries and not some silly battery that no one ever has around the house. It comes in a plastic protective carrying case so it's nicely portable. The read out is large, easy to read and understand. It has great memory options that allow for the storage of up to 180 readings for 1 person or 90 each for 2 people. I also like that there is a Arrhythmia detection and WHO Hypertension Indicator. There are clear instructions on how to operate the monitor and it's very easy to do. I also like that there are illustrations that demonstrate the proper way to hold your arm while using the device. The cuff is stretchy and Velcro fastening, it fit on comfortably and tightened only to the point it needed to be able to get a reading. The monitor gets a quick reading and displays it in an understandable fashion. I don't have another device to compare accuracy but the readings are consistent with my average previous readings. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

This skirt is incredibly comfortable, true to size, and has a nice stretchy spring to it. This time of year I have a huge issue with static so I was concerned this might be an issue with this skirt, I was really pleased that hasn't been the case. There was no shrinking after washing it's still as comfortable as it was before it was laundered. I am 5 10.5 and I really like my skirts to be very long, it is a continual struggle for me to find skirts that come down to my ankles and I was thrilled at the length of this maxi waist skirt. It's very stretchy and the waist is sewn extra long so that you can bunch it, fold it, let it lay in a kind of ruching effect and it works nicely to camouflage, and control top the waist area for some one who has a bit of a pooch in the belly area. There is one thing that on my body I didn't find particularly flattering. I really like when a skirt flows out from the hips and doesn't instead give the "mermaid" effect where the skirt cuts in below the waist to hug the leg line. So instead of being flattering this really highlights the lump that is my over weight belly This would be great for those who carry their weight more evenly but isn't the best for those who carry a lot of their weight in their middle. That being said it's nothing a long shirt wont fix and the skirt still looks nice with an untucked shirt. I love how flowy the bottom is and it hangs really comfortably. It's got a nice weight so it doesn't feel like the slightest breeze will blow it up over my head but it's still really light and airy material that breaths well. I did find that this is pretty sheer so I wear a slip with it. This is sewn well, feels quality made, the seams and hems are all secure with no loose or hanging threads. I like that it has three seams but that one doesn't land in front so that the front panel of the skirt is solid. This skirt can be casual or dressy and the black color that I got will go with anything. I am loving my super soft and comfy skirt and I will be wearing it a lot. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

On my weight loss journey I have come to realize just how important it is to keep records of my measurements. There are times I have found that the scale never moved or I gained a bit back in a week and I would feel discouraged. I measure in once a month and have found even when I'm not making progress on the scale I am still losing inches on the measuring tape. It's really important to realize that the scale is a guide line and only part of the picture. This is where these tools come in. I really love the body measuring tape, it's meant just for this purpose. It has  little round peg at the beginning of the measuring tape, you wrap the tap around what you want measured  (arm, calf, neck, waist, etc.) and hook it into the provided slot, you can then press the button and the tape will retract until it is flush with your skin and hold in this position. You can then unhook the little peg and record your measurement findings. This is made of plastic and feels like it needs to be used gingerly but so far I've not had any issues with it and it's more about perception than actual lack of sturdiness. This tool is really easy to use and would also be great for some one who does a lot of sewing for others and regularly takes measurements. I have owned a measuring tape like this in the past and it feels identical to it so I am pleased with that as I got a lot of use out of it before I misplaced it.This is the first fat test caliper I've used so I don't really have a comparison on this product. I really like that the included instructions were clear and guided me through the process of using this tool and that there is a chart to interpret those findings included. This tool isn't hard to use and I made sure to measure the same spot a few times to see that I got the same results and that this tool is consistent and it is. This feels a tad flimsy but is pretty flexible due the nature of the way it works and doesn't feel like it's going to fall apart at any moment. This tool is also easy to use, made to fit comfortably in my hand and has easy to read numbers on it. Definitely a tool I will keep handy so that I can keep track of my progress. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

I have issues with my oven and can't seem to bake a batch of cookies evenly no matter what I do. I am really pleased with these mats, they bake very evenly and I find that the bottoms of my baked goods aren't getting burnt before the top and middles get done when I use them. I also love that even though a lot of products say they are non stick and really aren't these mats are perfectly non stick and I never have an issue with any item. Food just slides right off the mat. I have a large sized baking sheet so I had no issues with the size of this mat, it fit fine. There were no issues with any unpleasant plastic like fumes or smells that tend to happen with some silicone products. They're working great, clean up easily with a quick hand washing, and are easy to store. I just store them right in my baking pans so they're ready to go when I need them. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

Don't be that person who slows to a crawl at the toll in order to dig your transponder out of a console so you can awkwardly hold it up to the glass. Nobody is going to break into your car to steal your EZ Pass. These strips are just the right size and the price is right, especially considering I wasn't able to find these in those obscure back aisles of the big box department stores. The stickiness is perfect, never had an issue even when the windshield gets ridiculously hot in the summer

I needed something to use in my office after coming back to my desk after a lunchtime run outside. The fan is tiny, but if you angle it correctly and put it close enough, it really does push enough air to give you that little relief you're looking for. I took away one star because the bendy metal arm isn't as easy to deal with as you'd think. It often sags and doesn't offer all the angles you might want. On the bright side, as you're trying to adjust the arm, you constantly stick your fingers in the fan and quickly realize that it's not a safety hazard nor does it cause any pain when you do this.

I've been looking for some good landscaping gloves for a while and I just couldn't find anything worth buying at the big hardware stores. I bought size XL and they fit comfortably. The padding on the palm is durable without being so heavy duty that you can't move your hand. The mesh outer is also high quality and is just light enough to not get too hot on very warm days.

These mousetraps are certainly easier to set and to deal with than the old school Victor ones with that precarious metal bar that comes down. You just squeeze slightly to reveal the inside where you can spread a little peanut butter, then squeeze all the way to set and hear it click into place. Once you catch a mouse, it's easy as clicking again to release.Because these are entirely plastic they aren't very heavy duty. They still caught mice, but the mouse dragged them a few feet. There was also still some blood to clean up, despite the promise of no blood, no mess.

This is a high quality toy at such an affordable price. The green and blue ends are flexible enough to be squeezed by stronger hands. The clear middle part is perfect for teething and gripping onto, while the tiny balls inside provide enough excitement to keep baby interested. Even at 13 weeks he's already gripping onto this and shaking it.

The price was right, but the application can be a little annoying. You basically flip the bottle upside down and wait for a drop to form and then drip onto the nipple. We tried to get the drop directly into baby's mouth, but he's usually crying at this point and it's tough to aim the slow developing drop into a moving crying mouth.If you primarily feed through bottles than this is much easier since you just include a drop in the bottle before feeding.Our doctor recommended using these drops as we were relying 100% on breast milk so we will continue to do our best to work with these drops.

Much thicker and more heavy duty than the cheap stuff you see at the hardware store. Still easy enough to cut and work with. Make sure you buy a good number of garden staples since you'll need these to secure the fabric over the dirt. I've had it in place in my flower beds for almost 2 months and there are no signs of weeds - great success!

The first thing you notice when you open the package is that this nozzle is heavy and durable - not the plastic junk that you see at most of the hardware stores. It was easy to thread onto the hose and it's very comfortable to hold in your hand during use. It's easy to cycle through the different spray types, though I find myself using 'Shower' and 'Full' most of the time. I have noticed on 'Shower' mode that there is a noticeable drip at the bottom of the opening, but it doesn't seem to impact the spray too much.The company is very intent on providing good customer service and proactively reaches out to see if you have any questions/concerns. They probably sent 1-2 more emails than I think is necessary, but I'd rather have overly proactive customer service than bad customer service.

This is a lifesaver. Our newborn has slept in this each night for the first 7 weeks of his life. I'm sure there are authors and doctors who would shun us for not letting him sleep flat in a crib, but our little guy is already up to 6 hour stretches of sleep at 6 weeks old so we will take it! We have it set up right next to our bed and it's so easy to just reach out and rock him if he starts to fidget or fuss.This is pretty easy to assemble, just take a minute to look at the pipes before frantically trying to force the issue. The fabric is very easy to get on and off for washing and the material has held up well after a few washes already. The vibrating feature isn't something we use - he doesn't really care for it and once the initial novelty wears off it just makes his cry sound funny.

These socks are a big snug on our newborn, but rumor has it he has big flat feet for a baby. The quality is quite good, with the material being thicker than you'd expect. The designs aren't too extreme that you can't mix/match with any outfit baby is wearing. We ended up ordering 2 so that we had more of each color to make it easier to find pairs in a crowded little drawer.

These are relatively cheap earplugs that get the job done with only a moderate level of discomfort. I use these to tune out snoring and they work pretty well, but there is still some level of discomfort when you shove something in your ear and then put your head down on the pillow. You can do much worse than these earplugs though. These are firm enough to block out noise, but soft enough to not really hurt your ears.On average I use them about a week before getting a little grossed out and going with a new pair. I read some other reviews where people rinse them off or wash them, but my attempt at that resulted in a gross waterlogged mess that you would not want to stick back in your ear.

Don't buy the cheap $29.99 Black & Decker toaster oven. I don't care how cheap it is at Macy's or how many coupons you have that the cashier won't let you use. Don't buy it. Don't be that guy (or that girl)This is such a better oven. It's big enough to fit a frozen pizza, but not so big that completely dominates your kitchen counter. It comes with a rack and a pan and there are 3 different rack positions, though I find the middle one to be sufficient for almost all cooking applications. The controls are very intuitive and the clock is easy to set and adjust for daylight savings time. One thing I've found annoying is that the timer defaults to 2 hours. You can adjust it down of course, but that takes time and instead I just leave it and do the math counting backwards to what I need (or I just use the microwave timer if I need to hear it beep)Overall, very high quality, cooks consistently, easy to use, and so far so good after about 6 months of use.

The price was right for these white tee shirts. They are soft and comfortable, but don't appear to be too durable as some of the comfort lies in the fact that the material isn't overly thick. There are no tags so no worries about getting an itchy neck or having to cut tags out. The fit is as you would expect and they didn't shrink much, if at all, after a few washes and tumble dries.

We have an old ironing board with a very beat up foam pad covered by some thin fabric. Ironing is a miserable enough chore without creating your own wrinkles just from ironing on a really poor surface. This ironing board pad saved us from buying a whole new board. It was thick enough to to provide a flat surface, while also being durable enough to resist any burns in case you pull a dumb move and leave the iron down. Minus one star for not being able to pick the color you want, but we lucked out and got gray, which is what we would have chosen anyways

These lights are BRIGHT, so much so that calling them a night light is a bit misleading. When I think of night light I think of something somewhat dim that will still keep the room dark, but will provide enough light so that you can find the bathroom door handle or avoid that pile of magazines on the ground. These lights are so bright that they light up the whole room. We put one in the hallway outside our bedroom and the bottom of the door was glowing white so bright that we couldn't sleep.The sensor worked well so no issues there, but I'd make sure you were ok with something super bright or perhaps save this for an unobtrusive application like the common area of an apartment or some place that wouldn't inhibit sleep.

I can't imagine there being a better case for the IPad mini out there for this price. It's the standard tri-fold case that you see most people have. We opted for the gray color, which is exactly as shown in the picture in that it's on the lighter side. Installing the case was as easy as just snapping the IPad into place and the folds you need to make to position the iPad are rather intuitive

I'm so tired of kitchen shears that just can't get the job done with cutting meat. After combing through a ton of reviews I rolled the dice with these as they weren't too expensive and people seem to like them. After about one month not only do they no longer cut meat, but they can barely cut the plastic package that the meat comes in. This is incredibly frustrating. I've tried sharpening them, and that proves to be an exercise in futility since they still simply don't get the job done. Don't bother with these and put the money instead towards a nicer pair that might actually work.

Prior to buying this pan I had been using a beat up pan that I inherited from my parents and that survived college and post-college living. Sure I got a nice set of cookware when I got married, but it wasn't nonstick and ended up being more trouble than it's worth to clean afterwards.I decided to spoil myself and get this pan and I'm glad I did. It's sturdy and rests completely flat on the burner - no more distortion and constant teetering like a bar stool with one leg shorter than the others. The size is a little big, but I'd rather have it be too big than too small and it's worked just fine for 3 egg omelets and various saute applications. It heats quickly and evenly and the nonstick works perfectly with no trouble cleaning after each use.

This is much more cost effective than continuing to buy the little tubes. The flip top is easy to operate when you're in the heat of the battle and have a squirmy baby going bonkers. Yes you have to dip your finger in and then spread that finger in the baby's butt. With the tubes you can squirt it on, but you still have to use your fingers to spread it so it's really no different in the long run. Baby doesn't seem to mind the application and so far so good with preventing diaper rash.

We got these storage bottles because they screw right into Medela pumps and are interchangeable with Medela lids and nipples. For that reason, they are worth the investment, but what's really annoying are the white caps that come with these bottles. The caps are actually in two pieces, which I'm sure serves some sort of purpose if you bought Evenflo nipples, but ends up just being really annoying with an extra piece to clean and put in place before securing the lid on.

This was extremely easy to put together - just line up the guides correctly for the drawer and snap in the little plastic pieces like you see in the picture. I don't know why the instructions give you more options for the height of the drawer - you can't go much lower than the 3rd rung (you'll see a double line by that rung) and you obviously can't go higher than the top since the shelf is there. Silly instructions.All in all this was just what we needed for under our bathroom sink. The shelf is deep enough to hold all of our medicine bottles and extra toiletries and then we can put bigger items on the top shelf

I've been using TYR nest goggles without prescription and I was tired of not being able to read the clock or see people across the pool. After one failed attempt at Rx goggles (don't waste your time with the TYR Rx model) I took the chance on this pair and ended up finding something that works. The seal is great, even with my narrow face. The straps are easy enough to adjust and the vision correction worked as well as I had hoped. My prescription is 2.25 in one eye and 2.75 in the other so I just split the difference and ordered the 2.50 correction. It works good enough and it's amazing all the crap I can now see at the bottom of the pool.

I was tired of shaking water out of my ear for hours after swimming and I'm thrilled to finally find some earplugs that will do the job. They are easy to pop into your ears and once in you still have no problem hearing other people talking to you. I hardly notice them when I'm swimming, but sometimes when I first pop up to take a break I get that "water in the ear" feeling before it quickly dissipates.The case is pretty flimsy and will just break if you don't open it slowly, but the ear plugs should last a while. Great little add-on item from Amazon if you're already ordering something else.

These are stronger than the cheap plastic crap you'll find at the discount department stores without costing too much more money. The clips can support the weight of jeans easily and the clips are tight and have no problem staying attached. When you open the package from Amazon you get three sets of 4 hangers so there is a bit of an extra step with getting rid of that packaging, but really not a big deal.

I was looking for an over sink drainer for the smaller of my double sinks, but unfortunately this item was just an inch or so too wide to fit. The stainless steel is high quality and the adjustable feature is great to cover the length of the sink, but there is no adjustment for the width so I was out of luck and had to return it.

I went to the home improvement stores and it was obvious that this trash container was sturdier and more durable than any of the other cheap flimsy plastic options out there. The lid was secured to the container (but doesn't lock down onto it even if you press hard so if you were to turn this thing upside down then the lid would open). There is a warranty offered from the manufacturer, but I think the bigger issue is having such a well made and expensive trash container stolen by neighbors.64 gallons holds more trash than my wife and I can generate in a week. It probably would take 5-6 very full kitchen garbage bags to come close to filling this up. It's very easy to wheel up and down the driveway and so far it's survived some rough treatment from the garbage men. It won't blow over from the wind or roll around in the street if the garbage men decide to leave it on it's side half in the road.

In the pictures this looks like an awesome product, but once you take the big neoprene strip out of the case you immediately realize how cumbersome this product will be to actually put in use. It's just one big, wide, flat strip of neoprene with velcro running down each side. If you have a ton of wires all coming from the same outlet perhaps this would be a useful tool, but I found it way too big/bulky for simple use behind a tv entertainment center. It's rather time consuming to attempt to thread the wires in and out just the way you want them and then at the end of the day it still looks like a spider web behind the tv stand. Ultimately I had to send this back and I'm just going to rely on individual velcro cable ties (also available on Amazon at a fraction of the cost of this monster)

Damn you C.A.H. for making a game that is so awesome that we've already become familiar with all the original cards and are stuck anxiously awaiting the arrival of the UPS guy so that we can see what's in store with the new cards. We haven't really utilized the blank cards yet, but it's nice to work in the new white/black cards in with the existing ones so that every once in a while you see something new that just makes you say "What the F*** ".Well played.

This stuff isn't cheap, but the Amazon price is competitive with other online sporting goods sites. I have a few of these laying around in various gym bags and lockers and I can't run without putting it on some areas that are sensitive to chafing. This is far better than using Vasoline (or butter if you're pulling a Kramer) and it doesn't smell or leave any nasty stains/residue on your clothing.The actual design on the stick changed a bit from the picture, but it's the same product and still yields the same chafe free results.

I have non-prescription TYR goggles that I use all the time and absolutely love, but now that I can't wear contacts for a few months I needed something with vision correction. Naturally I thought these TYR goggles would fit just as well, but I was totally disappointed. The way the straps connect into the side of the lenses is terrible - impossible to adjust and makes it all too easy to loosen the seal and let water rush in.The correction part was actually ok, but unfortunately with the lenses filling with water I wasn't able to keep my eye open long enough to actually see the clock at the other end of the pool.
perfect secure fit...great bright colors
didn't realize there's no sipping spout or straw...you have to unscrew the top to drinkalso, the insert is VERY difficult to remove...too much work - there's gotta be an easier way
perfect fit & great quality
not crazy about the scent, but does the job
as described, works great, great cost
smells great & soothes itching
top fits great, bottoms are small
as described - son loves it
busted after just 2 days of use
as described, easy to install, works great
Birthday gift for my daughter & she loved it!
just as described

The black edge came completely separated from the green backing within 2 days of use.  It was a birthday gift for my daughter & she didn't want to wait for a new one, so I ended up using crazy glue to put it back together.
doesn't work with iPhone 6...I tried holding it at different angles & nothing...well, maybe the occasional dot or broken line, but no consistent line...returning item as defective

these are my fav!  I'm on my third one in 4 years.  After about a year of use, they start to stretch/warp & lose the perfect fit that they have when brand new.  But I keep buying them, because they work so great!
love it!
perfect little case!
great skates!
perfect little press...still using 2 years later!
great product...durable & cute!
super cute, but the animal print sticker started coming off quickly...also had a rhinestone fall out during shipping
never really worked - would just flash continuously when batter was in place (not just when a call/text/notification was received)...of course, that means the battery died quickly
has been on my daughter's phone for over a year now & still holding up great...plus, super cute!
have owned 2 of these for a year now - bought them for our 10 & 11 year old daughters & they love them...great product for the price!
have owned 2 of these for a year now - bought them for our 10 & 11 year old daughters & they love them...great product for the price!
great deal for the price!  fits our ZTE Emblem (apparently same phone, just new name) nicely & protects well
bought for my 12yo daughter's room...feels a little stiff for my liking, but she loves it!  so easy to put together & looks super nice!  perfect for what we needed it for!
adhered on nicely & seems to do the trick
they're ok...but not as nice as I'd hoped...really disappointed in the fiber one - the rubber ones actually work better
son loved the shirt & fit just right
sturdy & nice...a little difficult to put on/off, but stays put when on
simply the best!  no other funky color holds as well & as long as this!
wish i could access my phone without sliding it in & out...but works as is described...nice quality
love love love!!!  won't hold a ton of cards/cash...but protects my phone perfectly & allows easy access
broke within 12 hours of my husband putting it on his phone...fell from his lap to the floor & the case snappedthankfully, the seller refunded us promptly
simply the best!  no other funky color holds as well & as long as this!
simply the best!  no other funky color holds as well & as long as this!

Love the size of these...love the internal heating system - they hold heat really well & for a long time.  Heats up fast too!  I need to practice more with different products to try & get my long, thick locks to hold curl, but that's not this product's fault.  Careful, the metal strips that the curlers rest on get super hot & if you're not paying attention, you may tap one when pulling the curlers out.  I might invest in some clips to hold these in too.  The pins are a tad difficult to use & they leave slight marks in your hair.  Only thing that would make this product better would be if there was a storage compartment for the pins.

I'm in love!  After trying a size 2 for our 20lb Schnauzer, we found it was too big (he could shake it off) & had to order a size 1.  Now, walks are 100% nicer!!!  He still tries to shake/paw it off his face, but he's unsuccessful.  And I'm sure after he gets a little more used to it, he'll stop trying.  It keeps him from being able to bark & lunge at other dogs (even if he means well).  No more pulling & tugging...exhausting my arms.  He now is a well behaved dog, who's still able to sniff & bark & do as he pleases...as long as it's not out of control.  The Halti has made him much more manageable - even for our kids!
nothing better than an otterbox!  still going strong after over a year of use!

or a good addition to your own collection for the winter holiday season...For the money I spend, I always trust a Lenox and this is one is no different.Just beautiful, heavy but not too heavy to hold, not too big, a wonderful center plate at the table. I could use this not just for eggs, but other smaller eatables such as mini-muffins or small pieces of desserts etc.But, unlike another reviewer mentioned, this is made in china, not in the US (may be designed in the USA).Nevertheless this is a great piece of Lenox tableware to have or to gift, and is worth every penny.. (there is a life time break replacement from Lenox, if something happens; I have seen one other brand Pfaltsgraf to do claim that and they have given me replacements in the past).

I drink several cups of coffee and tea a day and so I thought this will be a great addition to my office desk. But, what a disappointment...First the materials used: 1. The inner cup that holds the liquid is plastic. I would have expected a metal (stainless steel), particularlyif it is going to hold hot coffee or tea for a couple of hours. I can only use it now for cold liquids.2. The silicone (flexible plastic) tube that runs from the top of the inner cup to the rim so you can drink out of it? another bad idea if you drink a really hot coffee/tea out of it - you get plastic smell (at least initially..). And I am sure it won't last either.Several other design issues:1. The silicone tube gets pinched by the sides when the cup is placed on the desk. The handle moves up, lifts the inner cup and along with that the silicone tube by about a .25 inch when you lift the mug and that opens up the tube so you can drink out of that. But the handle moves so easily, that if the cup falls to its side on the desk, guess what - your table is full of coffee.. so the whole idea of no-spill cup is lost...2. A little too big for what it is. I would have expected a thinner one from the picture, and would have appreciated a thinner one.3. When you pour the liquid in, if you are not careful, liquid will go in the gap between the inner and outer cups! Then you have to clean it up...One nice touch is that the bottom comes out for cleaning; you really really need that facility for this one, anyways.In all, not really usable for me...

I have been using the original Eternity for quite a few years now and haven't tried anything new in the last couple of years. Comparing to that, this one:- is milder; just apply a little and it seems to vanish in a couple of hours. (at least I can't smell it anymore)- is pleasant, but I still like the original and IMHO, the original is more masculine than this one (but then what do I know? have to ask the ladies :) )- The packaging is more attractive on this (the bottle and the cap)I can only smell the vanilla and ginger/coconut but not all the things they say as ingredients.In any case, I would still rate this at 4/5 and will use it as an alternative to the original Eternity once in a while. It is definitely mild enough to wear for offices, and so I do use it for that purpose

Package, finish, ease of use (in holding the razor) etc are all great - as expected from a good brand.I have only one issue with this: it was good only for one shave. I know, it is disposable, but expected 2 or 3 shaves out of each razor before I throw it away.  Not so with this one, at least for me.If you don't mind that, and just looking for that excellent (first) shave on a disposable razon, then this will be a good buy..

all good till you wash it! Very first wash, it comes out totally creased everywhere. I know, I know it is cotton, but it is so crumpled, that I have to use an iron.I love corduroys, the texture, the feel, the shine, everything about them - except this part. Why can't they make it like some of these jeans that are marketed as 'never need iron' or 'will keep the crease out of the dryer" and so on?Am I asking too much??

As good as the best of the brands out there, in terms of the berry quality and packing wise (Viva Labs and Navitas are the other brands I have tried before).Also for some of the reviewer's comments on the dryness of these berries, Goji Berries are supposed to be used with soups (and salads) or with water,  If you eat them directly, all of them (other brands too) will be dry.In terms of price/affordability, this compares with Navitas, but may be more expensive than Viva Labs with some sellers. With that said, I like this and will buy again..

Wow! worth its weight in gold. A book full of informative bits on 1000's of animals, with beautiful color photos to keep any animal lover glued to it for weeks and come back to it whenever they need.Great gift idea for grandparents to give to their grandkids (or buy and keep it for reading when the kids visit).Hard bound so it will last for years, thicker paper inside as well, with a shiny finish (glossy).Aside from pages after pages consisting of various animals, every few pages there are full page photos and more information on some popular/well known/interesting animals in each category - such as Bornean Chimp, or asian elephant etc..I love this book..

Nice, pleasant, lingering perfume. Keeps the hair silky smooth. Helps a lot with my extreme dry hair situation. Excellent packaging.It is true that a spray nozzle would have helped a bit, but you can pretty much do that with this current bottle too. It just needs a couple of drops for my hair and may need more for those with more hair and so I can put that directly on my head, and comb.An essential in hair grooming..

I love it.. but only 4.5/5!There is only flaw I see with this product:Most of the outlets I have are two outlets in one wall plate. This one takes up most of the space, uses only one outlet, but hides the other outlet, so I can't use that outlet for anything. In effect, I convert 2 outlets in to 3 outlets + 2 USB - not bad at all.... but still. Could have done better with either a slim profile one that doesn't block the other outlet, or just use both outlets - using one for the 3 outlets, and the other one for the USB charging.Other than that, this is perfect.1. Solid construction; won't fall out; not flimsy;looks nice.2. Nice place on top to hold the smartphones or other electronics you are charging with this...3. Has enough protection for spikes etc..

Well made, has a nice finish and touches to make it a fashionable bag.Lots of packets inside and out. The inside packet is good enough for tablets/ipad of size up to 10-12 inches and not really for any serious laptop. So don't think of this as a laptop carrying bag. (Who would expect that in a fashion piece?) There are other additional packets for money and purse etc..Outside packet can be used for small change, papers, mp3/phone and a bottle etc.Not much security as it relies on a draw string to close the bag and there are not many zipped enclosures (that are difficult to open in a hurry), but that's OK for a fashion back pack or a day bag (for car travel etc.)The material used is very nice.Functional enough for day trips nearby, but not for long travels as the main handbag.

several good points and a couple of important misses...1. Fit and finish is great. Very well made2. Works well; just put it on the far side center of the table, turn it on and you go...3. Great for beginners to the game, to perfect their return strokesBut the misses:1. No variation - neither speed, nor angle, and no capacity to change top spin etc.. it is just flat service2. Slow for the most part. Great for beginners but then will get bored quickly.3. Uses 4 batteries; I hope I can replace them with rechargeable ones.4. can only contain about 20 balls! there is no accessory to catch and feed the balls back to this one; there is a net available, but I don't see that working with this model (may be I missed that). That would make it better, as it extends the time you spend on the other side of the table playing.In all 3.5/5.

I didn't expect this to be this good.Fit and finish is great. Entire thing folds up like a small portfolio (less than the size of an ipad), with a zipper bag on one side to enclose all the included accessories and cables). You just open up and keep it in the sun for charging. It has taken about 3 hours for me to charge the battery using sunlight, while charging from AC outlet has been much faster.Every accessory is useful and works well; included flash light (either the separate add on or built-in LED flash on the side) both work very well and for a long time. The fan actually works and gives a cool airflow (drawback is that you have to hold it close enough).After a full charge of the battery, it is able to provide about 70% charge to my Galaxy S6 smartphone: more than enough for emergencies!Definitely a must have for emergencies..and a good gift

I used to buy Navitas from Whole foods before. That's the only reference I have and based on my experience:1. The Viva Labs one has bigger, redder and more juicy berries (juicier just by a margin).2. Packed and shipped well3. Fresh4. Much less expensiveGood to use as evening snacks or with salads or even sprinkle on morning cereals..I am switching to this brand going forward..But not sure if this is the nature of the Goji berries or not: it is still dry/hard compared to, for e.g. raisins.

So light, that you forget you are wearing it, and all the roads are smoothed by an excellent cushion.Except that it has fabric top - meaning you can't use if it rains a lot or can't walk through puddles, this is the best shoe I have worn - ever..I am sold for life, and will continue to buy this; just wish it were a bit more cheaper as it wears out in about 6 months of daily use.

Overall 4.5/5non-scratching surface, a little big for normal 5" phones (like Samsung Galaxy S6 or Nokia phones), but good to have a big one like this on the table.Very well made, as with most Belkin products are.Comes with a really small USB charger/power adapter that looks cool and USB to MicroUSB cable. Charges my Galaxy S6 in about 2 hours from 0 to 100% and shows the status with LED. As it approaches full charge, it flashes colors (red and green!). While it is charging it is usually green.With the name of Belkin, I am hoping that this will last for a long time.One issue, (reported by others) is that it is a single coil, and the area of charging is only half or less than that in the pad. So, we still have to take care in placing the phone on this pad, so that it charges; can't just put the phone anywhere in the pad; have to watch the green LED.Definitely recommend this one, if you are looking for a Qi charger, and if this is priced right in comparison to competition (just a bit premium for Belkin brand name and the finish of the product, including the cute, small USB charger).

I didn't believe all the writing in the Amazon page when I ordered this, but then once I got it, now I am a believer!One caveat though: before using first time, read the manual. Unless the handle is pushed back in on opening it, it is not going to cut the nails. So read the manual that shows in pictures how to use this nail cutter.Once you learn how to use this, even your biggest toe nail is no match for this cutter.Very well made, totally sleek and is so small it is packet-able ( or can carry in a valet) but I wouldn't buy it for that reason! I would buy it just for the functionality of this little marvel.Unlike the cheap cutters, this doesn't throw the nails far and wide. You can collect it from the back of the blades.One of the sides has a nail file face so that is included as well.Only one issue I noted: the curvature of the blade looks a little wider than normal cutters. It doesn't stop me from using and is not an hindrance in any way, but just something I noticed.

Overall 4.5/5.0Pros:1. Well made, almost fits like a glove (if you take some care while putting it).2. Unlike other 2 part covers this one is not bulky. Very slim for what it provides - excellent protection all around including the back and corners.3. The openings are well done, so there is no issue in using any of them - IR,speaker, headset in, and power in.4. As if one color is not enough, you get 3 color bumpers!Cons:1. The buttons, while totally concealed (with just a tactile marking for hands to feel it), work just ok most of the time. It would have been ok to have the buttons stand out and work well.2. Heart rate sensor, with the cover, seems to be deep set, so some times, unless you are careful, doesn't work correctly; takes longer to get the rhythm and start measuring.These are minor quibbles compared to the pros - slim, well made, great protection, and so I can only reduce 0.5 out of 5 for these cons.Definitely worth a buy..

More like 4.5/5.0The cons (for reduction of 0.5):1. The loop for carrying is only for hand carrying, it is not like a carbiner loop and so can't be easily attached to a backpack for e.g.2. Even when you don't want the filter, taking out the filter/straw doesn't help; you still have to sip to drink water, doesn't pour from the spout. This is not a big issue, but just something to mention..Several pros:1. Nice, well made, right size2. Fits well in the coffee holders in the car etc...3. The filter is not all that expensive, 3 filters (6 months) is less than $10.That said, do not expect this to replace Lifestraw (ASIN: B006QF3TW4) for e.g. for filtering any water.  Only useful in places where you normally use Brita/Pur filters, but want something portable, personal use.

Summary: If you are looking for a really cheap, affordable and very easy to use GSM smartphone, this is for you. If you travel a lot internationally, or want to gift a phone to international relatives, this one may be good for that too - with the 2 Sim support.  In a crowded low end market with several androids, I would still prefer a Windows phone - just for one thing - ease of use! Even people who never used a smart phone can easily get used to a windows phone (or iphone for that matter, if you can spend more) - definitely not an android phone - the way current android phones arrive at customers with a ton of bloatware and confusing interface  for a non-techie.Details: In most specs, this almost looks like a twin of Nokia Lumia 635 (unfortunately, 635 is available in US for as little as $69), with just one exception - 2 SIM support. It is also a little more bulkier than the current sleek crop of phones, but then at this price range, it is quite good as is.Only a few cons:1. lack of applications (applies to Windows) - but if you are only looking for simple things such as email, FB, Twitter, Flipboard and some web browsing, this is more than enough2. 5 MP camera - not so good - pictures are just ok - not great.Several pros:1. display is fine for this price range (definitely not going to watch netflix in a 4.5 screen of this sort).2. Battery life is good3. Comes with a screen guard and a nice cover - that otherwise will cost you another $15 or so.4. Front camera too - for skype/video chatting/selfie (but looks like low quality VGA or less).5. No bloatware at all :) Most windows phones are phones first and smartphones second..unlike 'some' smartphones!6. Configuration, joining WIFI/Bluetooth etc are all so easy, and the experience is the same across all Windows phones.Misc. Notes:Micro Sims. And have to open the back cover to install the 2 Microsims, unlike Nokia models, but removing the back cover is quite an easy task. With 2 Sims you get 2 phone numbers on the same phone, giving you a choice to use which sim for calling out. Useful in other countries, but not of any use in US.(PS: My current primary phone is a Galaxy S6, upgraded from Nokia 1020, which was an upgrade from iPhone 4S. I have a good use for dual sim phones when I travel abroad, and this one fits the bill nicely for me).

What can you do in a phone cover to differentiate from million covers out there?? UAG has done it - done it well.Sleek, fits perfectly, looks quite solid (I only dropped a couple of times - definitely not for testing this case :) , and it was fine). Excellent corner protection, Even stays put when placed on a slanted desk. It doesn't hinder access to the heart rate monitor (LED) for measuring using s-health app.Best of all, quite lite; doesn't add bulkiness to the phone (only some , not a lot as you would expect from a 'military grade' cover).There is lip protection as well.If it is made affordable, this will be the best cover money can buy for a Galaxy phone.

Several things to like and a couple of (big) dislikes..positives list:1. Shiny, sateen like shell (polyester) on one side and such a sofft fleece on the other side. Feels so good on the body to use such blanket/throw.2. In spite of being made in polyester/fleece, it is quite warm and yet doesn't get too warm; does breathe through. So it is always pleasant to use either in winter or summer.3. It is quite light, not heavy at all. You would think it has to be heavy, looking at the fleece side.4. It can be a decoration as well, leaving it on a chair..Now the negatives:1. Not sure about this flag thing on it..may be some other graphic might be better. I worry about using any national flag or religious symbols on personal use things that could be construed as disrespect.

Overall: 4.5/5.0I attempted to assemble this myself, alone.  It was quite hard and I had to use all the ingenuity and muscle power to get it done over 3 to 4 hours, spread over 2 days. In the end it was worth it. ( to be truthful, I needed some one to finally lift it up after I finished assembly and again to hold it down, while I poured sand in the base).Parts and shipping: Great. Parts are sturdy and well made. Wall packed and arrived properly.The post is in 3 parts that interlock (and with a screw/nut). Only a few gripes here:-while all the parts were shown in the assembly manual, the parts could have been given a name, letter or a number that also shows up in the packaging of parts. For e.g. there were several screws, nuts and washers and the dimensions were quite close to each other, that you have to guess at times, as to what you should use for what.- I wish the post could have been made in strong/sturdy PVC or some other lighter material, bringing the overall weight of this.One small caveat for those who assemble: The height of 10 ft. etc is true only if the 3 parts of the posts are pushed together to the minimum length! The posts join together with an elongated long hole for the screw that keeps them together.After assembly: Better use sand to weigh down the base as that won't get spoiled or leak. I needed 2 bags of 50lbs sand from the neighborhood HomeDepot.Once it is done, it is quite sturdy, as real as you can get system for hours/years of fun. It can adjust from 8 ft to 10ft, and can be moved around the house as you see fit.The only gripes I have are: (and reasons for a deduction of 0.5 in the rating)1. Parts naming to identify the parts easily.2. Could have been a bit lighter3. It is still hard to adjust the height for one person (unless you are strong).I love it and recommend it for all families with kids (and those who are kids at heart or basketball players)

Pleasant smell, not overpowering, just there...Not too sudsy, again just enough lather..Leaves a feeling of moisture on the skin after bath and gives a clean feeling.Several things going for this body wash... except.... the packaging. The bottle looks more like a cough syrup bottle or an oil bottle than a body wash. If I see it in a supermarket I may not have picked it up (except for the Irish spring label), but luckily I got it as a vine sample.I love this and will buy again.

French press system on the go. For those who want to brew for themselves a personal cup instead of the usual office coffee, this is a good alternative.Several plus points and one con..Pros:1. Very well made, inside stainless steel (except for some plastic at the bottom of inside unit (shown clearly in the picture).2. Does hold coffee hot for an hour or so but not too much (less time than claimed because of the top flexible plastic cover)3. Does fit in my car cup holders (looks a bit wide at first sight though, compared to the usual starbucks ones).Cons:1. The flexible plastic cover; for the money and the features, it is a letdown. I hope they fix it in the final version (as this is a vine copy).Other caveats: as the instruction says, we can only use medium or coarse ground coffee in this. The fine ground coffee does seep in through the holes at the bottom.

Update: 5/1/2015:Yeah, but bad software - lots of bugs abound...Shame on Samsung and Google for such a software that is inferior to IOS and even Windows mobile. Even things that work well on my Nokia Windows, I have several issues with this phone software.A few ( I couldn't keep up with the number of bugs...):1. Screen rotation off doesn't work properly, even with samsung supplied software in cases. Even if I disable, it continues to rotate for most apps.2. Biggest gripe: the display brightness control. I have no clue how I can set it up correctly so it adjusts automatically whether I am indoors or outdoors. The Settings screen has a checkbox for auto and I have that checked out, but once I lock and unlock the phone, it shows as unchecked from the pulldown status screen. I have tried several things with this and I am still not getting it right. It is always hard to see in bright sunlight, until I pull down the status screen and check the box again. Shouldn't this be a sticky setting in the first place???3. Can't use carmode from my bluetooth when the phone is locked (and the phone gets locked after a minute of timeout. I can change the timeout to 30 minutes but then why have a locking feature with that timeout?). So, how am I supposed to use voice dialing?S-voice is even worse for this purpose.4. Settings is not organized correctly.  How do you get to wifi-dialing?? I would guess Settings/WIFI or Settings/mobile networks. No, it is under "more connections settings". This is not one issue, there are several such issues with settings organization - not intuitive enough.5. I am not fully happy with the camera also..the photos seem to be a bit grainy in 100% setting. (could be my phone issue...). The camera app is not good enough, and I have to probably use third party apps etc..(Note that I am more than an amateur photographer, and do take event photos for organizations, own a high end DSLR, used a Nokia 1020 before mainly for camera, and so I know how good this camera/software is).6. So I installed Google Now thinking that could be better. Now tells me that it will take 12 minutes to my office on Saturday nights and even on Sundays... Sadly, Google Now lacks basic AI smarts to tie the current time to what I may do at that time. I do not remember seeing such reminders even on Cortana. Cortana used to remind such things only in the mornings.7. Bluetooth software is quite bad. It has issues with disconnecting particularly when you pair it with multiple things (Car, headset), and can't even hear some times.In general usability is poor compared to competition, while the hardware is great.Original review:I actually bought one of these from T-mobile.  Here is a brief take:Pros:1. So beautiful to hold, nice size, finish, glass on both side; especially, the white glass on back looks more like an off-white marble.2. Best display on a smartphone you can buy. Youtube/video streaming is beautiful. But need to really try this with Gear VR accessory once I get it.3. Trimmed down software as promised! no bloatware.4. I love s-health software. It tracks all my walking and running in a day, without having to do any thing special, and measures the pulse when I want it. Quite useful5. While battery capacity is a bit low compared to even S5, this still lasts about a full day (roughly 20+ hours) with lot of email accounts. But then I don't do video streaming that much; I do use facebook and browse a couple of websites, use linked in and a few other apps on a regular basis.6. Blazingly fast. Absolutely no lag for anything.7. Wireless charging.8. Charges fast (in about an hour and a half for full charge, and about 20 minutes for 25% charging). Much, much better than my Galaxy S tab from last year (which takes about 5 to 6 hours for a full charge).9. Ultra power saving mode seems to work well - lasting about 4 or 5 hours with about 10% charge left.10. Finger print on the start button works well.11. The gorilla glass is supposedly scratch-proof but I don't want to test it within a month of buying :). It does seem to be quite solid so far.12. While the camera is good, I am not sure it matches my old Nokia 1020. My quick test does show up a bit grainy when the picture is zoomed, compared to Nokia's photos. This is not by any means a professional comparison though.Cons:1. I miss Cortana/SIRI; I can't get either google or s-voice to work properly. S-voice seems to work only some times, when I have the phone locked. When the phone is unlocked, no issues. But then when you are driving, phone is always locked and can't do voice dialing. This is a big bummer. I hope Samsung fixes s-voice2. Battery cannot be replaced by users.I don't consider the lack of sd  card slot as a big issue - with 32g on board and cloud to back it up...Overall 4.5/5. The best smartphone in the market today, and will be an all-time great if only a few software issues (like good voice dialing) and a bit more picture editing features are avilable.

First taste - tastes almost like a cough syrup! But adding all the other herbs to honey naturally brings that taste.While it is generally known that Manuka honey is famous for anti-bacterial properties and echinacea is for immunity and colds, the medical jury is still out (on echinacea).  I have been using Ricola lemon+echinacea drops for years for sore throats and colds during winter. And I get similar effect on sore throat with this honey as well, almost!The thing that worries me is the addition of Carrageenan and that's the reason for 4 stars..

I have been in the software industry for 25+ years, have used mostly waterfall over the years for many, many system projects, and have found little use for a full scale Agile so far. I see where it can be useful for applications development and for maintenance releases of software. In any case, though I don't need it, I decided to do an official PMP course and this book arrived at the right time! And over the years, I did incorporate some aspects of Agile in to my usual waterfall projects as well, where it makes sense. Reading this book assured me further to use more and more such strategy even if full on Agile won't work for my system projects. (Note that some system projects are so small, but takes a year or two, and a proper Agile becomes an overhead)The things I liked about this book are: not expecting the reader to know Agile (and giving an excellent overview), taking experienced waterfall project managers like me (as well as fresh project managers) from other PM methods to Agile, excellent set of case studies, focus on enterprise level and big projects.Things to improve: better/clear illustrations (bigger print, more colorful).In all, I would recommend this as a first book on Agile to experienced project managers as well as wanna-be-project managers as well. 4.5/5.0

Should probably give less than 3/5 for this.I have been using Skechers slip-ons for the last several years, because they are very comfortable, light, and fit very well.. Not so this time, and the one month is gone so I can't return it either.The trouble is with the back side, heel support. It bites my back of the heel even after a month of use, so after about 30 minutes or so, I can't walk with this shoe.I am going back to my trusted shoes: Go walk  shoes from Skechers and http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B008ZS5RYI/ref=oh_aui_search_detailpage?ie=UTF8&psc=1

While the concept sounded great (and I fell for it..), doesn't work for me; it won't for anybody who really likes a good coffee...Any day, I get better coffee/latte with the cheaper Delonghi espresso maker - http://www.amazon.com/DeLonghi-EC5-Steam-Driven-Espresso-Coffee/dp/B00009RXMQ/ref=sr_1_12?ie=UTF8&qid=1425572816&sr=8-12&keywords=delonghi+espresso+makerWhile this does work, a few issues:1. Difficult to make one cup (milk stays below the rotating wand till some coffee drops down from the top!)2. The plastic base plate has to be cleaned throughly after every use; otherwise your coffee is going to taste worse and worse with every coffee you make.  And if you don't clean between making a coffee latte and chai latte, you get coffee+tea latte. This is ok, I know I have to clean it, but then what purpose does this serve, if it is not going to make anything easier?3. Oh yeah, lots of plastic at the bottom; luckily, the milk doesn't get heated much so it may be ok..When I saw this product introduction, I was really happy to see it (thinking I can be more lazier!), unfortunately that became a dream...And forget the lazy part, the latte you get is not strong enough with the same coffee beans that I use with Delonghi or other Mr. Coffee espresso makers.

Pros:1. Light weight, well made2. Lots of packets, at the right places; enough storage for most things you carry every day..Cons:1. Padded, but not by much; so have to be a bit careful while putting it down on the floor or dropping it!2. Small and so mainly useful for everyday commute; may not be enough for long trips..I love it and use it every day to carry my 14" notebook to office and back...Overall 4.5/5.0

I have an older ear thermometer from another brand that I don't use much (because I can't believe the readings!). I was a bit skeptical while ordering this (a free vine sample, so why not try this once more...).Pleasant surprise.Have to power on, put in the ear, press the start button, and just 2 seconds later you hear a beep, and you have the reading. It is repeatable and as accurate as can be. Both ears need not be exactly at the same temperature and also there can be very slight variations - but never more than 0.1 plus or minus.  In my trial, it did come out to the same number in most cases and definitely the same number on the same ear of the same person over some time lapse...Pros:1. Well made, nice small size, easy to read, good controls; eject button tosses the plastic lens filters cleanly..2. Place to keep the filter pack in the plastic cover, so you don't have to search for replacements in the last minute when you want to use the thermometer!3. Quite accurate, and repeatable measurements.4. Very fast readings - less than 2 seconds.Cons:1. Replacement filters! If multiple people use it, it is good to change the filter and also good to change filter once after every few uses (Braun recommends changing after every use!). Cost of filters and the task of keeping in stock is an issue/con.2. Price of the thermometer.But, considering what is out there, this is best of the bunch and I highly recommend it, particularly if it gets a little more cheaper.Score: 4.5/5

Great value for the money! and a nice one to have around for all odd food prep jobs. I always love having a light, strong and wide blade and this fits the bill perfectly.Pros:1. Great handle; in fact one of the best I have seen amongst the knives I bought over the last 25 years.. Excellent grip and feels nice to touch.2. Quite sharp; I would assume it would lose the sharpness in course of time, but not to worry - can be sharpened again.3. Price is right.Cons: Can't think of any right now...Update: 10/4/2014: Well, not that sharp enough to cut tomatoes; other than that I still like it for cutting other vegetables. I have to use my Shenzen Ceramic knife for tomatoes..

I used it in places like the ones above the kitchen counter top, where I need a lot of light on the table.  I am quite happy with the light - it is cool white as promised (I have had some other brands that claim more than they could!), enough power as promised.Just one issue: the metal ring around the light is not fixed to the light tightly. I used it to screw the bulb in the socket in a narrow opening, and the metal ring starts rotating on its own independently of the light!  Don't know if this is a manufacturing issue or a design issue, but hope they fix this.Other than that, the clearance from the socket - the long threaded base is quite helpful, for fixing this bulb in narrow housings.Overall, I like these, as they serve the purpose at a very reasonable price, and would recommend this brand.

There are quite a lot of things to like about in this headphones and there are obvious issues with it.Pros:1. Excellent materials, fit and finish; wires never get tangled, and stay loose. The magnetic on the side of the earbuds is a nice touch. Once you take the buds off, they nicely stick to gather and stay put cleanly without tangling in the wires. But, I wonder, what is the effect of this magnet on the sound quality? can't say...2. Decent audio quality. I couldn't find much to fault with this. (except the Bass/treble/voice all seem to be set to the normal range and increasing/decreasing a range doesn't have much of an effect, so I believe it does lack in bass/treble  extremes - as you would normally expect a simple, in ear, earphones to. So I am not complaining...)3. Call taking, volume, sound etc are all quite good.So then what is my complaints?Cons:1. Earbud is fully plastic and is made for only some special ears/heads - definitely not for me. The earbuds don't stay in ear! I tried looping it around my ear and even that didn't help. If you can't keep it in your ear for long, what use is that earphone?2. Would be nice to have a small zip bag to go with this, especially when it is advertised as premium earphone!And of course an airline adapter would help too.Amazon has done some nice touches - such as the magnetic earbuds, and even the slim, low profile 3.5 pin that aligns so well with a slim phone is very thoughtful.The wire is great too - it totally stays untangled even if you crumple and stuff it in a small place.  This quality is comparable to the wires of more expensive Bose noice cancelling in-ear earbuds! But the most important part of fitting in the ears and staying in the ear is missed in the design - very unfortunately.Overall: 2.5/5

While the first section of the book is really intended for 'dummies' - things like what to look for when buying a piano/digital keyboard, the later sections cover all the required material all the way from beginner to an intermediate level.  There are several things I like about this book and should have given 5 stars for it, but:1. End of the day, you can't learn everything from a book - need direct practice and some instruction time from a professional teacher (unless you are a born genius, of course!). This book can take you only so far. After that you still need to practice a lot and also get some face time with some pros/teachers.2. More importantly, I feel there are less exercises and simpler examples at the beginning. The toughest part of learning something new is in the basic stages. That part should be really taken slow, with lots and lots examples/exercises. You can never overdo that.  While this book does try to cover a lot of ground, still not enough for the early stage, IMHO.3. Nitpicking: the print for the music could have been a little bit bigger.In spite of that, this is one of the 'must have' books you should have handy, as it provides lot of valuable information, pointers to references for further learning, and website access to all the songs for you to listen and practice while reading this book.For those of you who want to learn without a teacher, there are some software in the market, that can connect your notebook to a digital piano/keyboard through USB/MIDI cables, and such software can guide you real time with playing songs, track if you pressed the right key or not, within the tempo or not, etc.  I believe such a software along with this book will get me more complete instruction than otherwise.

You go in thinking of buying one item and end up buying 10 of those as you can't pass the deal. (and some times get choice words when your spouse sees it :) ). I got the same feeling when I saw this item. I needed only one and saw this deal, couldn't resist.For a change, though, this is really good. Now I get to use different color when I feel like.The covers are good quality, do seem to have good protection (though if you drop from 4th floor it may not stand). Since the covers are made of semi-transparent material, the colors show up lighter than what is shown in the picture here.
