Some are neon colors (orange, green).The cover does fully cover the important part of the phone - the big lens at the back. And has a small lip/edge at the front so the phone rests on the cover when it is put face down.And price is right, fast shipping. What else you want in a cover?

That said, everything comes with some compromises and this one is no exception.I owned (and lost) a QC15 headset; I liked it, but I could use it only for the sake of noise cancelling (while travelling or in a noisy lab at work). If I put it on more than an hour or two, then my ears start aching because of the way the ear cups sit on my head.This one came in as a gift from heaven. I didn't buy this for a long time, just because of the price. Even if it is good, it is still not worth the price at 300 and would have been a good buy at 200 or less. In my opinion that is a fair price for the value you get, especially compared to Beats and Sennheiser and other competitor products.Pros:1. Excellent noise cancelling of most constant noises (such as engine noise, computer fan noise, A/C noise etc) and also reduces overall volume of all other sounds - including people speaking in the vicinity.2. Excellent quality/finish, the cable is of right length and material (doesn't snag/catch on or get tangled).3. Fits nicely on my ear and stays. I have only tried for a couple of hours so far at a time and so far so good.Cons:1. Sound quality is reasonable/OK, but I don't see anything special with this headset compared to the cheap Belkin (http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00EPAVJZ6/) in ear headsets that I use otherwise. If anything, it is a little better, but not worth the price difference.2. Way too expensive.

Pros:1. really slim, but can store a 15" notebook as well as a tablet, power supply etc2. Light weight3. well made, a little stiff padding, so it should protect my computer well...4. reasonable priceCons:1. A little stiff padding! A big issue for me, as putting in and taking out things, when you try to pack more, is a real pain!2. No side mesh bag/holder for a water bottle3. The carrying loop at the top is also very stiff/unyielding type, that it is not so useful..In all, it is an OK bag for carrying just a couple of things - just your notebook and may be one or 2 things more.

Fit and finish - great; the top grain leather look is good. Fits perfectly. has protection for the corners too. Smart case, so closing this case, turns off the display automatically. Has a nice elastic band to keep it shut while not in use.Then why 4 stars? here is why:1. Only available in black for now...2. There is only one position for the stand, unlike 2 or 3 positions for some of the ipad and other tablet cases we have seen in the past.As it happens, the photo shown for this is not the right one! I posted a couple of customer photos for this product that shows the actual cover I got.

I upgraded from a old HP Officejet J6480 all-in-one to this. I was looking for the following:1. Good scanning capability (HP J6480 was one of the best ones when I bought it - excellent scan resolution).2. Wide format printing, so I can print some posters (not all the time though) - old HP was only standard format (up to legal)3. Reasonable printing speed (10+ pages pm) and running cost4. Support for mobile device printing (air print etc..) - my old HP didn't have this(This was bought from Amazon using a different account with a gift card, so it is not shown as 'verified purchase' but I do own this printer and did buy from Amazon).So far after a couple of months of using, I should say, I am more than happy on all counts - with some exceptions (reason for my 4 star rating!).The best I like is the scanning/copying: huge scanning surface 11x19 kind of size (haven't measured the exact size, but it is more than legal size). The feature I like here is the ability to auto fit the image to A4 size for example.One nice/neat trick is to set up your own email address, so you can send print jobs to your printer anywhere from the world through email!The thing I don't like:1. Remote/network software access. HP, for e.g., sports a web page for scanning, so you open up your browser and scan images to your browser and save it locally. Epson, still uses a separate desktop program, called Epson Scan, that lets you connect through network, scan it and save to your computer as a file. This doesn't help much (for e.g. I can't scan something to my android tablet now, which I could do with the ancient HP).Other than this, this is a great printer - excellent build - should last for years.Another thing I noticed is this: My old HP, while printing, will shake the cheapo table it is sitting on. The Epson, while bigger and heavier, doesn't shake the table :) Go figure...Epson is solidly built.

Great finish and quality for this price! Good storage, and the lid is OK (another bench at the same price point I have has issues with the lid opening and closing after some use). Looks really beautiful -with the piano black finish. Seat is comfortable.Assembly was quick - didn't take more than 10-15 minutes, but would have appreciated a proper tool for tightening the nuts. (that's the only negative point about this, the included one is not good). I have my own set of tools and so this didn't matter.  I believe I may have to tighten after some months of use (based on the assembly type of this bench), but then we have to do that for all such assembled furniture anyways.I would highly recommend this bench - for the finish, comfort, and price range.

I replaced a Norelco sensotouch 2D (1150x - http://www.amazon.com/Philips-1150X-46-SensoTouch-Frustration/dp/B006W2SYF8/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1404281741&sr=8-1&keywords=norelco+sensotouch+2d), with this new shaver from Remington - a first Remington in 20 years.Pros: 1. decent shave for the price - good performance for the below-100 price range. A little bit better than sensotouch 2d shavers.2. Less noise while operating than comparable shavers in this price range.3. Well made and should last (except for blade replacements)Cons: not much; but Remington could have made a better shaver than this to make it the BEST value for the money, but it falls short of that; The charger stand is a little weird - can't make it a stand so it is just an extra attachment around the body of the shaver.One thing to note: the Amazon web page doesn't say this: It is a wet shaver as well.The differences between XR1370 shaver and this one are:1. XR1370 has LED % display of charge remaining while this only has red light to indicate low charge level.2. XR1370 holds 60 minute worth of charge compared to 40 minutes of charge for this.Otherwise the 2 models are identical in shaving head etc..Definitely a good shaver for the price range and worth buying if you are budget-conscious. If money is no object, Sensotouch 3D is still the king of rotary shavers, IMHO.Update: 7/25/2014: Reducing the rating to 3/5. Spoke too soon. The heating problem I used to see with the old metal foil shavers 10 years ago is happening with this razor too. After a couple of minutes of use, the razor surface starts feeling warm to the skin. This heating doesn't happen with Norelco rotary shavers and seems to be specific to this model (or to Remington brands).

1:50 MinsUpdate 7/23/2014: reducing to 4/5. Battery life (and charging) is not as good as iPad or for that matter, for a device that costs 500 bucks. A few issues with Android as well (but then I have my own gripes with IOS as well). The microSD slot was hard to use. I use a Transcend 32GB MicroSDHC Class10 UHS-1 Memory Card with Adapter 45 MB/s (TS32GUSDU1E), but it is quite difficult to insert and keep it locked; had to use a tool (I used the microsd adapter!) to push the card in. This card does get recognized and I can use it well.Old Review:My iPad 2 broke and I was looking to buy an (a second one in the household) ipad air; got this at the right time, and am in tablet heaven...I did try a Dell Venue 8" - my first android tab - a while ago and it was a disaster (turns out there are display and hardware issues with that model). So when I got this, I was a bit skeptical - only for the first 10 minutes, though!Let us get to details then...Summary of differences with ipad:1. MicroSD slot! (up to 128Gb capacity)2. Better and bigger display3. 3GB memory for running applications (compared to 1GB)4. Camera 8MP compared to 5MP5. Fingerprint sensor!Size and handling: At 10.5, it is bigger than ipad air. Even thinner than iPad at 0.26 inches; smooth surfaces, and as with iPad Air, it is a bad idea to handle this beauty without a case; it is quite easy to drop these, and they are not made to hold in hand for long hours without a cover, either. So, please buy a good cover to go with this.Display: At 2560x1600 it is about 25+% more than iPad air in terms of resolution (287ppi compared to 264ppi) - and it shows! Beautiful Super AMOLED display beats out the LED displays. It is reported that AMOLED displays are usually not bright enough, but on this model, it is more than enough - even in bright outdoors. The settings entry for brightness has an 'auto' mode, but that doesn't seem to work fully well (an android issue or Samsung issue), and it is still bright in the night. I had to turn off auto and reduce the brightness manuallly for night time viewing! The display is gorgeous, to say the least, and the best part of this tablet.Battery and charging: Battery life is quite adequate at about 8+ hours ( I did run through several episodes of burn notice with netflix streaming on one charge). Charging with the included charger does take longer than I expected - several hours for full charge. In addition, there is ultra power saving mode you can turn on from 'settings -> General' menu - this mode takes you to a black and white screen mode and allows basic web surfing, email and a few application that you can choose to add.  In this mode, it can last quite a few hours with just 10% charge remaining.Bloatware: Contrary to some review, there is some bloatware that is pre-installed but not much. There are two boxes that show up in the second screen - Galaxy essentials and galaxy gifts. If you go in to this, you get to choose what bloatware you want :) But there are some good ones such as wall street journal or Economist 3 month subscriptions for free, GQ and other free issues, as well as some free games.There are 2 apps - Samsung Level (for the soon-to-be-released Samsung headphones - to compete with Beats..) and Samsung Gear - pre-installed.Camera: 8MP for the back camera with a flash compared to just 5 MP in iPad - seems good. But this is the only feature that was ordinary in Samsung tablet. The pictures in auto mode doesn't look as good as a normal (cheapo) 8MP digital camera photos in auto mode - even to an untrained eye. (I put a Canon EOS 7D to good use and I can spot a good camera when I see one; sadly this is not one of those..), but it is adequate; so is the front camera at 2 MP.WIFI - comparable; both support a/b/g/n dual band MIMO, but Samsung also supports 'ac'. Quite easy to setup/connect to home networks. So far there is not one hiccup with the wireless access. Excellent performance.CPU - While iPad only has A7 ARM cores, Samsung has 4 A7 cores and 4 A15 cores; it claims it switches the cores depending on the need/usage/power requirements. For all practical purposes, it is fast; there is some lag but not serious lag in using multiple apps and notifications and background tasks going on.Fingerprint sensor: It is all how you train (give samples) the sensor! It takes 8 samples to setup, and so use your finger in slightly different angles - tilting your finger a little from left to right before each sample. Settings screen and fingerprint setup also allows you to setup an alternate password in case you can't get through with your fingerprint. In addition you can always unlock with your google account. I am able to use the finger sensor almost without any failure so far and found this this to be way better than the one I have on my Dell Lattitude notebooks.Audio: has 2 speakers one on each side (unlike ipad air), and the audio is decent for this price, though I prefer to use earbuds for better sound.Watch On app and the IR capability: while new for Samsung, the app is still not ready; has several issues. It let me add my Denon receiver, dish receiver, sony bluray and panasonic tv etc., but I can't turn off or control all devices individually (no selection for device). Only volume, channel change etc work! Power button asks what device you want to power off - again didn't list bluray or receiver - only my TV and Dish. I hope this will get fixed as the app improves. But basic IR facility is great - worked from a distance of 20+ ft across the room.I absolutely love this. In terms of hardware, it scores a 10/10; fit and finish is great and I would expect this to last at least another 6 to 8 years (unless the technology obsoletes this hardware - which it will...); Apple has been trounced from the tablet throne with this entry.

While the watch settings interface is just OK, it can be improved. For e.g. a single setup button with sub-menus for various things instead of different buttons for different functionality is a little confusing. I had to read the manual to set this watch and use it. (Unless you use it regularly, you will forget the instructions so please keep the manuals around!).Good concept and Casio's partial answer to such accessories as Samsung's Gear Fit, Wahoo's Tickr and other sensors. In addition to these sensors, Casio goes one up and allows music control on the iphone.Pros: 1. Fitness and music control through bluetooth, along with traditional digital watch functions in one package - useful if you want to avoid having too many accessories around2. Price is rightCons: 1. Difficult to setup and use; while several features exist, this watch is not the best in class for those features.2. A little too big and heavy; could have been thinner and lighterAs for music control, my iphone headphones (with bluetooth) can do the skip/advance/rewind features better than this watch.As a digital watch with the usual features (stop watch, world/multiple time zones, alarms, 12/24 hour format etc) Casio excels - as always. In the end, this will be useful for those who like to wear a watch most of the time, and uses iphone/ipod touch...

I don't toss around much, but do turn to the side (either side) once in a while. This pillow seems to be better than my previous 2 standard pillow combination.Pros:1. Definitely good for neck pain and shoulder pain issues. I am getting sound sleep after switching to this pillow.2. Well made, good cover materials.Cons:1. smell; goes away after a couple of days of 'airing' (keep it out for a couple of days, or run through dryer), though.2. It is foam (polyurethane?) so it does hold some heat after some time. If somebody come up with a really 'cool' pillow, that will be great. This is not it. At the same time, it doesn't get too hot as well. Just OK.3. Good for sleeping on your back; not good for side sleepers.3. Price can be a little lower.

Pros: 1. Price can't be beat2. Quality and construction, finish3. Protection: all four corners and back are covered well. Front screen also won't touch the ground if it falls; should protect normal falls.Cons:1. The side plastics are all smooth and so there is not much grip while handling the phone. If only there was a rib on the sides (or at least not smooth finish on the sides), this will be the best cover for LG Optimus F3.This one bad feature (too slippery to hold) has made me give 4 star for this instead of 5 stars.  Usability is really key for consumer products and manufacturers should pay attention to issues like this.Update: After 6 months of use I love it; it is rock solid; upgrading to 4 stars

Going under the sink to fix bathroom/kitchen issues, attic/crawl space work? This light is enough to help you get around.Pros:1. Bright enough; the center light is the brightest for spot lighting and detail work - as it should be.2. Easy to put on and staysCons:1. Not sure if the elastic will hold the weight of the light fixture after a couple of months! Would have appreciated a plastic (with cloth/felt like exterior) front with just a little elastic at the back  or one with a fully adjustable plastic which may last. The elastic band looks as if it will sag with the weight. (Reason for 4 stars instead of 5).

By the time I got this product, I lost my second phone an iphone 5. The product page says "iphone or android" and I have a Nokia 1020. No harm in trying, so I tried with that and it works beautifully!Turns out that the technology is based on induction (no wifi/BT or other technologies that require software on the phone to connect to this speaker), and so in theory, it should work with most any phone.While the product page also says you can use for talking (skype, chat/conference etc), the microphone is the phone's. This product is only a speaker and doesn't have any additional microphones.Pros:1. Compact, well made (marked "designed in Detroit, made in china"), nice angle and solid non-slip feet to keep on desk.2. No need for power cable or for batteries. Built-in charging is supposed to last for 7 hours (haven't tested that yet, only for an hour or so..)3. As the claim goes, no need to pair, or connect. Just place the phone on the speaker, and play! If you take the phone out, speaker stops immediately. Can't get simpler than this.4. Excellent volume, sound quality. Great for phone, and ok for Radio/music5. Reasonable price for what it offers.Cons:Why 4 stars?? I did hear some static when I was not playing anything on the phone! But the static was very low volume compared to the music playing. I guess that's because of the technology, but then some noise reduction technique could have been applied to this to avoid static like this.I can definitely use it while I am working on my desk and I love it.

Most low cost furniture is particle board but this is even lower quality.I made a big mistake of buying furniture online and will never do it. But now I don't want to put in more effort to dismantle and send it back either..Pros: 1. Packed well; all required parts were there; and good instructions; while there are no wheels, it has nice legs with the right plastic foot attachments that make it glide on wood floor without marking.that's all I can think of...Cons: 1. too flimsy. Lifting the top makes the entire table move (and may topple too..), because the table is light but the spring hardware is more powerful for this size table! And while lifting the top, the top wobbles a bit.2. Slightly smaller dimensions than what I was looking for; the height after lifting the top is still low; and the length/width of the table is also a bit small. So please check the dimensions before you buy...3. The finish is cheap - you can obviously make it out to be a low quality furniture. The picture in Amazon website is a bit misleading...4. Pricey. IMHO, it is only worth 50 dollars..but If I had seen this a physical store on display, I wouldn't have bought this.I am also surprised at the good reviews here for this product. I have used a couple of Sauder products in the past and had been happy with that, but this one doesn't qualify...

For those who wear layered clothing even for fall (and those who don't live in Florida) this can be a good shirt to wear for slightly chill/cold weather.  Keeps you warm and in style!Pros:1. Well made, quality you can trust from Van Huesen..2. Fit and style (a little conservative but elegant)Cons:1. Price; If you can get it for 25 bucks or less, it is a great buy - buy immediately!This is one of my favorite shirts now..

Almost perfect!Pros:1. Well made, doesn't look cheap, light2. doesn't require batteries or charging (hopefully ever)3. Good keyboard, very useable for somebody who can type (of course useful for those who poke at the keyboard too)4. Pairs easily without any trouble with ipad 25. Got it at a reasonable priceCons:1. The auto off when I close the cover doesn't seem to work correctly. Since I kept the auto off disabled, the closing also didn't work correctly, though it made the 'appropriate' noises when I close the cover, as if it is putting the ipad to sleep. The setting in ipad did say "auto lock when closed", and I do see that the display goes off when I close carefully, but doesn't seem to stay that way till I open again.  Now I switch off manually when I close the lid.

Perfect for Kitchen, laundry etc.Pros:1. Well made, very comfortable, relieves stress2. Easy to clean (with a damp cloth or paper towel)3. Doesn't slip on wooden floor much (can move a little, but enough to warrant anti-slip below).4. Brown color goes well with the Oak wood floorsCons:1. If at all, it can be a little more affordable.I did buy a previous version of NewLife/GelPro a while back from Amazon, and when I saw this I couldn't pass up the opportunity to add one more. It is that good.4.5 stars.

I replaced a CFL PAR30 recessed lighting over the kitchen with this - and what a change!Pros:1. Looks beautiful in a recessed lighting (while, like all LEDs this has strange fins on the side, they don't show in a recessed setting).2. Excellent lighting - does give 40 degree wide coverage instead of the usual spot light we get with LEDs; pretty useful/workable for my counter work.3. Bright, more natural light; does look like 75-90W4. Excellent packaging; looks well made, though have to wait and see how long this lasts (20 years as claimed?? I will post an update in 2033 if you are willing to wait)5. Price is comparable and on the lower side by the time I write this review. (I do see more expensive ones in Lowe's)Cons:1. Packaging! While it is packaged very well, it was a bit difficult to take it out of packaging; just a minor annoyance.In all, I am very happy with this product and will buy more when it comes time to replace other bulbs in the house.

For carrying a DSLR (Canon EOS 7D) and a couple of lenses, filters, caps, for local trips, this is a fantastic bag. If you want to travel with this bag (airlines, long distance, public transportation etc) and worry about safety, then this bag can only contain a little bit in the zippered area - one body+ 2 smaller lenses or 1 big+1 small lens and a purse, passport etc. So usefulness of this bag depends on your needs.Pros:1. Several slots/openings/storage areas around the bag, that can contain lenses, caps, filters, batteries etc, when you are changing equipment in a hurry while shooting.2. Inside padded storage to protect body and lenses when you travel outside.3. Extendable; you can open the zipper on the long strap side (right side of the picture shown here) for more storage inside the bag.4. Very convenient for using either as a shoulder bag or cross belt style.5. Excellent quality, finish.6. Reasonable priceCons: except for this one, can't think of anything else:1. Couldn't put in 7D body with a long zoom lens (70-200mm L f4) in the padded storage area and zip it easily. Having the camera ready with a lens is a must for anyone who wants to take candid and quick shots at a moment's notice.

The best can opener you can buy.Pros:1. Excellent operation; ease of use. no spills,no ragged edges after opening, very clean cut of the lid.2. Looks/finish is way higher for a product at this price range3. Price/value; you can't beat it.Cons:None I can see so far.I only use it with standard food cans and haven't used it with bigger cans. But I love using this to open a can. (opening the can is more fun than eating afterwards :) )

If the scalp gets too dry and starts itching just one application of a couple of drops stops that immediately. For dry hair and scalp this is the best and SAFEST medicine you can buy with money. Fragrance free and the best part of this oil? it is not oily!I use it after bath for scalp/hair moisturizing purposes, once in a few days and it is doing wonders. It can also be used as oil treatment before bath.

It is just 1ft by 1ft (12 inches), so it can only accommodate a single large dinner plate (or similar size plate).Well made, folds nicely in to a very small package for storing when not in use.The embroidered lace on the sides is a plus, so that it reaches out to the floor and covers without leaving any gap for insects. We can also place some weights on the lace to keep the tent in place outdoors if it is windy outside.Well packaged, shipped on time, great for the money. An excellent product. If you want to sun-dry food and want to cover them with a food tent, then this is for you.

Pros:1. Nice, good looking set of cups2. Excellent price/value3. Right size - not too big and not too small - holds about 10 oz. without spilling.Cons:1. The stand is too flimsy and seems to be shaking a bit. Not sure if it will fall off anytime. It also keeps the cups too close so you have to be careful in handling this.2. Cups get hot quite easily - just pouring hot water in to it (not heating with it) makes the cup hot outside! So it may not be good for heating/microwaving for longer duration (say more than a minute or 2).For the money, it is definitely worth it. Not sure if it will last thought (only time will tell). It has been a month now and so far so good.

I was hoping this could replace my WaterPik, particularly for traveling; and it didn't live up to that expectation.While this product looks good, well made, has enough water pressure etc there are a few issues:1. It works well if you have an orderly set of teeth with uniform, nice (even if very small) gap between teeth. Otherwise, it ends up hitting the spray on teeth and the back pressure of that forces the tip away. Our own involuntary action will push the tip back resulting in hitting the gum/teeth with the plastic tip. It may take quite some practice to get used to this issue. Since WaterPik uses a constant jet, it is not such an issue with it.2. This only helps to clean between teeth while WaterPik helps in cleaning the area near the gum or things stuck in molars.3.The water pressure is not adjustable. It may be too much or too little for some.Overall WaterPik cleans better.Biggest benefit is that it is made for travelling - with its size and need for very little water storage.  And the fact that it can use the same charger as other Sonicare line of tooth brushes.

It has been about 10 days and now I do see a few popping out of the pot soil. Tulsi doesn't usually require lot of water. It just needs some once in a while (water when the soil is just about drying out).Excellent, on time shipping.This variety of Tulsi has several medicinal properties, chief among them being increasing body resistance to colds/flu etc. I will post an update if these seeds grow well and survive in about a month from now.I did get another packet of the normal holy basis (just green variety, not the dark one, from a local gardener) almost at the same time, but that has grown quite well in the same time period. That's the reason for my comment on the slow growth of these seeds.
Got this for my son as a gift as he likes Webkinz. He's happy so am I, no issues, it is what it is.
Got this to replace fan that died in Dell Optiplex, fits fine, just like the original, no complaints here.

I actually bought this for a job I was working on for a friend. I needed a bracket that could withstand being inside of an automatic car wash with soap, water etc as the original metal one we used rusted and fell apart.So far this one works fine, since it's plastic it won't rust which is exactly what we needed.For what it is, it's fine, great for outdoor use.
I have an older Makita grinder and this part was lost, couldn't find it locally but I found it here at a great price. My grinder works just like new now, I'm happy with purchase for sure..

No problems, fit my washer just fine, I now have a working washing machine so I'm happy.Be warned it's not something for maybe the average person to install, it can take time and effort and the right tools to get the job done correctly.

Got this for my son for boy scouts and it fell apart after just a few uses.The light top feel off and he lost part of it.The covering fell off the knife, it's just not good quality at all.Spend a little extra money and get something name brand really.

Well made overall.Locks tight to keep things out and keep cakes fresher.I used the cupcake insert and it works but not really for traveling, they're just not deep enough to hold cupcakes in place and steady. I don't use the cupcake insert at all, I really got this as a needed a new cake cover and for that it works just fine.
My son takes Viola so I got these for him as he needed new ones.No problems, fit fine, he's happy with them.

The packaging is nice looking and inside you’ll find the candle placed in a large piece of styrofoam with another piece on top and then the candles themselves are wrapped in a think layer of plastic for further protection. Once you get everything unpacked you’ll find the three candles, user guide and remote control. The candles are three different heights at 5, 6 and 7 inches tall and they’re all about 3 inches across.They’re made of wax, at least part of them is, the outer shell or layer is real wax giving them the look and feel of a real candle. The candles have a plastic flame in the centers that moves or flickers like a real flame does and gets illuminated by the LED inside to simulate a real candle look. The battery compartments are on the bottoms of the candles along with the main power switch. Each candle needs three AAA batteries for power which are not included.There’s just one remote control that controls all of the candles at the same time. The remote is small and it uses a button or watch style battery which is included for you. The remote has ten buttons for power, timer, mode and dimming. You can set the timer for 2, 4, 6 or 8 hours and it works on a 24 hour cycle meaning if you turn it on for 2 hours at 1pm it will stay on for 2 hours and then go off until 1pm the next day and come back on again for 2 hours and repeat the cycle until you change it.  The modes are candle and light, candle mode is where the flame moves and the LED is on, light mode is the LED flickering but the flame doesn’t move. The dimmer buttons are self-explanatory really.When you power the candles on they do look very real in the low light and especially in the dark. The moving flame makes it look even more real and they’re fairly bright, they would make for nice ambiance or just a nightlight for the hallway. The Comenzar LED candles are a great product for sure, I like them a lot, and this three pack is less expensive than buying all three individually.The remote can control all three candles at the same time which is nice for convenience sake but if you want to control them individually you can’t, to me it doesn’t mater much as I like all three on at the same time. The candles look and feel real thanks to the wax outer layer, in the dark you can’t tell unless you get up close.I have to say I’ve reviewed a lot of these candles lately and I do like them, they’re neat and they do look real. The others I’ve reviewed I’ve given away as gifts and those people were very happy with them but this set of three I’ll be keeping for myself!Pros:+One remote to control all three+Looks like real candle when lit or on+Less expensive than buying individually+Timer and remote control with numerous functions+Real wax, feels like real candleCons:-No scent like a real candleDisclosure: This product was given to me for review by the company for review purposes only for free or at a discounted price, and is not considered by me as payment for the review. My reviews are honest and unbiased regardless of how I received the product. I never have and will never accept payments for reviews from companies, for me there is no difference in reviewing a free or purchased product since all products are treated the same.

The mandoline comes packaged well with bubble wrap for protection. This is a mandoline and a storage box, all the accessories are shipped in the box. Once you get everything unpacked you’ll find a bag with three blades in it, safety food guide, clear box, peeler and the mandoline itself.They do include a free bonus peeler but it’s really cheaply made, the whole handle crushes when you squeeze it. The safety guide or food holder as they call it isn’t the best as the metal prongs stick out farther than they need to and once you get so far down on the food as you’re cutting the prongs scrape the plastic mandoline and scratch it and scrap pieces off into your food. Not good at all.There are four blades included, three on the side and one already installed for you. You’ll get a two grating blades, big and small, a flat blade and a julienne blade. The blades are very hard to get off and on to switch them, I’ll be honest, I was afraid I was going to cut myself while trying to switch the blades out. It’s just too difficult to switch them out and not safe at all.The main part, of the actual mandoline isn’t the best quality at all. There are extra pieces of plastic hanging off of it in various places, it just looks really unfinished and it feels flimsy overall.You’re supposed to be able to adjust the thickness of your cut with a dial or wheel on the top near the handle but it’s virtually impossible to move at all. It just won’t move at all with one finger or two or however I try to turn it. When it first arrived it moved slightly, very hard to turn, but after using it only twice it won’t turn anymore at all. I only used it to get some potatoes and then some carrots, and there’s nothing it, it’s clean but yet the dial will no turn. If you can’t turn the dial then you can’t adjust the thickness which means you basically can’t use the mandoline anymore unless you get it stuck on a thickness you always want to use… So it worked twice for me and now I can’t use it anymore. The deck or surface has adjustment lines on it so you can gauge the thickness of the cuts when adjusting it but they really don’t line up with anything at all so they’re useless.This is one of those products that I wanted to like and was kind of excited about but it was just a letdown really.The quality is bad, there’s extra pieces of plastic hanging off it, and it just feels cheaply made and flimsy.The blades are very hard to change to the point where it’s safety issue.The adjustment dial was very hard to turn when it first arrived, and now it’s impossible to turn at all, it’s stuck, frozen where it is. It’s clean, there’s nothing in it to stop it from moving, it just won’t move anymore, so the mandoline is rather useless at this point.I’m sorry, overall the Brieftons Mandoline is just a bad product really. Bad design and bad quality controls make it something I would never want in my kitchen or anyone else’s either.As of now it’s going in the garbage, none of it is worth salvaging. My advice, spend a little extra money and get a decent metal mandoline if you’re serious about getting one.I don't understand how this product got 5 star reviews, in all my years of reviewing thousands of products, this has got to be one of the worst I've ever seen. I don't think the 5 star reviewers actuality tested it and used it honestly, unless they got really lucky and got a perfect product.Pros:+Sharp blades+Container to collect cut food+Interchangeable bladesCons:-Very hard to turn thickness dial, now dial won’t move at all-Feels flimsy-Very hard and dangerous to switch blades-Thickness guide is pointless, doesn’t match anything-Peeler is very flimsy and cheaply made-Unfinished, extra pieces of plastic hanging off-Metal prongs stick out too far, scrape mandolinDisclosure: This product was given to me for review by the company for review purposes only for free or at a discounted price, and is not considered by me as payment for the review. My reviews are honest and unbiased regardless of how I received the product. I never have and will never accept payments for reviews from companies, for me there is no difference in reviewing a free or purchased product since all products are treated the same.

I love Scif-fi, it's probably my most favorite genre of movies with horror and sci-fi/horror coming up next.I like sci-fi because of what it can be, it takes you somewhere where you want to go or where you can possibly go.Mars is where it's at now and Red Planet is a great movie, sure it's not going to win any Oscars but I like sci-fi that shows what can be. Yes it might stretch the imagination a bit and yes it didn't get the greatest reviews of ratings, but I liked it. The movie has a bit of everything, technology, military and they even throw God and religion in the mix and it makes for a movie that's not sure where it's going I think, it's a hodgepodge or things tossed in together but I like it, it's about 2 hours of time I can just sit back and forget about real life.2010 is the sequel to 2001 and it was made way after the original and you can tell. The movie is very much different that the original. 2001 was a great movie but it was slow and rather artsy, but 2010 is more modern and I like it better than the original for the effects and just all of it really. It's a movie that moves at a much faster pace then the original but yet it helps to answer some questions from the original that were left unanswered.Contact was based on a Carl Sagan novel and it's not bad. The pacing is a bit slow at times and there are some things I wish they would have delved into more, but overall it wasn't bad.For three decent sci-fi movies, this collection is well worth the price.

The styli come packaged in a heavy duty zip style bag and each is individually wrapped. The pens are mostly black with a colored accent on the tops under the clip. There is red, green, blue, light blue and yellow in the pack. The stylus is on the front and there’s a hole in the center of it where the pen tip comes out when you push the back down. The ink in the pens is black and it seems to write just fine.I used the stylus primarily with my Samsung Galaxy S6 and it worked fine, just like any other I’ve got. I also tried it with a Win10 tablet and an Android tablet, again, fine, no issues.As a stylus these aren’t bad at all I think, they worked fine with my phone and tablets. As a pen it writes well but it’s too lightweight for me personally, I like something that is a little bit heavier. I’ve tested all of them actually and they all write, no issues there.I’m also not sure about the pen/stylus combination where the pen tip comes out of the stylus. Sure it’s convenient but if you happen to forget you’ll be using the pen tip on your phone or tablet. They’re not bad, but they’re not perfect. For the price, they’re decent, at about a dollar each, that’s not bad.Pros:+Write well+Good as stylus on phone or tabletCons:-Very lightweightDisclosure: This product was given to me for review by the company for review purposes only for free or at a discounted price, and is not considered by me as payment for the review. My reviews are honest and unbiased regardless of how I received the product. I never have and will never accept payments for reviews from companies, for me there is no difference in reviewing a free or purchased product since all products are treated the same

The brush comes packaged in a thick vinyl bag with a note card that has some specs and information about the brush on it. The brush has blue/purple semi-clear plastic handle with a hook on the end and then a wire reinforced top with yellow bristles. The brush is about 9.5 inches long from the hook to the tips of the bristles, about half is handle and half is brush.I’ve been using the brush to clean dishes and pots and pans as you’re supposed to and it works great. The bristles are thick and semi-ridged, they’re ridged enough to scrub and get dirt or food particles off but yet soft enough that they won’t scratch anything. The brush does a great job at cleaning in my opinion. The handle fits in your hand comfortably and offers a good grip on the brush.This is the perfect brush for cleaning my coffee pot. The pot I have is a thermos insulated style as I don’t like the ones that have the heater on the bottom that essentially cooks your coffee all the time so it’s larger that a normal pot. This brush allows me to get right in there and really scrub the pot and all around the edges and inside of the threads for the lid. The brush is also excellent for the filter basket as it has raised sections in it all around in lines radiating from the center point. I can use a regular sponge/scrubby but it takes more work, this brush gets right in there and cleans it efficiently.The only real issue I can see with this brush is the hook on the back, it’s just plastic so I’m not sure how long it will last. It hasn’t broken yet, but only time will tell if it lasts. Yes I do have it hanging up, I found the perfect spot in my kitchen near the sink for it.So far the Amazer brush is a decent product, and it works, again, only time will tell as to its longevity, but as of now I like it.Pros:+Seems well made so far+Works great+Comfortable to useCons:-Not sure about hook, just plastic, might not lastDisclosure: This product was given to me for review by the company for review purposes only for free or at a discounted price, and is not considered by me as payment for the review. My reviews are honest and unbiased regardless of how I received the product. I never have and will never accept payments for reviews from companies, for me there is no difference in reviewing a free or purchased product since all products are treated the same.

The tongs ship in just a basic brown box with the Ohuhu logo on it and inside you’ll just find the tongs and that’s it. You don’t need anything else, if you don’t know what tongs are for or how to use them then I don’t think you need to be buying them…These tongs are about 12 inches long and they’re made of stainless steel and they do feel well made. They do have some weight to them but not as much as you’d expect from something made of stainless.On the back end you’ll find a rubber coated ring which is part of the locking mechanism. You pull it out to lock and push in to unlock and the hole in the ring handy as you can hang them up out of the way. The bottom of the tongs is slightly rounded and curved upward and inward to make it easier to pick things up and to grip them. The upper half of the tongs has a rubber grip to make sure you keep a hold of them. They have a good grip like the name suggests.I use tongs all the time in the kitchen, these are useful for many things and I think they’re like the second or third most used item in my kitchen besides knives and spoons or spatulas. I have several pairs of tongs actually of varying sizes. Some of the tongs I have are with ends that are coated in silicone but sometimes I don’t want that, and these from Ohuhu are not coated so they do have a place in my kitchen.These tongs are very well made and they’re nice and long. They’re not coated so I wouldn’t use them in a non-stick pan but they’d be great for grabbing things out of the oven or BBQ or numerous other uses.Coated and non-coated tongs are useful and I like to have both type in my kitchen.Pros:+Well made+Nice and long+Easy lock and unlock+Rubber gripsCons:-None reallyDisclosure: This product was given to me for review by the company for review purposes only for free or at a discounted price, and is not considered by me as payment for the review. My reviews are honest and unbiased regardless of how I received the product. I never have and will never accept payments for reviews from companies, for me there is no difference in reviewing a free or purchased product since all products are treated the same.

The packaging is a white box with a window on the front showing the LED light which is held in a plastic tray inside of the box. On the back of the box is basic specs and directions. There are no instructions inside of the box, just the light.The LEDs have a USB port on the end and then the LED light on the other. They’re a little more than 6 1/2” long to the end of the USB connection and about 3/4” at the widest point. They’re covered with silicone and available in several different colors and they’re rather stiff so you can bend them and they’ll stay in that position to keep the light where you want or need it.The bottom is the LED light, it looks just light a large white panel and it’s about 1 3/4” inches long and about 1/2” wide. The top of the light has a piece of metal that acts like a heatsink for the LED so it can get warm to the touch, actually it can get very hot after an extended period of time.There is no on/off switch, you just plug it in and it comes on, unplug it and it turns off. The LEDs are very bright, you can’t look into them without hurting your eyes.My keyboard has USB ports on it but it doesn’t light up. I plugged this LED into one of the ports and it provides more than enough light to light up the keyboard to use it at night.On the back of the box one of the suggestions is to use it with an external battery charger and I tried it with one of mine and it worked fine. The battery is portable and so is the light, combine them and you’ve got a handy flashlight for sure. If you gout camping or hiking chances are you’ll take an external battery with you, I ‘d take one of these little lights as well to use as a lamp or in an emergency.I have a USB adapter or charger in the car and I tried in there and it worked fine, I was thinking of keeping on in the car for emergency uses as it might come in handy.I’ll be honest here, I like these lights a lot, I’ve found myself using them all the time for all sorts of reasons.It’s basically a flashlight but what I like is the fact that it can be powered from any USB source so you can use it to turn any external battery pack into a light.They seem well made overall and they’re very flexible but stiff to make sure they stay in the position you want then to for light where you need it.You can use this light for computer work, camping, hiking or just as a flashlight.One small issue is that it can get hot, as long as you keep that in mind you’ll be fine. I haven’t gotten burned as I paid attention to how I grabbed it, but of course I touched it our of curiosity and it can get hot, very hot after extended use and you could potentially get burned. If you’re going to grab it chances are you aren’t going to grab it by the light, it’s like any other USB device, you grab or pull by the connector, so yes it gets hot but I don’t seem a real issue honestly.Pros:+Very bright+Flexible to most any angle any way+Numerous uses+Great for emergency uses or taking camping with you and just about anything you can think ofCons:–Can get very hot on topDisclosure: This product was given to me for review by the company for review purposes only for free or at a discounted price, and is not considered by me as payment for the review. My reviews are honest and unbiased regardless of how I received the product. I never have and will never accept payments for reviews from companies, for me there is no difference in reviewing a free or purchased product since all products are treated the same.

The drop cloth comes packaged in just a plastic bag, but that's fine as it's not fragile, in fact it's very heavy.The material is an off white color, more of a beige look to it maybe. The material is thick, you can't see through it at all and the stitching is thick. You can walk on it and you'll be fine as it shouldn't rip or tear at all.The drop cloth is actually divided into three sections vertically along the cloth with stitching there as well to hold it together.The cloth is large at 12 feet by 15 feet so it should cover most rooms in the average house and it won't have any problem covering furniture and other objects.The cloth is thick and should absorb paint drops or small spills and not soak through.Drop cloths are used to protect and this one should do a good job, but you don't have to use it just for painting, you can use it as a dust cover or even to protect your couch from your pets. This cloth does look very nice and it's presentable, it's not a very rough material, it's semi-soft really.The material used is called 8oz cotton duck or linen canvas and a quick bit of research shows that 8oz cotton duck is considered a medium weight material but it feels heavyweight like the description says it is.The big issue I have with it is that I don't think it's going to fit in my washing machine as it's so large, but that just has nothing to do with the product itself, but it's something you might need to know if you were interested in a large drop cloth.I like it, I'm glad I got it as it will get a lot of use as I do have some remodeling to get done around the house and I usually use old blankets which aren't the best, a real drop cloth is what you need, it's what really does the job to protect your floors or furniture from paint, dust, dirt etc.Disclosure: This product was given to me for review by the company for review purposes only for free or at a discounted price, and is not considered by me as payment for the review. My reviews are honest and unbiased regardless of how I received the product. I never have and will never accept payments for reviews from companies, for me there is no difference in reviewing a free or purchased product since all products are treated the same.

The case comes in a clear plastic box and it’s available in many different colors, I got what they call Gray/Camel which the outer covering is a gray canvas color. It’s a diary style case with a magnetic latch on the front. It’s made of canvas and synthetic leather on the outside and it feels well made really.When you open the case the left side has three credit card or id slots and under those is a larger pocket where you can put money or receipts etc. The right side is where you’ll put the phone and it’s made of a TPU or silicone rubber. The top two slots are nice and wide but the third one is very tight, I really couldn’t fit my card in it, it would only go in about half way.The phone fits well the case, you basically just push it in. The case allows access to all ports and buttons and the cut out on the back is nice and large as not to interfere with the camera. The case does offer decent protection for the phone inside and it holds it well.The diary can act like a stand, the case inside is only partly attached and  the back cover folds to make the phone stand up in landscape mode. One small issue here is that I really haven’t even used the case, about a week or so everyday and on the back is very noticeable and rather ugly crease where the case folds to make the stand. I can only assume that as time goes by the crease will get even more noticeable and more ugly as that’s what’s happening already.The Goospery Diary case is a decent case to help protect your phone and allow you to travel light.The case does offer good protection for your phone and access to all ports and buttons.The case isn’t perfect though, there is a not so great looking crease on the back that seems to be getting worse as time goes on. I don’t think the crease does anything to stop the case from protecting your phone, but it just doesn’t look good at all. The crease isn’t that noticeable but it’s become more noticeable as time passes and I’m afraid it’s only going to get worse.Pros:+Well made case+Decent protection+Can just carry phone, id and cards in one caseCons:-Unsightly crease on back of case-Money needs to be folded to fitDisclosure: This product was given to me for review by the company for review purposes only for free or at a discounted price, and is not considered by me as payment for the review. The box is nice looking with a big picture of the battery pack on the front and some basic specs listed on the back. Inside you’ll find the battery wrapped in a soft plastic for protection and then there’s a user guide and thank you care included.The power bank is black and silver in color with a single button on the top for power and a small LED next to it. The led lights up red for charging and green for power. The charger is about 5.25 inches long and about 1.25 inches at its widest point towards the back near the power button. The battery inside is 2800Mah in capacity and it’s big in size, I have smaller portable packs that are larger in capacity that this is. Part of the size is the car adapter and whatever circuitry is is inside of course, but it just seems big for such a small capacity. On the back end you’ll find two USB ports that are colored red, you can charge two things at the same time if you wanted to.I charged the battery pack in my car and charged my phone at the same time and it seemed to work just like any other car charger I have. You need to charge the battery of course in your car before you can use it and that’s fine as you just plug it in while you’re driving and it will charge as you’re on the go. I tested the battery pack and it worked fine with my Samsung Galaxy S6 phone. I measured it and it was only producing about 3 watts at about .6 amps. Yes it’s not a fast charger at all, but it will work in an emergency to power your devices for sure. The battery is only 2800mAh in capacity and the Galaxy S6 has a 2550mAh battery so I could charge it fully at least once with the battery pack.The battery charger combination is a neat product in my opinion, I’ve never seen anything like it before and I think it can be very useful.It does have some small issues though, like it’s slow to charge and it’s rather large for the small capacity of the battery.Yes it can be useful though, it can be great in an emergency, use it to charger your phone while on the go and leave it in your car so you then have a emergency battery supply. The charger does seem well made overall and for what it is it’s not a bad product overall.Pros:+Useful combination product+Dual USB ports+Dual use car charger and battery in oneCons:-Slow charge-Large size for capacityDisclosure: This product was given to me for review by the company for review purposes only for free or at a discounted price, and is not considered by me as payment for the review. My reviews are honest and unbiased regardless of how I received the product. I never have and will never accept payments for reviews from companies, for me there is no difference in reviewing a free or purchased product since all products are treated the same.

So I purchased another inexpensive one of these and very much regretted it as soon as I opened the package, so I had to buy another one and I settled on this one and I'm very happy with this purchase.I use these for actual shower curtains and not just a liner as I like the clear to let extra light in, so this is my shower curtain, I've been been doing this for most of my life actually, using clear liners as curtains.This one has magnets/weights at the bottom to keep it in place and it also has metal grommets or metal reinforced holes at the top so it won't rip easily.My favorite thing about this product is that it's not wispy like less expensive ones are. What I mean is that it doesn't float up and stick to you while you're taking a shower, it stays in place. The last one I had did have weights in it but they didn't matter as it still floated and clung to me so I had to fight with it and keep smacking it away from me while taking a shower, very annoying. This one is great, it does not do that, it stays down while you're taking a shower.All in all I think this shower curtain is nicely made, it feels made of heavy material that should last a long time.I'm very happy with my purchase.

The packaging is a small brown box and inside you’ll find a plastic try holding the earphones in place during shipping and for protection. Once you get everything unpacked you’ll find the earphones, user manual, extra sized bud covers and a carrying bag with spring style top closure.They’re wooden so they’re very lightweight and they seem well made overall. I don’t see any marking on them for right and left sides though.In-line you’ll find the remote control with a single multifunction button on the top and then the microphone on the bottom. The button is one press for play/pause, twice quickly to skip or twice and hold to fast forward, three times quickly to go back or three times and hold to rewind. For calls the controls are one press to answer/end and hold for 2 seconds to decline call. At the end of the earphones you’ll find a gold plated 3.5mm connector that’s reinforced with metal above it.I tested these with my Samsung Galaxy S6 Android phone and the controls on the remote worked as they should. I’m not sure I like the one button for everything, but it does work and I guess that’s what matters most here.Sound quality is not the best, bass heavy music produces a lot of distortion at even medium high volume levels. There does seem to be a good balance of bass and treble overall, but they just seem to be able to handle heavy bass.As far as comfort, they’re not comfortable at all really, and they don’t stay in my ears. I tried different sized earbud covers and they just didn’t seem to want to stay in my ears.The FSL Xylem earphones aren’t bad for the price but they aren’t great either.Sound quality leaves a bit to be desired and they’re not really comfortable either, at least for me they weren’t.Pros:+Inexpensive+Seem well made+Remote works with AndroidCons:-Not quite comfortable-Distortion at med high volume levels-Not sure about single button for everythingDisclosure: This product was given to me for review by the company for review purposes only for free or at a discounted price, and is not considered by me as payment for the review. My reviews are honest and unbiased regardless of how I received the product. I never have and will never accept payments for reviews from companies, for me there is no difference in reviewing a free or purchased product since all products are treated the same.

If you have bed bugs this is the stuff you want to use. Do not bother with sprays or anything else as they only work when they are wet, as soon as they dry they are no longer effective.No more bed bugs for me, where they came from I don't know, but I was not happy when I woke up with bites on me one day all of the sudden. I have insomnia and bed bugs did not help that at all, they made it much worse. I could barely sleep just thinking about them crawling on me and drinking my blood like little vampires. I hate them, I wish there was a way to eradicate them from the entire world.Anyway, off on a tangent there, this stuff is great, I've tried gallons of pump sprays and aerosols and they did not work, just waste of money. And then I read about this stuff and figured I tried everything else so why not try this too and it worked! I'm so happy to get a good nights sleep.You will need gloves and a mask/respirator and something to apply it with. I picked up a large glass cheeses shaker from my local dollar store and it worked perfectly for application. (see picture).If you have bed bugs this is the stuff you want. Yes it might require 2-3 cycles of application and vacuum but it's worth it to be rid of these nasty pests and this stuff is safe for pets.A highly recommended product for sure, it really works, and I'm vary happy with it.

So I don't know where they came from but I ended up with bed bugs. I hate these things, I don't mind other bugs, they're just a natural part of life but in my opinion bed bugs have no place in the grand scheme of things or the circle of life as it were. I hate them, I hate waking up with little marks on my arms and neck and then having to try and hide them from view as they are embarrassing. I sleep on the couch often as wife and I keep different schedules and I'm kind of an insomniac, only sleep 4-5 hours per night usually so that interrupts her sleeping routines and it's just easier for me to sleep on the couch when I'm not tired at bed time. Bed bugs did not help my insomnia at all, they made it worse as I didn't want to go to sleep as all I could think about was those things crawling on me and sucking my blood while I was sleeping. Anyway, we ended up with bed bugs in our couch somehow and I bought two gallons of pump style spray killer and I even bought the aerosol kind and none of it seemed to work. Two gallons on the couch and floor and walls should have done the trick and it didn't, was fine for a few days but then woke up again with bites on me. Yes I saw them too so I know they were there as I ripped everything apart to clean everything yet again.I was at my wits end with these things but then I found out about diatomaceous earth and I'm so happy I did, no more bed bugs. I've gone weeks now with no bites.The only thing is that you need to a way to apply it and you need a good dust mask or respirator for the application process and rubber gloves as well. This stuff will dry out your hands, but some lotion and you'll be fine. I also have pets and the other spray stuff wasn't the best with them, but this stuff is safe for them as well so that's a plus there.I ended up grabbing a large sized glass cheese shaker from the local dollar store and it works great for application of this stuff. (see picture)It did take a couple applications, I just wanted to be sure. Applied it, let it sit for a few days, vacuumed everything and reapplied, did this every week for three weeks and no more bed bugs. Yes it might seem like a hassle, but it was well worth the time and effort to me to be able to sleep peacefully. You need to make sure that you apply to floors and walls as you never know where they'll hide, and any crack you see and on and under baseboards too.I'm happy, no more bed bugs, well worth the price for sure. I wish I would have learned about this stuff before spending lots more time and money on other pesticides that didn't work.This is a highly recommended product to get rid of bed bugs inexpensively.

Dune is one of my favorite movies but the blu-ray quality is just not good. It's very grainy, I might as well be watching it on DVD, or even VHS. I'm very disappointed in the picture quality of this blu-ray.I gave it 3 stars because of the movie itself, it's a great movie, but I think I need to find another version of the blu-ray as the quality is just bad.

Excellent Version of a great war movie.This is one of those movies that sticks with you, it's complicated and it explores the other side of the war as it were. There's a lot going on in this movie, it's not just about killing, it's about the experiences and how it really affects and affected those people.It's just a great movie, one of Kubrik's best surely.
