There are 20g of good quality protein, coming mainly from whey and soy isolates, with casein filling in the rest. And the inclusion of a vitamin and mineral blend is a nice touch. For those who are curious, here is the nutritional breakdown:Serving Size: 60gCalories: 230Total Fat: 7g (11%)Saturated Fat: 4g (20%)Cholesterol: 0mgSodium: 125mg (5%)Total Carbohydrate: 26g (9%)Dietary Fiber: 2g (8%)Sugars: 0gSugar Alcohol: 10gOther Carbohydrates: 12gProtein: 20g (40%)Ingredients: Protein blend (whey protein isolate, soy protein isolate, calcium caseinate)), glycerin, coating (maltitol, palm kernel oil, cocoa powder, milk fat, soy lecithin, vanilla extract), maltitol, cocoa soy crisps (soy protein isolate, cocoa, tapioca starch), cocoa powder, peanuts, water, canola oil, natural flavors, soy lecithin, tricalcium phosphate, vitamins and minerals: ascorbic acid, d-alpha tocopherol, niacinamide, zinc oxide, vitamin A palmitate, electrolytic iron, calcium panththenate, pyridoxine hydrochloride, copper gluconate, riboflavin, thiamin mononitrate, biotin, potassium iodide, vitamin B12.Cost per serving is on the average side, so the value is certainly there. Overall, not a bad bar to fill those afternoon cravings, but there are better bars on the market, so I will probably reach for a thinkThin only on occasion.

Sure, I reside in a state where the sun only rears its warm, life-giving light 10% of the year (yay, Minnesota!), but when those golden beams do shine down, I attempt to absorb every last photon into my pasty, translucent skin. To transform my milky white epidermis into a breathtaking golden hue, I generally rely on the standard Banana Boat brand of various tanning gels and creams. But, wanting to expand the collection of half-used, expiring bottles of varying SPF in my bathroom cabinet, I thought I'd branch out and try the new Hampton Sun SPF 15 Tanning Gel. Here are my initial thoughts:PROS:* absorbs really well, leaving no sticky or greasy residue behind* light, pleasant odor that won't attract bugs, nor repel the opposite sex (more perfumey than tropical)* offers good protection, while still allowing for a nice tan to developCONS:* the solution does not distribute well with the current spray cap, and tends to drip* for a "gel," it is very thin -- more like a cologne/perfume consistency* might have to reapply the solution frequently, as it does not seem to last very long -- especially when sweating or swimming* slightly irritating to the eyes, though not as much as my Sport Sunscreen* COSTOverall, if you're looking for a new, unique tanning gel in a fairly attractive bottle, you can't go wrong with Hampton Sun. But, being the budget-conscious individual I am, I will likely stick with my trusty Banana Boat.

I love me some wheat grass shots, and will jump at the chance to slam a fresh squeezed shot any opportunity I get. However, ArgoLabs Wheatgrass Boost shot will not replace the real thing anytime soon.The flavor is not terrible, as there are certainly hints of wheat grass and juice, but the aftertaste is not desirable. The shot leaves a tacky residue in your mouth that lingers long after you've swallowed. Blech.Boost? Did not notice any, which is its main selling point. The B-vitamins and "boost blend" are not dosed well enough to offer any real energy support, especially given that the B-12 (normally an excellent vitamin for energy enhancement) is the inferior form of Cyanocobalamin, which the body cannot readily utilize (look for Methylcobalamin, which is the active form of B-12, and much better absorbed and retained in the tissue). The only real boost may come from the 4g of sugar!Nutrition wise, this Wheatgrass Boost shot once again takes a back seat to an actual wheatgrass shot. Wheat grass has an amazing amount of phytonutrients and minerals, all packed into a few ounces. For contrast, here is the nutritional profile of the ArgoLabs shot:Serving Size: 3ozCalories: 20Total Carbohydrates: 5g (2%)Sugars: 4gVitamin B3 (Niacin): 30mg (150%)Vitamin B6 (Pyridoxine Hydrochloride): 10mg (500%)Vitamin B12 (Cyanocobalamin): 60mcg (1000%)Sodium: 5mg (<1%)Proprietary Boost Blend: 220mg(D-Ribose, L-Arginine, and Green Tea Extract)INGREDIENTS:Water, Pear Puree, Organic Wheatgrass Juice, White Grape Juice, Apple Juice, Banana Puree, Natural Flavor, Xantham Gum, and Bisulfate of SodaOverall, if you're looking for a solid energy boost that offers excellent nutritional value, seek other sources (such as an actual wheatgrass shot and a Vitamin B-Complex). Truthfully, for the cost, I'd rather take a 5-Hour Energy Shot over this!

The ab wheel/roller is one of the best exercises one can do to strengthen their abs/core, and it's an exercise I have always utilized in my workout routine. Since it's fairly tough to overwork the core, it's one of the few muscle groups you can workout multiple days per week, so having an ab wheel at home is ideal.Overall, the Ab Carver is a great piece of equipment and simple to use. The ergonomic handles feel great in the hands, and the wide wheel base offers easy targeting of the obliques -- as well as increased stability. As a more advanced user, I'm not entirely sold on the "kinetic engine" assisting in the movement, but novice users may find it beneficial.Compared to other ab wheels, the Ab Carver is definitely on the pricier side, which is the main reason for losing one star in the rating. Most ab wheels are priced between $15-20, and I cannot say having the kinetic spring is worth spending the extra money.But if you're looking to tighten that midsection and lower back, are new to using an ab wheel and want a little assistance, the Ab Carver Pro is a worthy option!

Over the past few years, I have tried numerous brands of in-ear headphones, but have never found that right combination of fit and sound. When I saw the new Monster iSport Strive, I thought my problems would soon be over. Wrong.First, the fit. The shape is kind of odd to begin with, perhaps in an effort to be ergonomic and follow the natural curvature of the ear canal. However, these never quite stayed comfortably in my ear. The upper fin was a nuisance at first, but I eventually did grow accustomed to it. But, the bottom portion of the ear piece was far too hard, meaning after just 15-20 minutes of use, my ears would be in pain. There are three different sized ear tips included here, but unlike Goldilocks, I could never find a size that was "just right." They were either unbearably tight, or incredibly loose.I'm willing to overlook the size/fit of the earphones overall, as it's hard to make a product designed to fit everyone, just as long as they sound good. And this is where I was really disheartened. I've owned several Monster products in the past, all of which have been outstanding, but the sound on these was dismal at best. The iSport is plenty loud, but terribly balanced. There is no real definitive bass on the low end, and the treble is rather tinny. Adjusting my mp3 player's EQ levels did help a little, but not enough to override the poor quality.The one positive aspect is the flat cables, which do help eliminate tangling. The cables are also fairly light, which makes it ideal for running or other cardio activities.Sadly, I cannot recommend the Monster iSport in-ear headphones -- especially at this price point. I wish I had a better recommendation, but I have yet to really find a pair that work for me! Overall, a 2 out of 5.

As a former fat guy (nearly ten years strong of having lost 70+ pounds), I know firsthand the stranglehold food companies have on consumers. I was addicted to every form of fat, sugar and salt available -- preferably all in the same food/meal! Now that I am health-conscious, preparing to become a fitness trainer and dietitian, with a wife who just graduated from nursing school, I'm hoping to use books like Salt Sugar Fat: How the Food Giants Hooked Us, as a means of relaying the insidiousness of food giants, and the dangers they impose upon the public.SSF is a well-written, heavily researched book, exposing the dark, predatory nature of food manufacturers, and how they use those three key ingredients to hook us into consuming unhealthy, packaged food in vast quantities. There is obviously an agenda/bias from the onset, so if you're looking for a fair and balanced expose, temper those expectations. But I think most of us know too well the greediness of food corporations, and thus have very little sympathy or interest in seeing their bottom lines are met.The book starts with a secret meeting held among the food giants, such as Kraft, General Mills, Pillsbury, etc., where a well-intention-ed VP of Kraft made a compelling presentation on the dangers their own food companies impose on the health of the public, and how they have an opportunity to step up and present healthier options. Michael Mudd, the VP on stage, was quickly leveled by General Mills head Stephen Sanger, who essentially rebutted with, "Look, we're not going to screw around with the company jewels and change the formulations because a bunch of guys in white coats are concerned about obesity." And that, folks, just about sums up the vested interest food companies have in our health. (Note: it isn't just the food companies who are to blame, as Big Tobacco is also in cahoots, as well as greedy politicians)From there, author Michael Moss takes us through what is essentially a history course on each ingredient, Sugar, Fat and Salt, why we have physiological cravings for them, how the food industry uses this knowledge to manipulate and stimulate certain brain receptors (interestingly enough, sugar has the same effects on the brain as drugs) in order to get us to consume more, and heart-wrenching stories of those whose lives have been directly affected by the food industry. Perhaps the most disgusting portrait of this abuse is the studies conducted using children, where a "bliss point" (that magical level of ultimate satisfaction) is being discovered through various taste tests of sugary foods.For fans of Michael Pollan, and films like Hungry for Change, you will certainly enjoy Salt Sugar Fat. For those with any interest in their own health, or the health of their families, this is a must-read.

I am really on the fence with this book. Dreams and Shadows was my first foray into the "sci-fi" genre of novels, so within that genre, I cannot make comparisons, but I know what I like and dislike when it comes to fiction in general. I'll try to construct this review as generically as I can, to avoid any plot spoilers.First, the characters were all inventive and plentiful, from wish-granting djinns to more sinister fairie-type creatures. But the author never gave me a sense of why I should care for any of the characters -- even the protagonist(s) Colby and Ewan. This may be the biggest weakness of the book, the lack of character development and empathy we should feel for them. Even the relationships between the characters was somewhat murky/unclear, in terms of how/if they cared for one another.The arc/plot is probably the novel's biggest strength, in that the story moves along at a fairly quick pace, with fascinating turns along the way. The world created by Cargill was bright and imaginative, and there is a satisfying amount of blood and gore for those seeking a little violence, but mixed with enough romance and humor to offset the novel's darkness. I definitely appreciated the fact that I could not tell where the story was heading (predictability is an immediate turn-off), and it did ultimately resolve in a satisfying conclusion.Stylistically, the author's writing style is somewhat weak, as is evidenced, for example, by his reliance upon on overused literary devices to serve as a means of exposition. There were constant passages of "An excerpt by Dr. Thaddeus Ray, Ph.D., from his book A Chronicle of the Dreamfolk," which is followed by a clinical, biographical description of certain characters and their kin/lineage. This particular device is on par with the done-to-death "Merriam Webster's defines ... ." The saving grace was the dialogue, which I did find to be natural and flowed well. Writing in the voice of children, for example, is often hard to achieve successfully, as most author's dumb down their vocabulary. But Cargill handles it with deftness, giving us a sense that the characters are mature and strong.Overall, a mediocre entry into the vast collection of fiction, though, perhaps, sci-fi enthusiasts will enjoy the colorful characters and world found within Dreams and Shadows. I will likely not recommend this book to others, but there is a good chance I will read Cargill's next effort, as his writing does show strong promise.

Kay's Naturals has never let me down in the past, so I had high expectations with these Cinnamon Almond Cookie Bites, and I'm delighted to say I was not disappointed. With just a handful of ingredients, Kay's is able to make a tasty, healthy, and satisfying snack, neither too sweet nor too dull, with an enjoyable crunchy texture. These are definitely more cinnamon-heavy than almond, but I don't consider this a knock at all.With 12g of protein, 4g of fiber, just 3.5g of fat and no artificial sweeteners, Kay's Cookie Bites are a far better option than most snacks available, and I have even tossed these in a bowl with some almond milk for a great breakfast cereal option!Here is the nutritional profile:Serving Size: 34gCalories: 125Total Fat: 3.5g (6%)Saturated Fat: 0gCholesterol: 0mgSodium: 336mg (13%)Total Carbohydrate: 15g (5%)Dietary Fiber: 4g (15%)Sugars: 3gProtein: 12g (17%)INGREDIENTS:Soy protein isolate, Rice flour, Yellow degermed corn flour, Almond butter, Corn starch, Evaporated cane juice, Natural honey, Pea fiber, Inulin, Tapioca starch, Cinnamon powder, Non-aluminum baking powder, Xantham gum, Natural flavoring, Stevia.The only real knock, and hence the 4-star rating, is the sodium content is on the higher side, which is a problem for those on a restricted or reduced sodium diet. I do, however, appreciate that this is a gluten-free product, which is great for those with gluten sensitivities/allergies.Price per serving is reasonable, especially considering the quality of the product! Overall, I definitely recommend these to anyone looking for a healthy, on-the-go snack, as I will be keeping these stocked in my cupboard!

For better or worse, I ingest copious amounts of caffeine throughout the day, and even if I taper off my intake in the early afternoon, I still feel the effects when it comes time to sleep. The obvious solution is to simply not take caffeine so late -- or at all -- but it's difficult to say no to that sweet, sweet rush of energy!Has Rutaesomn come to the rescue? I honestly have to give a reluctant yes, as I definitely had my doubts. To put Rutaesomn to the test, I took about 200mg of caffeine around 5pm, which normally would be a death sentence for sleep. A few hours later, I popped one capsule of Rutaesomn, and by the time I was ready to turn it, I actually felt sleepy and had zero issues shutting down for the night. I have even taken a capsule just as a relaxant, without caffeine in my system, and it works really well on that front, too! For me, it works even better than Valerian Root and Passion Flower, each of which is very effective in promoting relaxation and good sleep.If you're someone who has difficulty shutting off your mind after a heavy day of coffee or soda drinking, I definitely suggest giving Rutaesomn a try. The only reason for my four-star rating is the limited information regarding long-term effects. Given the lack of regulation in the supplement industry, it can, often times, be a toss of the dice with a product's safety and efficacy, so please do exercise caution and moderate your use of the product.

Chapstick, Carmex, Buddha Balm, Burt's Bees ... these are just a few of the countless brands of lips balms that have floated around my house in years past. Not necessarily on the hunt for a "volumizing" balm, the new Envyderm Lip Volumizing and Conditioning Plumper did sound intriguing, and having recently lost the last tube of Vaseline Lip Therapy, the opportunity to try this came at just the right time.The gloss applies really smoothly and evenly, with no clumping or overly tacky feeling. The scent is muted but fresh, so you're not overwhelmed with either a perfumed or waxy odor. And once applied, I didn't feel the need to reapply every few hours, as I tend to do with other lip balms.Does the product live up to its name by volumizing and plumping up your kisser? Yes and no. I definitely felt a tingle, which kind of took me by surprise, indicating there are active ingredients in the formula. It sort of feels like a menthol rub, akin to Vick's Vapor Rub, but much more subtle. My lips certainly felt much more hydrated and healthy, but I didn't necessarily perceive an increase in fullness -- at least not dramatically so.The applicator could use some tweaking, as it feels a little flimsy and cheap, not really delivering a smooth application. And the price point seems a tad high for what you get.Overall, I still recommend the product, despite its few setbacks, as my lips feel much healthier and more moist, but it's unlikely -- at least at this price -- that it will be a regular addition to my lip balm/gloss rotation.

As a fitness-y type dude who works out 4-5 days per week, protein powders have become a dietary staple -- for better or worse. I tend to stick with protein isolates or isolate/concentrate blends, which have little to no carbohydrates, and are fairly low calorie, reserving the rights to add carbs/calories as I see fit. As such, MetRX Protein and Oats wouldn't seem like a fit for me, but I thought I'd give it a go, as it would free me up from having to prepare carbohydrates post-workout or between meals. Well, I think I have stumbled upon a protein powder which will quickly go into my rotation!Taste is surprisingly bold, without being overly sweet. Lots of vanilla and cinnamon, both of which blend very well with the added oats. No grittiness or poor aftertaste, either.Mixibility is fairly good, but with oats being a big presence here, you can't expect a perfectly smooth, clump-less texture. Still blends better than a lot of other protein powders on the market.The texture took some getting used to, as the oats were begging to be chewed, so my gulps weren't perfectly smooth. Not a deal breaker by any stretch, but definitely a new experience.Nutritional profile is pretty solid, at 200 calories and 17g of complex carbs. There is very little in sodium, low sugars, with a healthy dose of dietary fiber, making it an excellent heart-healthy option. There is also a good 25g dose of blended proteins (soy, whey concentrates and isolates, casein and egg). This means you're getting a great combination of slow and fast digesting proteins. And the addition of digestive enzymes will greatly aid in the absorption and breakdown of those proteins and carbs.Here's a breakdown of the nutrients and ingredients:Serving Size: 56gServings per container: about 16Calories: 200Total Fat: 4g (6%)Sat. Fat: 1.5g (6%)Cholesterol: 55mg (18%)Sodium: 100mg (4%)Potassium: 300mg (9%)Carbohydrates: 17g (6%)Dietary Fiber: 7g (30%)Sugars: 1gProtein: 25gIngredients:Protein Blend (Whey Protein Concentrate, Soy Protein Isolate, Milk Protein Isolate, Calcium Sodium Caseinate, Micellar Casein, Milk Protein Concentrate, Whey Protein Isolate, Dried Egg White), Complex Carb Optimizer Blend (Instant Oat Flakes, Oat Fiber, Maltodextrin), Lean Lipid Optimizer Blend (Flaxseed Powder, Sunflower Oil, Medium Chain Triglycerides), Amino Acid Blend (L-Glutamine, L-Arginine), Cocoa (Processed With Alkali), Natural And Artificial Flavors, Carrageenan, Soy Lecithin, Acesulfame Potassium, MultiVitamin Optimizer Blend (Ascorbic Acid, Ferrous Fumarate, Dicalcium Phosphate, DL-Alpha Tocopheryl Acetate, Niacinamide, Zinc Oxide, D-Calcium Pantothenate, Copper Sulfate, Manganese Sulfate, Vitamin A Palmitate, Pyridoxine Hydrochloride, Thiamin Hydrochloride, Riboflavin, Chromium Picolinate, Folic Acid, Biotin, Potassium Iodide, Cholecalciferol, Cyanocobalamin), Sucralose, Sodium Caseinate, Mono- & Di-Glycerides, Digestive Enzyme Blend (Bromelain, Papain).Economically, it may seem to be a fairly inexpensive protein, but once you notice there are only 16 servings, you realize each serving comes in at over $1.00, which is my only knock on the rating. You could certainly eat only 1/2 serving size in order to maximize the value, but you'd also be cutting down on total protein intake, which you'd have to supplement elsewhere.Overall, definitely worth adding in to your dietary regimen, especially if you like to take in carbohydrates with your protein, after a tough workout. And try this as a batter base for protein pancakes! The combination of vanilla, cinnamon and oats make for perfect muscle building flap jacks, and could likely be used in other baked goods, as well!

For the past few weeks, I've been growing my first-ever beard, and the skin irritation and scratchiness has been nothing short of hellacious. Either taking pity on me, or having grown tired of my constant grievances, my wife suggested I use this new Simple Protecting Light Moisturizer. But, I'm a tough, bearded guy! I can't be seen dabbing moisturizer upon my scaly, blotchy skin! Enough was enough, however, and I caved. And I dabbed. And I liked.The moisturizer is very smooth, not greasy at all, absorbs remarkably quickly and, best of all, is only ever-so-lightly scented, leaving me some dignity as a Brawny Man. Best of all, it actually did ease the skin irritations from which I had been plagued. The fact that the moisturizer has an SPF of 15 is a nice touch, as well, though, here in Minneapolis where we see sunshine 13 days of the year, is not as much a necessity as in other climates.Overall, I highly recommend this product, whether you have a gnarly scruff in need of taming, or soft, smooth baby-butt skin that you're trying to preserve. The only downside is having to admit to my wife that she was right, the end of which I will never hear.

My brother just remodeled his basement bathroom, so as a gift I gave him this American Standard Satin Nickel faucet. In typical brotherly fashion, I was enlisted to help install said faucet, which, I must say, was far easier than I anticipated.Installation was a breeze, as the instructions were clear and concise -- which is much appreciated, for the non-handyman like me. We did not need to acquire any additional specialty tools, so with the basic wrenches, screw drivers, etc, we installed the faucet in very little time.The function of the faucet is incredibly smooth, with precise movements on the handles, and excellent water flow from the tap. What more can you ask for?The style/form is both modern and elegant, and satin nickel finish is killer. It will definitely be the standout piece in the bathroom.All in all, a great faucet at an excellent price. I'm now regretting not keeping this for myself!

Me gym guy. Me lift heavy weights, like rocks. Sometimes knees and shoulders hurt. Me no like. Pain sometimes make salty fluid discharge from eyes. Arrgggh!Okay, you get the point. Between running and lifting weights, I do pound my body pretty hard, all of which makes my joints ache. I always use a high-quality fish oil supplement, as well as a blend of MSM, glucosamine and chondroitin, to help combat the pain, but even that concoction still leaves me a tad stiff and sore. I had heard plenty of good things about turmeric (curcumin), namely its ability to help decrease inflammation, so I thought I'd give it a try. Wow. Where has this little capsule been all my life!?Jarrow Formulas Curcumin 95 offers 500mg of curcumin per dose, and is now a regular part of my supplement regimen. I take one capsule after my workouts, along with my other supplements, and not only has it helped decrease my joint pain, but it speeds up my recovery as well. For example, last week I strained my lower back, so I doubled up on the Curcumin -- which was the only change I made to my regimen -- and within just a few days my back was nearly good as new. I've strained my lumbar region several times (should probably stop lifting so many heavy rocks), and have never recovered this quickly before.All things considered, we all respond differently to supplements, so many may not experience the same benefits as I have, but if you're looking to improve joint health and muscle aches, I can't recommend Jarrow Formulas Curcumin 95 enough. And at its current price, it is a fairly inexpensive supplement as well, so give it a try!Me now go back to cave and take nap.P.S. Try breaking open a capsule and adding a dash to some stir fry!

Full disclosure. I have no intention of using these in the kitchen. My bathroom is painted grey, and I thought they would look very nice when used as a guest towel. Grey may not be the color of choice for everyone, but it works for me. These are a nice size, and they look very attractive on the fancy towel rack. I like the size, and the fabric quality is very good. They will require a quick touch up with an iron after washing, but that will take a minute, and is fine with me.

I'm not sure why these would be necessary, but I decided to give DII Kitchen Millennium Washable, Non Adhesive Refrigerator Bins and Shelf Liners a try for one reason. Soup season has arrived. There is one single thing that I put into the fridge in a pot, and that is soup. Recently, due to the fact that my Paula Deen cookware soup pot has a lid that has never fit properly, I have spilled soup a time or two. I usually put a fresh pot of soup into the fridge overnight, before eating it for two reasons. One, it always tastes better the second day. Two, if the soup contains any meat or poultry there will be fat. I skim it off the top before heating it. Due to the ill fitting lid I have spilled some soup a time or two. These will hopefully soak it up before it manages to spill over the sides of a shelf.I did not spill soup in order to review this. Even if they work well, it just isn't something I want to do. I did cut them to fit a couple of shelves, and they look nice. I took a piece and tossed it into the laundry and washed it twice. It must be laid flat to dry. It does dry up pretty well so far.  Time will tell if this is a good idea, but for now the refrigerator liners look nice, and seem to wash up pretty well. Hopefully it will perform as hoped and help to cut down on cleanup.

My husband was quite pleased with this deodorant. He is not someone who works in an office but he does like to wear a dab of fragrance when he goes out, ( he actually found one that doesn't set off my sensitivities,) and always tends to buy deodorant with a scent. I thought this would be nice for him to try.  What he does do for a living is repair machines in a food factory. Even though he is about at retirement age, he has a physically demanding job.This does not have an overwhelming scent, which I am grateful for, because I am sensitive to fragrance carriers. It is light and pleasant and so far has not given me a blasting headache, so I think I'm safe. Also, the fragrance fades fairly quickly which makes me happy. He enjoys this fragrance and has had no issues with it not being strong enough a deodorant. It works quite well for him, even at work.I would say that this is a win, win in this house. He was happy as could be at getting a fancy new deodorant, and it doesn't seem to contain the carriers that bother me. Will we purchase this agin? Possibly, as a gift. Perhaps even for my 3 sons.

Island Fresh SUPERIOR Organic Extra Virgin coconut oil is wonderful! There is a light, fresh coconut taste, nothing heavy at all. I have used this product in coffee,  instead of butter in cookies,, for popping popcorn, "fried" apple slices, zucchini fritters, turkey burgers, and more. And of course I have used it  as a moisturizer for my skin.I am sure that there are some things I am forgetting, and this would be a 5 star product, if not for the packaging. This is a large, wide mouth jar, and that's great for scooping out the coconut oil. However, I am a 5'2 inch woman with small hands. Getting this open the first time was impossible for me, even with two rubber jar opening mats to help.The neck of this jar could be a bit smaller, and the product would still come out fairly easily. This is my one and only complaint. If you have someone willing to open it for you the first time, you will have no problem.

Carhartt Women's Base Force Cold Weather Bottom fits as expected, and they are comfortable and well proportioned. I have put them through the washer and dryer about half a dozen times, to see how they hold up, and so far so good. No real shrinkage, they resize to your body when you put them on. They are very comfortable, and as far as I can tell at this just turning cold time of year, they seem warm and comfy.Carhartt brand is frequently purchased in this house, and I expect these will hold up just as well as the coats and hats, etc. that my sons have worn for years.
Very entertaining. Good, likable characters. The stories each pick up where the last one lets off. I plan to finish the series.

It was clear in only a few days that this is a good product. I cleaned out my crisper drawers and placed them. A wee later, my graps were still plump and tasty. I immediately bought some for my son. Since then, fruits and veggies have stayed fresh and delicious much longer than is typical. Good gift, great for yourself, too.

The colors of the Neutrogena Healthy Skin Blends Clean Translucent Oil-Control Powder blend nicely and they lay lightly on your skin. It goes on smoothly and the colors blend together to make a nice shade. The actual color can be controlled by using only one or two of the colors offered. You will need your own brushes, this does not come with one.I had to apply it morning and then again after lunch, so it isn't long lasting. I was very pleased with this item, and even though my skin is somewhat dry, this worked well. I usually "set" my makeup with a light spray of distilled water with a few drops of essential oil. That is what I did whwen I used the Neutrogena Healthy Skin Blends Clean Translucent Oil-Control Powder, and it worked well to give it a less dry appearance.

The Veil (Fianna Trilogy III) by Megan Chance is easily the best book of the three. Well paced, well written and very enjoyable. The story of the Fianna, the velada and the Fomori and the battle they have been called to fight. The calling of these two warring factors was inadvertent, but it now had to be dealt with. The decision belonged the grace, the Fomori.There was yet another choice. If Grace survived the decision on the night of Samhain, which of the men would she choose? Patrick, her protector, or Diarmid, who may have won her love through enchantment? And still, things were different now, than they were 2000 years ago, there was something different about the velada. What was it?There were triangles everywhere, perhaps the magic of three? And we can't forget the Druids and the Sidhe, for they factored into all that was happening as well. How would it end? What would the decision be? And what did the change in the prophecy etched on the ogham stick mean?The first to books in this series drag a fair bit. I blame the editing, not the author. Perhaps the publisher wanted a trilogy where a good solid book would have sufficed. THIS is what they could have had, if they had let that happen. This is a good solid, and memorable read. But you really do need to read the first two books first.

Cafe Diario Regular is delicious. There are times when I want a strong hearty cup of coffee. More often, I like a nice smooth and tasty medium roast. This is what I found with Cafe Diario Regular.I have been drinking a store brand morning blend, and had recently complained of its lack of flavor. Then I had the opportunity to review this brand. To be honest, I was hesitant, because the last thing I needed was another box of K-cups that I don't like. One more cup of the store brand convinced me to give this a try. I was pleasantly surprised. I suspect that this is a brand I will be purchasing in the future, simply because it's good. I like it.

This is not the ideal time of year for me to review Curel Itch Defense Soothing Moisturizing Spray. I have very dry skin, and typically have a lot of itchiness in the winter. It's full summer, now and so my skin is at it's best. I do have a small inexplicable patch of itchiness, and so tried the Curel Itch Defense Soothing Moisturizing Spray on that area. It helps. It really helps. So, I will guardedly recommend this item, and update in the winter, should I need too.

I have been reading the Leigh Koslow series since book #1. I did not go looking for that book, but thankfully it found me. I was looking around a Half Price Books store and happened on a few of Edie Claire's books. In fact, two of the three I picked up that day were stand alone books and not part of this series at all. I loved them both. The I started in on the first Leigh Koslow, and never looked back. There were a few lean years, when I wasn't able to find any new books by this wonderful, upbeat author. It was disappointing, but things happen. Then, like magic, Leigh reappeared with all sorts of new adventures, a fabulous family and every story better than the last, which really doesn't happen very often in a series.I believe that the Koslow series is kept fresh and entertaining because the author writes play and other books in between. She has some wonderful YA books out there, for instance. Take a look at her book Wraith. I am far from fitting into the YA category, but I enjoyed that book all the same. I think you will enjoy it, too!Every single book is filled with twists and turns and mysteries and surprises. Every single book lacks grim gory bits, and has never needed them. This is refreshing and necessary, today. The market is filled with plenty of grisly, gory, stabby books. Far more than we need. Rest assured that entertainment is what you get with Edie Claire. No children or animals suffer in these uplifting, lighthearted and well written books.

I The Star Side of Bird Hill: A Novel by Naomi Jackson is a story that pulls you in and makes you part of it. The family around which the story was built has the usual cast of characters. There are the good, the not so good and the beautiful and those that need more effort to love. But they were loved. Each and every one of them. Hyacinth is the mother of Avril. Avril moved from Barbados to New York when she was young, and married a man she loved. A story that is all too familiar, one grew tired of the other and Errol, her husband was soon out of her life.One summer, Dionne and Phaedra were sent to Barbados to sped some time with their grandmother, Hyacinth. They did a lot of growing up and a lot of learning, during that time. Hyacinth had a lot to teach. As the days passed and the girls learned the ways of their granmother, and of their mother's girlhood, thing happened that would change their lives forever.The question arose, would they stay in Barbados, or return to the states? What path would their lives take, and would they both choose the same path? Where would the healing be found that each of them, like most of us, seek. This book has many dark moments, but soft ones, as well. Touching and soft. I was sorry to see it end.

So here it is, summertime. I enjoy hot cocoa, but it is rare that I brew some up during the summer. I was offered the opportunity to reviews these from Amazon Vine, and couldn't pass it up. It just looked too good. Well, last night I was invited down to my niece's house for dessert and coffee. I rarely say no to that because I get to see her boys, wh light up my life. I always try to take something, with me, but had nothing on hand, so I grabbed a selection of these. I thought they could be an addition to, or a replacement for dessert. And frankly, I adore my niece but her house is as cold as a morgue, so it seemed perfect. I took :Midnight Dark ChocolateCharlestown ChewSugar BabiesJunior Mint ( Which I chose and enjoyed)Mexican Spice which I tasted and it is really good.Tootsie Roll andCharlestown Chew Vanilla.We brewed them up, and had a sort of taste test, pass around and see who likes what session.My nieces husband put his Mexican Spice over ice....interesting! And for the littles, we made sure it was cooled down before we gave it to them.They chose Tootsie Roll, which I knew they would, so I took 2.General consensus was that it was weird to drink hot chocolate in the summer. This may be true for the most part, but there are those damp nights or the I crave chocolate moments where I see these coming in very handy. Besides, we drink hot coffee and tea in summer, so why not chocolate? Who doesn't enjoy chocolate?Bottom line it was fun, the Two Rivers Hot Cocoa was tasty, and I do see myself purchasing this sampler in the future. I didn't taste one that I didn't like.

The Whisper (The Riverman Trilogy) by Aaron Starmer, is book two of The Riverman Trilogy. This is a series meant for juvenile readers, which I am assuredly not, but I was led to this series by a mighty villain who lures other into reading books she enjoys. Most of the time I'm helpless to resist. In this case, I have no complaints.The Whisper picks off where The Riverman left off. The same main characters populate the book, and there are some interesting and imaginative additions. The story is fast paced as Alistair journeys from here to there and back again, and magical creatures and non creatures abound. It's pretty tricky reviewing a series, so as not to indicate something that others will interpret as a spoiler.So, I will simply say that there will be quite a few surprises, a few things here and there that you have already suspected will turn out to be the case. And dreams really do come true... or not. There is a bit of time travel involved again, as the journeyers of Aquavania can return to the solid world at the very moment that they left. Will this make a difference? Can it change lives?  Well, I'm certainly not going to tell you.This will, in my opinion hold the interest of young readers, boys and girls will enjoy it equally in  my opinion. I also think it is a light and enjoyable read for adults.
I expected a bit more color, but it's better than using nothing.It does leave a very faint color on my cheeks. I won't buy this online again, I want a bit more color.

The Trisha Yearwood Royal Precious Metals 10 Inch Non-Stick Ceramic Fry Pan, Titanium is a nice addition to the kitchen. I have ade drilled cheese, with cheese on the outside of the bread, as well as inside. Over easy eggs, and sausage patties. Today I made crab cakes. Everything slid right out of the pan,  and the pan itself cleaned easily. This is a nice size for one or two people, too small if you want to make dinner for a family, at least that is my opinion.I like Trisha Yearwood, and that is the reason I chose to give this pan a try. I will continue using it, because it's really a great pan...as long as I'm not in too big of a hurry to give it TLC

Ortho 0475010 MAX Poison Ivy & Tough Brush Killer Ready-To-Use, 24-Ounce worked well for me. We have had a lot of rain lately, and so I had to wait to pray a stubborn patch of poison ivy that I have been at war with for years. No matter how careful I've been, I have been stricken with those fiery patches on my arms, and sometimes my neck after doing any work in the back forty of our property. Two days ago I sprayed the area early in the day. I considered waiting for a few dry days in a row, but since the poison ivy plants were just getting bigger by the day, I went for it. I did rain later in the day, so I wasn't sure it would be effective. Two mornings later, the area sprayed was visible even from my back porch. A trip back to the area showed me that my biggest concern, my honeysuckle, was still thriving. I don't like using these products, but after years of losing the fight, I wanted the offending plant gone. I have a small area left to do. This is all confined to two very large, concrete,  raised beds behind my garage. Those things have been useless to me since I moved into theis house over 25 years ago. Hopefully another application of the Ortho will finish it off for good.

Good series for a variety of ages.  After reading this book, I made sure that our local library purchased these books for their shelves. Good reviews from those wo have read the two books before The Klaatu Terminus, and I expect the same from this book.

Sharpie Permanent Markers, Ultra Fine Point,, the colors are great and there is a wonderful array of color choices. Sharpie products don't let me down, I go to them for various marker needs and have for years. It's good to have a product that can be counted on to deliver.

These are the best earbuds that I have ever owned! The sound quality is outstanding! The earbuds come with an attached mic, multiple rubber tips for comfort, and 3 sets of back end caps for the back of the earbuds. The back end caps are different color and correspond to the type of music that you are going to listen to, a very cool feature. The earbuds enable you to change tracks, and answer phone calls without having to touch your phone. They also come with a small case to protect them in. This is a great quality product and I really enjoy them.*I got these at a discounted price for my honest review*

My oximeter arrived in excellent condition. I wanted to have one on hand for my asthmatic son to keep track of when he is in trouble and needs to get in to the doctor. It comes with a lanyard and a soft case to protect it. Not only does it accurately read his O2 levels, but it also keeps track of his pulse rate. This is a great item to have on hand for any home first aid kit.*I got this at a discounted price for my honest review*

My Zhu Ting Paintbrushes arrived in excellent condition. I am very impressed with the quality. The bristles are nice and soft and firm. They will not leave bristles in my work. They each come numbered by size. The packaging tells what each brush is called and how to use them, which is nice. These are perfect for use with oils, watercolor, and acrylic. Great product for any artist's collection.*I got these at a discounted price for my honest review*

This is a review for Artix Elite Gamer Series headphones made by Sentey. These are great headphones if you are a PC gamer. They have good sound quality, and excellent speakers. It had an adjustable headband which makes them very comfortable, and an adjustable microphone attached to the left headphone. It has a USB cord that you plug into your PC. You can adjust the volume on the headphones themselves. The earpads are padded adding to the comfort level, this is a great product and I highly recommend it to PC gamers, it is also a very affordable price for what you get.*I got these at a discounted price for my honest review*

I really like this thermometer. It has a longer probe than any other meat thermometer I have. It comes with the battery included. It also came in a little plastic case that can be used to store it. I used it to measure the temperature of chicken. I found it to be fast and accurate. You must hand wash it, it's not dishwasher safe. It can be used in candy making but I haven't tried it for that yet. Overall I believe this is a good product and is a good value for the price.*I received this product for free in exchange for my honest review*

This is a review for the durable well made mobile phone holder that has a silicone suction cup base. I really like this product, for it enables me to be completely hands free while in my car while using my Samsung Galaxy S5. It has an adhesive suction cup so it holds onto the dash excellently. It also holds the phone nice and tight. This is indeed an excellent product that everyone should have, because you hands free is the way to be.*I got this at a discounted price for my honest review*

Who doesn't love a good pair of headphones? That's right everyone loves a good pair of headphones. You can never have to many set of headphones, they are so easy to misplace or lose all together, right? These have quality sound when I played my music with no static, unless you get to far away of course (30+ feet). I love how they have a volume/song control right under the right earbud, it's very easy to reach and use. These were fairly easy to pair to my phone and they stayed in my ear quiet well as I rocked out.*I got these at a discounted price for my honest review*

0:11 MinsI had seen friends have these bluetooth dancing water speakers. I knew I had to get what all the cool kids had, that's these dancing water speakers. There's so many things I love about this speaker! I love that this is bluetooth and easy to sync to your phone as well as micro sd/usb compatible. The colors of the dancing water is perfect and it comes with a measuring cup thing so you don't over fill the speaker with the water. It is the perfect amount of water of course to put in for an awesome water dancing look. I love that this speaker dances to the beat of the music, this speaker is a lot of fun!*I got this at a discounted price for my honest review*

I was excited to receive this selfie stick. It is spring loaded and easy to extend out. It did not come with any directions in the box and I was confused as how to pair it at first. I was able to get it paired. My phone didn't fit in between the clamps as nicely as I thought it should. As you can see in one of the pictures I took, the side clamp is bending a bit and is not holding the phone tightly. It included a small mirror to place on the back of your phone. I didn't really see the need for it, but it's a nice extra.*I received this item for free in exchange for my honest review*

These lunch bags are really cute! I liked the "apple green" design. The large bag at  9.5L x5.5 H x 7.5W held quite a bit of food. I was able to fit a few small containers and a drink in it. I used a small ice pack and it kept my lunch cold all day. I really like the small bag which measures 7.5L x 5.1H x 4.13W for carrying medication that must stay refrigerated. It was nice to throw it in my larger bag and not worry about an ice pack leaking into my bag. The box arrived damaged and I was concerned the insulated bags had damage but luckily they were fine.*I received this item free of charge in exchange for my honest review*

I ordered this jacket in the grey color. It was a whole lot better than I expected from past purchases from other companies online. The jacket material was not cheap and thin, at the same time it was not overly thick either. As far as how it fits, well it fits close to perfect. That is really hard to find when buying clothes online as well for me. I a lot of times have to return them, which is a pain. Another thing that is perfect about this jacket, it is perfect for the fall weather we have had. So, again this is a perfect fitting jacket for fall like weather and you should get it if you want quality.*I got this at a discounted price for my honest review*

This is a great little headlamp. I think everyone should have one of these in their homes and cars, along with 3 AAA batteries. It has 2 small red LED lights. It has three different modes, high, low, and strobe (flash). I have used the high and low settings but have not needed to use the strobe. This headlamp is meant for arm's length tasks.There are so many different circumstances where this would come in handy. I used it one evening while working on my lawnmower. It provided the right amount of light. The rotating feature is awesome too. You can direct the light to shine on exactly what you are looking at.It is also waterproof but I didn't get it wet at all. The only thing I would change is to have the strap be black or a dark color. I foresee the white part on the strap becoming dirty very quickly.*I was provided this product for free in exchange for my honest review*

First of all who doesn't love a good gag gift? This ones even better because it's pathetic Donald Trump and you can wipe your ass in his face! I think this gag gift is so brilliant, Trump is just making a fool of himself in these debates and these silly people are falling for it all. Get this gag gift for your political loving friends, they might laugh or they might shrug a their shoulders. Either way this is a funny funny gag gift.*I got this at a discounted price for my honest review*

I knew this lock would come in handy. I actually thought it was very sturdy and well made. It did not take me long to set up my combination. I thought I would use it to lock my gym locker and it worked very well. I love the fact that it's a 3 number combination, I won't have to keep track of any keys. It is TSA approved and I think I will be using it when I fly. A very impressive feature is that TSA can't remove their key until it's locked. So they won't be leaving your bag open. I think overall it's a good lock and a good value!*I received this product for free in exchange for my honest opinion*

The Haweel Windshield Car Mount is very lightweight.  It has spring tension and holds the phone well along with the soft silicone pads. The suction cup is very strong. It holds the phone better in the horizontal position than the vertical. The phone tends to want to slide down when it's in the vertical position. There was a great variety of recipes and I really enjoyed the ones I tried. Look forward to trying the rest of these and making some more healthy meals for my family. The intro was also extremely interesting.

I didn't really use my slow cooker before I bought this book, but I'm really happy I got this. Helps me use my slow cooker in all sorts of ways and has saved me tons of time cooking dinner. Thanks for the great ideas!
This book really helped open my eyes to how much you can do with the Mediterranean diet. Loved a lot of the recipes including the Lamb Sliders and the Quinoa dishes. Looking forward to trying more!

This Memory Foam Gel Mattress Pad is so comfortable! I def. give it 5 stars for matching the description! I am really glad we chose to pay a little bit more this time around, you get what you pay for. This 4 inch thick pad is soooo soft and comfy and actually stays pretty cool at night with summer right around the corner. If you are looking for a quality memory foam topper, I would have to recommend this one! My spouse and I love it!

This Mirror is exactly what we expected from the description, Beautiful! I give it 5 stars for the quality and design. It has a thick solid frame and beveled edges. We placed it in our living room and it has def. added depth and style! I would highly recommend this mirror to anyone. You can not beat the price!

This Bike is exactly what we expected with the Shaun White name on it! It def. fits the description and my son loves it! We gave it 5 stars for its quality, durability and appearance. He takes it to the tracks daily and it has not only held up but performed great! Great looking bike as you can see! I would recommend this bike to anyone looking to get into BMX or just for a great day to day bike to get around! It is a steal for the price!

This 7 piece patio set is exactly what we ordered and fit the description perfectly. I give this set 5 stars for its quality and appearance. There is great detail in all the pieces but I especially love the table with its diamond shaped glass inserts. You get what you pay for and more with this Patio Set. Whenever we have company over to our house they compliment on our patio set and ask where we purchased it. I would recommend this table to anyone looking for a quality set and not just the cheapest price.

This Table is exactly what we ordered and fit the description perfectly. I give this sofa/entry table 5 stars for its quality and appearance. We placed it in our entry way and we have had so many compliments on it. I would recommend this table to anyone, especially for this very affordable price!

I love this stuff. It gives my skin a nice plumping effect and makes my skin silky smooth.  I've only been using it for a month, so not sure about the long term effects, but even so, its still worth it

I've had a slow cooker forever and never used it because of the lack of options I thought I had when I found out I had a gluten sensitivity. This book helps me use my slow cooker to the fullest while making sure I don't break any of the rules set for me.

There's a lot of DASH Diet books out there but this one keeps it simple and gets to the point of what I can eat and what I should avoid while providing a consistent balance of recipes to reflect those servings. Too many DASH Diet books focus on dishes with meat when you can't even have too much of it in the first place. Really outstanding book.
Going low carb for me only made sense since I'm trying to lose weight in a healthy way. This book gave me tips on what to watch out for and also had a great selection of recipes that I plan on using.

This book is full of recipes that have helped me decide to quit buying those sugary juices from the store. Lots of healthy options that are really tasty. Juices in here for adults and kids that are quick and easy to make using common ingredients.

The author does a good job of emphasizing running form above everything else. What I like most about this book is that the author points out the little mistakes through pictures. That really helped me since I’m more of a visual learner.I just wish the techniques took less time to learn. I had only a week left to prepare for the marathon. I was able to improve my race time by 18 minutes with the right preparation and some help from this book.

I was given this product as a gift in January. I been using it as directed 3 times a week for the last few months (the jar really last a while) I've noticed that it got rid of my blackheads as well as prevented new ones. I've been complemented on my face complexion a few times and that is a good feeling. I just put in my 2nd order with the Vernal serum. Can't wait. I would definitely recommend this to everyone. It is very pricey for my standards but a little does go a very long way as I mentioned. If you're on the edge about this just take the plunge. It's a great product.

Kids' engaging collection car show; funny, and interactive encyclopedic book. Every possible, potentially moving, part is responding to the little fingers poking them to tickle and react. For the four years old it is magic, for the sixes it is fun, for the eights is inspiration, and parents joyfully content.Here is what I just received from Marina, my daughter-in-law, "Hi Joe. We got the 'The Ultimate Book of Vehicles' book today. Oliver LOVES it. Thanks so much!" joyful for beloved grandson enthusiasm, I sent promptly my following reply:"My eyes already touch Oliver's vehicles,going ultimately of the road I have begun....it has its inner light, even from a distance--and changes us, even if we do not reach it,.....,"-- Rainer Rilke [Q/Q]

"With their spindly legs and bulgy eyes, flamingos aren't as cute as penguins, but they have a similarly intensive, dual-parent approach. ...Drama flares when a storm builds, and the flamingos can only huddle close together and wait it out."--Abby Nolan Flamingos form one of nature’s dazzlingly beautiful birds, grandson Oliver, as all first graders will enjoy watching the life cycle of the flamingo, from hatching to flying with others. Since the female lays an egg on the shore, she and her mate take turns sitting on the egg, to keep it warm, until, a sticky curious head peeks out! The parents start feeding the wobbly chick, which then learns to feed itself, until it’s ready to fly and start its own life as a grown bird.Introducing these exotic creatures in an account that will be an enjoyable read, J. London lucidly explains how the birds breed and care for their young. This biology informing picture book joins up, bird's biographical narrative with vivid scenes in pencil and watercolor to follow the flamingos and their big flock throughout their life pattern. Author's poetic text and K. Rodanas’s artful pencil and watercolor drawings dramatizing the life of this nice bird.

"Forever changing places- And they put out the star-light with the breath from their pale faces. And buries them up quite- In a labyrinth of light-" --Edgar Allen Poe, Dream-LandThis is a delightful book, in an appealing series on the quadruple great grand nephews of American icon Edgar Allan Poe, whose mystery short stories captured my teen imagination. The legendary Poe's tales of mystery and horror initiated the modern detective story, and his amazing poems and tales are unrivaled in American fiction. I love to introduce him to my achiever grandson Noah, and this is an appetiser.In 'Once Upon a Midnight Eerie', unique twin boys are special, as they can look into each other's mind and read their other thoughts. This makes them a challenging case for the lunatic Professor Pangborn Perry, an evil scientist. Here, the twins are in New Orleans, about to play Poe in a feature movie. The villainous Professor, is determined to kill one of them, in order to prove his mad scientific theory.I am delighted by this Poe mystery style tale , "Entertaining and original. ... Endlessly fun and ultimately very satisfying on every level," as described in the starred review by Publishers Weekly. I hope Noah will be amazed by the creative mystery, along with the occasional interludes of original Poe and the wide cocktail of history, codes, jokes, and assorted literary reference and vocabulary.

"She is so distraught over the loss of Patches that she imagines that terrible things have befallen him, ...She translates all of her anxiety into drawings that show the worst of her fears."--Barbara BuckleyA book written with a senstive understanding of kids concerns and their learning styles. Jenny is having a hard week, as happens sometimes with Angelina, my grand niece who studies in Almunecar, south of Spain. I was sympathetic to pet loss of patches, jenny's missing guinea pig, since I went through one, with my own son years ago in Milan.Jenny got a hard assignment for her homework, to write a comprehensive story. But on arriving home, she discovers that her pet Patches, is missing. Although she loves to draw, she has trouble composing stories and is worried about the assignment. She draws missing-pet posters and hangs them up in the neighborhood, while searching for Patches.This is an engaging story, fashioned with suspense and portrayed with vivid pictures which cover Jenny's hard week. This kid-friendly picture book that I ordered for my grandson Oliver, will appeal to his cousin Angelina, once all ends well when a neighbor returns her beloved pet. Here is a reminder for busy mothers, that young kids have their own concerns too.

"We read this in two nights, the boys would have preferred it in one sitting! They laughed a lot, clearly missed all the old movie references but it didn't seem to matter one bit."-- MelissaA bungling crew of New York City rodents has a story to tell in this jaunty fable, a funny story about three gangster mice who attempt a hold up at a cheese shop. Marvin hitches a ride out of the theater, discovers a cheese shop nearby. He persuades his companions that renown, with delicious food, lie where Marvin plans to "pull off the job of the century."The intended target is the Cheese Barrel, a shop filled wall-to-wall with all sorts of delightful cheese: 'appetizing, flavorful, luscious, savory, sharp, and tangy'. The mice base their ideas, plans and actions on numerous movies they saw while they were living in a movie theater. The account is entertaining and is reminiscent of old movies.First published forty years ago, Merciless Marvin shines as the convincing talker, leader of mice and rat gang of the Bijou Theater. As flashy gangsters and heists, join Marvin in the criminal adventure with some funny, if unsuccessful initial attempts. By book's end, restless Marvin prefers adventure over an easy life of accessible cheese.

"Another hurdle is the fact that most American kids, or adults for that matter, aren't familiar with the Garibaldi biscuit. Originally published in the UK, this title may suffer from a cultural divide of cuisine."--T. JonkerGaribaldi's biscuits are wafers cooked with currants, sometimes containing raisins in them. This funny children's book recounts the story of how Garibaldi's biscuits were cooked, and the whereabouts of their invention. Using insane surreal fiction and existential chaotic drawings, the author and artist will leave the reader both perplexed and entertained, which is pretty wild for a kid's book.After years fighting battles in South America with an army of Italian exiled soldiers, General Garibaldi returned to Italy. There Giuseppe and his men fought back the invading French Bourbons army, for a while. The Bourbons have kidnapped Garibaldi's grandparents to cook them biscuits. Undiminished in courage or valor, Italy's hero and his fighters wage water balloon war on the Bourbons.Garibaldi's soldiers use pizzas for belt buckles, holding up their pantaloons and eat them when they're hungry. Pet woodpeckers wearing overalls, and waging war with water balloons, will all mingle to create a tale that is hilarious for imaginative kids, and amusingly odd for their parents. Garibaldi is victorious, but his kind grandmother volunteered to bake the defeated army something to eat, thence the famous biscuits are born.

***1/2This clown 'Prince of Crime', is Batman's arch-nemesis, famous for his three-piece purple suit. His real motives, origin, and provocations are shrouded in mystery. He has caused Batman more suffering than any other enemy has ever faced. Batman must call on his top ally Superman to join forces in a team assault.The robot has giant barrel hands that automatically swing down when the legs are squeezed. It's hands have light arrows on them, that kids find where exactly to stand the figures whenever they want to grab them. Kids can position one of the figures under the barrel, and then make the robot grab and contrive the figure.The set is designed for young kids, and collectors of 5-7 who love to add the figures to their collections. Grandson Oliver, would have a lot of fun conducting Batman, Superman against The Joker Robo Rampage Figure.  Batteries are not required, and a fierce battle is ready to be waged when they show right out of the box!

This is the most charming Alphabet I have ever encountered, using an innovative complex assemblies to present the Latin script by means of an uncommon subject for kids; a Steam Punk. While those mice are machinery fans, using a vocabulary of fittings and machines as: anvil, bolt, crank, drill, and faucet, ending in a 19th century flying marvel; Zeppelin!Re-inventing funny machinery out of old hardware is a great mission and will promote the love of alphabet to preschool and first graders, by a thrilling make-believe outmoded but kid friendly 'steam-punk' world. the kids tour guides are two cute Victorian mice.The drawings are very well presented in a machinery environment that appeals to youngsters.I selected this fun inducing, reading enhancing, alpha-help book, in spite of its presenter 'Professor Whiskerton' choice of hard to keep vocabulary, for my first grader enthusiastic grandson Oliver. I am sure his big brother Noah will love to share and borrow the book, which promotes machine appreciation, for the boys linking to an engaging future career.

Since twins Molly and Penelope were born, the Quirks were forced to move over two dozen times, to avoid being exposed. Within nearly a decade, their attempts to settle down in quiet normal neighborhoods are jeopardized. The family inclination to abuse their own 'special powers' may have contributed to their problems, rather than being the villains they seem. At school, Molly, Penelope, and Finn are now learning circus skills in gym class.Finn, a five-years-old naughty boy, takes advantage of his latent invisibility to play annoying tricks, stealing from Mrs. DeVille, while low concentration mother Bree, keeps her job as a waitress by influencing customers' minds, to her benefit. It takes detective work to keep their nosy neighbor from snooping around Luckily, and uncovering the Quirk family secrets. The unskilled Molly works her magical tricks to keep her illusionist sister distracted.I got this funny book for my grandson Noah, who looks for adventures and imaginative stories that he enjoys reading. The third grader is a young avid book reader, who has a passion for funny stories with real twists. Though Soderberg plays the Quirks' dilemma as a comic situation, young readers are less likely to smile than be embarrassed at the Quirks' behavior. Few hard words are thought stimulating and would grow his vocabulary!

"Find the twelve relics. You are the last."-- a message on a dangerous quest to unlock an  ancient, guarded secret that could destroy the fate of the world !Darrell, Lily, Wade, and Becca fly to Germany to attend the funeral of an old family friend, but instead of just paying their respect, they end up mingled into a dangerous global chase to discover the secret that could jeopardize the fate of human race. Their mission is to locate some hidden parts of a time-navigation astrolabe built by Copernicus. They are in a mad race, fearful that the device could fall into the hands of the evil Knights of the Teutonic Order.In this first installment of the Copernican Legacy series, best selling author Tony Abbott's epic begins with 'The Forbidden Stone', an appetizing  sampler of scientific discovery in fast-paced action, and entertaining characters. Abbott connects all the threads together in a masterful fashion, creating an engaging thriller, full to the brim by puzzles, codes, and locales. Grandson Noah and friends are looking forward to enjoy the science thriller as the series progresses.

****1/2It was reported on Friday October 18, 2013 by Park City Daily News that Kentucky Creation Museum, has been the beneficiary of a large dinosaur skeleton, which is said to offer even more proof that supports the account of a universal flood. The dinosaur skeleton, donated by the Elizabeth Peroutka Foundation of Maryland, is said to be the remains of a 10 feet tall, 30 feet long, Allosaurus, which is in tremendous order. This incident was a reminder to plan a trip to the nearby museum, but first find a guide book on dinosaurs.This, 'Not For Parents' book reveals everything young prehistoric adventurers need to know about how to become a famous dinosaur hunter. Hence, you have to be ready to journey through time into space, if you choose this fine book to be your guide to the desolate corners of the planet. It can guide you to search and find dinosaur fossils, as bones, teeth  and eggs, or just mere footprints. Earth's ancient geologic past will unfold to discover out how dinosaurs lived, where and when.Don't be scared when you confront the strangest, largest and most frightening creatures that ever dominated our planet earth. Since experience makes all the difference, tips from some of the eminent dinosaur footprints trackers and remains investigators of the last century and present archeologists, will help.  You could join the great fossil collectors and find out modern methods to date prospective petrified skeletons, transport them to our realm after surviving the wild expedition.This is a great book for curious third and fourth graders, enthusiastic for information on wild prehistoric creatures. "We" learn where and how dinosaurs could be unearthed. Archeological names of the dinosaurs are given, challenging the parents to join their young kids adventure, to explore prehistoric facts. The illustrations are vivid, inviting us to enjoy geosciences at their best on all about dinosaurs. This is a wonderful book, that I shared the enjoyment of old world mysteries with my grandson Noah.

For my friendly first grader, grandson Oliver, his chartered school's active librarian is a kind of a helping teacher, who advises on books. She finds and acquires great books that keep kids in an elevated states of interest in school, about the environment, and help him discovering new ideas.He thinks this is a nice book, about which he knows many of the information, but enjoys reading more about them. This time, he opened the cute picture book, and invited me to share with him his experience with books, school, and young kids his age. He is now my guide to his intellectual world.It is very encouraging to feel Oliver's self confidence, and cute command, while he gave me a good tour of his 'alma mater'. He takes pride in borrowing of many books, that he selects by himself, and shares with the family on arriving home. He recounts his new encounters, and lively learning adventure!

Uncovering lost manuscripts, suspected to be authored by William Shakespeare, changed forever Colophon Letterford's life. The authenticity of the manuscripts, in hand, is in question, when the centuries-old family publishing business is in danger. Now, in this entangled mystery, thirteen-year-old Colophon  travels from Oxford's lofty landmark, the Tower of the Five Orders, to London's sewer slums. The stakes are high in her pursuit of truth, in an effort to save her family honor.This is the second in a series of mysteries, wherein our heroine Colophon Letterford continues to search for the family treasure. Shakespeare fans, and mystery lovers alike will be delighted in the puzzling circumstances of this engaging novel, a sequel to Secrets of Shakespeare's Grave, which I am following since its review a year ago. Colophon is a likeable character, courageous and determined. There is a fine buildup of suspense, that focuses attention and sparks interest in her adventure.The story just mentions Shakespeare and Marlowe, in the passing. The Bodlean library may provoke the curious young readers to pose a question to their teacher. The novel keeps an  entertaining pace, and poses hints on literary celebrities, to invite cultural dialogue. I think some young readers, are invited by Deron Hicks, a quality writer, to start their investigation of other adventure stories that extend their interest in history, geography and literature, after enjoying the Tower of the five Orders!

****1/2I found this science enhancing book, for kids at early age, a good match for my six years old curious grandson. The book has an introduction to explains how fossils are formed, and how valuable they are for learning about prehistoric life on our planet earth. A fossil is an article  either from a plant or an animal, that has been preserved by nature for a long time. It may be a petrified shell fish, or a woolly mammoth, frozen for thousands of years in the icy ground. Sometimes it's the skeleton of a dinosaur that has turned hard like stone.The book uses full-color pictures to tell the story of a boy, who while taking a walk along the shore of a lake, with his cocker spaniel, finds three different fossils. Going for a hike, the boy trips on a fossil, that comes to life, revealing its origin as an ancient complex leave plant. The boy splits open two other fossils which also come to life, a dragonfly, and a pterosaurs.  When the boy releases a huge, scaly pterodactyl, it carries his dog away, that he must find out how to send the beast back to its petrified state.Artistically told without a word, this visual story will surely inspire first grader Oliver and instruct him creativity.  Thomson’s dramatic, extraordinary illustrations, are vivid art on every page, enlivened further by exploratory geometry, and active shots of the boy’s shocked face. The mix of Fossil with the flight of fancy is thrilling as a kid breaks open fossils and sees live versions of the fossils appear.  But this book will tell Oliver, a young artist in his own right,  how can you make a fossil, too;  the imprint of an ancient leaf in a rock.

Just before the start of her eighth grade, Siena moves from Brooklyn to a coastal town in Maine. Unlike most youngsters, thirteen-year-old Siena doesn't care much about the move.  Her impared vision makes it hard to build close relations, but she has hopes that a new school will allow her to start anew. Siena also hopes the new surrounding may encourage her mute young brother to recover, speaking again. Siena's has an obsession with abandoned things that began, about the time her two-year-old brother Lucca stopped talking.Siena starts to accommodate to her new environment, uncovering oddities about their new home. She experiences flashes from the past, and weird happenings when an old pen begins writing by its own. She becomes absorbed in the events, trying to discover all facts about the former inhabitants, who lived in the house during the great World War. Siena is able to form friendships and as she continues her investigations.. Her new ability for interacting, has eventually provided her with the insight to help her brother unlock his will to speak.Although Siena's strong inclination for imagination strides has inflluenced her illusive mood, the plot is more leisurely in the first half of the novel, that active readers may detatch. Supernatural themes blend naturally with a drift for reality, thus appealing to critical young readers who enjoy paranormal events to be justified. The milieu of Siena’s world is perceptible, with the developing mysterious and engaging narrative. I hope Noah, my 9 years old grandson, will be engaged enough while the novel acquires its inertia  in order to enjoy the happy conclusion.

****1/2"The most significant book of our time, in the field of Christology." --Rudolph Bultmann*Many people today don't realize that Jesus claimed to be Devine. They're content to think of Him as little more than a great moral teacher. But even His enemies understood His claims to deity. That's why they tried to stone Him to death (John 5:18; 10:33) and eventually had Him crucified (John 19:7). C. S. Lewis reflected, "You can shut Him up for a fool, you can spit at Him and kill Him as a demon; or you can fall at His feet and call Him Lord and God. But let us not come up with any patronizing nonsense about His being a great human teacher. He has not left that open to us. He did not intend to" -- Mere ChristianityDonald (John) Baillie completed the new edition of his book, "God was in Christ," with editing and appendices, just before he passed away in 1954. He anticipated and pioneered the task of liberating biblical terminology and reforming theological expression, that culminated in post WW-II best seller, "Honest to God, 1963" by the Bishop of Woolwich. Baillie was praised half a century ago, to have written his brilliant essay on Incarnation and Atonement; 'as an adequate and up-to-date form of orthodox Christianity, since the ecumenical movement started enhancing the clarification of some theological topics in biblical exegesis.'For a novice student of theology, John Baillie has offered a sharpening tool, in his essay, to examine the question which Jesus posed to his lay disciples, of fishermen, that echoes at every Christian encounter with Christ, "What do you think I am?" Prof. Horton discussed the book in a lengthy exposition in his book, "Christ the savior," expressing an important issues of using intelligible friendly language. Same was emphasized by Nottingham's G. H. Bebawi, professor of systematic theology, and eminent patrologist that, "The great patristic thought of the church fathers, needs to be expressed in today modern vermicular language."In 'Christ in Gospel and creed', biblical theologian James Barr has made a parallel observation, that orthodox Christianity possessed an insight which has been lost from sight in much modern biblical studies; the insight that the interpretation of Christ must state that He was not only what He did, that must not only be soteriological but also antological." Baillie attempted thus to affirm a biblical doctrine of the Person of Christ that adheres to the Pauline teaching; "that God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto himself, not imputing their trespasses unto them; and hath committed unto us the word of reconciliation." --I Cor 5:19

Demi is the dean of biographical storyteller, recognized by American young teens, as well as celebrated children book reviewers. this is my second encounter with the gifted Artist and troubadour. Her story teller skills which she invested in introducing Marco Polo, and her artistic talent has brought him within the pioneering spirit of mediaeval Europe into exposition, and earned her many praise.The case of the Macedonian prince and heroic invader, could have taken a better course, if "why Alexander became great, since he was sixteen, was better highlighted.  While Alexander was trained to be a bold king, his education made of him an original thinker, by exposing him to Aristotle who tutored him within a group of outstanding peers, who thought with him, fought on his side, and propagated Aristotle Hellenization concept.Her impressive drawings, painted with black and red inks and shining gold overlays, and with frames inspired by jewels from the tomb of Philip II of Macedonia at Verghina. The note describing Demi's research and source material could be meant for book promoters and reviewers. With all this said, I feel like this book praised war heroism rather than statemanship of a united world.Starting with Alexander's childhood Demi did not underline quite clearly the creative impact of Aristotle as a tutor, in a healthy study milieu. Alexander grew up with global improvement and unification concepts under his Greek culture, which Macedonia was part. Our children and teens should always believe that America is great because science is enhanced, so technology blooms and thrives.

****Manolito Gafotas was adapted from a Spanish popular comic. Manolito is a ten-year-old boy from Madrid, Spain. If you ask anyone in his neighborhood who Manolito is, they will say that they do not know, but all of Manolito's friends know him well. they call him Four-Eyes, because of his extra two thick glasses. Manolito doesn't mind his funny nickname, he got used to it since he was five years old.Manolito is a cheerful but accident-prone child who doesn't see his father very often. He lives with his family, enjoys a happy life with his parents and loves his grand dad, thinking he's the coolest grandee. Manolito is having great times always with his Grandfather, from venturing up and down town, meeting famous personalities, once taking part in a demonstration. He rushes through life getting into and out of trouble with reckless exuberance.In Manolito's eyes, everything that happens is dramatic and earth-shaking. He feels strongly that life is good and volunteers to tell everyone all about "how that adventures and venturing friends and neighbors adds flavor to every moment. His chattering big mouth ends up causing him to visit the school psychologist. When he starts recounting his life story to the psychologist, with every minute detail, the psychologist has to get rid of him!This is a books that is perfect for reluctant boys or girls, who may enjoy and profit by reading it the most. While its language is agreeable, Manolito's expressions are distinctly Spanish. There are some turns of speech that may  jeopardize kid's attention.
