I do, however, have a thirst for efficiency and the deepest appreciation for quality and excellence, and my review is coming from that perspective.The phrase "The bitterness of poor quality lingers long after the sweetness of low price is forgotten" is completely applicable in every area of life, but especially when it comes to the tools required to do a job quickly and do it well.When life demands I get down to business and create something in the kitchen, or lend a hand to the true pro in the food production process, more than anything, I want to have the best tools at hand. Over the years there have been many cheap ($5-$25) knives take up space in the drawers in the kitchen. Initially, these knives do a decent job, but over time they beg to be replaced, complaining that a tomato has become a significant challenge. Instead of their kitchen duties, some have even suggested they be retired and live out their existence as a form of cruel and rather painful form of home defense.Given there is a significant cost increase for this knife, from what I have paid for knives in the past, my expectations around its ability to deliver stellar results were unrelenting - as much as they could be for a nonprofessional.From the moment I took receipt of the shipment and took the knife out of the packaging, I was impressed. No matter what I flung on the chopping board, no surface was a match for the business edge of the Sabatier.I have read other reviews that called the validity of the 'Mother of Pearl' materials and also the metal used. For me, given the performance from this knife, it could be wrapped in banana skins for the handle and be made of Kevlar as long as it keeps cutting the same way.In summary, if you are a chef, or someone who knows a lot about knives, you might find fault with my review. If however you are like me - a non-pro - you may be just as delighted as I was to have this knife replace 8-10 of the older blunt objects sitting in the knife drawer.Just kidding on the cup of coffee...
It's nice looking and feels strong.It does a good job protecting the phone.It performs well when closed, but once it has been open for a while, it doesn't close quickly.

In reviewing this router, I am comparing it to my ASIN:B00PDLRHFW TP-LINK Archer C9 AC1900 Dual Band Wireless AC Gigabit Router, 2.4GHz 600Mbps+5Ghz 1300Mbps, 1 USB 2.0 Port & 1 USB 3.0 Port, IPv6, Guest Network.When it comes to Internet access, my needs in a router go beyond simply being able to surf the Web and check my email. They are more centered around being able to upload and download a significant volume of high-resolution images. As such, simply getting a signal is not enough to woo me; there has to be power available with the signal.When reading this review, consider that if your need for speed is not as demanding as mine, then this router may be more than you need. Alternatively, and not something I was able to test for, if you have a big family or office with four or more people with significant bandwidth demands, then this may be the better option for you.With my testing, this router did about the same as the TP-Link Archer C9 AC1900. I did side-by-side testing both routers using three different products - a Dell Laptop, an Asus tablet (that could only connect to the 2.4Ghz network) and an Asus Zenfone 2 phone.In terms of the specs for both models, they are quite similar.AC1900 with 1.9Gps on 1x 2.4Ghz (600Mbps) and 1x 5Ghz (1300Mbps) networks but the AC3200 has 3200Gps on 1x 2.4 (600Mbps) and 2x 5Ghz (1300Mbps) networks.Both the AC1900 and AC3200 have a 1Ghz Dual core processor.Both routers have USB 3.0 ports to share printers and storage across the network.AC1900 has 3 antennas and the AC3200 has 6.Both have 4 1 gigabit ports.Both use beam forming technology.Both offer guest networks.Both products appear to have the same set of functionality in the user interface.ProsTri-Band allows for two networks - 1x 2.4Ghz and 2x 5Ghz allowing one to connect more devicesSUPER easy setupGreat user interfaceEasily identify the devices connected to the network4 1 gigabit portsDesign  - very attractive. Much prefer this design to the AC1900Guest network allows visitors to be able to connect to the Internet while keeping my network secure.Access via iOS and Android to remotely administer network privileges, monitor usage, adjust parental controls, etc.ConsFor me, there aren't really any cons - it's just not as powerful as I expected given the higher price and the six antennas. Having said that, I wasn't streaming 4K video on each of the networksSummary - difficult to say regarding performance when compared to the AC1900, because I didn't have any 4K to stream (maybe another reviewer can speak to that) but this is a dream to set up - super easy, and the administration via the app is a big plus. You could literally be taking advantage of this great product within 8-10 minutes of opening the box (that includes taking the time to change the network names and setting up your passwords, etc)NERDY stuff....Test results from side-by-side testing using speedtest.net on the three devices mentioned above: For each result listed below, I did five tests and posted the highest score from those.DL = download, UL = Upload, and Bars is signal strength.AC1900 2.4gHZDell LaptopDL - 112.12UL - 13.85Asus TabletDL - 22.54UL - 13.53Asus Zenfone 2DL - 72.35UL - 14.20AC1900 5gHZDell LaptopDL - 403.24UL - 13.87Asus TabletDL - COULD NOT CONNECT TO 5gHZUL - COULD NOT CONNECT TO 5gHZAsus Zenfone 2DL - 219.27UL - 14.78AC3200 2.4gHZDell LaptopDL - 110.52UL - 15.43Asus TabletDL - 21.47UL - 15.39Asus Zenfone 2DL - 63.73UL - 14.76AC3200 5gHZDell LaptopDL - 318.21UL - 15.37Asus TabletDL - COULD NOT CONNECT TO 5gHZUL - COULD NOT CONNECT TO 5gHZAsus Zenfone 2DL - 227.84UL - 14.36
Adorable artwork and the kinds of verses kids love.

This is a great alternative to the rather limited electric or battery operated  products on the market. Having had a few over the years, I either lose the chargers or they simply break because of quality issues.This product reminds me of something I would see my dad having owned for 20 or more years. It has a solid feel to the construction, and the materials feel like high quality.The product does a great job, and the fact that one's skin is protected from ever coming into contact with the business end with the cutting edge is very comforting.The fact that it works perfectly, will never cut your skin, only the hair, and the old world appeal of a non-motorized, well-engineered product make this a 5-star product.

I was sent these in exchange for an unbiased review, and i have to say, they are great.Pros:Even though my hands are small, they fit well thanks to the grip of the rubber.Every part of the glove is the same thickness, so I am able to grasp whatever I want and not get burned or feel excessive heat.I'll never have to put them in the washing machine.They're a great color.Cons:Can't think of any.

The cream feel nice on the face. It's not oily or greasy, and it spreads easily. The pump doesn't necessarily squirt out the exact same amount each time, so sometimes there's a bit too much and sometimes not enough.I've used this every night for five days now, and took photos of my eye before and after. As far as I can tell, it has made no difference at all to the lines around my eyes or the puffiness. Perhaps after a longer period of time I'd notice a change, in which case I'll update.I'd recommend looking for another cream if you're targeting wrinkles.

Having given this product a fair stab (4 weeks) at becoming something I love, it is time to do the review.Firstly, the product was unable to win me over. The first thing out of the box is that the tip looks like there is something missing or perhaps fell off in shipping. While not a design major, or anything remotely close, my brain had a hard time resolving that such a wide opening with holes on the sides was going to deliver a more powerful deluge of mouthwash than something more probe-like. Upon inspection of the images on the box and website I discover that it is how it was designed, and nothing is missing.After a full charge cycle I loaded the chamber and elected to give myself the full treatment by setting it to 3 and let it give the plaque a really good talking to.Unprepared for the sidespash and ricochet onto the bathroom mirror, I decided I should close my lips to localize the discharge as I continue my test run.  Now, with that problem addressed, an no more 'cleanup on aisle B' over the intercom, I face a new situation.  With each burst from this oral hygiene M16, I am treated to a new  and wonderful sensation - the joy of watching my cheeks enlarge as I inflate my face.  At this point, I just feel like I have been pranked and look around carefully for the hidden cameras.Upon conclusion of my first test run, with mirror cleaned off, and umbrella safely stored away, I look at the reservoir that holds the rinse and can't help but be surprised that I am almost completely out of ammo. Maybe I have used the same amount I would in a normal mouthwash, but it just looked alarming to have used so much.As I think about the marketplace regarding this product, there are 3 players in this equation. I have ranked them in order of winning to not so winning:Whoever makes the Breathrx mouth rinse.Phillips.The consumer.In closing, I have to wonder about the following bullet points in the 'About the product' section on the Amazon listing.Clinically proven as effective as floss for gum healthHealthier gums in 2 weeks, guaranteed#1 - If it is as effective as flossing... then .... I'm sorry, but isn't it just a super expensive (by comparison) alternative ?#2 - For any such guarantee to be valid, it has to be based on a measurable metric. Do we have to visit the dentist and get a checkup prior to the first use, and then return 2 weeks later.  Also, that guarantee is only valid for someone who isn't currently flossing, because as stated in point #2, this is as effective as flossing. That would mean if you floss, and switch to the Airfloss Pro, you will not see healthier gums.I could go on, and do the pros and cons, but i'm not sure it would deliver any new information. If you have made it this far, then I think you know where I stand on this product.

Really love this backpack. The leather feels great, and you can tell from across the room that this is a quality piece of merchandise. Amazing craftsmanship from the design to the construction.ProsThe leatherThe stitching looks solidThe straps are securely attachedSnug pocket for 15" laptopPerfect amount of pockets and compartments insideTop pocket next to the handle perfect for keys or phoneConsNoneIf this bag is in your price range, it will not disappoint you.

What impressed me the most was the stoneware interior that can be removed and washed separately. It seems to avoid the stains ans smells other slow cookers are prone to do.The color is a good neutral gray, and it can easily fit enough for in it for 6-8 people.It has four settings--off, low heat, high heat and keep warm. It would be great to have a light to show it's on though.It's a good size at 13.45 inches x 8.65 inches x 13.77 inches, so I wouldn't recommend it for meals for two.I can see how the meal is cooking through the glass lid.The handles don't get too hot to handle.The lid doesn't fit at all snugly, and you can almost move it in circles when it's in place. The vents are not in the lid, they are scored into the sides of the stoneware. Perhaps that's why the lid doesn't fit tightly, but it seems like a poor design feature.The lid holder on the side is a clever addition. Sometimes I have so much in my counters that it can be hard to find a place in a snap to leave the lid.The cord is only about 18" long--not adequate for the way my stuff is set up.All in all, it's a good choice if you are cooking for a crowd and don't want the crockpot stained or smelling after being washed.

For the purpose of being able to comment on this garment, I put this shirt through an extreme test, I wore it all day while driving in Texas.Since this is something I have done quite frequently (the driving, not testing out shirts), I knew it would be a good acid test to determine if it does keep you dry and comfortable.Firstly, I am 5"6, 160lbs and have a 32 inch waist, and this shirt fit me as expected.Despite the material being a little heavier than what I thought it 'should be' to deliver on its performance claims to keep me dry, I was pleasantly surprised.What I wanted to know was immediately clear after getting in the car, and remained unchanged all day.  This fabric is amazing.In addition to remaining comfortable, and dry, the additional component for me that makes all the difference  is remaining presentable. There is no point in feeling comfortable and dry if your clothes look wet, with this shirt, that was not the case.For me, the only negative is in relation to style. I feel the fabric is a little long in the body. For a shirt that isn't going to be tucked in, my preference would be for a shorter shirt but about 2-3 inches. While I took away one star for this, it in no way affects its performance which is more important :)In conclusion, in addition to the material used, the construction (stitching etc) yields a shirt that works well in high temperatures and is very durable. I can see this shirt lasting for many years.

This tape did the perfect job in keeping my new replacement screen secure.It would be nice to see the tape sold in smaller amounts, because I think I would have to replace a screen 3 times per month for a year to use all this tape up.

I love this grinder. It fits neatly into my kitchen cabinet with my other coffee gadgets. It comes in a bag -- cylinder and removable handle.Simply attach the handle, spoon in your coffee, and turn until you see it all in the window below.The grind on the coffee is perfect for my Aeropress or Mr. Coffee percolator.This is definitely a one-person/one-cup grinder due to its size, but it does the job quickly and well.It would be nice to have a funnel to get the coffee beans into the top part, but not vital.Recommended

This came in a few parts that were easy enough to put together. It has a four-prong base, four screws to attach the grill top into the cradle, and a swing arm to lock it in place.Once ready, this stands quite low off the floor -- about 3 foot high. I'm only 5"2, so it worked for me, but I can't imagine a tall guy working easily with this.The second issue I had with this is its light weight -- there is no weight in the base, and any child or dog could easily knock it over while it's grilling hot food.The third thing I found unhelpful is the uneven cooking -- I put some veg, 3 pieces of bacon and two burgers on it (about as much as it can fit), and had to move the meat onto the side that seemed to be cooking it faster.The fourth complaint is the fat drainage. I like bacon fat, but the whole point of this grill is to drain off everything. A lot of the fat collected at the top end of the grill and didn't even enter the groove in the middle to transport it away.On the plus side, everything was cooked in 15 minutes at the 4 setting, and the bacon didn't spit at me the way it does in a skillet.All in all, a disappointing grill.

[I was given a copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.]Dorinda Trick has very evidently put her years of experience and knowledge into this gem of a book. While a lot of identity workshops and books use oft overused Christian tests and labels, Trick writes about seven redemptive gifts as identity markers, and spends time in each chapter going through the positive aspects of what you bring to the world and what you might need to watch out for if you have that particular gift. At the end of each chapter is a detailed blessing of that gift in you, which is written in a similar style to the Blessing Your Spirit prayers by Sylvia Gunter and Arthur Burke.Trick includes much of her personal story to freedom in the opening chapters, which helps lay a solid groundwork for the material she introduces in the remainder of the book. She also includes a questionnaire at the back of the book to help you figure out your most predominant and secondary gifts.I'd recommend this book for anyone interested in learning more about self-awareness and personal growth or counseling and coaching others.

This is a nice desk lamp that looks great and provides a nice amount of coverage on my desk.Pros:Sturdy constructionQuality materialsSignificant weight - unlikely to be knocked overConsUnable to angle the shade that houses the bulbLacks fluid movement when raising and lowering the height (not sure it's a significant issue for me because once it is in place, it is more likely to be left at that height, but could be an issue for some customers)Included bulb is very cool (blue light) - not a major issue since a replacement bulb can be purchased, but straight out of the box, the light delivered through the provided bulb is very clinicalOn/off switch/spindle only operates in one direction - in the other direction, it unscrewsIn summary, if the angle of the shade was adjustable, thereby providing directional adjustment to the coverage. and the color temperature of the provided bulb was warmer (more orange like incandescent lighting) then this would get 5 stars.

For a rotary shaver, this is the closest to a foil head shaver I have ever used. Of all the rotary shavers I have tried over the years, none has ever performed well for my shaving needs when compared to foil head shavers or a blade.Below my review, I have listed my most recent shavers in order of preference.This is a great shaver, gets the job done well and provides a close shave. There is no burn or skin discomfort (highly unusual for a rotary shaver for me). In addition to being wonderful from a functional standpoint, it is elegantly designed and features LED status lights that are beneath the surface of the handle.  Lots to love with this product.ProsExcellent shaveNo burn or discomfort after the shaveElegant designBeard trimmer does a brilliant jobLove the fact that it can be used in the showerLove the fact that the charge cable can be plugged directly into the shaver for charging, eliminating the need to bring the big base unit on the roadConsBeard trimmer is a separate accessory, which makes it possible to leave at home when travellingSize of cleaning charge baseReliance on a renewable (=additional cost) item to keep the shaver working at its bestIn use, it just doesn't sound like it's fully charged and ready to remove my facial hair pronto.Most recent shavers in order of their performance:BladeRemington XF8700 Smart Edge - (Foil)Philips Norelco 7700 - (Rotary)Panasonic ES-LT41-K Arc3 - (Foil)Remington XR1340 - (Rotary)Philips Norelco 4500 (AT830/46) - (Rotary)
Love this card so much.  I have purchased 9 of them over the last year or so.
This Anker car USB charger does a great job delivering all day performances for 2 cell phones, a tablet and an e cigarette.

Because I use my phone all day long - there is nothing better than having a second battery ready to go if mine runs out.Sometimes, the demands of my cell usage exceed my car charger ability to keep my p[hone amped for the day. This additional battery is a life saver (ok, not actual lives, but it enables me to keep in contact with my clients), and I never leave home with out it.

Usually when reviewing a product, I like to compare it to a competitor's product, or something similar, to give some understanding as to where my opinion is based.For this review, I can only compare the ease of use, power, and results to those previously achieved through the use of a more primitive competitor - a hammer. I will break my review into two parts, the good and the bad. Lets start with the bad.The documentation. The layout of the documentation and the "steps" to follow to use the product leave a lot to be desired. To dispel any fear about using such a product (especially for people who have never used anything like it before), I feel there could be a major improvement in the documentation regarding clear steps to follow.A graphic-intensive instruction set would be really helpful. Having photographs with the areas of interest detailed with numbers is fine, but having to read through the entire instructions to find out what each element is in order to follow the instructions makes for very difficult reading. For me, the main area of concern was how much pressure should be in the tank. This is not detailed anywhere in the documentation.On to the GOOD (or should I say awesome)!Once set up and running, using it is effortless and so enjoyable -- so effortless I feel guilty.All 3 attachments, (Brad Nailer, Finish Nailer, and Stapler) are super easy to connect and load.The results from each of the three attachments are simply incredible. At the pull of the trigger I went from being a weekend hack to producing professional results. Both nails and staples were completely flush with the wood surface and completely undetectable to the feel.In my operation of all three attachments, there was no jamming, and they all operated flawlessly.Wish listIn the operation of the product, my only real beef is I wish there was an optional set of wheels with locks that could be attached to make it easy to move the compressor around the room one is working on, instead of lifting it.I wish the electrical cord was longer.I wish the hose was longer.I wish the magazine held more ammo. :)I wish the kit included belt clips so you could carry the different attachments with you easily while on a project.I wish I had this during the last round of house repairs and remodeling.I wish I had something else to go work on so I could keep using this brilliant product.Conclusion - in comparison to competing products, I cannot comment; however, if you are looking to move away from a hammer (or a mechanical staple gun), this product will not only deliver results that will make you look like a rock star, but it will preserve your fingers from unfavorable interactions with the business end of a hammer.

Everything you need from the only brand I trust to protect my phones. With the shift of cell carriers subsidizing the cost of phones to now adding the full price to the monthly cell bill, it makes sense to use the best when protecting your smart phone.This has a good matte finish, which helps it not slip out of the hand easily. Obviously an Otterbox case will make the phone fatter in the pocket, but the shell is light, so it's not too heavy in the hand. The scarlet red color isn't too bright -- it's a good rich red tone.Otterbox cases have been successfully protecting my phones on the front lines of life for some years. For this iPhone 6 case, the story is exactly the same -- a great fit, coupled with the best protection you can buy. In addition to the protection, the addition of the extended battery is not only brilliant, but for some, essential, especially for those who are frequently some distance from electricity (campers, hikers etc.). As another reviewer has noted, it seems to take a while to charge up the cover compared to charging the phone directly, but the extended life makes it worthwhile.ProsAmazing physical protectionCharges relatively quicklyStops charging the device when full2600mAh battery extends battery life x 2LED power check statusOnly a smidge bigger then the Defender caseNo camera/flash obstructionCons (not really a con considering the fact that the case is so good and has a battery in it, but worth a mention)The weight - case is 3ozThis case is a perfect option for anyone, but especially a road warrior.

I flew from New York to Dublin (and back) in 2014 and there were no complications either way. I had a 6 lb. Toy Poodle in it, and it was in the cargo hold. There are so many rules when flying internationally that this is really impressive!I've also used this day-to-day, and my dog loves it. It's great quality, sturdy, roomy. The door is removable, of course. Storage is easy and it gets pretty small.NOTE IF YOU'RE FLYING:You will need to purchase metal bolts. The ones that come with this model are plastic, and that's not allowed. HOWEVER, don't let that deter you from getting this crate, because plastic bolts are the norm, it seems. You'll probably have to purchase them no matter what crate you get.I got a pack of bolts for $9 from here:http://www.dryfur.com/universal_kennel_hardware.htm

Really high-quality, sturdy, will probably last awhile. These DO NOT feel cheap or flimsy.I really like them. Planning on ordering a couple more for different places (like my car and another speaker).

I've actually ordered these twice. Once while in California, and then again when I moved state. Very pleased with them.They're thick, do a really great job blocking light (also seem to block sound decently), and look nice. A lot of the light-blocking ones are super ugly, but these are great.(I got the dark brown ones both times.)

If you're wondering if this is too big for your dog, the answer is probably no. That was a concern of mine, and I was excited to see that my dog can manage it. I have a 6 lb. Toy Poodle, so if he can do it, any dog can do it. :D

I have a very small dog who poops tiny poops, so I was worried they'd be too big and cumbersome — but they aren't too big; they're perfect.Love these! They're thick and high quality. Will purchase again. They're now my go-to brand for bags.

Perfect! They fit tea candles and votives wonderfully (yes, I tried both).There was a tiny chip on the edge of one, but I still use it. That's to be expected, I think, when ordering glass online. And this chip isn't noticeable when the candle's up on a shelf or mantlepiece.
These were great! I made a point to order when the weather wasn't too hot (I live in Texas) and nothing melted. Nothing was crumbled or damaged.Great candles, great price. Will order again.

It's a great, easy-to-read, concise history of Christianity. I read this in ministry school a few years ago and decided I wanted to read it again.The "Think About It" blurbs are a little annoying, but I just skip over those. hahaha

I purchased a couple of these, liked them, and then ordered more for other curtains. They're great! They do the job perfectly and are a good price.Sturdy. I have heavy light-blocking curtains on them.A plus for me was that they curve in toward the wall on the edges (see the picture) which allows the curtain to get closer to the wall, blocking more light. Most of the "fancier looking" ones don't do that.
Wonderful dirt.No problems, arrived in good time. I used it for my organic vegetable container garden and have had a good harvest. Will purchase again.

I have a 6 lb. Toy Poodle and these work great. I wasn't sure if they'd work for such a small dog since they're for "medium/large" dogs, but they're great!Sturdy, good quality, seem like they'll last a while. Glad I purchased. =)

Completely delicious.LOVE LOVE LOVE this, and it looks great sitting under my WRT1900AC Wi-Fi Router (SE4008)Hard to do an in-depth review wince the setup is so easy and my bandwith requirements are not life or death situations but here are my thoughtsWhile I understand most people don't have as much equipment as I do in my office and house, I have never been a fan of routers that only come with 4 ports.Using the Switch to expand the gigabit network is completely brilliant for me.In my house, I have the following1 tower PC2 Laptops1 Seagate NAS with 2 1GB ports1 Buffalo NAS1 Playstation1 Alienware Alpha ASM100-4980 Gaming Console2 Network printersThis allows me to get everything wired at the same time and the devices all see each other.PROsEasy setupAmazing to have 10 gigabit ports - 7 on the switch (loosing one of the 8 to connect to the router) along with the other 3 gigabit ports (loosing one of the 4 to connect to the switch) on the routerLooks awesomeRuns coolCONsNoneIn conclusion, this is a great addition to my home network from a brand I know and trust.

In writing this review, I can't compare it to previous experiences with noise cancelling headphones, or anything of a similar quality, but I will list the other products I have owned for the sake of having a point of reference. Additionally it is worth mentioning that I have headphones on most of my working day.The previous two headphones I have owned have been in the $50-$100 range and were thePanasonicRP-HTx7-G1 $50Sennheiser HD 212pro ($100)While I really liked the previous headphones mentioned above, I now realize the gap in quality now that I have the Bose headphones. My review includes the following sections - Audio quality, Build quality, and Comfort.AUDIO QUALITYFirstly, the noise cancelling capabilities are ridiculous (in a great way) . Even without switching on the noise cancellation, the headphones do an amazing job of eliminating sound from around you.  I did 3 tests of the noise reduction without any audio input.#1 beside my tower computer (which has 3 large fans) - result = silence#2 beside my air conditioner - result = silence#3 beside the washing machine and clothes dryer (both running) - result = silenceTo do a fourth test I asked my son to stand in the laundry room with the headphones on while I had the noise cancellation switched off.  Then I turned it on and I watched disbelief and joy sweep across his face, as I am sure it did when I had done this test moments before.Secondly, in relation to the audio reproduction, I wanted to assess the quality in 3 areas - Bass, mids, highs.For the reproduction tests I went to Youtube on my computer for videos with test audio with the search term Headphone test Music.The first test was with the video - "Sound Test for Beats by Dr.Dre - SkillGamingHDI"This video has a strong bass component but weak mid and highs to speak of.  Despite that, it still does an impressive job of giving the headphones a workout.The second test was "Bass and surround sound test" Nice results but I feel the audio itself is not high quality.The 3rd test was "Beethoven's 9th - Ode To Joy | Dolby Headphone 3D sound from Immortal Beloved HD 5.1" Gorgeous quality audio source file and gave each range of the headphones a workout, where they all excelled.The 4th test was sorely focused on the low end response and was validated through playing the track "Ultimate Dubstep Bass Test"Lastly I decided to bring up a favorite artist to reach for extreme bass, while still having a balanced range of mids and highs to assess - for this I listened to Deadmau5  4x4=12 (Continuous Mix) .Since the majority of my daily use is movies and not music I then went to Netflix and looked some movies including some of the most recent releases (for potentially better audio content) to test. Here are the results but remember, results are also dependant on release date.Black Hawk Down - Release date 2001 - Dialogue 9 - Action Sequences 9 - Music 9- Atmosphere (distant rain, breathing etc) 9Marvels Daredevil - Release date 2015 - Dialogue 10 - Action Sequences 10 - Music 10 - Atmosphere (distant rain, breathing etc) 10The November Man - Release date 2014 - Dialogue 10 - Action Sequences 10 - Music 10 - Atmosphere (distant rain, breathing etc) 10Overall a score of 10/10From my LG android phone the audio was not as brilliant, but that is a function of my phone and not the headphonesBUILD QUALITYA typical area of concern for me in headphones is the build quality, especially around any joints or any area that moves.I was delighted to see metal hinges which are embedded in rather thick plastic.  I do not anticipate any breakages in normal use of the product.Fabric covered headband - while this black fabric feels nice  to the touch, I think I would rather leather or another material to reduce the potential for the accumulation of dirt either from hands or hairOverall a score of 10/10COMFORTAgain, for me I wear headphones for many hours a day, so this can be a deal breaker. These fit perfectly, and in no way hurt my ears or present any negative elements from a comfort perspective -  they are a joy to wear.Over all a 20/10PROS AND CONSProsSound qualityBuild QualityComfortIncludes Headphone adapter for inflight entertainment that requires the two prong connectorIncludes a battery so the unit can be completely operational straight out of the boxIncludes and beautiful carry case that accommodates the headphones when they are folded upInline volume and play/pause button for controlling audio on the phoneInline mic for phone calls provides great clarity for the person listening on the other endConsNONE...In conclusion - for me the Bose Quiet Comfort 25 are completely wonderful, and I cannot wait to travel with them on my next flight to enjoy some inflight entertainment - until then, they will be in daily use here at the house.

This has amazing power to get the task done, no matter if it is dust, debris or a liquid spill.Being as powerful as it is and with its size, it has the capacity to take a generous amount of dirt out of the way in a short timeframe without the need to empty it repeatedly in between small tasks. It works brilliantly straight out of the box.Our converted garage flooded during a bout of heavy rain, and this vacuumed up all the water with ease. The fact that it's on wheels aided greatly in the emptying of the tank each time.Pros:Power 4.2 peak HPCapacity - 9 gallonsWheeled base7 foot hose10 foot power cordLarger than standard hose diameterAccessories store on the vacCan also be used as a blower by attaching the hose to the air outlet portConsThe construction and quality of the build materials strike me as mid to low mid quality. I will be interested to see how this is working after 8-12 months of frequent use. The hose is of a completely different grade plastic, and is the area of most concern.The air outlet port causes other dirt and dust not yet vacuumed up to blow all over the place. Would be nice to see this angled up instead of straight out.

This does a great job and it prevents cursing. No really. Who woulda thought...?So you may look at this product and say to yourself, wait a sec, 12 volts? I'm a professional (or at least want to be seen as one). I need to have nothing less than an 18 volt tool hanging from my belt.Well, think again. Power is not the only consideration, and neither is size. For the longest time I have always thought that way, but this tool changed all that.I already have a Ryobi 18 volt impact driver, but as one might imagine, it is a lot bigger than this Hitatchi. For others out there, the thought "Oh, let me get another tool that is smaller and less powerful that the one I already own" may never cross your mind, but consider this:Two days after I took delivery of this product, my car developed a horrid squealing noise. Being the weekend warrior (in my situation, thats code for a frugal tight-fisted individual), I googled the situation and found a video on how to take care of it.To execute the remedy, I was required to lie on my back in the floor space in front of the front passenger seat in the car with my legs sticking out of the car, and work in an incredibly confined space up under the dashboard. When I saw the spot I was going to have to work in, I instantly knew that the larger Ryobi 18 volt impact driver would never fit and it was the perfect opportunity to try the Hitatchi.Not only did the Hitatchi make an easy job of undoing nuts that had never been opened since the car was made (some 10 years ago), but it was the perfect size to allow the driver with the attachment to reach the nuts. It delivers mad power,The icing on the cake is the little LED that illuminates the task at hand so you don't have to use your cell phone or something else to see what you are doing in confined dark places.If you already have an impact driver, it might not be suitable for every application. Having this as a Plan B is a great idea.ProsMad power - this thing is virtually unstoppable.Size - it is smaller and therefore more suitable for a wider range of tasks than larger tools.LED light - pressing the trigger will engage the LED light prior to the driver spinning up.Belt clip - easy to stash the tool on your belt or on your jeansTwo batteries - no need to explain that oneConsNA

I love this vacuum. I am reviewing it minutes after using it because I am excited about the product and there are so many excellent design features and such creative thinking that went into this vacuum..I have mostly hard wood floors, so right out of the box I decided to give it the harder test of getting the dog hair off the rug in the living room. What a stellar performance.When I started using it I thought there was some obstruction and somehow it was dragging the rug, but no - the suction is just stronger than any other vacuum I have owned (including Dyson). In my attempts to get the dog hair off, it really only needed one pass across the rug instead of the usual two or three passes with the other vacuums -- Eureka and Electrolux.Pros:Power - tremendous suction powerSuction power is adjustable to allow for easy use on longer shag carpetsSize - It is so small and light (despite being very powerful)Easy to detach hand wand for smaller tasksStretch hose for hand wand - ample lengthAnti allergy filterShaft connected to hand wand remains connected to the wand when using the vacuum in a traditional upright vacuum mode, meaning you don't have to attach something else to use in wand modeRotating head for easy maneuverabilityBrush mechanism has an on off switchBaglessMain unit is easily removable from floor attachment making it easier and lighter to carry for spot cleaningIncludes additional small suction-powered carpet headIncludes small-reach narrow head with a brush that moves up the shaft when not in use preventing the loss of the brush attachment. This attachment will work on the hand wand or on the end of the shaft when attached to the hand wand for longer reachFloor head incorporates an obstruction overload mechanism that cuts off power to brushes when it encounters resistance. This prevents motor burnout or any type of damage to the head mechanism when something gets caught in the rotating brushes.Once the overload protection has triggered and the brushes stop rotating, just push the reset button with the tip of a penRed and green indicator lights on the floor head let you know if you are removing a little or a lot of dust in the products operationEmptying the dust bin is easy and quick, and the included small brush for spot cleaning can be used to clean blindsFilter is removable and washableCons: (definitely not a deal breaker or enough to remove anything from its 5-star rating)The angle at which the small suction-powered carpet attachment best meets the floor can not be changed, requiring one to be quite close to the floor to get the maximum use from it.In closing, this is a brilliant vacuum. The amount of dirt it holds before being emptied is less (1.5l) than larger vacuums, thus making it perfect for small residences - or (and probably more healthy) it just makes you empty after each use.Get one - you won't be disappointed.

This is seriously the best shaver I have ever owned. I have had many electric shavers over the years, and I'm comparing this to my most recent ones -- the Panasonic ES-LT41-K Arc3 Electric Razor Wet/Dry and the Remington Lithium Powered Rotary Shaver XR1340GOLF.Pros:It gets really really close without any skin irritation or burning sensation.I like the weight and size of the product and how it feels to hold.Looks nice in the charging baseComes with a travel bagHas a travel lock preventing accidental power on while in transitGood for use internationally with 120/240Comb attachment to trim your beardIn terms of a close shave, it is better than the Panasonic and way way better than the Remington rotary shaver.Cons: (Not deal breakers (because the shave is so close) but worth mentioning)There should be a clearer indicator that when fully charged it displays the remaining minutes (60) rather than % charged.When the charge cable is in, it does not go fully in and has the appearance that there is something wrong or something stuck in the socket.There are 3 rows of shave heads and the two outside shave heads are for longer hairs and the inside middle row is for short hairs. This means when you have a goatee, the skin closest to the goatee hair will only ever be reached by the longer hair row.  In my mind, it would be better if one of the outside rows was another short hair row, thus enabling you to turn around the shaver so the shorter hair blades can get in there.You cannot charge it without the base. It is something extra that I have to bring when travelling, and if I lose or forget it, I cannot charge without buying another base.In closing, it does a great job at the one thing it is supposed to do. :)
Might end up buying a second pair of these. Absolutely perfect fit and really soft.

Pros:-This curtain blocks out the light really well. I used a curtain rod that lets the curtain wrap around the sides, and from outside, with all the lights on, it looked like the lights were off.- Curtain has Velcro tabs that you can stick to the wall on the sides and bottom if you really want to make sure it seals against the wall.- Color is pretty accurate which is nice. I've received a few curtains from Amazon where the color didn't match the picture at all.Cons:- It definitely has a "you might see this curtain at grandma's" old lady pattern to it. This makes it hard to make it look good in any room in my house.I can't really comment on energy saving, since that would take quite a while to have evidence of and it's not particularly hot or cold outside right now.

We had the boys put these on in the dark and it was still an easy process. Once on, they do the job well and grip the screen as they wipe. We have yet to try them in torrential conditions, but I suspect they will do well.

This truly is an incredible product. I have used it for about a month and it delivers perfect results every time. The visual appeal and design of the product makes it one you are proud to have on the countertop. The quality is what you would expect in a professional kitchen.Once it is in one of its pre-programmed cycles, it slows down to allow more of the items to sink in the liquid (to make sure they are reached by the blades) and then it speeds up again. The different cycles available make sure that the speed suits the results you want.This is better than every other blender I have used. Just go ahead and get it - you won't regret it. :)

Great little gadget. Fits beautifully in the cup holder, and it has two buttons for a continuous stream or a stop and start stream. The blue light the steam streams over makes me look cool, which is what matters, right ...?It's super easy to set up: Fill it to the line with water, wet the stick, put the stick into the slot under the lid, and plug it in to your USB charger.Best of all, it really does help a bit with the dry air in the car. It's not like a large humidifier, obviously, but every little helps.

I am not a video expert, but I do shoot some video, and this product is a smashing addition to your rig, even if you don't shoot often. I just ran a field test with my Canon 5D Mark III and a Rode shotgun microphone.I have never owned anything like the Tascam DR-60Dmkii, so my review is centered around how using it improves shooting with a mic that just goes into the camera.For the biggest test I did, I went to a fairly busy boat slip on the river to see how it would handle audio from a distance. I have to say I was astonished.For this test, I was filming from around 60 feet from the boat slip, and I got audio I would never get without this.In the playback I discovered amazing audio for the following:The sound of the hand crank gears as the boat was pulled up onto the trailer.The owner's wet sneaker twisting on the metal of the trailer while hoisting the boat up the trailer.All associated sounds with getting off the trailer and getting into the truck.The engine starting and being put into gear.The tires on the wet boat ramp.The individual drops of water falling to the asphalt from the boat as it left the water and continued up the ramp.I have used the Rode microphone on its own before and it's 'good,', but when you are shooting HD like the 5D Mark III captures, I have come to realize that going with 'good enough' on the audio is a shame. Without the Tascam, I would never have had enough reach with the Rode microphone to get all the additional details in the recordings I made.So that's the first part about what I find impressive. The other pros include:Ease of use (even without reading the manual - I always read the manual, but I also see what I can do without the manual first)Multiple inputs, including two xlr (compared to simply plugging one microphone into the camera)Physical buttons for the features most frequently used during operation4-track recordingRescue track (backup track at a lower level)Line and headphones output to monitor audioOnscreen audio levelsOn device take review with track advance via thumbwheelLimiter and low cut filterSlate tone generator to sync with camera audioDesign - it looks really awesome mounted under my cameraIn closing, I love this product for what it does for the audio, and because it gives me confidence about future video projects in relation to the audio capture and quality.
Brilliant value for money. If you want your 1020 protected (and who wouldn't), get this case.Goes on and comes off easily when needed.Perfect fit for the phoneLove the kickstand feature

Love, love, love these - I needed to buy these boots to make my bi-annual trip to NYC to photograph Fashion Week. Every February is always the polar opposite to my life in Austin, Texas. In 10 seasons I have never had the right boots for NY's cold and snow. This season I set out to protect the feet as part of my strategy to have a successful stay.Not only were the boots very comfortable, but they broke no promises in keeping my feet warm and dry.I recommend the Kamik Nation Plus for waterproof boots that keep you warm in conditions as low as -40,

Hard to get too technical on this one.I only have two USB 3.0 ports on my computer, but other than my mouse and keyboard, everything else is USB 3.0 including:2 CF card readers,2 JBOD 4 bay HD enclosures,and a slew of portable drives.The only ones that need to be in all the time are the CF readers and the JBOD enclosures. After that I rotate the additional portable drives when I need to transfer thousands of images.This hub just makes everything so much easier than having to deal with than the ports my computer came with.My only wish is that the power cable plugged in from behind rather than from the side, but that's not a thing that affects performance, just how it looks on the desktop.In closing, if you have multiple USB 3.0 devices and need a powered hub, I strongly suggest this one - TP-Link UH700.

This is a decent phone for the price.Sound quality is good for both calls and music.Display is clear and a good width and height.App are easy to download for use, and unlike other phones, it isn't swarming with unwanted pre-downloaded apps.Battery life is fairly long. It lasts me at least 24 hours if I don't use video.The only downside is that it's clunky, and with the cover on, it's not as easy to click the side buttons.All in all, this is an average phone that doesn't necessarily excel in any area, but it's a good purchase for the price.

If you are reading this, buy one today. :) Completely stunning results from this Pioneer subwoofer.I must admit I am surprised that this, being the best sub I have ever owned, that it is a Pioneer. It's not that I think they make bad products, but it's not the first maker to spring to mind if I think of top-of-the-line audio components.The 4 subs I have owned in the past include brands like Jensen and Polk Audio, and in the past, when selecting components, I will admit I had typically been swayed by the "bigger is better" school of thought. The Jensen I was using before putting the Pioneer into my surround sound rig has a speaker that is 2 inches larger, but the Pioneer out-performed by a long shot.My home theater components include an Onkyo receiver and 4 Yamaha tower speakers, along with a Polk Audio center channel and a Polk center rear. Side by side with all the other subs I own, this appears to have all the same controls and features. but the difference is in the quality of the bass and that fact that no matter what level I set it to, there is simply no distortion.ProsUnapologetic deep, deep wood floor and pant-leg-shaking bassNo distortion - just powerful performanceConsThe blue status light on the front of the sub: Needless to say, one can tape over it or turn the sub 90 degrees to the left or right so it is not visible. Many people probably wouldn't care, but when I watching a movie, I don't want any visual distractions.In closing, if you have the money and have only had subs that cost less than $599 in the past, then I suggest this sub as a delicious upgrade to your existing home theater setup.

I'll spare you on the plot details, as so many other reviewers have done that already.This was a good read -- well-written, paced plot with rising action, satisfactory ending. Flanders has a self-deprecating sense of humor that she weaves through everything, which adds to the amusement of her MC's foibles.I found the MC's constant perspectives on things she came across as annoying a lot of the time. Most of them had nothing to do with the plot, and it felt as if Flanders was filling pages much of the time. Granted, they helped develop her MC, but if I had a free pass to sit in a room and listen to the rambling thoughts of a middle-aged woman, I'd pass immediately.Another annoyance was the number of characters in the story line --far to many to keep track of.Overall, though, I'd recommend it as a good read. It's not as fluffy as chick-lit, and is a more intelligent read than most books I've picked up lately.

Fast card at a cheap price from a brand you trust - what's not to like. We bought two of these to enhance the memory in our phones. The amount of space that the newer phones come with is laughable, and you really need this little gadget to fit all your apps.

Brilliant product - holds my tablet or phone perfectly - love it. It was easy to stick to the windshield and it has a good strong grip of the phone. It seems immovable - doesn't slide around the glass or come loose at all.
Love it - does what it's supposed to do and has a remote shutter button - very nice addition.Brilliant value for money and a quality product. Recommended

Fits snugly around my 5D Mark III with one exception - not when the extended battery grip is on.This would be a 5 star rating if it accommodated having the battery grip on there too. It just bunches up when you try to use the thumbwheel on the grip to secure the item in place, and then the skin no longer fits snugly. I would have to take an Exacto knife to it if I want to use it when the grip is on there too.Since it doesn't claim it will include the grip, it does what it's supposed to do -- protect the camera body. It fits well and is very usable, as long as you remember what all the buttons are for, since you can no longer see them (or at least, I can't).Sometimes the buttons take a little extra effort to activate, but I can't imagine a product of this nature for which that is not true.In summary - if you don't have the extended battery grip then you are golden - get it.

Its few quirks take a bit of getting used to. It's a more affordable backlit keyboard than most, and comes with 6 programmable keys x 3 banks (so 18 keys in total), but when typing it does strange things.When using the CTRL key to navigate entire words in a sentence, it jumps around a bit further than you might be used to. Apart from that, it's a decent keyboardOnly con is the backspace key is smaller than normal, so it takes a bit of accustomization -- when you think you are deleting, you see the \ character appear instead.Overall, it's worth getting because of the overall value.

This is a brilliant product. For my review: I have it connected to my Sony Bravia 42" TV with a wired Internet speed of 115 mbps download and 11 mbps upload, as well as having it hooked up to a 7.1 surround sound.I was able to download games I already had got through PlayStation Plus that connected to Steam for free, and was able to download and play them in minutes.Compared to a larger gaming tower, this won't deliver the same experience; however, for a living room gaming platform/PC, the performance is beyond any current platform.Pros:It's fairly to set up, but I would recommend using a keyboard to speed things up.Boots into exclusive user interface that overlays Windows 8, giving a clean experience while protecting the system (if used by young kids)Different user accounts for different family members/roommatesComes with Windows 8.1 and can be used as a PCThe ability to perform traditional Web-based functions on your HDTV in high qualityGames like Minecraft, RuneScape, Maple Story, etc. run very well and fast at the highest quality. I also had YouTube streaming in the background for music, which didn't produce any extra lag for drop in fpsIt comes with a controller.True 1080p quality on any gamePC gaming on the TV without having to move in a computer beside the TVAble to stream Hulu in Windows 8.1 (Playstation and other Internet-enabled devices only work with Hulu Plus)Quad core i5 3GHz, 1TB drive, 8 gigs of ram, Custom Nvidia Maxwell GTX GPU 2gb videocard.Both CPU and Ram upgrades are possible, in addition to adding more hard drive space.WiFi and wired Internet speeds (when wired, getting full 115mbps speed versus a max speed of 42mpbs on the PlayStation 3)The ability to use a keyboard and mouse if you feel the need for more keysIt has a very small footprint.It is extremely quiet.ConsThe Xbox controller it comes with requires AA batteries. A PS3 controller is much more practical.The first game I played through Steam (metro: last light running at 1920x1080 resolution and quality very high) produced a great experience for 20-30 seconds ... until the fps shot down to about 5-9.Also, if the volume on the desktop has been muted, it will mute all volume inside the alpha ui overlay. So if another user was using the unit as a desktop and the next user booted/launched the UI and tried to play a game, they may not know to go back to the Windows 8 environment to un-mute.**I was most excited to play Medal of Honor again after about  a 10 year gap, and while it is on Steam, it's not a console game. The Steam store that runs through the alpha user interface would show the game to me as buy-able, and I would have thought that since this is a PC, Steam would detect that this is a PC with a keyboard and allow me to buy and play. I exited the Alpha UI and found the game through the Steam app was available for purchase, just not through the Alpha UI.In summary, the PS3 which was the main source for all things that entertained us, and it has barely been turned on since. The alpha is perfect for someone looking for a PC/console hybrid and doesn't want to buy both.I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking to buy a console and computer -- for $550-$900 it's a steal. Perfect for a dorm room or  a house where light computing requirements exist.

Gorgeous featuring, great design and really good shaverUPDATE - Rating Changed & additional details added. See below...UPDATED Summary. I only use it if nothing else is charged or available, or I need to shave while in transit. My suggestion would be to forgo the stylish looks, the 3 month subscription to the magazine, and get something with less 'makeup' and more time in the gym.ORIGINAL *****************As the title states, the shave from this product is really good for an electric shaver. In this review I will compare it to the Philips Norelco AT830/46 4500, the Panasonic EX-LT41-K Arc3 and a Gillette Mach3 razor.Having an everyday functional product that is gorgeous to look at is not necessarily a true feature or benefit. Having said that, this product is completely gorgeous, and seated in its brilliant stand, it just has a luxurious look to it. Even though it is designed with golf in mind, its lines and colors make me think more of F1 racing, which adds to the appeal.ProsDesign, design, design. I actually want to bring it to the studio and shoot it as a product project for my portfolio.While not the best shave (compared to a blade), it is a very good shave.Fastest shave yet from an electric shaverEasy to cleanBarely irritates my skin - definitely less than other rotary heads (all rotary heads irritate my skin)Drain hole in base of standRuns really quiet, which I prefer in a family home with just one bathroom.Fabulous looking charging stand (makes me think of a segway)Comes with a great carry case that should fit all toiletries on a tripConsIn my experience, none that are unique to rotary head shavers - just not as close as a blade or pivoting head and irritates my skin a little (possibly that could be the fact that this was the first shave with this product, and after my skin adjusts to it after using a blade for so long, that might no longer be an issue).The last item of note is not a con, just a preference, and that is I would prefer the beard trimmer to be a bit wider. It does a great job right now, just a bit wider would cover more ground faster.Summary - If I had to get a rotary shaver, this would be the one to buy.UPDATE *******************You only get one chance to make a first impression but sometimes that impression isn't the whole picture.Ok - whatever good impressions I had about this shaver from the first few times I used it - I wouldn't say I was wrong in what I wrote based on those interactions, however I have new information stemming from later usage of the shaver.After about 5 uses I went to have a shave one day. When I started using it, I felt the shaver actually pulling hairs as they were getting caught in the rotary mechanism while I was shaving.My initial reaction was, 'I must have forgotten to charge it.'  I placed the unit in the base and came back to it a few hours later when the led indicator showed that it was fully charged.Same thing again, pulling hairs.  I have always thought the shaver sounded (based on every other shaver I have owned) like the battery was nearing the end of its usefulness. Think of your current electric shaver and when you are using it, that sound while shaving from a fully charged battery is a 5.  Well this shaver sounds like its at about a 2. It sounds like what I would imagine a toy shaver might sound like so its safe.

The lock broke on this after a few weeks. Other than that, it's a great idea and my mom loves hers. Just pour your beaten egg plus a few extras for flavor into this and it will serve you up an evenly cooked omelette in a short amount of time.

Love this - just bought a new one because the lime water browned out the last one. The cord is a good length, and the water boils quickly. I like the measuring marks being so visible, and the best part of all is that it turns itself off once it's boiled. I have no idea why most kettles aren't made to do this in the US - crazy.

It's a Wonderful Life is annually shown on various networks around Christmas, suggesting that it's reserved for that time of year. Really, I think it's a movie that's appealing for any time of the year. What's really important is its prevailing message. James Stewart and Donna Reed are stellar in this timeless classic. A 2-disc set, it contains many special features that keep on giving to those who are nostalgic to its charm and tradition. The sound and picture quality are very good, too.

Okay, this is a 4 star (well, 3.5) review of an album from one of my favorite bands of all time. I give it lukewarm praise, because this album solidified the commercial direction the band was taking, which is something I didn't embrace. Blue Oyster Cult is not a commercial band, let's face it. Their first 3 albums are masterpieces, with a sound all their own. I don't know of any other band that has such a unique sound to their music that can't be duplicated. Spectres followed the successful Agents of Fortune from a year earlier; 'Agents' hinted of a forthcoming commercial sound, but was still rooted in their earliest sound. With Spectres, it's apparent that the band wanted more of the mainstream. The opening track, GODZILLA is a concert favorite, but I don't see what's so good about it.  It's rather bland and unimaginative. The rest of the tracks don't hover much above mediocrity. Still, Spectres is to be respected for its experimentation. Their next album, Mirrors is even more experimental, but resonates a tad more for me, as the songs on that album are a bit more sophisticated. Spectres is still essential to own.

This small space heater features two settings (750 and 1500 watts) which provide plenty of heat for any modest space in the home or office. This is a fan-forced heater with a thermostat. On the lowest thermostat setting, the fan will kick on and off very frequently, so it's a good idea to have it set on the highest setting initially to heat up the room to avoid this. This unit also has a safety mechanism that shuts off the heater when knocked over. Finally, I like the top handle for ease of carrying, instead of the very common handle-less heaters out there. This product is of very good quality, as it's durable, and can therefore withstand moderate wear and tear. I recommend this heater for its practicality, quality, and value.

A Nightmare on Elm Street 4 is just about on the level of 2 and 3 (mediocrity), which basically is a mediocre movie with surprisingly few scares. Yes, Freddy is in top form here, but that's the only real highlight. I'm not a big fan of excessive special effects in horror movies, either. In some ways, this feels like a sci-fi movie. If you're going to make a horror film, keep the lasers to a minimum! Also, this movie gives John Carpenter's The Thing a run for its money when it comes to the gore. And if you like 80's music (I do for the most part), this movie provides plenty, along with the 'big hair.' Overall, this fourth installment doesn't resonate when it comes to being dark or suspenseful. The three stars I'm giving it are generous.

This contemporary-look version of the classic of classics game Clue still has that nostalgic feel when played. The game that requires some skill (not recommended for kids under 6, in my opinion), due to the process of elimination in solving a crime, is a household (or mansion) name in board games. For those who've played this game many times, it's all too common to cut to the chase when naming a suspect, room, and weapon when making a suggestion or accusation; the condensed way of saying it is (for example): "Mustard, Ballroom, Wrench." We've all done this at one time or another, to save time. Overall, Clue is a fun game, not just for its simplicity, but also for the curiosity it generates, because we all want to know "who done it." Great for a rainy day.

A Nightmare on Elm Street 3 has Freddy taking on many forms (which is interesting), but this movie feels more like sci-fi than horror. Furthermore, the creators should've made up their minds as to what direction they wanted to go in terms of darkness; this movie yanks us back and forth between darkness and lightness. While there are some memorable scary moments in this movie, there aren't enough to keep your interest for a 98 minute movie. Finally, this movie has the feel and look (at times) of two very famous horror films (The Shining, The Thing 1982) in terms of special effects. This third installment in the series is just as inferior as the second, and just as unnecessary. This movie is simply a special effects extravaganza, and distracting at that.  The plot vehicle (dreams becoming real) is unique for the horror genre, but unfortunately the acting is subpar in supporting it. Overall, this movie is very mediocre, as it doesn't capture the imagination like the first movie. Here, the imagination is handed to us via all of the 'goodies.' On a positive note, Freddy is resonating as usual.

A Nightmare on Elm Street 2: Freddy's Revenge has a much lighter tone to it than its predecessor. This movie is lacking in imagination, attributable to it being rushed into theaters not even a full year after its predecessor. This was to jump on the bandwagon of 80's slasher films competing with each other. If more time and care went into the production of this movie, it would've probably been more appealing. This movie is surprisingly not scary, and doesn't have much darkness to it. I don't recommend this movie for those seeking a real scare; you're better off with the first movie, or one of the early Halloween movies.

I applied this product to my two roof dormers back in April, and I'd say that maybe 15-20% of the algae is gone, despite a pretty wet spring, summer, and now autumn. This product was applied as directed, so I don't know why it's not working. What I DO know is that this product is expensive, so I feel like I wasted my money. I don't recommend this product.

This iPhone charger certainly does its job of charging, but not without some concerns. First, the charger becomes very warm to the touch, even shortly after you plug it in to charge the iPhone. Second, (and this is a safety concern), the two prongs have broken off and got stuck in the wall outlet. When this happened, I had to throw the charger away, and removed the prongs with a non-conducting tool, as this poses a safety concern due to the potential of electric shock. I just wish Apple would make a more durable and safer charger in the future.

I've had this treadmill for 7 months now, and use it daily. As long as you properly maintain it (cleaning around motor components and underneath the belt), it shouldn't require any significant repairs. There are warranty options, and I chose a one year warranty that covers everything. What I like most about this treadmill is its versatility; I feel like this is a much above average product that doesn't break the bank. There are several nice features that enhance the whole workout experience. I like the workout programs that it offers, but find myself inventing my own programs. Furthermore, though standard on most treadmills these days, I really like the heart rate grips that you can utilize to chart where you're at from a cardio fitness standpoint. Oh, and I love being able to plug in my iPod to listen to music while I work out! This treadmill has speakers for those who don't want to use their own ear buds. A safety key is used to power on the machine after plugging it in, so the machine doesn't run if the key isn't used, which is good if you have small curious children. And electrical usage? I'm smiling at the fact that this unit doesn't use that much electricity. I've found the belt to be a tad squeaky in the summer months (owing to humidity), so don't let this deter you into thinking there's some sort of mechanical failure. As long as you lube it on schedule, it will perform at an optimal level. If there's one thing about this unit that is lacking, it's the inferior performing fan, which emits very little air. But hey, isn't it all about sweating? I recommend this treadmill for its quality and value.

Pippi Longstocking (1969) was released in late 1973 in the U.S., after being successful in Europe. The voices of the actors had to be dubbed over in English, which easily shows in the out of sync talking in relation to mouth movement. While mildly annoying, it doesn't take away from the movie itself, as this first installment is worthy of praise. Pippi and her new friends seek one adventure after another, and the overall tone is cheerful and the mischief is playful. I overlook the almost laughable special effects (such as when Pippi lifts her horse, or when she lofts her tormentor into a tree), because a movie like this doesn't need the best effects to be good, and the obvious fact that this movie was made in the late 1960's. Overall, this movie is fun, and recommended.

Filles De Kilimanjaro (1969) continues Miles' experimentation with electronic instruments, though still not the full-blown fusion of In a Silent Way or Bitches Brew. Here, were treated to a post bop sound with fusion, resulting in a very unique, much more subtle sound than its predecessor, Miles in the Sky. I can't help but think of myself sitting in a hotel lounge and enjoying these songs, as they have that feel and sound to them. The title track steals the show, with electric bass that moves the song. The song itself is very elegant, and the bass adds the final accent, giving it real presence. Filles De Kilimanjaro is absolutely essential for any Miles fan, or jazz fan for that matter; it's an often overlooked masterpiece of groundbreaking fusion elements. The bonus track (Tout De Suite) is a slightly longer version of the original. Enjoy!

At first listen, Miles in the Sky (1968) is a tough album to digest, because it's purely transitional, with post bop elements, rock beats, avant garde, and ultimately fusion permeating its unique sound. The songs have a groove to them, dominated by its drumming. Brassy, electric, acoustic- it's a little bit of everything. However, it all makes sense as you listen a second or third time, because it has a uniqueness all its own.  I purchased this album in order to truly appreciate a band that was evolving into what would be called 'fusion' a few releases later, with In a Silent Way. I wouldn't put Miles in the Sky in my top 5 Davis albums, but it's still essential to one's collection as a groundbreaking gem. 9/10

Well, let's face it: this group made an indelible impression in rock history with their 17 minute masterpiece of psychedelic rock, In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida. A one hit wonder? Yes, but a sustainability unmatched by no other one hit wonder, as this song is still played quite a lot today. Iron Butterfly hung around for a few more years, but weren't able to match the success and nostalgia of this album. The other five tracks on this album are respectable, and definitely worth a listen, though greatly overshadowed by the title track, which is presented in long form, live, and single form. Overall, this is essential 60's acid/psychedelic rock.

Twin Peaks- Fire Walk With Me (1992) isn't a whole lot like the TV series of a few years earlier, though it has the general tone and feel of the series. Here, the characters are a lot more mysterious and dark, and the plot is more complex. At times, the plot is hard to follow, but at least the viewer knows that there's a mystery to solve. This movie offers objects of interest, much in the manner of a later movie (Mulholland Dr.), in order to try to piece things together. This movie is sort of hypnotic in its approach and delivery; Laura Palmer is thrust into a strange world, taking the audience with her. Overall, this is vintage David Lynch at work; a movie that begs for answers to strange happenings. I must say that the critics were harsh with their ratings of this movie, as it's certainly way better than the panning it took.  I recommend this underrated movie.

***** This review contains spoilers. Love Story (1970) stars Ali MacGraw and Ryan O'Neal as a free-spirited couple that goes through trials and tribulations (Oliver's poor relationship with his demanding father, and Jennifer's fatal illness), but their love for each other is eternal. While watching this movie, I could just feel the intensity of each scene, as if it's so real, rather than the sometimes unrealistic love that is found in some Hollywood movies. Ali MacGraw gives the performance of a lifetime as a sharp-tongued vivacious and very comical young woman, and carries this throughout the whole film, as if nothing can crush her spirit. This movie has a tragic ending, which makes the average person want a happy ending (due to the loveability of Jennifer), but if that somehow happened, this movie wouldn't be half the movie it is. In a sense, we the audience have to get on board when it comes to the sad ending and endure the frustration if we are to appreciate what a true love story is really about. Casting MacGraw was the perfect choice, as well as O'Neal; they seem to have the perfect chemistry on screen. The prevailing message of "love means never having to say you're sorry" is very powerful here, and used perfectly. The special features are good, too. Love Story is one of the greatest movies of all time, and certainly in my top 10.

Rebecca (1940) is Hitch's American debut, and it doesn't disappoint. It takes quite some time for things to get going plot-wise, but it's worth the wait. This is a movie that has excellent cinematography and direction, similar to another film of that time period, Citizen Kane. It also has similar music to Citizen Kane, or better yet, Citizen Kane has similar music to Rebecca, as that movie came out a year later. Joan Fontaine is perfectly cast as the second wife, and reminds me of Ingrid Bergman and even Kim Novak. The overall feel and effect of the premise of the movie is subtle and slow-moving, but nevertheless effective. It helps that this movie is in black and white, because that tone brings out its underlying darkness. While this movie isn't anywhere near my favorite Hitch movie, it is still very recommended, despite the sacrifice one must make with the slower pace that is reflective of the time period. The special features are excellent and plentiful.

Black Christmas (1974) is a good horror movie that provides some real chills and edge-of-your seat moments. In some ways, this movie reminds me of the Halloween 1978 movie, as the telephone is a prominent feature. Furthermore, it has the teenybopper/young adult element. This movie also has a few notable actors (Margot Kidder and Keir Dullea) who bring some balance and credibility. Casting Dullea seems Keir-oius, as it's a bit surprising that he would accept a role in a B type of movie after he found mainstream success in 2001: A Space Odyssey. If anything, it's noble that he didn't think that being in this movie was beneath him. Overall, Black Christmas is somewhat of an acquired taste, as it has cheesiness alongside some very serious moments. All things considered, this is a good movie.

The New Adventures of Pippi Longstocking is the ideal family movie; it features Tami Erin as the nonchalant, spunky redheaded girl who can touch a nerve or two with those she meets. This movie is a sometimes forgotten gem, because this film franchise has actually done better overseas in terms of box office gross, but still resonates in the U.S. This is the prototypical G-rated movie, in that it can appeal to a wide audience. I remember my first ever movie attended at the theater was a Pippi Longstocking movie (in the mid-seventies), and enjoyed it. Years later, it's nice to see a mild resurgence of this neat little character. I recommend this as a good family movie.

Under Siege (1992) stars Steven Seagal, Tommy Lee Jones, and Gary Busey, who take this movie to another level of edge-of-your-seat action. Erika Eleniak is the perfect supporting actress, and with all action movies, there's a lady to complement the hero. With a plot that flows and is easy to follow, you are thrust right into it from the get-go. Though a bit predictable at times (as most action movies are), it still immensely entertains and leaves one wanting more. Under Siege is a movie that has many thrills and humor thrown in; the critics say that it's "Die Hard on a ship", but I think it's worthy of its own identity, and one of the best action movies of all time. Steven Seagal has all the right moves and one-liners for an unforgettable movie experience. The picture and sound are crisp for this blu-ray, too. Recommended.
